name: Hebian-To to Cragstone
description: Drops out at 24.45N 47.05E -- Goric Greyskunk 10/3/2001

name: Cragstone to Hebian-To
description: Drops out at 38.6S, 82.1E

name: Healer and grocer - Cragstone
description: Avalenne and Acina Hilmad lives up on the hill overlooking River Prosper and Cragstone. What a beautiful place they have here. Avalenne The Healers selection and prices are also very beautiful. Selling stamina elixirs, excellent healing kits and healing potions at 105% while buying back at 90%. -- Immacolata 5/22/2001

name: The Isle of Tears
description:
Near Cragstone
it exits at 22.5N, 51.9E. Lotsa wasps, shreths, and reedsharks on the island, but the underground citys okay. -- Hiemdal Olafsun 2/4/00

name: Shousi Grotto
description:
Home of the Worn Out Key for SoLL -- Slant 10/5/99
soll key is found in the throne room -- The Peddler 11/3/99
This is a nice dungeon for people who fit the level restrictions. It is a popular place, but not ever overcrowded deeper in (at least hardly). I suggest going in with a friend, but only one, because I went in once with a party of five or six, and it got a bit boring. -- Rimgar 3/7/2000
Great starter dungeon. Mostly low level drudges and shreth, bit tougher at the end. Once youre confident then go for the throne room. -- Zulu Njomo 2/23/2001

name: The Web Maze
description:
One way travel to either Shoushi, Mayoi, or Hebien-To
To get to Shoushi Portal go straight ahead then turn left (follow the left wall). To get to Mayoi follow the right wall. Hebian-To from the drop into the maze run straight in the direction the drop leaves you, just hit auto run in the portal, and don't turn at all. Just bounce off the walls going straight and near the portal you will get hung up on a knife edge ""Y""...stop and take the right fork...the portal is right there.Now contains Drudge stalkers, lurkers and raveners. -- Chupon 8/19/2004

name: Shoushi to Yanshi
description: Updated exit coords to 10.7S, 46.5E from 12.6S,47.3E -- Dutton 7/11/2004 This portal has moved to 33.5S, 73.0E from 34.9S, 74.4E. -- CapFan 12/9/2004

name: Yanshi to Shoushi
description:
Drops out at 32.4S, 72.9E
Has changed to exiting at . -- Immacolata 5/26/2001

name: Impious Temple
description: You get the broken staff here for Impious Staff quest. The portal to the Impious Temple is behind a locked door within the courtyard of the 4 towers fort. Dizah requires a L Trade Note to open the door.

name: River Bridge Portal
description:
In Water
out at 28.5N, 48.0E -- B""Leth 9/21/99

name: Dungeon of Shadow
description:
The first time you go through this dungeon, beware of the black things that dont show up on radar... *eg* -- Polecat 9/14/99
The black things are Shadowchilds, creatures of the dark, very fast, very agile, and quite deadly. There is a portal to the surface near the place you will meet them first, so you might consider running if you never faced them. -- Saffron Dusk 9/15/99
Mosswarts, A chief, and lots of Shamen -- Grunzio 9/18/99
on the bottom, where the shadow childs are, sometimes a ghost wisp, can cast magic really quick sometimes, so low levels beware -- Enyx 9/28/99
Great place to solo in your late teens. Bottom room you get mobbed by about five to six shamans, one chief, and one mudlurk. Blast. Decient selling loot. make about 10k a run (top to bottom)Bring your melee defense. -- Sariel 4/16/2000

name: A Ruin (Rithwic)
description:
drudges and outcasts. crowd in the basement not sure whats there. -- Guy Noir 1/4/00
This is the screwyest Dungeon I think I have seen to date... The entrance portal is guarded on the south and the west by Banderling Scouts and Young Banderlings as well as Green Phyntos Wasps, Outcast Monouga, Mite Snippets, and a few Shreth... Inside, there are essentially 3 levels... the level you enter into has two or three Drudge Skulkers (lvl 2), one Drudge Slinker (lvl 4), and one Outcast Monouga... This entry level also has a stamina fountain in the middle of it, but there are no chests and loot is minimal... On the lower level (that is, down the ramp from the entry level), there are three Outcasts all gathered in one chamber, and a looped hallway that goes from one end of the chamber, behind the chamber, and to the other end of the chamber... in the hall are two Gnawer Shreths... On this level of the dungeon there are also no chests, though I don't know about loot because I ran in, looked around, and left without killing anything... On the upper level (that is, up the ramp from the entry level) there is a long hall with several side chambers (six I think)... all but one or two of those chambers have enemy creatures in them, and those creatures are usually in groups of 2-4 creatures... There are mostly Drudge Sneakers (lvl 4 I think), but one of the chambers has two Outcasts and a chest... only About half of these chambers have doors, so expect to get swarmed a bit... The chest that I mentioned has low level cloths, and a little food... At the end of the hall on this level, there is a locked gate (I have not yet found a key), and behind it there is a very small cavity with a single Drudge Sneaker and a chest... since I haven't found a key and I don't have a very good Lock Picking skill (only level 35), and since I haven't been able to kill everything on the level, I haven't been able to get into the chest or even through the door... in fact, I died three times trying before I gave up and decided I need to wait and go in with a group... I recomend never going into this dungeon before level three, and only with at least one other person, unless you plan to stay on the bottom two levels... When I have more info about the chest on the upper level, I will add it. -- ANM 3/28/2001
OK, I finally was able to open the locked gate on the top level (I used lockpick with a ""Reliable Lockpick"") and got into the chest (on the second attempt... after the first time, I died right before I got into the chest)... This dungeon is not worth the trouble... The chest contained all of 9 pyreals... All this dungeon is worth is exp, and even that can be better recieved in other places... Don't bother with this dungeon... ever. -- ANM 3/28/2001

name: Rithwic to Holtburg
description: Drops out at 42.9N, 34.5E

name: Reedshark Lair
description:
Two spineys at the entrance. Mess of red wasps, several reedshark pups, and a few adults. -- Khrome-Khoran 10/18/99
Above notes still accurate. This is a fun little dungeon, and except for the spineys at the beginning, the creatures are spaced out nicely. One chest with cheap loot. -- Minas Tirith 2/23/2000

name: Green Mire Grave
description:
Camper Central -- Uncle Istvan 9/19/99
Wow its actually tough now... Mudlurks, Chiefs, Shamans, ton of traps -- Soltari 9/24/99
Instead of newbie campers now Level 20+ campers with SOLLs own the place. Still a long wait for the Green Mire even with the new upgrade. Same old place just higher level people. -- Axel 10/12/99
Just spent an a night here. As run up with the key to the lower level, there are 6 players waiting for somebody to open the door for them. The real sad thing is that several of them already had the damn ""jolly green giant"" armor on already. I just picked up the loot on the floor found my self encumbered and left. Sorry I didn't need to wait several hours for the armor. -- ~Confucious 2/4/00
The Green Mire Cuirass is a set of Green Yori armor that is great for characters of any class for use until well into their 20?s if they wish. It covers upper, and lower body. It is located in the Green Mire Grave not far from Shoushi. This is an adventure for characters of at least level 12 in a group, or level 18+ solo. From Shoushi head to the Lifestone at 25.7 S 74.8 E. There is also a house here that is safe to rest in, if you have been injured by the area?s nasties. From here head to the dungeon location at 27.8 S 71.7 E about a 3 minute real time run. The portal is surrounded by several pillars of stone. Inside you will find your self in a large room with 4 exits, and 4 surface portals. Through 1 exit you can get to the Green Mire Yari (see that quest) from another you can get to the Green Mire Cuirass. ****** WARNING****** The next section contains SPOILERS do not read this if you want to discover the dungeon on your own. Ok, you have been warned. For the Cuirass head to the West exit. Stick to the wall on your left until you come to an opening to your right with stairs down. The 2nd opening I think. Go down. When you get to the 4-way intersection go left to the end of the hall. There will be a door here to be picked. Not too hard. As you descend the stairs you will encounter several different Mosswarts. Barkers, Feeders, and Mudlurks. At the bottom the hall will turn left. There is a large room here. At the far end is a chest, with some minor magical traps on it. This is where the Cuirass pops. The chest is pickable, but for those of you, who can not pick, the Mosswart Chief drops the key to the chest. In either corner of the room pops Mosswart Shamans. They can cast some nasty spells, and for the lower level adventurer this can be deadly. Also, there is a stone arch. This is where a Ghost Wisp pops. The cycle is about 30 min. All monster, except the Wisp will pop 2X before the next chest pop. When you see the Wisp pop, that is the sign that the Cuirass has popped. Vylarn Monarch of the Elite Brotherhood Harvestgain. -- Vylarn 5/10/2000
The place is soooooooo crowded. Forget the Curias, just pick up all the loot everyone else isn't intersted in. I make from 15-30k a run. -- Bleys Icefalcon 5/23/2000
when u get to the intersection it is right not left -- lighting strike 9/23/2000
The correct directions for the Green Mire Cuirass: From the entrance, head west. Take first left. Take first right. at the crossroads take a right, not a left. Follow to a locked door and pick it. Follow beyond the dorr to the room with the chest. -- Hexxor 12/31/2000
Key for the West wing door is located in the north wing on a barker moswart. -- Hexxor 12/31/2000
I have also found a red key that says it goes to 'a prison door in the Green Mire Grave'. -- Hexxor 12/31/2000
If you dont have lock pick here is what you do. From the entrance, head North into the dead end section, kill the barker mosswart, grab his key. Go back to entrance area, head East until you reach an area with a locked door going upstairs. Use the key you just got off the barker and head on in. This area leads further upstairs until you reach the grave area, which is the highest point of the dungeon. You can get the prison cell key off the low level mosswart (its redish). Return to the entrance area then head South. The southern area is small, 2 low lev mosswarts and a few drudges. In the drudge area, you get the prison cell chest key off the big drudge. After heading back to the entrance, head West. Take a left on the first fork in the hall, then make an immediate right heading downwards. At the 4 way crossroad, make left, kill the 2 mosswarts and use the red key to open up the prison cell. Use the key you got off the drudge to open the chest. Inside the chest is a key that opens the BIG door that leads downstairs and all of its medium level baddies. Once downstairs, you must kill the Chief mosswart in order to get the key that opens the chest which gives you the Green Mire armor. To open the chest in the upstairs section (East from entrance) you need to kill a mosswart in the West/Upstairs section. Cant miss him, he has a barker and shamen to keep him company. NOTE: This place can often be camped by high level monarchs obtaining easy armor for their vassels. -- prok 1/3/2001
NOTE:This dungeon is allmost allways camped by everyone all of the time.Expect to wait for many hours for the armor during peak hours.and you can forget about getting the yari.if you come at midnight there might not be anyone around but you better be able to solo everything from the weakest mosswarts all the way up to the mosswart cheif and the wisp that guards the chest with the armor.unless your level 20 or 30+ then your screwed no matter what. -- Sega Slayer 3/24/2001
heh...now everyhting I said in my last post is innaccurate. Nobody ever comes here anymore... -- Sega Slayer 12/27/2001

name: Thieve's Trail
description: Banderlings, Undead, Zombies, one Liche. You will need lockpicking just to get past the first door though

name: Dungeon Muddy
description: Was there last night. Has 6 mud golems, 4 limestone golems, one sandstone golem, 5 Blue Phantos Wasps, 4 Mire Phantos Wasps and 6 Lesser Mumiyahs. There is a chest at the end. 3 Mumiyahs are behind locked gates. I am a lvl 14 archer and can solo the place. Great xp for the mid teens. -- Benedict 8/23/2001

name: Red Rat Lair
description: Very small dungeon with couple Red and Brown rats

name: Mayoi to South Direlands
description:
Drops out at 84.2S, 34.4W. Before you go in to portal, Be prepared to fight a 14th level Gold Phyntos Wasp. 60 health and 70 mana. there are 2 of them.
bull crap i been here a hundred times and i never seen a gold wasp, mire wasp yes but not gold, and i would be mroe affraid of the lich lords and ash""s that spawn a little to close to the portal exit -- Shags 10/1/99
Beenhere, the Gold Wasps killed me before the ashes did. -- Eaglewerks 10/4/99
Last time I visited was greeted by a lovely Mountain Rat. Ever since the dires patch the smart thing to do is come out running, you go north enough and you""ll find the exit portal, camp there unless you have 20+ people who aren""t childsplay to a Ravener (lvl 19+). -- Manxer 10/17/99
Just used this portal today, nothing around upon exit but the lifestone was surrounded by raveners and stalkers -- Laciel 1/3/00
Damm it ppl, the spawns are random, ive had all sorts greeting me out of the portal, the best thing to do is just run. Errrrr maybe not did that straight into Panumbs the once best get ur bearings. -- Crabus 7/20/2000
Ha guys... you all joking. i just went through it and got killed by a nice umbris shadow. thats not what i expected ;) -- Nanies al-Fylin 12/3/2000

name: Direlands to Mayoi
description:
From the Direlands to Mayoi
Exits at -- Stern 12/25/99

name: Banderling House
description:
Empty house around Cragstone. 2 Banderlings levels 7ish
West of town and 2 banderling guards in the house, one young one outside -- Sinsho 12/16/99
This place is LOADED with Banders. Raiders, Guards and Scouts. They can hit through the floors and ceilings, so look out. The area surrounding is loaded with all sorts of badies too. -- Soo Yung 12/18/99

name: Hebian-To Sewers
description:
Major drop really far down in the sewers with a life stone at the bottom. -- Atal 9/15/99
After the ~75 point drop ther are life stones and a portal to Shoushi and the surface -- RB 9/16/99
Also a portal to Heb there. -- Al 9/20/99
Surface portal used to take you to Accursed halls. Have not checked lately. -- Honest John 2/17/00
After the 60-70 point health drop, you fall into a very large area built like an underground fortress, with 3 lifestones and several surface portals including one to Shoushi. No monsters down here but looks like there was supposed to be, probably Golems judging from the height of the landings and the way the lifestones are spread around(not to mention the fake Golem piles behind the closed doors). One room that spawns a single dagger- nothing more. Obviously an unfinished dungeon. Good for fast travel to Shoushi. -- HothRebel 2/22/2000
there is some monsters some black/grey rats,blue wasps,zombies but still after the larger fall there is no more monsters 3 portals 1-surface which is next to hebian-to 2-hebian-to?? an soushi...still think the run there is easier.. -- Alkitron 3/28/2000
If you can find your way down, there is a locked room with a bunch of dillos in it...never went all the way through though cuz health was too low. -- yi 7/16/2000
Have been through the whole dungeon now, first level is a few wasps and grey/white/black rats,second level more black rats,third level - spiney dillos,fourth level - spikey dillos ,2 zombies and a lich, to get to the zombies and lich + getting down to the lowest level you need lockpick. At the bottom - 3 lifestones and 3 portals, 1 portal exits just s of heb, 1 std heb portal and one to Shoushi --- Ana-Linh Goh -- Ana-Linh Goh 10/31/2000 Lockpick is reqired to get to any useful areas of this dungeon. Lifestones and portals to Hebian-To, Surface and Shoushi are at the bottom. This dungeon also has several Spiny Armoredillos on the 2nd level, 2 jumps down and behind a locked door. They drop Small Armoredillo Hides, which are housing and collection quest items. At the end of the Armoredillo area of the dungeon, there are 2 Spikey Armoredillos, which drop the regular Armoredillo Hide. This is also a housing and collection quest item. The respawn timer is around 10 minutes however, good to camp if you are desperate. -- Taarna Blood SC 9/13/2004

name: Theive's Den
description: Ive seen banderlings (young, scouts, guards, ravers, captains), skeletons, skeleton warriors, mite sentries (i hate those mofos), and a couple of black rats and drudges (prowlers, slinkers, the other white guys). lots of jewelry, plenty of loot as weapons, healing kits. the best place is, due to population density, all right turns. at least for loot, as its not too populated. -- Liao Allard 5/31/2000 Stop #9 in the Undead Mechanic quest added in the October 2003 patch. -- Geomancer 11/14/2003

name: Eastham Sewer
description:
Gnawer and Carrion Shreths when you walk in, and drudges throughout. One Hunter Shreth at the end where you can get a decent shield. -- Maxxx 9/18/99
Also a drudge robber about halfway through with decent treasure. -- Bubb 12/19/99
This place has been handing out more magical gems lately, but it's usually camped by too many people. -- Kaizen Sie Koe 12/26/99
If you are level 8, almost any class, you can solo this place. As a warrior at 10th i could run the whole think in about 30 min. and take about 2.5k of loot out. -- Vylarn 12/29/99
I can't get past that darned locked door. Is there a key? Or do I need lockpick... -- Alex Faysun 4/30/2000
High camping spot. An intricate sewer system with drudges and shreths. A very intresting set of interior rooms behind a locked door (need lockpicking). One hunter shreth and a surface portal at end. -- Zarkon 5/18/2000
The final room has an opening to the exit portal. Run there in the arch and the three prowlers can't flank you. Spawn is O.K., so you can build up some EXP pretty quick - good for 4-7th leveling quick. STAY IN ARCH - or you will be flanked... -- Bleys Icefalcon 5/23/2000

name: Mountain Short Cut
description:
Drops out at 41.0N, 56.0E on the mountain side.
Mattakars as soon as you drop out. -- Jarl Pixin 11/10/99
This portal is history and so is the small house that was next to it. It has been destroyed by one of the drilling shadow spires. -- Lars Larsson 10/17/2000
ooops, portal is still there. Near the new spire. -- Lars Larsson 10/17/2000
2 lich lords (lvl 55) right when you enter, they dont usually notice you right away though. Good hunting for levels 20 and up: a lot of grievvers, monougas, tummies, and drudges. Mostly monsters are about lvl 40-50 -- Pikkon Zha 10/19/2001

name: Arwic Portal
description: Drops out at -- Malef 12/16/99

name: Eotensfang to Bandit Castle
description: Drops out at

name: Drudge Nest
description: You can perch and kill about 8 skulkers. Getting out requires you to jump down and go through 3-4 prowlers to the exit. A locked chest that spanws newbie stuff. All in all fitting of its level reqs. Never anyone in here. -- War Mongress 2/26/2001

name: South Sawato Life Stone
description: A life stone in the middle of nowhere...

name: A Mosswart Nest
description: One main room, two smaller sub rooms. Very small dungeon. Several mosswarts, feeders and creepers mostly. Nothing special. -- Rhaz Darlin 4/14/2000

name: Mosswart Cave
description:
There's a peddler and a lifestone just north, and a lot of high lvl monsters in the area also. -- Mabelrode 1/11/00
Near the chief at the bottom of the cave there is a weapon/armor generator. Saw some decent weapon and armor for low level players. But if you can clean the place alone, those items are definitely not worth it. Better items on the chief tough... -- Tatsuidaya 6/14/2000

name: Yanshi to Yaraq
description: USed to drop out at 20.7S, 1.1W -- Habidakus 9/21/2000 New exit coords: 21.8S, 1.8W -- Dutton 7/11/2004

name: Yaraq to Samsur
description: Now exits at 3.2S, 19.0E -- Seeker 5/13/2004This location has been changed to 21.2S, 1.2E from 23.0S, 0.2W.-- CapFan 12/9/2004

name: Samsur to Holtberg
description: Drops out at 41.6N, 33.7E

name: Holtburg to Rithwic
description: Exit coords: 10.8N, 59.3E (Formerly 9.9N, 59.1E) -- Dutton 7/11/2004 This location has been changed to 42.4N, 33.8E from 40.8N, 34.0E.-- Armin 12/8/2004

name: Drudge Hideout
description:
Theres a locked off room at the beginning that spawns weapons. To make it a bit more harder, 2 drudges spawn (skulker and prowler in the same room. Used to spawn a whole lot of weapons in beta, now its toned down to 2 weapons per monster cycle, usually a sword and a bow. Rest of dungeon pretty straight forward. -- Garf Bond 12/26/99
Drudge Slinkers, Drudge Robbers, Drudge Slaves and a Ruined Chest here. -- Charles t Great 7/20/2003

name: Crypt of Ashen Tears
description: There is quite a few liches here, at a decent spawn rate. One right behind you when you enter, but he is down a ramp and usually armed with a long range weapon, so he doesn't get to attack you immediately, giving you time to prepare. From here, Right is to more liches and left is to Banderling Guards (and lots of 'em). And the one 27th Goldenback Tusker is now two 27th Goldenback Tuskers, but don't let them stop you from getting the decent XP from this dungeon, they can't reach you from their ""pit."" -- Rimgar 8/30/2000 Stop #8 in the Undead Mechanic quest added in the October 2003 patch. -- Geomancer 11/14/2003

name: Qalaba'r to Zaikhal
description: Drops out at 13.1N, 0.9E

name: Zaikhal to Cragstone
description: Drops out at 26.1N, 48.1E, but watch out for that last step, its a doozey.

name: Cragstone to Zaikhal
description: Drops out at

name: Samsur to Yaraq
description: Used to drop off near Yaraq at 21.9S, 2.2W -- Jezebel 12/19/99 Current exit coords: 21.8S, 1.8W -- Dutton 7/11/2004

name: Glenden Wood to North Direlands
description:
Drops out as
This portal is level-restricted to 12th+ -- Govno 9/27/2000

name: North Direlands to Glenden Wood
description: Exits 28.9N, 26.3E -- Polecat 12/9/99

name: Banderling Tower
description:
Near Glenden Woods. Lots of treasure and XP.
Takes foreverfor the banderlings to respawn and treasure is standard for the most part not much good loot anymore -- Vanyels Blade 9/24/99
Very hot camping spot. Always ~8 people competing for the banderlings... -- Nether 10/15/99
Also a Tumerok Warrior and a multi-trapped stairway leading up to top where Bander Capt. and a few Ravers reside guarding 2 trapped chests. If you attack the Captain approximately 7 - 10 additional Banderlings rush from off radar to assist. If you take the inside track up the stair you can avoid all traps. NOTE: This place is plagued with lag (at least on DT server it is anyway) if you have a lousy connection I suggest to find another place to lvl as the exp. is avg. and the loot sucks :7D. -- --Lia Fujishima 7/1/2000

name: Holtburg (sort of) to Glenden Wood
description:
Drops out at
This portal is actually closer to GW than it is to Holt ... but its still a shortcut if running -- Balder of Staal 1/14/00

name: North Glenden Prison
description: The first part of this dungeon contains level 25 mite matrons. Go deeper in and you will see level 32 risen soldiers and a few leve 25 zofrit zephirs. The chests in this dungeon have good loot. -- Falcon of Fury 8/7/2005

name: A Cave
description:
The banders are now Raiders, Blades, Ogres, and a Chief and a Bandit (lvl 44). The rats are Mountain Rats. And handing Tibri's Fire Spear to Tibri will get you 50k exp. No level restriction. Suggest 2-3 level 20s minimum. The banders still come in large mobs. -- Halcyon 9/12/2003
To get Tibri to speak to you, give him ""A note from Iquba"" purchased from a bar in Qalaba'r. You can also obtain Tibri's Fire Spear from this dungeon.

name: Fort Aimaru
description: Walled Fort with two Towers and lots of Mossworts, Brown Armoradillos, and Drudges.  Walled Castle with Two Towers.

name: A Rat Nest
description: A Rat Nest. White Rats, Grey Rats, Tan Rats, Russet Rats, Black Rats, Red Rats, Desert Rats, Swamp Rats, a one Mountain Rat. Ruined Chest here. -- Charles t Great 7/20/2003

name: Abandoned Tower
description:
No monsters, but it could make for a cool staging point.
There are monsters here. Reedsharks are the best killings here. 10/10/99
This is the ""Hilltop"" the portal in Crater Village drops off at. About 15-20 Drudge Prowlers around here on a fast respawn, great place for level 5-10 to hunt, also great spot for getting drudge head. Beware the higher-level spawn point real close by that sometimes produces shadows and laigus lugians. -- Confucius of FF 3/5/2002
Has around 10 Drudge Raveners now. If you take Hilltop portal from Fort Teth you drop right in the middle of them... -- Jaz of SC 7/8/2003

name: Fort Witshire
description:
This Fort has changed considerably as it is now the final dungeon in the Elysas Favor quest. Expect a large number of level 23 Hollow Minions in the courtyard. Below are the quest details: Note: It appears you can start the quest at Yaraq or Shoushi or Holtburg. Use the Witshire?s Key, gotten by doing all previous steps of the quest, to open the door to the building in the center of the courtyard. Once inside open the trap door under the stairs to enter the dungeon.
  • Fort Witshire dungeon is very maze like. Once inside make your way to a large room and take the north passage. From there continue going down and north until you reach the final room. From there kill a Hollow Minion named Dranith Menacet who spawns in the northeast corner of the room. He will drop Menacet?s Orders.
  • Take Menacet?s Orders back to Sir Tenshin at 32.8s 73.3e. As a reward for your bravery for the kingdom you receive 2 Sturdy Iron Keys and Elysa?s Favor. Elysa?s Favor is a ring and has 2 spells. The first is Life Giver that adds 15 Health. The second is a random stackable Minor Spell. Our 3 rings had Minor Endurance (+5 Endurance), Minor Focus (+5 Focus), Minor Strength (+5 Strength), and Minor Armor (+20 Armor). The final orders can be tuned in to any of the 3 senior guards.

    Krell Sunset Knights of Leafcull www.sunsetknights.com/ac -- Krell (LC) 1/23/2002




    The following information is out of date and is included for historical reasons.



    A deserted fort in between Cragstone and Glenden Wood. Lots of monsters and a life stone.
    Good Hunting. Druges, Hunters, Brown Arms -- Dunc 9/14/99
    This is a great place for Mages and Archers. The lifestone close by really helps out. This place is starting to get heavily camped at times. Anywhere from 5-10 players present at any given time. Wizards and Archers blasting away from the castle towers rule the day here. Treasure could be better but exps are good. -- Maglight 12/28/99

name: Witshire Dungeon
description:
The portal is in the southwest tower of Fort Witshire.
Green Wasps, Skeletons and Sekelton Captains. Good for experience, if you dont have a lockpick dont bother... Nothing great for treasure. -- Moe-Hone 11/12/99
Above notes still valid. Green Wasps and Grey Rats on first floor. Skeletons and Skeleton Warriors on the second floor. Skeletons, Warriors, and Captains on the third floor. Best thing about this dungeon is that most beasts are behind gates or doors, allowing time to heal between fights. Very dark in places. Need lockpick skill. Treasure still nothing great, but good exp for levels 10 and up. -- Minas Tirith 2/23/2000
Black Rats now, no Grey ones. Only one Skeleton Captain, who is at the lowest level. Bring your missile defense. While half of the skels keep you busy in melee, the other half shoots at you. Some nice wands as loot. Dungeon no problem for a lvl 15 solo meleer. -- Mobilat 8/20/2000
Now the final stop in the Elesyas Favor quest. Cant be entered from ground level (unless you are a really good jumper) -- the front gate is barracaded. A copy of Whitshires key needed to get into the second part of the dungeon. -- Doc Feelgood 12/17/2002

name: Fort Tethana to Glenden Wood/Cragstone
description: Drops out at  and it""s marked ""Hilltop""

name: Suntik
description:
Climb the Hill starting at 18.5 N 3.6 E. Crude Monougas have overrun the town. Bring your melee defense.
Some will appear outside the town at first -- dont kill them yet. Wait till the town spawns with many of them for a chance at a magic axe. -- Khrome-Khoran 9/18/99
This (now empty) to town was once called Suntik. The Monougas now are its only inhabitant?s. Theres a Letter of Request that details a little of the story of this sad town. -- Dunc. 11/6/99
You dont have to wait for all the monsters to spawn just pick up the axe in a cirtain building which is worth around 2K yet not really worth to use your self. -- Yanto 12/1/99
This is a great place to sharpen your urban combat skills -- lots of hiding places in the buildings and tents. -- Doc Feelgood 2/10/00
There is a corpse halfway between Glenden Wood and Zaikhal (I believe) that has a not that is supposed to lead you to this town. -- Rimgar 9/17/2000
That guy was the mayor I think and this place is called Suntik. Theres a New Suntik further down the road now. -- Immacolata 6/13/2003

name: The Undergound City
description:
Drops out where you started out, on the Isle of Tears. There a lot of monsters, but you have to look for them. Theres a good number of 11th level Barker Mossworts in there as well.
Supposed resting place of the legendary Thorsten Cragstone. Read the legend in the Cragstone library. -- Nether 11/22/99
Theres also a moss near an overlooking room on the the very lower levels with a very nice elemental axe. -- nemo 11/27/99
-A nice place for 8-16 lvls but be CAREFUL. U have to go to Isle Of Tears First theough to get to the portal..(isle of ters Portal is EAST of cragstone on the beach) -- Death Warrior
Well dont beleave the name, go to the isle at lev 4 or 5 maybe even 7 for there is nothing to fight there. Two wisps at top of mountain, one hunter, drudges, blue wasp , and drudges, a waist of time. And dont even bother going in the indergroud city -- Yanto 12/4/99
Have you been INSIDE the underground city? Plenty of Mosswart shamans, and a chieftan with nice loot. Beware the magic traps in the floor and the swarming mudlurk mosswarts. -- Imprimis 12/29/99
Also Thorstens grave in here, guarded by drudges, need key to get to chest, dunno whats inside -- Brave Sir Robin 12/30/99
Thorstens Grave is opened by the beautiful Key in the main area...No loot in the tomb...just click the tomb and it gives you Heal Other IV or higher... -- N 1/1/00

name: Crater Cave
description:
Dungeon full of icky nasties in the middle of the crater.
Granite Golems right when you enter...all the way up to magma golems further in... -- Koban Cho 9/20/99
This is were the coveted Black wand all the mages want is located -- Asalan 10/1/99
A very hevily camped area with 3 treasure chest that are currently broke & do not spawn much. But are heavily gaurded byt 7 level 103 Magma golems. Campers are here mainly to level as each magma golem will give 9000 exp. In this cave are Magma's, iron, obsidian, granite & copper golems 2 knath's also. lol the entered by slot wont fit my whole name so Im putting it herre :) Habib the terrible 11/30/99
Great place for life mages to lvl. If possible, come here at lvl 15 (the lvl limit). There are so many cheap spots among the granites, and once you can take them out easily, the magmas wait below. In the entrance room, 3 granites spawn across from you, to left and right will be 2 portals. Get up next to the wall between the portal and the granites, a bit closer to the portal, and use life magic to kill all granies without them being able to get to you. Go down into a room with a chandelier. Take the center hallway from there. There you see a little V shape split. Lure guys here, run on opp side of V from them, and more easy XP. Also, granites cant run underneath the chandelier if you lure them up there. Copper golems can however. Next take a right. There will be 1 granite right there, lure him out, and kill him. Now you can go in, turn left, and get next to the wall. From there you can hit the granite who, if done right, is stuck against the corner. He can still get you with magic though. The other you can lure behind a big rock thats aroudn the corner. If you would have taken a left up higher, you end up going towards the magmas, and after you kill the first4 granies, there is another wall u can use to hide behind. For magmas, when you jump down, run forward a small bit, and turn right towards a portal. Go into the corner near the magma there, easy harming and draining. Go back out to main hallway and go as you were going. A bit ahead, near a lot of magmas, there is a ramp to your right, sit on the ramp for more easy XP. -- Flamelord 1/5/00
Life magic sucks :-] -- Nightwolf 2/1/00
I agree withthe Above statement. Hopefully a said by the designers, Magma's will start learning the spells cast on them -- Keric Horde 3/2/2000
How in the hell do you get inside the rim of the crater by running? I've been to the dungeon via portal before.(player summoned) -- Juliet Dominici 3/9/2000
Come here if you wish to obtain an Atlan weapon. There are a total of 8 chances per spawn, if you manage to kill the 4 coppers, 3 irons, and the obsidian and leave nothing behind for anybody else. The mote spawn here ranges from poor to excellent. Don't bother with granites if you only want motes, but sometimes they just get. Nice place to power level and work on a quest at the same time. -- Xcalibur 3/27/2000
Cool place for Mages who like to power-level by draining. Virtually solely populated by the said Life Mages with only the occasional warrior or archer to be seen. Creatures have been described above but the danger wasn't really emphasised :) The very bottom is huge and spawns lots of Magmas. Good fun draining them if that's what you like, but at the same time you're slowly taking damage from the heat down there. And in response to a previous poster, the magmas now know their life spells :) - they now drain you :). Also home to Flares (lvl 12?), Flammas (lvl 43?) and Infernos (lvl 121). Flares and Flammas are no problem to 25+ Mages, the Infernos are a different matter :). Crap loot except for the occasional black rock from the magmas, black stone from the obsidian above or the even more occasional spawning mote from everything bar the Granites. A previous poster mentioned dropping down to the Magmas at level 15; well unless you've got someone with you who can dump a yield on them (at least IV) I wouldn't bother... my life is 240 and I still get resist, resist, resist :) If you want to practice on the Fire Elementals (Flare/Flamma/Inferno) before you go down then look no further than the Crater Lake :), just get ready to run from the Inferno, he hurts. -- Laz al-Farah 4/27/2000
Sturdy iron key opens chest at bottom -- Shoto Fle-Alch 5/7/2000
You can access the crater via a passage on the rim on its southwest side. The passage is guarded by one (or two) groups of a Flamma and two Flares and is visibly marked by tall columns on both the entrance and exit sides. Trying to jump in elsewhere can get you killed (even with 170 health..). -- Tell of William 7/6/2000
They changed the bottom of this place in the July 2000 patch. No uber chests down there now; the chests remain open, they don't even need picking. The spawn of Magmas in the very bottom has been reduced considerably. Where this was once an open area with a large lava pit in it, it is now populated with lots of small hut type structures which could be forges. Next to one of the forges is a set of Pyreal Forge Bellows. These are no drop, but I have no idea as to their use. -- Laz al-Farah 7/13/2000
I don't know if this is just pure luck or what but I went here before June patch 2001 and got 1 SIK for about every 100 magma golems I killed. But now I get one for every 10-20. :) Now I can get some level 6 scrolls, thanks turbine. [Stay Puff of MT] -- Stay Puff 6/30/2001 Stop #15 in the Undead Mechanic quest added in the October 2003 patch. -- Geomancer 11/16/2003

name: Crater to Hilltop (Near Glenden Wood)
description: Takes you from the crater to just outside of Glenden Wood ()

name: Lifestone and House north of Holtberg
description: A nice lay over spot...

name: Crater Pathway
description:
This dungeon has at least two exits. The one closest to the entrance takes you back to the start, but if you run straight through, using the center passages, you get to the exit surface portal that drops out at in the middle of the Crater.
Loaded with Zefirs which blast and drain you (not recommended for lower level chars) -- Rodan 8/24/2000
Zephirs everywhere plus at least two dark wisps wandering about inside. When it comes to the Zephirs think about that scene in Terminator II where the kid says The police are here Mom asks How many Kid says Uh, all of em I think. Well, that describes this place and Zephirs. -- Wyldstar 9/25/2000
4 Dark Wisps Spawn throughout whole dungeon, 1 at the beginning and 3 more in between. Great for getting wisp hearts to get Essence Flicker Orb. -- Darks Lord 1/16/2001
Portal is a half-click further north, underground. -- Immacolata 5/6/2001

name: Crater Village
description:
In the middle of the crater is this village with a couple of merchants, a lifestone, a number of portals. (Hilltop, Sho Roadside, and Crater Pathway)
Any one know what lvls are good here, and how to get here?? -- Not telling. 1/2/00
Way up and into the Crater at 64.8N, 9.5E -- Sol Noir 1/21/00
Here is where you?ll find Silencia, from whom you buy the glyph to merge with the Ingot to get the Atlan weapon (the glyph costs 9,500 pyreals). Before putting the glyph onto the ingot, make sure your attack skill is at least 250 to get a peerless (i even got a superior with 270). :-( -- Io Hell 7/11/2000
Oh, most likely you will find high level enchanters here who?ll buff your attack skill. Many of them are cool and won?t charge you for that, while other will ask for a C note. Waiting a little bit, you?ll get your buffs for free. -- Io Hell 7/11/2000

name: Crater to Sho Roadside
description:
Exits out at
festival 9/25/99

name: Mountain Keep
description: Stop #11 in the Undead Mechanic quest added in the October 2003 patch -- Geomancer 11/14/2003

name: Hut with Healer and Peddler
description: Near Holtburg

name: The Isle of tears to Cragstone
description:
On the Isle of tears, a way to get off
Exit Coords 25.3N, 50.0E-- Jamuran 1/18/00

name: Arwic Mines
description: Like many of the old newbie haunts, the critters here have been upgraded. Silver and Sewer Rats, Drudge Lurkers and Stalkers, Malus Shreths, etc. have replaced their previous newbie counterparts. -- Shemp 6/8/2004 Contains Elthina the Shady, a provisioner type shopkeeper. Buys at 90%-- Taarna Blood SC

name: Mite-y Fine House
description: A house full of Mites.  Boy are those puppies noisy.  Watch out for the external gaurds.

name: Mite Cave
description:
This cave lies almost directly north of Arwic. Be cautious, the Mites are nasty and the Matron is the nastiest one out of the bunch, and I do mean bunch.
The real coords on this dungeon are: Mite Maze Portal, 41.1N,57.2E (the location stated above is in the middle of nowhere) -- Balder of Staal 1/5/00
Its not a dungeon. Its a hole in the ground with mites. :) -- Polecat 1/22/00

name: Mountain Cottage
description:
A mountain cottage north of Arwic with a couple of Merchants. Rather handy.
also a good place for some xp a good amount of snowy and white mattekers, crude and rough monauguas and some limestone or sandstone i forget which golems 10/2/99
No Golems or Mattekars in immediate vicinity. Only mites. Portal to Arwic at 41.0 n 55.8 e Mattekars and Golems further up pass at 42.0n 53.5e -- Balo 2/25/2000
The spawns up here are random sometimes you get matties, sometimes golems, sometimes mites, sometimes monoguas, sometimes shadows, sometimes higher level drudges. -- Red and Gold 8/11/2000
Oddly enough, this place has the cheapest healing kits I have seen, 146 P for a good kit. -- Jann 9/30/2000
This place got a lot more dangerous in the last update. The Drudge Stalkers are still there, but the golems are more likely to copper or granite, and the Dires Banderlings have moved into the area. -- Lars Larsson 2/1/2001

name: Mite Maze
description:
More info to come.
Mostly sentries and squib. Once u see a Mal Tusker, youre near the nest with Squires and a Matron. Nice staff for reward. Rated : average (4+ level 10) -- Ken-sai 9/26/99
This is a mazey place. Natural cavern setting with lots of branching rooms and corridors. Medium size and mostly mites of many sizes and varities. -- Doc Feelgood 2/18/00
Final destination in the Impious Staff quest. Bring a lockpick. See Arwic Mines, Colier Mines, 4 Towers entries for more details. For map to the mage, visit - unique food items in here: cold milk, etc... -- Vincent Price 3/31/2000
No idea when, but now instead of insults when you speak w/ Harlune he gives you a quest to seek a book from Celcynd in Rithwic, who in turn sends you to Mt Lethe... the plot thickens... -- Shal - MT 11/27/2001

name: Lair of Death
description:
Watch it, Olthoi Workers. -- Lumino. 9/15/99
Forget the workers, watch out for the Soldiers and the Noble -- One who knows 9/23/99
Level 15+ -- Polecat 11/18/99
This must be one of the easiest high level dungeons to locate, really close to the Mountain Shortcut portal in Arwic. You portal into a large room which doesnt naturally spawn any of the giant insects
however if someone has been chased out of the dungeon (and alot are) there could be many of the nasty beasties waiting for you. Ive ran out of there with upto 7 of the things crying to have my body for lunch :) A network of passageways lead downwards, these passages contain nymphs (dont be deceived by their Lvl - they hit very hard), workers and soldiers. At the very bottom is a Noble. Usually the whole dungeon is very crowded, the noble is always camped. In there youll probably see some poor warrior tanking away with the Olthoi whilst a load of Archers do their thing - I gotta admit to being one. Exit portal is in room off large room where you portal in. No exit from the bottom which means trying to get past all the olthoi again. I believe they spawn some of the best loot in the game, cant confirm this as I only went there for the xp and didnt hang around long enough to loot any kills. -- Laz al-Farah 3/5/2000
You dont have to watch out for the soldiers and noble. All are dead within 30 seconds of spawning. for the short bit i was there the noble spawned some nice stuff. -- Theneler ( TD ) 6/22/2000
Entrance/exit is hot, covered by local Mountain Shortcut fauna. Dungeon is medium small, and spawn rate is slow, about eight minutes, so the hero carrying capacity is low. Corridors are windy enough that wall working is easy here. -- Doc Feelgood 10/1/2001
can you say camped? This place is camped if theres one guy here. and Doc why do all your post revolve around wall working? Dont tell me your one of those wussy life mages. I always thought better of you until this wall working stuff started. -- Sega Slayer 12/27/2001
Jun 03 update: Olthoi spawn updated a bit, and a whole new section added behind a portal at the bottom. New section is a large, honeycomb layout spawning Soldiers and Nobles at a medium spawn rate. The hero carrying capacity has been much increased. There is no exit near entrance in the new section. -- Doc Feelgood 6/20/2003
Further update: This place is now huge. Evis and Guards found as well, and yet another new section -- Catacombs of Opposition -- behind the new section. -- Doc Feelgood 6/21/2003
Back of the Catacombs of Opposition has the Olthoi Hunters Camp, and some Swarm Guardians beyond them -- a rough place. You can also get to the Catacombs from Black Death Catacombs. -- Doc Feelgood 8/24/2003

name: Mountain Pass with Olthoi
description:
Mountain Pass with Six (6) Olthoi workers blocking route.
also has wild monauguas and a snowy matteker 10/2/99
Also Has mites of all sizes great xp and loot there are also white and snowy mattekars all over the place among banderlings and crude and rough monaguas -- Ashe Pheonix 10/11/99
Get into this defile from 44.3N, 65.9E -- Doc Feelgood 2/28/2000

name: Rithwic Crypt
description:
The top looked easy, 3rd level monsters.
newbie dungeon, home of a mysterious key 9/23/99
Top level is all red wasps (1-2 at a time) and gnawer shreths (usually 1). Many behind doors. On 2nd level are white rats and 1 undead. Door is opened by going to far left corner (from door). Chest was empty for me. Also 1 locked door on 2nd level w/2 rats... no idea what else is in there. -- Naamor 9/29/99
Found the odd key on a white rat on the second level. -- Nether 10/10/99
Dont tackle the undead unless you are at least level 4 and at full stregnth. -- Talus 11/17/99
This Dungeon is level 1-6. -- Morgoth 12/5/99
The Mysterious Key / odd key mentioned is needed for the Quest for the Sword of light - see Halls of lost light - 76.7S, 74.8W -- Flibble 6/6/2000
Can be tough to reach if you are within the level restrictions for entering. Land around is full of Banderlings, Reedsharks and Broken Fragments. Best route is to follow the line of standing stones that begin just north of the Rithwic Bridge, go cautiously and you shouldonly find drudges and red wasps in your path. -- Mishiko 3/1/2001 This place has gotten tougher, now has Mire wasps, Hunter Shreth, and Desert Rats. The upper level is basically a large loop with rooms branching off, at the far side of the loop from the entrance is a ramp down to level 2 where the rats and the key are. -- Halcyon 9/11/2003

name: Neydisa Castle (a.k.a. Northern Castle)
description:
This is the location of Yi Yo-Jin, the leather crafter originally responsible for the hoary mattekar robes and who now can convert an older mattekar coat to a wooly mattekar coat. -- Servant-san 12/14/2000
The new furry mattekar coat looks nice, but remember that the conversion raises the coats value to 4k. So you will lose it a lot more. -- Keef the Thief 12/29/2000
The Archmage here now sells ALL scarabs including the new Platinum scarab (72,000p for one). He doesnt sell gems or master robes though. -- Fistandantillus 1/14/2001
The castle house the Loom on which you use the Spool of Silk as part of the Flag house item quest -- Jaz of SC 6/15/2002

name: Colier (a.k.a. Ghost Town)
description:
This is a dead town surrounded by monsters. Very cool for the atmosphere. In it is the access portal to the Collier Mine. Lots of Banderlings.
Discovered this town as I was just going for a run, no named town because it is a Banderling town. Made up of about 8 building. located inside one of the buildings is the entrance to the Coiler mines. Have yet to make it iside this building. Town is full of Banderling Guards, Scouts and Raiders.. maby even some bigger banderlings. -- Shadir 1/2/00
inside the mine are assorted critters - Skeletons, Banderlings, and the undead Baron Collier. Portal out down with the Baron, fun quest to kill him -- ChurnDash 2/4/00
If you are looking for a non-stop Banderling shoot, this is the place. If you have moved beyond Banderlings this place is just plain irritating. Expect to find yourself standing on a pile of Banderling bodies, whether you like it or not. -- Jann 9/29/2000
This place got a lot more dangerous. If you can handle the Banderlings the town itself is the same, but the hills around it are full of tuskers, large groups of mites, banderlings, and hunter shreths (all things that will chase you in packs if you fire on them). Anyone below level 15 or so is going to have real problems alone. -- Lars Larsson 10/18/2000
Baron of Collier drops a cool amulet that gives you +15 hp... -- Janx Spirit 10/18/2000
There are about 30 banderlings in the town, all on a 5 min spawn. Watch out when hitting the drudges in town, the high level drudges protect the lower level drudges. Dont be suprised when you get swarmed by 10 banderlings and 4 drudge lurkers at once. The portal is in a house guarded by 4 banderling guards. You need a special key to open the door unless you can pick a 600 diff door. -- Homer the Wise 7/3/2001
Now you can find everything from Banderling Guards to Banderling Enforcers here. There are now every remotly high lv monster here. I have seen everything form Linch Lords, Shad Lts, Greviers (sp),Monouga, Giga Luggies, Tusker Slaves, Dire Matties... I love this new spawn pattern (tip use the LS here or tie to the Portal) -- Eclipsa 9/20/2001

name: Colier Mine Portal
description:
In the basements of one of the shops in the Ghost Town.
Closest to 56.7/38.5 -- Kendall t Quick 9/16/99
Pretty crappy dungeon for its location in the middle of a monster inhabited town...only saw drudges and a young banderling on the first and second levels. Better stuff outside the dungeon. -- Nether 10/23/99
Also has undead miners,skels and zombies. Baron of Colier has a lightning long sword and guards four chests... havent opened them yet.. theres a Treasure Chest I couldnt pick with the help of a 46th level creat. enchanter -- Kaizen Sie Koe 12/26/99
No point in going through this dungeon, as the only good thing down there is a chest constantly besieged by campers -- Balder of Staal 12/31/99
You need a key to open chest. I dont know where to get it. Someone muttered somthing about obsidian golems though :) ohh that narrows it down... Ill post if I find anything, the guy with me says it carries great armour... opps, more campers.. -- Kahni 1/15/00
Someone also told me you need a key, but they mentioned the direlands. That makes it easy :( Way over camped for crappy stuff... -- Orko 2/2/00
everything you get out of the chests has too high of requirements to use ive seen rank 5 swords that only cast lvl 2 spells and its waaaaaaaaay overcamped by low lvl players who have no clue of what they are even getting. bottom line if your gonna go there dont even bother with the chests you wont get one unless you wait like 3 hours -- aln 2/4/00
No level restrictions on the portal -- Doc Feelgood 2/15/00
I found this place fun, kill a few Guards go and heal, repeat... Made 3,100p off the items that I found, As most of the Guards have a magic item on them. One house has a Raider in it, also there is a Raver running around. Note dont attack the Mite Scamp in one of the houses, as it will bring about 15-20 mites, not a fun thing to have happen. -- Nestor 3/4/2000
Made a trip here yesterday and found the camper chest gone...only 2 chests in the Barons room now
the one that has a difficulty of 999 (requires a special key) and an open one that loads moderate to low end items. Nice, but barely (and maybe not even barely) worth the effort of getting to the bottom. Got to find the key to that other chest... -- Dryke 3/9/2000
There is ore in this mine (as well as in a wheelbarrel at the bottom of Arwic mines) needed to complete the Emious Staff quest. Anybody know where it is? Ive searched and searched and havent found it. Also, anybody know where to get the key or keys that open the treasure chests? There are two 999 chests (on in the Barons room and another nearby) and a 700 chest (upper floors). The dungeon is rediculously easy for a high level player, but surprising when I went not another living soul (no pun intended) was there. -- Xcalibur 3/27/2000
I still recommend Arwic Mines for the iron ore. This mine is too remote to be convenient. -- Vincent Price 3/31/2000
the mine are broken/empty, at least on sol, collier itself is still full of nasties 10/02/00 -- Shorou Kai 10/1/2000
The ore in Arwic Mine was nerfed in the Sept 2000 update. As far as I know colier is only place to get iron ore now??? To find the wheel barrow get past the first door requireing barrons key(NOT pickable 1000?). Follow right wall (dont jump in pits) there are 2 undead guarding it. I found that ore spawned every 20-25 min but its on a 1-2 hours quest timer so if you want more than one bring a friend. The barrons key can be found on an undead(cant remember which type miner?)in the cell area its the cell door at end of hall. Which actualy isnt realy a cell its another hallway that curves to the left leading to more cells. He also drops the sratched key which is used in Life Giver Quest. Kill a Drudge(man is he ugly)inside a house on surface to get key to cell door(pickable). Kill a bander Raider in house across from the portal to get rusted key which opens entry door to mine(also pickable). -- Dark Man - Sol 10/3/2000
Is the quest broken or retired? I went down there, got all the keys, slew the Baron and used the treasure chest key to open the locked chest in his room. There was a mana stone and another item I cant remember. But no Coliers Lifegiver :-(((( I have done this quest before, but that is more than a month ago. -- Sis. Immacolata 2/4/2001
its a pain to get to it run from holtber dont no wich way gatta run through buncha crud like goldenback crimsonback fale female tuskers drudge lurker level 50 :( few banderlings if u like hunting high level ursins like linvak esper maybe a dire or so shadows maybe some fragments and broken ones plese come prepared kill creatures in the ghost town till u have 2 diffrent keys then find clier mine portal find the firds key bye finding a room whith an undead on the wall an undead miner spawns thare he has 2 keys find some locked chests till one has a treashure key in it when u find a room whith a switch press it then run across then u gatta jump ..btw its not that hard of a jump. if u wanna to the quest agin u have to exit then enter then repete the prosses kill the baron and like 6-7 minerz:(( then use the treashure key on the chest to the right in the room whith the baron in it im not shure where the ore is but id like it if some one found it and put a message where it is... -- rabbithunter 4/10/2001
The Barons Amulet will cast a unique spell giving you extra HP . This is THE item to find... The key story is a bit difficult (two keys to find outside, others inside) but the reward is great . -- Rackel 8/28/2001
Barons Amulet of Life Giving -- Difficulty 45, 230 Max Mana. As of 8/2001 on LC, Trade Value = 5 SI Keys. -- Nocturne [LC] 9/3/2001
Barons amulet is definately working as at 02 Sept 2001, completed sucessfully. -- Hol 9/4/2001

name: Colier to Holtburg
description:
Drops out at
Ghost Town a.k.a Town of Colier -- Ghozer 1/8/00

name: Skeletal Temple
description:
Lots of skeletons and one skeleton captain.
There are 3 Skeletons and 1 Captain (Lvl 18). Plus 8 empty Sarcophagi. Not much loot here, best thing I got was a lousy Heavy Crossbow. Also watch out for the Mites along the way, shoot one and a bunch come running. -- Nestor 3/4/2000

name: Bandit Castle Prison
description:
In the lower antechamber of the castle.
This place has just about every monster you would want behind bars. Lots of liches, a tusker and even a few gold wasps. -- Manxer 9/28/99
Big place. Not that a good portion of the monsters are NOT behind bars, so be careful. Lots of liches. -- Nether 10/27/99
Nice Architecture on actual surface compund, although not a single creature there. Would make a fantastic spawn spot--I am suprised it is not used as one currently-reminds me a good deathmatch map :) -- Kira Argounova 12/4/99
Update: Was here today and most of what was behind bars were undead and banderling ravers...the two gold wasps are nice but they spawn slowly as do the two liches at the bottom...lockpicking comes in handy as the wasps are behind a locked door and there were many other locked doors and chests as well...keys to the cells are easy to get if you want to loot as well as kill :) -- Khrome-Khoran 5/7/2000
This dungoen is for the Neydisa Haubruck quest.First though you have to go to Neydisa Castle and buy some Nelvaine's Olde Ispar Stout, after that ALLLL the way back to the bandit castle and give the ale to Mac Dugl's lieutenent and he gives you a key. Inside its explained by notes above but the locked door to the wasps is where you use the key that the lieutenent gives you. Kill the wasps take the alcy bag and the note. The note you take back to Neydisa Castle and give it to Lady Tallial and she gives you the hauberk(Al 100 with somewhat decent resistances)the alchy bag you give to the alchemist next to the bandit castle prison portal for 40 frost arrows. 6/4/2000
Also, there is a locked chest just outside the gold wasp room, which i believe has the bandit shield in it (i forget the stats, but i think its only AL 70 or so). Any confirmation? -- redmoskito 6/14/2000
Just to note, like MANY other places, this is a BAD place for mages to go to....it's probably easier just to target the bag and notepad grab and run to the portal before the gold wasps do much dmg. Making more than one trip would also probably be a good idea. Take a buddy with you..... -- kwailo 7/14/2000
BAD place for Mages? This is a Wonderful Place for Life Mages, most every thing is behind bars. You can't ask for a better Find as a Life Mage. I've been here since Level 1 and that was just a week ago. If you want a Good leveling place for starting Life Mages. This is a good place for it. -Bear the Archmage -- BearTheArchmage 9/7/2000
No point in going here first...go to 69.6n 17.6e first to get the Olde Ispar Stout -- matty 9/19/2000
VERY GOOD PLACE FOR LIFE MAGES TO DRAIN. - I agree wholeheartedly Bear.. I spent a good amount of time here levelling up. :) -- Opti Silmara 9/29/2000
Great place for low level mages and newbies to learn the art of life magic (if they can find someone to portal them into the dungeon). People are often killed when they go after the gold wasps. DON'T MESS WITH THIS WASPS AS LONG AS YOU ARE NOT LEVEL 30+ (with some good magic protects) OR IF YOU CAN'T DRAIN THEM. They don't look very dangerous but they are very nasty, fast and unforgiving. -- Kara Gandharvi 12/20/2000
Next to the exit portal at the end of the dugeon (near where the Gold Wasps are) is a locked chest. Inside the chest is the BANDIT SHIELD (AL 60, Flame Protection Other II). The chest has a resistance of 500. I never no clue if there is a key for it, or where it might be located. I was able to pick it with Lockpick of 296 and Weaken Lock IV. -- Qryax 1/10/2001

name: Bandit Castle to Eotensfang
description:
Drops out at , northwest of Arwic
added info: the Mountain Shortcut portal to Arwic is a three to five minute run... south? Follow unclimable cliffs that are on your right as you exit. Watch out for the two mountain rats waiting when you drop out. -- Doc Feelgood 1/30/00
Now drops out at 42.3N, 60.5E -- Habidakus 9/21/2000

name: Tower
description:
Good log-out site.
This tower isnt empty any more, has an Ivory Crafter within it now. 12/18/99
Yeah, and her pet blue phyntos wasps. Or what ever they are. Theres a locked chest in here and a lever. The door cannot be opened by conventional means. To do that you must run through the Stone Circle a few steps north of the Tower. -- Immacolata 5/2/2001

name: Crater Lair
description:
2+ Olthoi Workers (lvl 55) inside. Surface portal right next to the entrance. Didnt go any farther as I was alone.. :) -- Dunc 9/29/99
This is one of the new Interest Points on the Map. -- Dunc 9/29/99
It has been around for awhile...what is new are the nearby lifestones, one in the Northern Castle (a full-service town), and the other in Esper Caldera...you can walk down from the rim of the Caldera in one spot, or jump backward from many others...however if you dont portal out you must find the one spot to walk out at...(hint: 65.3N, 11.2E) -- Twisted Sword 10/3/99
Inside are many Olthoi, rangeing from Nymphs to Soldiers. The castle nearby is NOT full service. There is no armorer or jeweller. -- Soo Yung 1/1/00
BUGGED - The dungeon attempts a complete reset when you are inside making it very difficult to manuever. You would almost think LAG but its not. Frame rate drops down to 2-4 frames per second - Which with all those olthoi, can get ugly real quick. -- Olthoi Food 1/6/00
This is a medium-size Olthoi dungeon with nymphs, workers and soldiers. It is early era design: the gen rate modest, the corridors twisty, it can be wall worked. The exit is safe, the entrance guarded but easy to run into. The foyer doesnt gen, but monsters who have chased people into the foyer stay there. The dungeon is not too busy, and not too hazardous to reach, so its a good place to test out Olthoi tactics. -- Doc Feelgood 7/2/2000

name: Stonehold
description:
Northwestern town. Lots of monsters in the way.
Mostly a staging point for the Pit dungeon, south of there. Some hunting near the town (Crude Monougas, Wood Golems, Mites and Banderlings). Phyntos Menace dungeon is also near. Vendors have a good selection from all the players selling loot. One-way gate to the Heartland (Between Glendon Woods and Cragstone) nearby. -- Saffron Dusk 10/3/99
Pretty good selection of mage goods..lockpicks peerless,suberb etc etc -- Alkitron 4/26/2000
Way to there is now crowded with Tuskers (up to Goldenback) and shadows (on Harvestgain) -- Jean Ranta 5/2/2000
Are there any portal to Stonehld -- Hanas-Mouringth 7/26/2000
You can actually live in Stonehold, I have a friend who succeeded in getting mules there. Because of the very long trip, by foot, very few people. Tough creatures within sight of town. I fought a Goldenback Tusker in the village square. Shadows, Stalkers and Lurkers within easy walking distance. Town merchants buy everything at reasonable prices, and Archmage sells full compliment of trade notes. Level 20+ Hermits, this is your town. -- Jann 9/29/2000

name: Stonehold to Heartland
description: There a sign that says Warning: One way travel.

name: Lakeside Lair
description:
Pretty straight forward
Four Grommies. -- Grunzio 9/18/99
No grommies, creeper and feeder Mossies -- Mako of Thistle 11/30/99
About 6 or 7 mosswarts total. Worthless dungeon. -- Nether 12/11/99
its not worthless to us low level guys... -- Darwin al Mohed 3/14/2000 Still just creepers and feeders. Desparately in need of an overhaul, I doubt anyone ever goes here, its much too far from newbie areas. Are there any true newbies in this game anymore, for that matter? I havent met a sub-20 that didnt have a high-level char on some server in a loooong time. -- Halcyon 9/12/2003

name: Glenden Wood Lifestone
description:
Oh my god. Its actually in town. -- Nether 10/10/99
Scary... Well if you continue straight down the road a little bit you should see another lifestone by the roadside at the store outposts. Seem to be the only 2 Lifestones in GW. -- Garfield3d 10/20/99
Go out the East road and youll find a third -- Glendon Guard 11/15/99

name: Dead Samsur Suburb
description: Dead town, lots of corpses and cows.  The occassional drudge...

name: Dungeon Manor
description:
1-6 dungeon. Drudges inside and a locked door I couldnt get through. -- Danril 9/20/99
A SOLL key rests here -- Ki Dung Sa Bong 10/9/99
Heh the Drudges on top like to jump off at you when you come in, pretty fun for low chars. -- Arador 11/13/99
Worn Rusty Key -- Wormtongue 2/23/2000

name: Stone Face Oasis
description:
A large stone head in the middle of a desert oasis...
This is actually a crater that does indeed have a stone head in the center of an oasis. The side are a little steep in places but naviagble. Hideing next to the stone head are 2-3 mud golems. Also in and around the crater are rust grommies and red wasps. Not a bad area for the level 5-8 player with a life stone a short distance away. -- Dei Ray 3/13/2000
Sometimes 4 Mud Golems and trick getting in or out. Run N from the East outpost. -- Tobias 2/9/2001

name: Al-Arqas Lifestone
description: Moved to 31.3S, 13.6E from 31.2S, 10.8E -- Seeker 5/16/2004

name: Banderling Ruin
description: Banders have grown up -- now has all types from scouts up to a chief. Fast spawn. There is a runed chest here, locked (diff 100), and a few normal chests. Probably a great place to level before the Lugian Citadel, since its utterly deserted. -- Halcyon 9/11/2003

name: Drudge Farm
description:
Good farming land. Drudges and cows.
Changed, the cows are still there with cabbage growing in the pin. The house has a peddler inside who seems to be baking a rather large pie. lol (Should be changed to a shop now) -- Logan the Wyz 12/6/2000
Selling cabbage and killing cows are some stuff to do for brand-new characters. Watch out for sharks, golems, shreths, and mattekars in the area, however. Makes for great low-teen level hunting in combination with the adjacent Golem Hill. -- Wylfghar 12/7/2001

name: Drudge Camp
description:
Roasting drudges over an open fire...
Spotted mud golems here. They spotted me, too. -- Ghiradella 1/10/00
They spotted me also but it was too late for them, all 4 of them. The spawn rate seems to be about 10 minutes. 4 Mud golems spawn around the pillar and a 5th just a bit south. -- Nestor 3/3/00 3/2/2000

name: Cragstone
description: Capitol town of the Aluvians, in the region known as Osteth. You can see the ruins of a shadow spire here. You can buy level 3 and 4 scrolls, as well as foci. - Geomancer

name: Cragstone Reach
description: Also one at 24.4 N 48.3 E, Why they put two so close is anybodys guess. -- Muhannand 9/25/99

name: Lytelthorpe
description:
Small Alluvian town
Sells all tapers for people based in Holtberg. Easy portal run to resupply. -- Terlys 2/12/00
Mana stones very cheap, bought some for 350 pyreals. -- Kragor 3/12/2000
sells only tapers and large trade notes on entire starter towns loop. -- Slash 9/28/2000

name: Lytelthorpe to Holtberg
description:
Drops out at 41.3N, 33.3E (One Way)
Now drops out at 41.6N, 33.7E -- Habidakus 9/21/2000

name: Lost Distillery
description:
Really funky looking portal. Levels 1-5
Quest Dungeon - Level 1 - 7 -- WeeWillieWinkie 1/1/00
now level 1-9 -- Ragnarok II 4/10/2000
Appears to be broken--the quest is to take nectar to the Keep Master in Lytelthorpe, and he will give you a key to the rest of the dungeon. The nectar is behind the locked door, though. -- Ander the Quick 5/28/2000
No, Ander its not broken. I just went in there, and the nectar is in the same chest where its always been, not behind the locked door. If the chest is empty, you just gotta wait for it to respawn, like any other camped dungeon. :) -- Niten Kensei 6/14/2000
Now level 1-20 home of the Town Stamp (at the beginning near the exit portal between the rocks). Nice newbie dungeon to level & do a quest at the same time. -- Kara Gandharvi 1/8/2001

name: Lytelthorpe Open Space Temple
description:
A large, outdoor temple outside of Lytelthorpe.
A great hunting ground for mages or archers levels 5 thru 15... Several good monster spawns (8 thru 14) within range--you can safely lure them in and pick 'em off from the Temple platform... -- adamblast 3/17/2002

name: Lytelthorpe to Rithwic
description: At one point, this portal dropped out at 9.3N, 58.9E. Then it was 9.9N, 59.1E according to Habidakus 9/21/2000. Not quite four years later it now drops out at 10.8N, 59.3E. Update provided by: -- Dutton 7/11/2004.

name: Rithwic
description:
Nice town to start off in. Good hunting, drudges, bandies, wasps, reedsharks, just North of town. Weaponsmith buys at 100% value. -- Fistandantillus 4/1/2000
You forgot Eastham beach, just follow road across river get to eastham good hunting -- ... ........... 12/3/2000

name: Mt. Alphus
description:
The mountain of great interest -- Polecat 8/1/99
-- Mt. Alphus 2/20/2001

name: Mt. Alphus to South Zabool
description: Drops out at 20.5N, 18.1E

name: Mt. Alphus to Mountain Base
description: Drops out at 19.6N, 17.0E -- Larce Mantoll 10/5/2000

name: Mt Alphus to Alpine Valley
description: Drops out at 19.7N, 15.7E

name: Mt. Alphus Tower
description:
Nice view...
-- Mt. Alphus 2/20/2001

name: Obsidian Enchantress
description:
Obsidian Enchantress enchants certain (whatever that means) obsidian crafted items for you.
Verified 11/2/1999. -- Dunc 11/2/99
Gives you an Obsidian Crown or Ring in return for an Obsidian Sphere(for Crown) or an Obsidian Jewel (for ring) -- Critical Hit 5/7/2000

name: Glenden Wood
description:
Very Popular town. Lotsa armor & weapons in the shops--better than Holtberg IMHO. -- Iceon 9/17/99
Not sure about the armour and weapons part. Everytime I have been there, nothing good is in the shops execept for an occasional Ice Tachi -- Xoran II 2/25/2000
Components are at base price here, up to Silver scarabs and up to Moderate Mana Charges. Long run from Holt, semilong run from Hilltop. -- Garfield Bond 8/5/2000
Halfway Portal from Holt -> Gledon - at 36.7N on the Road Turn Due West the Portal is about 15 Seconds Run -- Reslk lvl30 8/16/2000
This might be the best place to call home in Dereth. Plenty of decent weapons and armor to buy. Archmage sell scarabs up to silver, and tapers are cheap at 28 pyreals. Lifestone in town (.), plus a lifestone at each outpost, east and west of town.Easy to powerlevel to level 5 in 30 minutes because the countryside is loaded with monsters. Create your character in Holtburg and run him to the portal at 36.7N, 29.1E. Many friendly people easy to get a portal opened to almost anywhere in Dereth. -- Happy Spellmore 4/27/2001
Hmm....with the June update moderate mana charges are now 2,550 pyreals amd tapers are 43 pyreals. This place has alreadt lost some population. Too bad. -- Happy Spellmore 6/16/2001

name: Peddler and Cow
description:
Sells food and sacks, outside of Arwic.
There is a lifestone here as well. -- Dunc 9/16/99
Hes actually labeled as Farmer and not Peddler -- Jaz 12/10/2001

name: Arwic
description: Alluvian town

name: Leather Crafter
description:
Collects amoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, and mattekar hides and will make things for you.
Right off the road to Eastham before the first orchard and filos doom -- Slash 9/28/2000

name: Lugian Fort
description:
Theyre big. Theyre bad. And theres a lot of them. Good treasure if you can survive...
One of the nastiest areas Ive seen. Surrounded by tons of skels of numerous types and sprinkled with dillos, golems, and various other baddies. Bring a small army with you as we did nothin but run for our lives. -- Cieran 12/25/99
Great place for 3 or 4 20+ guys.stuff around fort is not as bad as above poster makes it sound but makes it hard to run away if you have to. -- Sega Slayer 12/1/2000
Monsters in the are now Dolls, dune reavers, silt lurkers, and skeletons with the occasional dread mu-miyah. -- Yellowbeard 6/8/2001
Monters in the fort are still Lugians, and its still a fun place to take down. -- Doc Feelgood 2/28/2002

name: Lugian Outpost
description:
What more can I say?
One of two Lugian Outposts...there are generally only 4 Lugians at any one time in this very small dungeon. -- Min Donner 9/15/99
Usually a shield that spawns every 5 mins there. -- Puncture 4/26/2000
Lots of twisty tunnels...could be dangerous with lugians in a closed space. Lithos and Laigos lugians right when you enter. Not crowded...no one else was there. -- Zenaph 6/3/2000
Very uncamped due to the logn run from the nearest lifestone. Nice hunting outside while the lugians respawn. Everything from low drudges to lugians, coppers, matties. The mountain fortress is also nearby if you run out of other stuff. The entrance is safe, the exit is not. -- War Mongress 2/26/2001

name: Zaikhal
description:
Quiet town, few players, no portal storms. Has weapon/armorer, archmage, healer, jeweler, sage, grocer, tavern, leather crafter, ivory crafter and a stone collector. Mostly lvl 12-20 players due to lvl of most nearby monsters and dungeons. -- Khrome-Khoran 9/18/99
My favorite town. Really tranquil, sleepy place. An excellent starting point for the Crypt of Ashen Tears, Sylsfear, the Halls of Helm, a trek to Stonehold and the Moss Caves (but why would you want to go in there? Nothing.) -- Saffron Dusk 10/7/99
Wahts a portal storm?? -- Not telling you 1/2/00
Starting town for unarmed weapon quest.. -- Silverion 3/12/2000
Starting point for many quests, including the Impious Staff. Is part of the Frore quest as well. In the AC backstory, this is the capitol of the Gharundim people. -- Grim Fiddle 6/11/2000
My home town. Nice quiet town, with all your basic needs. Perfect for vacationing :D. Beautiful countryside, with some average to good hunting. And if that isnt enough, its got portal ties with Qalabar and Cragstone, which both eventually lead to Heiban-to. -- Rimgar 8/30/2000

name: Tufa
description:
Place where you can buy almost all the spell componets, they have all the tapers, but missing the final 2 scarabs -- John the Strong 9/27/99
A town, center for ghrun Dim -- TKM 12/7/99
Also great for cooking and a rock collector, great place and good money compared to its naboring town Yaraq (see what I said about Yaraq) great hunting on the way there as well, watch out for Hunter Streth and Low lvl skeltons -- Cheiron Vale 1/2/00
No one sells any spell components or tapers in this town any more. -- Killindil 3/28/2000
Nice little town. There IS a mage shop here and it is one of the best Ive seen. Has some of the best prices for Mana charges. -- Gonj The Unjust 3/30/2000
The fletcher in this town is good, too. He sells blunt, AP and broadhead arrows. -- Doc Feelgood 4/25/2000
Alas, the fletcher only sells Armor Piercing now. -- Truthsayer 6/10/2000
Has Alchemy Supplies and Lockpicks of all qualities. -- Khaos 8/29/2000
Tufa is no longer. Now a giant crater destroyed by shadow spires. 3 Spires still loom above it. Electricity randomly erupts from the ground. A waterfull now runs through the center of the crater with a black fog that does dmg to you. Also, the new Spider creatures spawn in the cratet, but only every 30+ minutes. -- T-Bird (HG) 9/12/2000
The pit spawns a group of shadows and children and a spider - kill the spider and you get the following message The Grievver collapses at Megachiropteras feet with a sickening wet sound. Moaning in pain the other shadow-spawn collapse. The steaming wreckage of Tufa is quiet, for the moment. when you examine the corpses of the shadows they are killed by misadventure -- Megachiroptera 9/16/2000
Tufa is back to being a full service town. There are some side effects. The merchants are scattered, and some (like the bowyer) have much reduced selections. Second cheapest source of healing kits I know of (so far only Cragstone has cheaper kits). The Tailor is decent, there is a trader with Peerless lockpicks and the mage still has a good selection of comps including the level 1-4 scarabs and all the tapers (38 pyreels each as of today). Unfortunately the mage pays only 50% - Sell your magic stuff in Yaraq and get 100% instead. Stone Collector and Ivory Crafter seem to be gone. Also the Shadow Spires have dispersed. -- Maglor Daefalas 11/4/2000
Ya-Bint-Al-Hawa tells you, There are healing kits even more potent than the ones dropped mainly by Lugians. The Zharalim have recently uncovered lore that enables them to treat these kits in order to make them more potent. If you trade me a memnosyne fragment, I will reward you in turn, depending on the quality of the fragment. -- Sixfingers 3/21/2001

name: Old Yanshi
description:
Great rock in the middle of town. -- l 10/26/99
For starting players short on funds, this is one of the best starter towns. Check out the left-side smith when you have things to sell :). -- Zimbalt Cac 3/23/2000
In the newbie-town portal loop, Yanshi healer has the best prices for health draughts. Smith (Nu Sha) buys for 100%, sells for 110%. -- Ling Sit-Sit 8/2/2000
Town was destroyed posted a point of interest to replace this. -- Zen Tek Ken 6/25/2003

name: Dryreach
description:
Warning. Gates lock at dusk...
Be prepared for 20+ Tumeroks just outside of town. -- Manxer 9/29/99
actually, gates remain locked round the clock. I camped for one full day/night cycle..they never opened or became unlocked. -- Grainger 11/16/99
Get the gate key from a man in East Rithwic hiding under the stairs at the pub -- Weezl 11/16/99
You can also buy the key from the Weary Old Man in Eastham -- Ari 12/5/99
Inside the town you can get a parchment with directions to help you find Sir Joffres Party. There is also a tower guarded by Tumeroks due north of the town. I didnt go in though, as we had already lost two members of our party. Many Tumerok warriors. Recommend lvl 18+ fighters or 15+ mages -- Ten Miles High 1/4/00
Smith buys weapons and armour at >100%, Jeweller buys at good prices also. Make a small fortune selling the junk youd normally not bother picking up. -- Ylyrra 5/2/2000
Where is this parchment for Joffres party? I cant seem to find it. More details greatly appreciated. -- Davros 9/14/2000
If you plan to stay in Dryreach for any period of time bring a lockpicker or several keys, as each key is only good for three uses and the loot around here is very heavy. You will use your key up very quickly, and just because there is another player inside the city doesn not mean that he will open the doors for you. -- Jann 9/30/2000

name: Sawato
description:
IMO dont bother going here. Beatuiful place, nothing that matters. Between it and Shoushi though, is a BEAUTIFUL mountain, shaped like a man from above. -- Adren 9/18/99
All basic stores here. Close to swamp ruin,full of mudlurks and barkers,couple shamans. -- PizzaFiend 1/14/00
The only reason to go to this smelly swamp town is to get blunt arrowheads, which come in handy for direlands hunting. 1/19/00
Hear, hear, one of the worst laid out places on the map. Bad news monsters in the trackless swamps north, and a lifestone thats halfway to enternity heading south. I left two corpses in those swamps just trying to get into town from the north. -- Doc Feelgood 2/15/00
A good reason to go here: it sells basic stock Yoroi armor for the lowest prices anywhere. For example, basic AL 80 Yoroi leggings, which cost 1788 in Mayoi and 2145 in the Hebian armorer sell here for 1645 (as of this date). Other Yoroi-type basic stock armor pieces are similarly low priced. So if you are like me and like checking out unknown areas in armor that is not a problem to lose (coming back with your good stuff once you know you can handle it), here is the place to get basic Yoroi stuff. Its also not a problem to get to...run NW from Shoushi on the road that passes the GMG. Not hard at all. -- Zimbalt 5/18/2000
I liked Sawato, The swamp can be a pain but there is a life stone with a Mage to thee North as well as a Mosswart Tower that holds mudlurks, barkers, and a shaman. If you head North through the swamp and into the mountains you can find another lifestone. In the mountains there is a mosswart Chief and many other good monsters. -- MojoRisen 5/26/2000
My opinion of Sawato has improved since my previous entry. Lifestones are now close by both east and northwest, the mage shop has low prices, there is a trophy smith and a wing collector, I can use blunt arrowheads, and its close to the Sho Roadside exit point. -- Doc Feelgood 6/10/2000
If you want blunt arrowheads (and you do.), this is the place to get them. -- Keef the Thief 12/8/2000
