If youre looking for plants with which to dye your armor red, the swamps to the west are a great place to find them. -- Sixfingers 12/10/2000
The mage here now sells plat, pyreal, and gold scarabs. -- Xarion of MT 3/5/2001
Casino nearby, It should be a boom town soon. I prefer heb for a bse though but I think I may temporarily Move to Sawato. -- Satsujinki 4/26/2001
Also home to the Ogre Mask maker named Tsua Kagemata as of 7/7/01 give him a Virindi mask and hell give you an Ogre mask (AL 220 UA IV sho only UC 180) -- Chryon 7/7/2001

name: Drudge Nest
description:
Rated very cheesy...
3 skulkers and 1 sneaker at most. Should be tough... -- Sithlore 10/6/99
Lvls 1-5 only -- Big Red - (FF) 5/10/2000

name: Arwic Beach House
description:
Empty and a good log out point
Should be changed to Eastham Beach house since its near eastham, not arwic -- Yakana 5/12/2000
Houses like that one are dotted along the beach, and provide places to rest, log off, or escape. Theres a lot more than one. -- Liao Allard 6/2/2000

name: Hebian-To
description:
Good lvl 3 to 10 area, the area just across the river is good hunting. Lots of drudges, mosswarts, and variety of shreaths. -- Asalan 9/19/99
Best prices on mana charges I have seen -- Jann 9/29/2000
Fair prices, but not the best. For moderate and small charges (what Hebian has), both Eastham and Glendon Woods have the best prices. Moderate in Heb (bungalow mage): 1995p. Moderate in GW and Eastham: 1650p. High and Great charges are available at all 3 of the master mages in Dereth, and work out to be the best cost-per-mana, if your items can hold 500 (high) or 1000 (great) mana a shot. -- Zimbalt 10/15/2000
Tailor pays full value, for you shirt accumulators. -- Ognam 11/15/2000
The Mage store carries peas, although they are cheaper in Mayoi. -- Tressia 2/1/2001
A great town with links to Qalabar and Cragstone. Smack in the middle of Nanto and Shoushi. Fully funcional town, has a Virindi Gem Collector. Sell rate is 90%. -- Nocturne [LC] 9/3/2001

name: Mayoi
description:
Home of the Incredible Blacksmith of Lag. Takes a while for the shopping window to come up, but the selection is incredible due to the nearby South Direlands Portal -- Valis 9/26/99
the black smith has been fixed so its not so bad anymore -- s 12/5/99
Small, hard to get to, should be atleast 7th lvl to try, Drudges and Low lvl streth-Mongoas on the route from shoushi -- Cheiron Vale 1/2/00
7th level my foot. Ive done it at 3rd level. You just need to stick to the road. If you can outrun a group of drudges you can get here easily. -- Mycroft999 1/4/00
There is a portal from shoushi to Nanto then you can run south from nanto. I have made the trip as a lvl 1 mage and it is not that difficult. Another bonus about this place is the mage tower down the beach has very low prices and is very popular with mages. -- Laitly Crestfie 2/13/00
Excellent hunting from level 5-20, with great transitions from lowly Drudges to Grommies and Water Golems to Amploth Lugians to even Shadow Liutenants being sighted not give minutes from town. Spectacular beachfront property, to boot. -- anony 6/10/2000
I would just like to note that the Prices at the mage shop are not low, bu actually rather high. For mana stones at least... -- Ganzor 6/21/2000
The mage tower close to town has crappy prices, but the one farther down the beach south and east has decent (10% markup) prices, worth the extra 2 minute run -- Serafin 8/4/2000
Bowyer sells Armor Piercing arrowheads. Worth a trip if you have an alchemist/fletcher -- Jann 9/29/2000
Good hunting but good and crowded too. If you dont like to run into too many people while out adventuring, Mayoi is probably not the best choice of hunting spots try some of the Gharu towns out west which are virtually deserted. -- Hu Pong 11/2/2000

name: Fort Tethana
description:
This is in Fort Tethana (the walled town) in the middle of the direlands
Lifestone has been moved from here. -- Xonin 11/18/99
Lifestone is just outside the front gate, down the hill. -- Stu 1/1/00
Big Crowded place, cool architecture. Tall towers with good views of the surrounding landscape. Supposedly good items to buy, though I havent looked myself, and with the many amount of people, good place to sell/trade things. An uncrowded corner has rat spawn in it. One warning, however. When I first entered, I found my computer freezing up big time. This is when I discovered the rat infested corner. This is also when I discovered that I could change my video settings to make my framerate faster. This is the only place Ive ever experienced such horrible framerate with those settings. -- Rimgar 8/30/2000

name: Direlands Lifestone
description: Next to the Mountain Halls dungeon with a nice, relatively safe, tower near by. -- Polecat 12/10/99

name: Dungeon Gallery Tower Portal
description:
This portal is restricted to levels 1-10. Wouldnt recommend a level 1 goes in alone since the drudges will gang up on you.
Drudges ganging up on you? I went through what I think is the whole place, and did so for about 10 minutes, and I only found a robber, and a few sneakers on the upper levels. Either this place has a horrible respawn, or it is simply a boring dungeon -- Rimgar 3/7/2000
Ever since I found a Life amstery 2 orb and some good magic jewlery off the robber, I come back whenever Im in Rithwic. Also the room near robber spawns a tart apple (saved my ass a bunch of times) -- Ki 3/13/2000
Respawn rate is terrible. Drudges jump down at you when you enter, but take a long,long time to respawn -- Ragnarok II 4/10/2000
I am sorry to say that in my opinion, this is one of the worst places I have ever been. Although is is a lev 1-10 dungeon, I went in as lev 4 with a lev 2 chr, we did it VERY quickly, got board and left. Not worth the waste of time - there are far better places to get experiance in Rithwic - go to Rithwic Crypt for example. -- Flibble 6/6/2000
I wouldnt suggest a lvl 1 going in there, but its not really that tough. I went in there at lvl 6 and soloed the tower, cleaning it out in under 10 minutes. Talk about a disappointment. -- Himura of TD 11/4/2000

name: Eastham Outdoor Altar
description: Very nice and tranquil. -- Polecat 9/14/99

name: Rithwic Lifestone
description:
hmm not sure which of these 3 stones is the one near the portal to shoushi, But for those who fight near shoushi (either the grotto or out in the woods with the banderlings) the Rithwic stone is accually closer to town then either Shoushi outpost stone. it drops you on the hill near the Grotto portal. -- Dryctor Ben Rei 1/16/00
Its not this one. This LS is near the East Rithwic Outpost. The LS near the Shoushi portal is listed correctly here at 11.2N 59.4E -- Zimbalt Cac 3/29/2000

name: Rithwic to Lytelthorpe
description:
Drops out at 1.3N, 51.7E
Now drops out at 1.9N, 51.9E -- Habidakus 9/21/2000

name: Shoushi to Nanto
description: This portal has moved to 33.3S, 72.8E from 32.3S, 71.7E. The new exit coords are: 52.2S, 82.5E instead of 51.0S, 81.7E-- CapFan 12/9/2004

name: Twin Springs
description: A couple of huge springs that exit into nowhere around Nanto...

name: Nanto to Yanshi
description: Drops out at 10.7S, 46.5E instead of 13.1S, 46.9E -- Dutton 7/11/2004

name: Yanshi Lifestone
description:
Not there 10/9/99 -- Nether 10/9/99
Correct coords are 12.8S 45.1E dated 10/9/99 -- Nether 10/9/99
Updated the entry to reflect the new coords. -- Polecat 10/9/99

name: Yaraq to Al-Arqas
description:
Drops out at 31.5S, 12.5E. Take a good look at the surrounding pillars and what you think that may mean?
Now drops out at 31.0S, 12.7E -- Habidakus 9/21/2000
New exit coords: 31.3S, 13.2E -- Dutton 7/11/2004 This location has been changed to 21.2S. 1.4W from 22.8S, 0.7W. -- CapFan 12/9/2004

name: Al-Arqas to Samsur
description: Drops out at 3.2S, 19.0E -- Seeker 5/13/2004

name: Yaraq Drudge Tower
description:
Drudge tower in Yaraq
Levels 1-6 but unfortunately, the hill is usually guarded by 2 hunter shreths, 1 blood and a spiny dillo. -- Khrome-Khoran 9/19/99
The Monstors on the hill cycle from day to day. I have seen sandstone golems, spiny and stony dillos, and skelitons but there may be more. -- Warbin 3/25/2000

name: Under-Cove Crypt
description: You will need to go to the nearby Drudge Tower and push a button at the top to open the door to this portal. Sand Golem at the end and a runed chest -- Astral Dominae of TD 3/10/2004There is now a quest tied to this dungeon. A level 26 marionette lives inside. Kill it and return its skull to a quest NPC in Yaraq. The runed chest requires lockpicking. -- Falcon of Fury 7/29/2005

name: Roaming Bowyer
description:
Buys and Sells Bows & Related Equpiment.
Not just any ""related equipment"", but special arrows and quarrels you would normally need a fletcher to make :) -- Zimbalt Cac 2/15/00
Special arrows means armor piercing. That's it, no bludge, slash, etc. -- Truthsayer 6/10/2000
This guy used to sell arrows at 100%. As of the June Money fix he buys at 90% sells at 155%...:( -- Dark Man - Sol 6/20/2001

name: Nanto Lifestone
description:
Near tutorial dungeon
Moved to 52.2S, 81.6E from 52.4S, 85.4E-- Dark Dominitrix 5/29/2004

name: South Rithwic Outpost
description: Training town...

name: Daiklos
description: Filled with Liches, Drudge Lurkers, Silver Rats, Skeleton Captains. Also chest and Runed chests as well. -- Broto McKilsey 6/16/2003

name: Daiklos Wall
description: A quarter circle wall next to the dungeon portal where it gets its name.  Due to the rich assortment of monsters, this is an excellant place for a mage to excercise their skills.

name: Lifestone
description: near Tufa -- Adric the Red 4/8/2000

name: Hunters Leap
description: Lilithas Bow found here. Populated with various humans, brigands through lvl 44 assassins at the end. They all cast various 2/3 life and war spells. . -- Halcyon 9/11/2003

name: Undead Town
description:
It's actually just a little east of that location, from the shore of the lake. It's a building full of undead (undead spell casters too) and a tent. Didn't stop to admire the view as I was alone. Zombies and Undead galore
This is also an Interest Point. -- Dunc 10/3/99
This is a collection of Gharundum buildings filled with about 30 fast-genning Undead and Zombies, and one slow-genning Liche. No chests or other BDT (Big Dungeon Tresure). The surrounding monsters are plentiful and they will join in fighting if you stray too far from town center. In June patch the surrounding area is hosting some Auroch Fire cattle. -- Doc Feelgood 6/15/2000
Two level 20-ish Archers made a pilgrimage to the town. We killed many undead and zombies and liches, but there were too many. We were not able to loot the dead undead. You will take bolts from every direction, you will be attacked by armoredillos and shreths and mites when you attempt to heal yourself in the trees. The tent will not hide you. We were forced to flee after we ran out of arrows. We never did get close to clearing hte place. If you come, come loaded, and ready for an epic battle. This place is far out of the way. You can spend an afternoon in non-stop combat, just you and the monsters. We attempted to take the buildings, and engaged in some fabulous building to building street fighting. But ultimately we were repulsed. WARNING, the trip home may be even more dangerous than the town itself, especially if you blow your supply of arrows. -- Jann 9/29/2000

name: Advocate Dungeon
description:
This is where you go if you want to become an Advocate. One Skeleton with a key that doesn't open anything. -- Grunzio 9/18/99
Completing thsi quest doen NOT make you an advocate, its just one part of the process -- Honest John 10/3/99
To become an Advocate, you must complete this quest, and then seek out an advocate in the game so they can promote you to Advocate status. -- Valadon Grimm 10/10/99
Addendum - this dungeon is quite out of date by now. Anyone interested in being an Advocate should visit (link deleted by Geomancer 2-16-2005 - was long dead). -- Delantio 10/15/99
As of now you can pretty much put off going to the portal unless you're level 126... =) 10/17/99
I was told that it was 126+ because of a bug, but I highly doubt it. -- Cerfance Justis 11/11/99
Not used by advocate programany longer. Nothing in there of note. Level 126 is to keep people out until the portal can be removed 2/17/00
Actually this dungeon is full of little rooms with no entrances or exits. A Sentinal took me there to check out some armor I had that had swear words in the inscrip. -- Bin Ibn Tabar 8/3/2000
This place no longer exists. -- Grim Fiddle 3/16/2002
Ah what the heck, the AC-spedia Board of Derethian Curiosities have decided to let it remain for history's sake. -- Immacolata 3/20/2002

name: Disaster Maze
description: Very Bad Place. Everything from Drudges to Virindi's.

name: Dungeon Fern
description: Has a Runed Chest at the end. -- Charles t Great 7/20/2003

name: Golem Burial Ground
description: Now contains Mist, Obsidian, Magma, Oak, Unstable, and Glacier Golems along with a runed chest -- Chupon 8/19/2004

name: Halls of the Helm
description: Dungeon full of undead, the Guardian of the Helm drops Superior Helmet, and Fiery Shield.

name: Inner Dungeon
description: Stop #18 in the Undead Mechanic quest added in the October 2003 patch. There was no sign of any key needed from a guy, but in two places you'll need to pick doors with a 350 difficulty. -- Geomancer 11/16/2003

name: Lost Garden Ruins
description: Stop #17 in the Undead Mechanic quest added in the October 2003 patch. -- Geomancer 11/16/2003

name: Old Mine
description: Stop #14 in the Undead Mechanic quest added in the October 2003 patch. -- Geomancer 11/16/2003

name: Small Complex
description: Part of the 40+ Renegade Stone Clasp / Renegade Herbal Kit quest. This dungeon is full of level 100 Tumeroks, Lugians and a few Murk Drudges. At the bottom is Captain Waliknua, the tumerok leader here. He holds several Strong Iron Keys that are used to unlock a chest at the bottom of Burun Cathedral (used to be old Sclavus Cathedral) just south of here. 1 week timer for key. -- Taarna Blood SC

name: Yaraq Tunnels
description:
Home of a SOLL key -- Ki Dung Sa Bong 10/8/99
Watch out for Skel Wars just North of here. -- El Gareth 10/19/99
Probably the toughest of the first 6 SoLL key quests. -- Bubba 12/19/99
Worn Strange Key -- Wormtongue 2/23/2000
Outside this dungeon, I have seen everything from Innocent Dolls to Dread/Anciend Mu-Miyahs. Not good for low levels. If you stay on the side of the hill that faces town, you are ""relatively"" safe. However, I have seen Skeleton Warriors on that end of the plateau as well. Watch your radar. -- Dezran Rogue 7/18/2001

name: An abandonned Farm
description: Here you can find a grape of abandonned farms

name: A cow pen
description:
A cow pen, mouhoo.
Good place for low player level hunting. Druges, cow and white rat. -- Dunc 9/16/99

name: Imuth Maer Doquin (a.k.a. Bunch of Ruins)
description:
This isnt just a bunch of ruins. Each of four buildings is filled with Mosswarts. Ludlurks, Barkers, Shaman, etc. Good place for treasure and experience for a few level 12 players. Undergorund areas have secret doors, so look for them. -- Shogo Akai 11/24/99
The name of this place is the Imuth Maer Doquin according to the map on the quick ref card. -- Xian Liu 1/31/00
This now has the 4/17/2002
Lets try that again shall we? This now has the NPC you Talk to to collect more of Elysas Letters. Part of the Thorsten Cragstones Armor and Axe Quest. -- Stern - LC 4/17/2002

name: Farm/Healer
description:
A healer shop, and a farmer.
Healer sells kits and potions at cost, great deal. -- Serafin 11/20/99

name: Camp of Undead
description:
A small camp of Undead and Zombies.
A short run from Heb To. Tough for low level chars. About six undead and a couple of zombies. Good exp for low level chars and some enchanted undergarments if youre lucky. -- Zulu Njomo 2/23/2001
Very nice xps for level 12-20. Take a mixed group, as the zombies and undead spawn in groups and can overwhelm a lone player. Lots of other stuff around the camp, reedsharks, blood shreths, bandies, etc. Thanks to Ghungaden Ironwill for showing me this spot :) -- War Mongress 2/25/2001

name: Yanshi Tunnels
description:
Home of the Worn Plain Key. Drudges & Gnawer -- Slant 10/5/99
Level 1-6 -- Morgoth 12/5/99
The Worn Plain Key needed for the SOLL Quest ist at a Drudge Slinker in a room with 3 small tables and some chairs. -- Kara Gandharvi 11/19/2000
To find the key go left and follow the rooms until you can go left right or straight, go straight. Respawn time is about 20 minutes, took me about 2 hours to get 5. -- Takagi Shouga 12/9/2000
You can also find one of Jong Mis writings in a chest, before you reach the drudge with the key. -- Chin-Wa 7/16/2001

name: Lifestone
description: Near the Banderling Cave

name: Liazk Itzi's Temple (Blackmire 2)
description:
This is one of the new Fellowship quests. Liazk Itzis Temple is the old shop of Fadsahil al-Tashbi the Master Archmage. His portal gems still exit here making questing much easier. Go inside and use the Odd Looking Vine to enter the dungeon. You need Dragonsblood from any mage shop to appease the statue in the entry and open the door. Inside there are 4 statues for 4 different level splits, with 100+ being the highest. The dungeon is just a series of long corridors and a few puzzles, there is no real boss monster. Prizes include Ancient Armored Bracers, and choice of Primary Attribute Fellowship spells, Bow, Staff, Dagger, and UA weapons -- Taarna Blood SC




All pre 2004 information below is out of date and incorrect. It is included for historical purposes. -- Taarna Blood SC




South west of Al-Arqas,Has all of the high level magic components, including pyreal scarab.
Also sells the Gharundim master robe (50,000p+ each) -- Obsidian 1/24/00
An excellent shop for PKs to stock up at...almost never anybody here.Also, prices are among the best. -- Krack 8/31/2000
Not only are the prices good, the view is amazing. The building type thing that the mage is in is similar to the entrance to the HoLL with black smoke flowing out from the inside...theres a frost bolt spinning in one spot inside too. Great place to take a screenshot :
) Prices are the best u can get, and never laggy here. Run is relatively safe..just the occasional lowl level desert monsters. -- Nexic 11/10/2000
Scarab Prices: Platinum 44,000, Pyreal 1,100, Gold 550. Great Mana Charges 6,050. All peas to boot. -- prok 1/13/2001

name: Lifestone
description:
in middle of nowhere
Services the Double Portals to the south -- Doc Feelgood 2/18/00

name: Arwic Portal
description: A one way portal to Arwic. Exits ate . Also as far as I can tell, this is the Interest Point between Arwic and Eastham. -- Dunc 11/14/99

name: Walled Fort
description:
Cool little fort
I ran through this after the October update to find it still empty. Breathtaking view of lake from center tower. Great place for a gathering or party. -- Sixfingers 10/12/2000

name: Banderling Tower
description:
A really neat looking tower, with banderlings, unable to ender because of the slope.
There are a couple ways up the slope. Theres a bunch of banderlings, including a Chief (lvl 16). -- Dunc 10/2/99
About a dozen banderlings, both inside and outside tower. -- Doc Feelgood 3/8/2000 Banderling Manglers and Strikers now. Runed Chest as well. -- Charles 7/25/2004

name: Holtburg Redoubt
description: Creatures: Drudge Skulkers, Drudge Slinkers, Drudge Sneakers, and an occasional Drudge Prowler. Quests: Part of Welcome Letter quests for Holtburg South and West. Location: Just east of Holtburg South. (A starting town) Has been moved to 40.4N, 34.5E from 39.0N, 35.6E as of the December 2004 patch.-- Armin 12/12/2004

name: Glenden Wood Dungeon
description: Stop #4 out of #20 in the Undead Mechanic quest added in the October 2003 patch. -- Geomancer 11/12/2003Contains various monsters level 12-26 such as drudge servants, drudge slaves, banderling blades, banderling ogres, and silver rats. -- Falcon of Fury 8/7/2005

name: Empyrean Garrison
description: Part of the Undead Mechanic quest for the October 2003 patch. (Specifically the second location) -- Geomancer 11/12/2003

name: Druge Cave
description: Great place for a small party to get exp and loot - merchant with everything (except trade notes & spells) right on the surface. Outside Samsur - if memory serves.

name: Holtburg Dungeon
description:
Just North of Holtburg. Got some skeletons and a lich down on the lower levels... -- Garf 11/19/99
Exit near enterance. Early parts filled with little Drudge Skulkers galore. In the early rooms, fighting one will usually bring a lot of them if someone hasn't taken care of them. Takes a bit of exploring to find Sneakers or higher drudges and a bit more running to get to the area with Undead and such (there's a sign with a portal in the room before you enter the area with undead.) SoLL key here, look for it in one of the lower, smaller, white skinned creatures. -- Garfield3d 11/25/99
To go in the lower level you must absolutely have a lockpick... Beware for undead... If you stay in the higher level there is only Drudges... It's good to gain xp for low level players... -- Galadriel 12/22/99
Worn Small Key -- Wormtongue 2/23/2000
This dungeon is now level 1 - 10. -- WuJen 2/27/2000
Lich near bottom, spawns in room with locked coffin that has some pretty nice magic jewelry for a lvl1-10 dungeon. Taking out the lich at < lvl10 requires a lot of teamwork and strategy and is very fun. -- Machina 3/5/2000
How does one enter the lower level without a lockpick? (Or anyone else who has one.) Is there a key somewhere? -- Tim 6/13/2000
To get through locked doors, have a friend with lockpick skill or create a new character with the skill and log that char behind the locked doors (there are many doors though). The 3rd level is great for level 4+ chars; tons of undead. Great for leveling and getting good loot for the dungeon's level restriction. Don't piss the lich off (on level 4). -- Lifestoner 10/8/2000
Dont even waste your time looking in the UNlocked sarcophagous-there is nothing there... If you beat the lich and end up in a room full of light, hug the walls, dont get in the middle of the room or you will meet an electrifing fate of a one who was scorched by a lightning trap... The sarcophagous in that room contain good jewelery as does the loot from the Lich-but watch out he is easilly boodered and not easily distacted from killing a character that ""pissed him off"" P.S. How come there are people of level 15< there? I thought the dungeon was restricted to 1-10 lvl... -- Witold 3/2/2001
There is no way to get to the bottom section without lockpick. The SoLL key spawns on one of the white rats in th lower section. There are level 15's here occasionally camping the undead, which can be fought and killed through the door. If you leveled while in the dungeon, it does not kick you out. -- War Mongress 3/4/2001
Drudge Slaves, Spikey Armoredillos, Swamp Rats, Sandy Armoredillo, Limestone Golem, Jade Gromines. Lower lockpicked levels unchanged. No level restrictions. SoLL key on the level 11 Swamp Rat. -- Charles t Great 7/20/2003 Other than one SoLL Key, this dungeon also has 2 Spikey and one Sandy Armoredillo on a 5 minute spawn. A place to hunt hides if you are desperate. -- Taarna Blood SC 9/13/2004

name: Two Abandoned Houses
description: Two houses with lots of Banderlings inside

name: Waterfalls
description:
Not much here except for the big waterfalls and incredible scenery.
Festival stone on West side at top of the falls -- Gracejones 2/26/2000
These are the Cragstone Falls, named after the heroic fallen warrior, Thorsten Cragstone. -- Sparky 3/2/2000
There are Water Golems here. -- Chef Fletcher 4/14/2000

name: Moss Chamber
description:
Lack of Monsters
Dont waste your time -- pathetic. -- Khrome-Khoran 9/19/99
Pathetic doesnt even describe it. A great big place, filled with nothing. 5, maybe 6 Creeper Mosswarts, with only one that can attack you, the others being behind bars, with locked doors (no keys around). A bunch of corridors, all doubling back to the same space, where you started. True Boredom. -- Saffron Dusk 10/7/99
Still pitiful, no monsters. A waste of some decent architecture. -- Neilla 10/3/2000
It was still pathetic around end of August 2000 when I was there -- Tadesha Xian 10/4/2000
This place finally got a little upgrade. Check it out, youll have to search around some... -- Aliera 10/15/2000
Loot and experience are good for people in their teens. Moderate amount of Mossies up to a Chief. A few liches and zombies. Lockpick is a must. How do you get down to all this fun stuff? Finding it is the funnest part... -- Kinjou Dragoon 1/31/2001
No longer empty:
now its got higher level mossies (Idolators, Fanatics, Zealots, and Soul-Trappers) plus a very high level mossie chieftan whos hard to hit with melee skill of 300+. Very fast spawn, as well. At the bottom theres a portal called Moss Chamber, which leads into a room containing five mysterious Virindi NPCs. This is all part of the February quest. -- Constantine 2/15/2001
Beware. On AC explorer only the first couple of posts relating to this dungeon appear. Beware. If you dont expect, or can handle, Mossie fanatics (L35) and zealots (L45), from the moment you enter,then you are doomed, as I learnt to my cost :-( -- Hagen II 2/16/2001
Is is the place you take your Virindi Essance and cloak (or shroud). Shroud and Essance gives you 5 diamond scarabs...cload and essance will give you one of 4 weapons...sword spear mace or axe...they have VERY good spells on them with low diff..but beware..you die and they are gone forever :P -- The Dead 2/19/2001

name: Treehouse Tower
description:
Lots of Banderlings.
10/2/99
This is an Interest Point. -- Dunc 10/2/99
No longer Banders but Tumeroks of lower lvl. 4 if i remember correctly. One chest. -- Kosugi 1/8/00
Found 8 Tumeroks here, from lvl. 8 scouts to lvl. 20 warriors. -- Finn Djhala 2/27/2000
Over a dozen tumeroks now, with three priests, still one chest. -- Doc Feelgood 3/8/2000
Lots of Tuskers and Mites in the general area if you get tired of whacking Tumeroks. -- Warblade Prime 5/23/2000
Chest still there, wasnt anything in it when I arrived. However, there were no Bandies, maybe they didnt spawn, but there were a whole bunch of esper and linvak ursuins around it. I love the way they die. -- Trebber II 3/13/2001
Very Hard, Surrounding it can contain Lich Lords, Granite Golems, Mid Level Drudges, and other nastys. I saw a few grievers... I brought my LvL 16 vassal and he died a few time obviously.. -- DirX 10/3/2001

name: Lifestone
description: Lifestone near Uziz

name: Pod of Beasts
description: This is the center of a nice little area with 8 or so fires. Lifestone near by, good hunting.

name: Mage Shop
description:
There are no spell components except for what others have sold there -- Bin 9/25/99
Found quite a few excellent spell components here, but the building is surrounded by Outcasts and Banderlings -- Gwen the Strong 5/11/2000

name: Tower and Buildings
description:
A tower with a couple small houses near it
Seems to be mostly drudges. just down the hill is a house where some (very limited) magic supplies are sold. e.g. I saw maybe 3 herbs, a few powedered gems... -- Gracejones 2/26/2000
In the southernmost house, with two drudges, is a chest. Locked, of course. Perhaps it holds the key to the tower a short distance towards Eastham? -- Immacolata 3/24/2001

name: Shreth Hive
description:
Restricted to characters of Levels 1 - 6.
1 of the 4 quest stones are here (Not the Stone of Compassion, or Humility though) -- Iban Sato 10/25/99
Seems like this is now a drudge spawn party, no stones here. -- Merdryn 11/5/99
The Stone of Detachment IS here. Just gotta go all the way to the bottom. -- Cindy 11/15/99
This is not a bad place to level up (to about 5th). The entry level overlooks a pit filled with drudges -- fine hunting for archers and war mages. The bottom half is big, but not complex, and filled with low-level shreth. A fine time can be had by all kinds of newbie characters. -- Doc Feelgood 4/11/2000
I went through it in a party of two and never saw the chests at the bottom with what were at the time HUGH SHERITH then my friend went in with three others and wooped its rear got the stone and some decient loot for the place but this was with a carecter with a heulm and chane mail armor when i had studded leather but its fun at any lvl that you can get in at if your in a grupe just never jump off into the big pit. -- Leonon 9/13/2000
Find the Shoushi Town Stamp (for letter quest)right inside the entrance, next to the surface portal. Very convenient, no need to go all the way down. -- Sis. Immacolata 12/17/2000
Lvl 1-20 only. Very nice place to level for low level warriors, archers and mages equally. But be careful when you enter, there are one or two druges waiting. -- Kara Gandharvi 12/25/2000
Been here 3 times, never seen a Shreth, just lots of drudges. -- Yuki of FF 1/1/2001
The Shreths are located at the bottom, ranging from the Gnawers (which you can avoid since they are passiev), to Carrion, to one Blood at the end. Bring armor, not a robe. :) Jump midway through the dungeon, look for a small ledge, roughly 25 points. -- Nocturne, LC 4/6/2002

name: Lifestone in the middle of nowhere
description: Lifestone in the middle of nowhere

name: Lin
description:
This new town is between Baishi and Mayoi
portal to tou tou, and khayyaban -- maxforce 9/21/99
No more portal to Tou, have to use Al Jalima portal in Khay to get to a tou portal. -- Manxer 9/28/99
There is a TouTou portal now. -- Donknow 2/2/00
Good level 8+ hunting to the southwest and northwest. Lugians, shadows, zefirs, shreths, banderlings, mosswarts, all within a 4-minute run of town. -- Chi Domkwai 3/25/2000
Mage is expensive, sells only tiny mana charges and no tapers. You have to portal to Khayyaban to get tapers, and theyre expensive there. The other portal here is to Tou Tou, and the mage there doesnt sell tapers, either. -- Wa Chen 9/9/2000
Can be a good place to shop for armor. Jeweler gives fair prices. Run between Nanto and Kin uis fairly safe and quick, one way of getting from Arwic-Al Jalima portal circle to the big portal circle (Yanshi portal in Nanto) -- Jann 9/29/2000
Great town for anyone under level 40.Drudges,mosswarts and banderlings(few nearby dungeons with these as well)spawn all around town for lower levels and the lugian citadel is nearby for the higher levels.good prices on stam elixirs and small mana stones. -- Sega Slayer 12/1/2000
Now sells tapers and high end components (gold scarabs, pyreal scarabs and the new platium scarabs for example):
better selection than Arwic. -- Jan01Patch 1/11/2001
Oops.. forgot to say mage shop, well you get the idea. -- Jan01Patch 1/11/2001

name: Grievous Vault
description:
Close to Uziz, can be seen from the road. For characters of levels 10-20, havent been inside, but told is populated by skeletons and skeleton captains.
Contains 1 Skeletal Lord and -lots- of Red rats. -- Maarek 9/15/99
The Skeletal Lord & Red rat comment is incorrect. This place has mummies Lichs and a Lich Lord. There is also a Banderling Chief thats locked up and if you kill him you get a Copper Chainmail Shirt. -- Axel 09/17/99 9/17/99
Portal to Samsur as well. HeHe If you can find it. -- Lorthos 3/28/2000
This is also one of the dungeons where you find a gem for the Crimison Stars quest. Upper Limit of Level 30 on the entrance portal. -- ReSpawn 4/9/2000
When you enter you are in an L-shaped passage. Go around the corner and just past the surface portal is a four-way intersection of sorts. Jump down into the crossing passage and head north, till you come to another four-way. Go east into the large Temple room. Secret passage to Samsur portal is in the south wall, to the right of the altar. -- Adric the Red 8/2/2000
At the bottom, there is a LL and a Tortured Soul. The TS has a liche skull on it that can be turned into a key to open the Mines of Despair if you give it to a hermit in the mountains NE of Kara, just outide the Undead Town and Mines of Despair. Another room at the bottom contains a Greater Mummy surrounded by lessers that will drop the Ruby Mahwen which is NO drop and part of the construction of the Silfi of Crimson Stars. -- Ryth-al-Rothgar 10/12/2000
Level 30 cap removed in 11/14/200 patch. -- Adric the Red 11/15/2000
Important Note. This will get you the Golden Key for the Focusing Stone [Mines of Despair] Quest, but you wont get the second key. See the Soul Fearing Quest writeup in order to get the correct skull. -- Nocturne [LC] 9/3/2001

name: Shoushi
description:
A complete starter town, with every merchant possible, and some good hunting up the western mountains (Level 15+). -- Saffron Dusk 10/7/99
Newbie central and also a place to find scammers. I have found several people here looking for patrons. They take what they can and drop the gear onto their main character. Patrons beware. Also some very stupid thieves who will try to get you to hit the V key on the keyboard by promising that it will increase the value, armor level, etc of the item. Newbies beware. -- Morheru 4/20/2000
Newbie central, for sure. If the Yanshi left-side smith is the place to sell all your stuff, the smith in this town is the place to buy all your stuff. He sells weapons, armor, and the other junk people sell to him _below_ list price. Towns like Holtburg and Rithwic sell at list, but here is the only place that sells below list. A consideration when starting out alone without a patron. Like other starter towns, his basic stock stuff doesnt go beyond chainmail and low-end weapons (no Tachis or Yoroi, for instance), but occasionally you will find good stuff that folks sell. -- Zimbalt 5/31/2000
An excellent place to find vassals. Expect about a third of them to rip you off and you wont be disappointed. -- Jann 9/29/2000
Shoushi is the coolest, that aside like most (if not all) newbie towns, the mage now sells tapers. -- Jan01Patch 1/11/2001

name: Castle
description: Sewer rats, Skeleton Bone Lords, Skeleton Lord, Skeleton Wraith, Fleshless Warriors, and Baron Nuvillus who drops Crown of Bone. Inside the castle is the Spinning Wheel on which you use Grievver Silk. This is part of the Flag house item quest. There also a Ruined chest where Baron is at.

name: Beach Fort (a.k.a. Small Town)
description:
N.W. Beach fort with mage, healer, peddler buy/selling weapons, armor, health kits, lockpicks, arrows, other items
NPCs here are a healer, weaponer, peddler and mage. Cant sell food, armor, jewlery (peddler buys gems). Mage has very limited components. -- Doc Feelgood 3/8/2000
The mage there will trade the following: A Pyreal Mote for a hint on the herb for the ring spells, a Pyreal Sliver for a hint on the talisman for the ring spells, a pyreal Nugget for 5 Diamond Scarabs, a Pyreal Bar for a scroll of Eye of the Storm. -- Polecat 7/12/2000
This is the place to get your ore refined in the hollow/ravenous weapons quests.. Outside there are some Goldenback tuskers and drudge stalkers.. occasionally some Shadows. -- Jade Al-Youh 10/8/2000
The mage there is the middle character, and he gives other scrolls for pyreal bars, I got a Spike Strafe scroll from him. -- Fourpius 12/27/2000
If you wish to get your chunks of chorizite refined, there is a Quest-timer on the NPC. its 16.30 hours. -- Der Nominator 12/14/2001
Faruza ibn Salaq is the name of the NPC -- Og of Olothi 2/20/2002
To get here easily: 1) Go to Mayoi, locate the settlements portal (60.8S, 80.3E). 2) Jump in the Lady Malia Estates Portal. Be ready for Northern Osteth creatures (Banderlings, Drudges, Niffis, Monougas, etc). 3) Run to the Beach Fort at the above coordinates. -- Nocturne, LC 4/28/2002

name: Fountain
description:
Near West Holtburg. The fountain casts Revitalize Other I if drank from. Lots of food and Druge Slinkers and Skulkers for hunting.
Verified 11/2/1999. -- Dunc 11/2/99

name: Thistledown Festival Stone
description:
Near the falls. Must find all such Festival Stones scattered around Dereth, apparently to achieve something. Nice screenshot.
The inscription on the stone was changed to Commemorating one year since Asherons Call first brought intrepid adventurers to Dereth. This change happened, as one would expect, around the one year anniversary of Asherons Call. -- Hiro Okisho 11/17/2000
Does anyone know what finding all of these stones will do? -- rmr11 12/28/2000

name: PK Shrine
description: In the direlands.  Pray at it to become PVP Status.  -Ninjachen

name: Skeleton Tower
description: A tower with Skeleton Warriors and a Skeleton Captain.

name: Old Talisman Dungeon
description: Lots of Zombie and undead. Another Pk alter at the bottom. This dungeon is not tieable (for those looking for one for the mage armour dungeon nearby -- Barrett theBold -- Ithron -- Luci X

name: Lifestone
description:
Out in the middle of nowhere. Good spot if you plan on travelling to the northwest
If for no other reason use it just because :) -- Atal 9/18/99
The mid-point in Rochesters Way from Zaikhal to Stonehold -- a relatively peaceful route. From here run NNE to 53N, 13W, and from there to Igloo LS at 70.4N, 17.2W, then into town. This route avoids the thick high-level drudge and tusker herds that populate the lowlands south and west of Stonehold. (as of August patch) -- Doc Feelgood 8/26/2000

name: Dungeon Mei
description:
Is inbetween shoushi and hebian-to. Contains L >9 rats and L >8zombies also muchs drudges
Many zombies and a Lich, however the many chests here are broken as of 9/16..no loot :( -- Granger 9/18/99
Some grey rats and lots of Drudges, followed by Undeads and Zombies by the ton. The final chamber is 5 Zombies and a Lich. Not too hard, but with a good party, its easier. The chests are fixed as of 02/10/99 -- Saffron Dusk 10/3/99
Restricted to Levels 1-12 -- Dunc 9/10/2000

name: Lifestone
description: StoneHold Lifestone (Katyaa)

name: Westward Portal
description:
-Katyaa
exits to 70.9N, 29.9W Near Lifestone at: 71.5N, 29.8W -- Seeker 12/13/99
It exits at now, and has level 15+ restriction on it. -- Immacolata 5/3/2001

name: Lifestone
description: Westward Portal drops out here. -Katyaa

name: S. Direlands to Hebian-To
description:
-Katyaa
Exits at 38.6S, 82.1E -- Xian Liu 3/4/2000 New exit coords: 38.9S, 82.6E -- Dutton 7/11/2004

name: Dire Lands Life Stone
description:
Savage entered this
This is the exit point for the Carved Caves portal to the Direlands. This spot is usually safe, but monsters abound on all sides. Just north is a rock with cavern underneath. The fastest way to continue to HOLL is to follow the ridge south to a temple building and take the portal there. Be prepared for action. -- Doc Feelgood 5/1/2000
You will definitely want to tie here on your way to the Halls of Lost Light from the Carved Caves, as the run is very brutal for mid-level characters. -- Wylfghar 12/28/2001

name: Tou Tou to Lin
description: Drops out at 53.9S, 74.3E -- Habidakus 9/21/2000

name: Tou Tou to Arwic
description: Drops out at 33.3N, 57.1E -- Habidakus 9/21/2000

name: Tou Tou Meditation Altar
description: A small altar and font with a mat and pillow.

name: Water Fountain
description:
Used to cast Revitalize Other I on the user...
This does NOT do that, maybe it did during BETA, I dont remember . . . -- Kaldiaen 3/28/2000

name: Zombie Cave
description:
A cave with a lone zombie... Nice one on one.
Caves here, but no zombie (or other bad guys). -- Dunc 12/18/99
I couldnt find the cave -- Rimgar 3/8/2000
both the cave and the zombie are here but I cant see why anyone would come all this way just to kill one zombie... -- Sega Slayer 11/28/2000

name: Lin to Tou-Tou
description:
Portal to
Actual exit at: 30.4S, 94.7E -- Dutton 7/13/2003

name: Mayoi Lifestone
description: Moved to 61.9S, 82.3E from 61.4S, 80.0E -- Seeker 5/13/2004

name: Outpost Traders
description:
Nerchant, Healer, and Archmage in a house off the road. Iron Scarabs, Tapers, and Scrolls, oh my.
They dont sell tapers or scrolls anymore. -- Caewen 7/24/2000
The archmage does, however, carry a paltry supply of Aqua Incanta. -- Sis. Immacolata 10/2/2000
Well cry no more. From january the archmage has tapers for 30 p and up to silver scarabs. Tiny mana charges for 420. He buys at 80%. Oh, and of 50 Aqua Incanta when you are in luck. -- Sis. Immacolata 1/23/2001

name: Island Castle
description:
This is actually just the Smugglers Lair entrance. -- Nether 10/16/99
Enter via a nearby hut if you cant get in. -- l 10/26/99

name: North Nanto Outpost
description: Small starter town with dungeon and a shop.

name: Mosswart Tower
description:
spinny armidillos surround the tower
Theres a tower here, sure. But theres no armoredillos. Just three or four mudlurk mosswarts, and no chest. -- Coulthard 4/18/2000

name: Lifestone at fork of road North of Zaikhal
description: This is a life stone, North of Zaikhal near the fork in the road. The lifestone in town is no longer to be found (at least the one reported to be at  13.8N, 0.6E). Entered by Dunc.

name: Zaikhal Lifestone
description: Zaikhal Lifestone. In the forest patch SE of town. Found by others, but entered by Dunc.

name: Revitalizing Fountain
description: Casts Revitilize I on user

name: Hebian-To to Qalabar
description: Drops out at

name: Qalaba'r Lifestone
description: Since the other has gone MIA...

name: Peddler
description: Buys for 60% Sells for 100% A Few golems north and some other stuff below. Not that great a palce, but pretty lonely on DT at times. -- Uzik Al-Zafar 2/10/2001

name: Al-Jalima
description:
Small Garundim town on the road south from Zaikhal
spice merchant there sells hot pepper, oregano,and cinnamon 5/26/2000
Best price for Armor Piercing Arrows I have found -- Jann 9/29/2000
Very good AP arrow prices (100/625p), however the roaming bowyers at various locations around the countryside sell them at cost (100/500p). The most easily accessable roamer is in a house by 3 cows on the NW road just outside of Cragstone. -- Zimbalt 10/15/2000
There is also a collector there that will transform a variety of monster heads into masks. 10/20/2000
GREAT town for levels 6-15. Fun dungeons, good loot, uncrowded (except for the golem cave), and if outdoor action is your thing, the monouga houses are not to be missed. Lack of a jeweler and archmage will keep you portalling down to Khayyaban but the two-way portal makes for a quick trip. The popularity of the golem cave with campers is probably all that keeps Al-Jalima from becoming a ghost town like Samsur (Solclaim). -- Hu Pong 11/2/2000
Al-Jalima now has an archmage, hes in the same shop as the healer. This town is still an excellent place to level early in your teens, but the Forbidden Crypt and the Golem Cave (its actually a mine) are crowded 75% of the time (Thistledown). -- Grimshaw 1/13/2001
Spice Merchant is VERY expensive
the one in Plateau Village has much better prices. -- Wa Chen (MT) 1/20/2001
Home to the Shadows Garb mask maker Janda Sulifia. Give a Virindi mask in exchange for Shadows Garb mask (mummy mask) AL 190 Staff mastery IV Gharu only Staff 180 -- Chryon 7/7/2001

name: Al-Jalima Lifestone (Garundim)
description:
Lifestone just west of Garundim town of Al-Jalima
Has a lvl 53 armorer who doesn?t trade but takes fused gems to craft armor from them. -- Wolf der Hexer 8/29/2000 Moved to 7.3N, 4.7E from 7.1N, 3.0E -- Seeker 5/16/2004

name: Ruins
description: Just a big stone foundation with nothing on it.

name: Qalaba'r Lifestone
description: Near the Hebian-To portal

name: Qalaba'r to Hebian-To
description: Drops out at

name: Lifestone (South of Samsur)
description: Lifestone (South of Samsur) out in the middle of no where. Found it as I traveled to the Pryamid. Entered by Dunc.

name: Portal to Desert Ridge Border
description:
One Way Travel to 5.9S, 39.7E
appears to drop you off SW of Samsur 9/26/99

name: Lifestone
description: Its right next to a tower... -- Polecat 11/6/99

name: Tower
description:
Surrounded by Spiny Armordillos, Skeletons, a few gromnies (Ive seen Jade and Rust) and occasionally a few red wasps... good place for low level archers or mages. Has a nice view too -- Stuart 12/7/2000
Ive seen some fair blue Lapyan plants growing around here. No one around to pick them though :) -2/11/01 -- Rayn Brun of FF 2/11/2001
The critters dont stay near to the tower so you need to lure em. Good for level 10 to 12 warriors as well as mages because lifestone is so near in case of emergency. Some easy beach action too. -- Zulu Njomo 2/23/2001

name: Lifestone
description: Lifestone on the road from Uziz to Al-Arqas. Entered by Dunc.

name: Mattekar Cave
description:
Place with Snowy Mattekars
Mostly Great Mattekars. some ice golem also. Dungeon is small. -- Ken-sai 9/26/99
If you fall in the pit at the end of the dungeon the portal takes you to a bandit castle which is way east, the road takes you back to the crater castle but its a long run. There is also another portal which even goes further east. -- Skystreak 10/14/99
If you came looking for hide... you came to the wrong place. 15+ people here at all times. WAY TOO CROWDED. -- Unikz 11/23/99
Well actually theres not as many people as you say there are. the most ive seen there at the same time was 5. and theres always enough matts for everyone there. -- nemo 12/7/99
Oh, the place is much more crowded than that at all times now. Never seen less than 10 people there at once. -- Balder of Staal 1/30/00
Its crowded alright. I entered when there were only 500 ppl on the whole server (Leafcull) and there were 10+ ppl in here then. All of them take the everything that spawns and all the loot is mine attitude - I got heavily flamed for getting some loot off a Great I had helped kill... I wasnt best pleased after having them jump all over my kills earlier... the language started to fly then :)grrr Sometimes I wish we could pk whoever, whenever... :) Virtually all Greats here, the very occasional snowy or white. The pit at the end spawns ice golems. If you want loot jump in here as the Matties tend to do that themselves, get killed by the campers above who then leave the corpses. -- Laz al-Farah 3/5/2000
i was here for about 3 hours BY MYSELF,and only saw one person after that -- scarfacebt 11/2/2000
I go there quite freq, on LC. 1-5 people there at any given time. -- rmr11 12/28/2000
Good staging point to hoard the Great Mattekar Horns for the Composite Bow. -- Nocturne [LC] 9/3/2001
As of this day, nothing is spawning inside the dungeon..another casualty of the dreaded updates -- Melkor 1/4/2002
Melkor I dont know where you got that idea, but I was just in there 5 min ago, and there were matties all over the place. mostly snowy and great and a few white.Its kinda late so I didnt see 1 person except for the friend I brought along ---Archer of Magic -- Archer of Magic 5/10/2002

name: Oasis near NW of Uziz
description: Oasis near NW of Uziz. Good hunting, but not much treasure on the monsters. Skeletons, Shreths, Druges, Armadillos, Wasps. Found/Entered by Dunc.

name: Leafcull Festival Stone
description:
Leafcull Festival Stone
-- Dunc 10/10/99

name: Tower
description:
Tower in the middle of a valley, NW of Yanshi. Valley is filled with monsters. Reedsharks (Adults and Elders), Druges, Brown Armadillos, Wasps, Outcast Mongs. Found by others (as evidenced by the corpses littering the place), entered By Dunc.
This is the landmark for the dropoff of all portals going to Desert Ridge Border... -- Twisted Sword 10/4/99

name: Musansayns Vaults
description:
Levels 1-6. NE of Samsur.
Entered By Dunc
Object of a welcome letter quest. -- Khrome-Khoran 9/19/99
Locked door to library here. Not sure if there are keys, or you need to pick it. -- PDQ Blues 6/14/2000
The key can be obtained from the exploerer society agent north west of Samsur. he is in a tent next to the advocates tower. The dungeon used to provide an endless upply oif Books which meant easy XP cash and potions. Had a nice little chatroom feeling going in the line most nights but it got nerfed in the recent update now you need to wait 2 or 3 days before getting a second book. -- Satsujinki 1/10/2001
Level restriction is now 1-20. Find your Samsur Town Stamp next to the exit portal in the entranceway. -- Ankhentomen 3/30/2001

name: Lifestone
description:
This is an essential lifestone, if you are going to enter the Crater Pathway Portal, nice and peaceful here. -- Taylric 10/11/99
Also handy before you enter the matty cave -- Polgera 1/1/00
An exellent lifestone for low Lvls (18 and under) to base from. Especially useful for those without melee D. Within yards of the stone (although you seem in relative safety at the stone) are a few Limestone Golems and masses of Wood Golems. Loot is non-existant but xp earned in abundance here by low Lvls. A large open rolling area, suitable for ranged and melee types. -- Laz al-Farah 3/5/2000

name: Lifestone
description: Two log cabins and a lifestone.

name: Skeleton Temple
description: Skeletons (L5) and Skeleton Warriors (L12) - Wa Zing

name: Cave Of Alabree
description:
lvls 1-6
First few lvls mostly Streths 9/17/99
Compass shows the portal and a Shreth, but the portal seems to be underground? -- Kephrin 2/29/2000
There is a quest amid this place. You get an axe called Brogers axe in the bottom, and give it to the lady in the bar, and get rewarded with something. To get the key into the room, you have to do most of the welcome letter quest -- Rimgar 3/7/2000
Brogords Axe is the payoff from the Holtburg welcome letter quest. Its on the 2nd floor. The place is swarming with gnawer shreths on insanely fast respawn, a couple carrions at the bottom. Great xp if you dont get swarmed. -- Chi Domkwai 3/12/2000
Brogords Axe is, for the most part, useless. Speed 70, damage 3-7, no magic at all. Doesnt sell for much more than a hand axe. Give it to the woman in Holtburg and get 6 healing tonics for your troubles. Overall, the quest is fairly easy for warrior types. Should complete it by lvl 3 or 4. -- Regis 4/22/2000
Brogords Axe useless for the most part? Bah. Pay no mind to the above person. Its a very decent starter axe...the actual, truthful stats on it are as follows: 7-13 slashing (NOT 3-7), with a slow-60 speed (not 70). Some of the best stats available next to an Atlan. Its also worth only 280p, so you are unlikely to drop it when you die. For beginning axe users, its thus a very worthwhile quest. -- Zimbalt 5/23/2000
This is where you get the Holtburg town stamp for the newbie letter quests. So the dungon is now accessable to people of up to level 20. Brogords axe is now on a quest timer too. -- Armin 12/27/2000
Latest info on the reward for turning in the axe: you get 2 health potions (25 hlth boost), 1000XP, and 200p. I use sword so for a low-level person its probably worth it. -- Soyan 6/24/2001
lvl 1-20 is the right restriction level. -- Greeneye 9/22/2001 This dungeon has been moved to 41.8N 32.1E from 42.3N, 29.3E as of the December 2004 patch. -- Armin 12/8/2004

name: Desert Beach Peddler
description: This peddler carries a little bit of many things, and buys a little bit of many things. Buys weapons, but not armor, buys gems but not jewels. This is near a portal exit, both the portal exit and the peddler can be monster infested. -- Doc Feelgood 11/26/2000

name: Archmage Shop
description:
This place is definatley @ the designated coords. -- Luke 1/26/00
Not a whole lot of a selection, but Im sure it would help in a pinch... -- Polecat 1/26/00
This archmage has a meager selection, but lives in style. He has a whole Gharundum shopping mall to knock around in all by himself. -- Doc Feelgood 11/26/2000

name: Farmer
description:
A farmer and a few cows allow the road
Should read 68.1E, not 681.E 9/16/99
Near Shoushi -- Cuttler Strongm 10/30/99

name: small village
description:
2 houses, a portal to rithwic, good hunting, --Paaa
Portal to Eastham..not rithwic..doh. -- Grainger 12/9/99

name: Direlands Tower
description:
Middle of Nowhere Tower and Lifestone.
There were a couple Silver rats (lvl26) close to the tower when I was there (10/15). -- Dunc 10/15/99

name: Deserted Farm
description:
Many Drudges here, some Stalkers, and some Wasps.
No stalkers here. Drudges, Young and Scout Banderlings, Hunter Shreths, and Red Wasps. -- Minas Tirith 7/17/2000

name: Sea Temple Catacombs
description: You can obtain Perfectly Aged Cider, Warm Apple Pie, and Yaraq Town Stamp.

name: Life Stone (near Bandit Castle)
description: Added info: The road west of here leads to Lady Nylissas Castle. Its a long run, but relatively safe for mid levels -- Doc Feelgood 1/30/00

name: Lich House
description:
A small house in the middle of nowhere with a Lich inside
Decent treasure on the Lich. Got Blood Drinker II Battle Axe. Shreths (blood and hunter), Bandies, and Reed Sharks in the area. -- Thirmon Kashkan 6/12/2000

name: Sandstone Monument
description: Two Sandstone Golems appear here at this little stone monument.

name: Lin to Khayyaban
description:
- Koban Cho
Drops out at 47.6S, 26.7E-- Balder of Staal 1/16/00 Now exits at 47.4S, 25.6E -- Seeker 5/13/2004

name: Hang Man's Roost
description:
Its a ruin outside of Holtberg with a hanged man and pile bones. Drudges and banderlings abound...
No more. Now monougas, broken fragments (level 11), and hunter shreths. Not much to see. -- Minas Tirith 1/25/00

name: Empyrean Power Plant
description:
An old Empyrean fort with a really interesting generator...
Last time I was visited, there were two Shadowchildren, a Shadow Leuitenant, and one other Shadow thing, not sure what it was. That leuitenant was tossing level 2 war spells around. -- Polecat 9/15/99
lvl 5 war spells. 75+damage. Caution advised. -- Wayne 9/19/99
I was also recently there and there is a shadow captian as well. Level 61. Run like h*ll. -- Kal Wolfe 9/28/99
a.k.a Temple of the Shadows. This is also an Interest Point. -- Dunc 10/2/99
Oh look a shadow lieutenant, he casts a firebolt at me. BOOM. Im dead. I had 89 hits at the time. If you see him..... heed the advice of others.... RUN -- Taylric 10/11/99
Note, for Life mages... you can sit behind a wall and Harm things for lots of easy XP. 10/22/99
unless u can take LVL 5 warspells on the chin and live, dont even think of going there -- Origy 11/13/99
Went with a group and had Mages act as bait for the Lieutenant. For our efforts and deaths we got a pice of parchment out of one chest and a Brass Acid Tofun and some sort of magic shield out of the other. Not worth being burned to a cinder by the Shadow Lieutenant. -- Ronin Cheshire 12/30/99
I never got that close of a look at this place, but with all the suspicion about the shadows lately, I think that theres something else going on here besides a bunch of shadows living in an Empyrean Power Plant, and I think that thing in the middle, the ash stuff I read about, and the shadow in the sky on the Northern Horizon have something to do about this... -- Rimgar 3/7/2000
At lvl 26 i took 2 lvl 20s and a lvl 19...all but one person was slain...they had about taken the wussier shadows while i fought the Lt. With thanks to the update, he now HEALS like nothing B4. I had him almost dead...then was blasted by Flame Bolt V...the others soon joined me at the Lifestone... -- Sword Nut,ThDwn 6/8/2000 Area around this place is far tougher now than inside, but the Shadows remain. Also a portal nearby to Direlands. -- Charles 7/25/2004

name: Fountain and Corpse
description: Near Arwic there is a beautiful fountain, surrounded by flowers with a levitating pink gem and tinkling waters, and a whats left of a hung man overlooking it.

name: Tower
description: Tower on the west coast, near Tou Tou. Some time there will be a Banderling Raver and Young Banderling, with a Blue Wasp on the top. Entered by Dunc.

name: Halls of the Lost Light
description: The dungeon in which the Sword of Lost Light is acquired. There is a portal to this dungeon at the bottom of the Carved Caves near Al-Jalima. Seven keys retrieved from across the land are required to enter the chamber with the sword. It is guarded by the Guardian of Lost Light. This is probably a level 40+ quest. Keys are as follows: Shoushi Grotto: If you are in a throne room with a portal off to the right, and you are not at the beginning of the dungeon, you are there. You have to go up a ramp into the throne room. Holtburg Dungeon: Take the first left each time (a right turn might be most left option), until you see white rat(s). One of the rats has the key. Rithwic Crypt: Its on a white rat on the 2nd level down. You have to open a door somewhere to get down. Dungeon Manor (Samsur). Find the stairs down. Go to the left I think. There should be a hallway, with mroe stairs down into a farily large room with drudges. One of the drudges has the key. Yaraq Tunnels: Go to bottom of dungeon (there should be a gate near stairs. Go somewhat right until you upon a room with 3 rooms branching off from it. 2 rooms have 3 cages in them, the other doesnt. Somewhere in here is the key. Yanshi Tunnels: I forgot :-) The last is in Carved Caves, and hardest to get. You MUST have a full set of keys. All of the doors requiring keys are listed as UNPICKABLE. Every sword fighter should complete this quest - the Sword may not be the best, but its a great status symbol, especially once converted into the SoLH. -- Flamelord -- Bonehead -- Nether -- Jarl -- Jain the Huntress -- Vylarn -- Wylfghar

name: Trothyr's Rest
description:
No level restrictions, however I would not recommend low level characters try out this dungeon. Has Azure Gromnies (acid-breathing), liches and, Im told, a Lich Lord. There are two exit portals to the surface that I know of.
Near Rithwic. Asherons Altar (removes +pvp status) lies at the very bottom of this pit. Beware, Liches and Lich Lords haunt this place. -- Caeryn Dryad 9/14/99
Will need Lockpick if you wish to get to Asherons Alter. Lots of liches and a lich lord near the end, also has Trothyrs Shield, buts it quite pathetic
) -- Impa 11/24/99
Not sure about needing lockpick, i didnt when doing this dungeon, but you can by the key @ appler seller -- infoMAN 1/8/00
Has a Chest towards the Left side of dungeon with a Lich Lord and 5 liches guarding it. It spawns some decent 2k-5k Items. -- Gem [DT] 2/9/2001
Neither the entrance nor the exit portals are tieable -- Hexxor 7/28/2001

name: Liche Tower
description:
NE of Hebian-to. Tower full o' Liches (Level 20), guarded by a Granite Golem (Level 33). Bring friends, and a lockpick for the chest at the top.
one granite golem ,and 8 liches to be quite precise. Golem is outsied tower, liches within. Found some really good money treasure. -- Baldock Kruth 2/3/00
Correct Coords: 32.5s, 91.8e -- ChoJin 6/23/2000

name: Rithwic Banderling Tower
description:
Banderling Tower near Rithwic. Chests up top. Lots of stuff in the surrounding area (in particular in the hills to the east) to whack when the tower is already camped (blood/hunter/vorous shreths, pup/adult/veteran reedsharks, etc) -- Iron Fist McGee
This is the Interest Point SE of Rithwic. -- Dunc 11/14/99
this is a great place for lvl 10+ mages/archers to lvl up solo and lvl 10+ melee fighters in group. the chest is uber for newbies and u can get some very nice armor if u want color cordinated armor -- Ulv the Viking 1/6/2001
Be wary of this location if you have trouble fighting massive numbers at once. Killing the banderlings camped inside the tower will cause a swarm of lower level bandies to approach the tower from all directions.. Ive encountered 50+ Banderlings at once in this manner.. -- Mirions 2/17/2002

name: Lugian Tower
description:
Lugian Tower along the road between Qalabar and Kahyyaban(?). A couple of them (lvl33) plus allot of black rats. Didnt hang out long... :). Entered by Dunc.
Excellent location to gain XPs for Mages and Archers. If youre fast and buffed you can sprint through the Lugians (1 Lithos, 1 Obeleth, 2+ Amploth, 3+ Laigus) and climb the stairs. Watch for the rocks thrown by the Obeleth and the Amploth. Once inside you can leisurely pick up several thousand XPs in an afternoon. For Mages, I recommend lvl 10 or above. -- Xalaq 2/21/2000
Minor corrections: 1 Lit far out front (S), 1 Obe and 2 Amp in close out front,1 Lai to the NW in close,and 1 Lai to the NE farther out. Total 6. Use the LS in Khaf -- Elindel 2/22/2000
DANGEROUS SINCE LAST UPDATE. Shadows, Gromnies, Lugians, and Golems, Oh My. -- Galen 3/2/2000

name: Khayyaban Lifestone
description: Khayyaban Lifestone. Found by Dunc.

name: Southwest Direlands to Glenden Wood
description: It drops you at 28.9N, 26.3E -- Dr Nick 2/9/00 New exit coords: 29.7N, 26.5E -- Dutton 7/11/2004

name: Shop
description:
Archmage and peddler. Archmage has alot of scrolls. Entered by Dunc.
The Peddler has healing kits. -- Polecat 11/8/99
This place no longer sells Scrools, And the mage sell very little compontents. But he dose have mana charges. -- Willow 3/10/2000

name: Drudge Camp
description: Drudge Slinkers, Skulkers, Prowlers and Robbers spawning area.  Popular camping and low-level hunting area near Holtburg.

name: South Yanshi Outpost
description: Easy dungeon just ot the S-E, quick run through for lousy loot :) -- l 10/26/99

name: South Yanshi Lifestone
description: -- Embien

name: Farmstead
description: A little farmstead with cows, farmer, roaming bowyer, peddlar, and a lifestone. Nearby are tuskers, mites, banderlings, and other assorted critters. -- Aladrin

name: Lifestone at Farmstead
description:
-- Aladrin
This is on beach out in the middle of nowhere. -- Balo 4/9/2000

name: Thasali
description:
NW of Uziz. Red rats, desert rats, skeletons, warriors and a skeleton lord. -- Six
Do not show up alone.. -- Axel 9/21/99
The Skeleton Lord is Lvl 43, theres also a captain or 2, it can get ugly as hell w/massively fast respwning rats. -- Destructor 9/29/99
I went there alone, but had plenty of stamina and health potions with me...a necessity as about 30 desert and red rats attack simultaneously so that you can not move...you either fight and kill them all or you die... the rest is easy if you are level 20 or above... -- Twisted Sword 10/3/99
Excellent EXP... You gotta have big cohones to battle these rats and skels alone. I believe the rat respawn rate has been increased. Look out behind the second wall.. Its all part of the rats master plan. Bring your heal kits and your Tart apples fellas.. youll need em... -- Axel 10/12/99

name: Desert Mine
description:
SE of Samsur. Skeletons, warriors, skeleton captains, liches and a lich lord. -- Six
ok dont go here not at all the monsters on the way [that] will kill you including more than 5 golems skellie captain you name it it will be there....... -- ME 9/21/99
Dont be a wuss ME. Getting theres easy if you go straight from Samsur Outpost. Once inside, dont jump off at the beware sign unless youre lvl25+ or want to die and lose your stuff. Did I say 25? Make that 30+. -- Khrome-Khoran 10/20/99
Study Iron key opens chest in lich pit. Magic items in this chest are almost always Ghru only. -- Shoto Fle-Alch 5/7/2000
Entrance to dungeon usually hosts a jolly monster convention, with mucho boneheads and bonehead warriors. If youre adventuring solo, getting in is your first challenge. At level 16 I had to draw em away from the entrance a few at a time and layeth the smacketh down before I could enter. Once inside, the upper floors of this dungeon must have the politest and most well-mannered skeleton warriors Ive ever seen. If you dont do something dumb like go booming into a group of them, Ive seen them come up to you one at a time for leisurely wailing. Big phun. -- Hu Pong 12/20/2000

name: Uziz Lifestone
description: Moved to 24.9S, 28.2E from 24.1S, 27.4E -- Seeker 5/16/2004

name: Grilhud the Hermit
description: Portal here to PK altar. Need Broken Sigil from Dungeon Nye. -- Six

name: Dungeon Nye
description:
Lots of drudges, some banderlings. Broken Sigil is for Hermit at 11.8N, 33.7E. -- Six
New Note -- Marcus Aurelius 11/12/99
this dungeon has a secret passage,where a lesser mumiyah protects its sarcopharg.. -- Kron Quien 6/4/2000 Stop #13 in the Undead Mechanic quest added in the October 2003 patch. -- Geomancer 11/16/2003This dungeon was full of level 70 drudge raveners when I went their recently. -- Falcon of Fury 7/29/2005

name: Archmage Shop
description:
Lifestone nearby. -- Six
There is another structure nearby as well. Goes underground. I challenge anyone to even attempt it. Surrounded by 20+ Swamp Rats, Granite Golem, Liches, Zombies. It is the horde of swamp rats that will kill you everytime. -- Gandalf the Son 11/1/99
Archmage carries a limited component selection. But, this is a respite point: the rats from Greenmire B&B will not stay here long. -- Doc Feelgood 6/9/2000
Not a bad place at all. The rats and stuff are to the south, hang away from that area and youre safe. -- Daija of HG 11/26/2001

name: Mosswart Nest
description:
The only exit portal out of here will NOT take you back where you started. It leads to 36.2S, 62.0E, far southeast of Sawato. This place only has 5 or 6 creepers anyway. -- Nether 12/12/99
Outside the exit portal there is a large mosswart cave. 15 or so creepers, mudlurks, barkers, and a chief. -- Nether 12/12/99

name: Portal to Desert Ridge Border
description: Drops at 5.6S, 40.0E -- Habidakus 9/22/2000

name: Direlands Lifestone
description: Merchant nearby. -- Six

name: Merchants
description: 2 merchants in a walled complex -- Sennarrion

name: Plateau Village
description:
Town on the top of a plateau, next to the Inner Dungeon. Portal to base and from base to top. -- Gax Charon
Plateau is hard to leaved headed south... unclimbable cliffs. Take the portal to the base and go south from there. Run in from the north is not a problem -- Doc Feelgood 2/12/00
Route to North Direlands is through the valley, with a high ridge on your left. Keep going south, you will cross farmland (must be farmland, theres lots of Auroch Fire Bulls there) until you get to north terminus of Ridge Route into Direlands. -- Doc Feelgood 2/12/00
Jeweler in town that will buy your goodies ... and Ka Ku-to near the windmills sells Plate Armor. Nothing heavyweight up top. -- Blayd 5/18/2000
Starting point for the Lost City of Frore Quest. -- Natural 8/15/2000
Spice Merchant sells all spices, at prices far lower than the spice merchant in Al-Jalima. -- Wa Chen (MT) 1/20/2001

name: Lifestone
description: Near Hebian-To -- Ramazul

name: Portal to Plateau Top
description: Portal to the Plateau top. -- Dunc

name: Cabin with Roaming Bowyer
description: Cabin with a roaming bowyer. Place is surrounded by Mattekars (White, Snowy, Great), Monouga (Rough and Crude), and others. -- Dunc

name: A Ruin (Samsur)
description: Dungeon is along the road from the Samsur East Outpost. Didnt see any rats when I was here. Drudges, three Outcast Monougas behind a locked door which they dont seem to see as a major obstacle and will take swings at you through it. Good for wall-working. Nice, clean, simple architecture with single gnawer shreths and packs of drudges (3 or 4 at a time). Drudge group on lower level drops some nifty loot. This is a must-visit for newbies. -- Hu Pong 11/1/2000

name: Snowreap Festival Stone
description: Snowreap Festival Stone. Next to the lake in the crater. -- Dunc

name: Crater Pathway
description:
Crater to Crater Pathway. Exit is near the entrance. Theres a Dark Wisp near (which I ran from after getting hit by a Frost Boly IV). -- Dunc
Bodies cover the single path through this tunnel. -- Dunc 9/19/99
There are two exits to Crater Pathway, one is in the Crater, the other is further south outside the Crater ()...nice place to test your magic resistance.. -- Twisted Sword 10/3/99
Zefirs, Dark Wisps all powerful magic users very tough to get thru the straight hallway. Nasty path....recommend entering the crater another way -- Fingers 1/11/00
Zefirs, Dark Wisps all powerful magic users very tough to get thru the straight hallway. Nasty path....recommend entering the crater another way -- Fingers 1/11/00 On 9/5/2003 Renegade Gotrok, an Admin-controlled level 185 Lugian, fought in the crater, then fled through this pathway. He fell outside it. -- Witness 9/6/2003

name: North Desert Edge Portal
description:
Drops you off in the desert...what fun -- Hostage
Also 3 merchants and a lifestone here. Nice place to fight out in the wild with a lifestone and merchants so close. -- Nether 11/9/99
Portal goes to North Desert Edge 4.7S, 3.1W -- Krita 12/26/99

name: Khayyaban Lifeston
description: -- Tso Chi

name: Leather Crafter
description:
upper floor of the bowyer shop -- Serafin
Crafts Gromnie, Armoredillo, Reedshark and Mattekar Hides -- Caeryn Dryad 3/31/2000

name: Wing Collector - Lin
description: Both trophy and wing collectors live here, just up the hill from the jeweler. -- Serafin

name: Carved Caves Lifestone
description: Near Carved Caves

name: Portal Fort
description:
Fort with portal to Zaikhal (), also a lifestone. Tuskers and banders outside. -- Hot Pants
This is also an Interest Point. -- Dunc 10/3/99
This area will be of particular interest to war mages and archers in 8-15 range: posting points are excellent, monsters are nearby, lifestone is nearby, portals are nearby to haul out loot, only problem is the long run in. -- Doc Feelgood 6/14/2000
dont try the long run in if you do not have the help of at least two firends of lvl 30+, or you will have to try a dozen times to get there from the next lifestone. To enter the fort use the chests to get over the wall. -- Hagen der Hexer 8/21/2000
This place is awsome for anyone level 10 to 14 mainly archers and mages. There is usually a Ursin spawn (Lvl 16)X2 and a Fragment spawn (LVL 29). Jump off the boxes and head had a tad off West to the south and you hit the bander fort. Which is surrounded by Ursins/Tuskers/Banderlings/Monoguas all 15th to 17th. Nice place to hunt for a group. -- Kublah Kai, MT 1/9/2001
Spawn near heres changed since the last time I was here. Expect Drudge Lurkers, Stalkers, Crimson and Goldenback Tuskers, and Esper Ursuins. Great hunting if you survive the run in. -- Ibn Schachabo 2/7/2001
Spawn changed again. Now expect Magus,Leeches, Virindi/Tusker groups, Basalt and Nepidious Golems, Legionaries and so forth. Nice quiet hunting spot, spawns within castle bow shot. -- Rigor 6/19/2003 You can finda portal to the East Dires directly east of the fort with in view of it. Thats the nifty think about. Plus the loads of 60 ~ 80ish mobs all around. -- Kublah Kai 10/1/2003

name: Al-Jalima to Tou-Tou
description:
-- Serafin
exits -- Violent J 12/14/99

name: Al-Jalima to Khayyaban
description:
-- Serafin
Same Exit coords as the Lin to Khayyaban Portal: -- Stern 2/16/00 Now exits at 47.4S, 25.6E -- Seeker 5/13/2004

name: Al Jalima Lifestone
description: -- Serafin

name: Filos's Doom
description:
Dungeon near Rithwic, restricted to Level 3 or greater. Not too hard, lots of banderling guards, and drudges -- Cicero
correction: no banderling guards there... just young ones... Rated: Cheesy Lvl: 3-8 -- Ihad 9/23/99
No upper level restriction. -- Mad Dugan 10/14/99
Has a ?royal cabbage? -- Dicer-DT 3/22/2000
Has rats, drudges, weaker shreaths, and banders. One skeleton in a room with loot better than other monsters in the area. Theres a tiny cave where four young banders spawn. An ok camping spot. However, the name Filos Doom doesnt mean much - probably the skeleton. Good solo spot for Lv6+ -- Zarkon 5/17/2000
Has several doors that are operated by levers. Not a bad spot to take newcomers to. -- Sirfrey 6/25/2000
Great spot. Some shreths in the first room, then basically banderlings and rats from there on. A room with a few drudges (slinkers mostly). -- Dryah II 8/16/2000
The room across from where the Skeleton lives spawns healing food on the floor. Royal Cabbage, Special Cheese, and Salmon appear at random and will replenish your health a small bit. To access the room, you need to pull the lever in the room with the skeleton. -- Cuttler Strngmd 9/2/2000
NOTE: Checked out this dungeon 11/09/2000 and found a strange phenomenon. Although the purple blip was there, there was no portal to be seen. I stood directly over the blip and there was nothing. Very Odd. -- Naala 11/9/2000
Umm... Naala, the dungeon entrance in a small cave. -- Neo Lee DT 11/16/2000
this portal has disappeared, at least in Solclaim. -- Hagen II 11/20/2000
Dont go to the exact coordinates of the dungeon, theres a cave nearby that leads down to the portal. Also, at the bottom there was an empty chest. Was there supposed to be something in there? -- Riki-Kiki-Taco 12/7/2000
Youll notice on map when u run from rithwik to estham thsi place suckes you shouldnt even young bandies drudges rats 1skeleton somtimes it has wands,orbs.items spawn in a room whith a russet rat and 2 bandies mostly tappers wands powders and mana stone..btw the stones have no mana sucks totaly skip it.... -- rabbithunter 4/10/2001
... ... ... Right, rabbithunter, right... -- Jibner 7/1/2001 Now part of the Undead Mechanic quest, added in the October 2003 patch. -- Geomancer 11/12/2003

name: Burial Temple Portal
description:
Limited to level 5 and above. Filled with Skeletons, Skeleton Warriors, and maybe Skeleton Captain. -- Houdani
NO skele capns, but a new skele lord (lvl 34) in room behind door tripped by lever upstairs -- Karlos 10/2/99
With the 11/23 patch, it is now levels 5-10 only. So much for a good exp pool for the monks. -- Vlanna 11/23/99
A dungeon with a level 34 creature is limited to level 10 at the most? HELLO?? Also, the skeleton lord has a Key from the mage academy (atleast it did before the 11/23 patch). -- Scythen 12/19/99
The Skeleton Lord gives a cursed key which weight for 1000BU, it cannot be given and it doesnt open the door to mage academy -- Xin 12/26/99
Correction. The key do open a door there.. -- Xin 12/27/99
The cap is now 10th level, its now 5-10. -- Doc Feelgood 1/30/00
If you find a black rock, a mage at 6.1N, 3.5E (far side of Al-Jalima) is looking for it. -- Doc Feelgood 2/13/00
This place is great never found a black rock but if you jump down the east hole and run through the fake wall to the left is a pickable chest and in the room with the lord is a great chest if you can trap the skeletons in rooms you can make 25k in one night easy -- lorthos 2/27/2000
LOL 25k in one night.. Really.. Whether thats Pyreals or Xp your talking about thats pathetic :) 4/25/2000
The mage Doesnt want a Black rock He want a black GEM From an undead probaly in the Burial Temple. -- Wistiu Li Cho 8/19/2000
Cursed Key dropped by Skel Lord opens door at Mage Academy that will lead you to Lord Rytheran. Also Black Gem is a portal gem that will provide portal to MA when given to NPC mentioned above. See my entry at Mage Academy. Since level restrict is 5-10 now should have high level friend provide ultra-buffs so killing the skel lord is possible. -- AllyMcAlchemist 11/1/2000

name: Bone Lair
description: Between Al-Arqas and Yaraq. Loads of Skeletons. Pointless to go alone as it takes at least two to open the doors. And make sure on of them is a lockpicker -- OllathairNow the third (of 20.) stops in the Undead Mechanic quest added in the October 2003 patch. You dont need to know lockpick if you have any kind of decent jump skill. Only one lever was required to get to the alloy piece. -- Geomancer 11/12/2003

name: Smuggler's Lair
description:
Banderlings (including a few ravers) and Mite Scamps -- Ollathair
if u stick to the left wing off the main entrance room, you will find one banderling scout and rooms each with a lev 8 mite. If u stay there and kill htese as they respawn treasure, in form of jewelry, is quite good. -- Pendragon 11/19/99
If you take the right wing, you can go down to a lower level (with a couple of sub-levels below) with Ravers, Raiders, Guards, and several decent chests. There is a second exit portal down there as well. -- TreeFellow 11/24/99
I believe it is called the Smugglers Hideaway, also there is a captain, but the less people that know where he is the better. -- Manxer 11/24/99
Thats why I didnt mention the Cap
) There is also a breeder that everyone seems to miss, thou he isnt hidden... just out of the way. -- TreeFellow 12/9/99
The portal to the actual dungeon has a level 8 or higher restriction on it. -- Vexorg 1/31/00 Stop #10 in the Undead Mechanic quest added in the October 2003 patch. -- Geomancer 11/14/2003Level restriction removed. Now populated with banderling strikers, banderling rogues, and
a few opal niffis. There is a fake wall at the bottom near the exit portal room leading down
to a couple unlocked chests. -- Wolftear 10/12/2005

name: Forking Trail
description:
Take the north road from Qalabar most of the way. Lots of lugians. Expect to be hit by a couple Lithos as soon as you get in. -- Zing
In this dungeon there is a hidden room: go down the stair and to the left. there are more stairs
take them. You will be in a room with more lugies and stairs going up
take the stairs going up. Quickly turn around and run into the left wall in the far corner. You will be in a hidden hall the lugies cant get to. You can safely cast life spells on the lugies and get tons of xp. (I did this when i was Level 3) -- X-CreaToR 10/14/99
Over populated. Usually 10+ people there. If your not a life mage, attack from the top of stairs or boxes. Remember, warriors: their head is the most vulnerable spot on them. -- Unikz 11/14/99
I think you all are talking about the Lugy Bunker just north of town. In the forked trail you will not find stairs or secret room, but you will find tons of lugys, including sometimes a GIGA Lugy. -- Andreas vanHaus 11/21/99
You are right. Giga rock throwing nasty luggies are up here. Pyreal armor rumored to respawn in a safe in there... I gotta check that rumor out, I never made it that far. -- Unikz 11/23/99
Yes and also make sure your with a group. Right when you enter your in a skinny hallway and behind you and infront of you are rockthrowing laigus lugians and rocky armadillos. No escape from there.
) -- Xzeno 12/4/99
There is no longer any goo armor or items to be found here. The Gigas in the end guards a chest with 1-2 plain-excellent healing kits :( -- Shang Di 12/21/99
The chest spawns Greater Mana Stones too. Decent death items at least. 3/5/2000
If the insides camped, sometimes the outside has a better spawn. Usually Lithos and Obeloth outside, Laigus to start with inside, all the way up to Gigas along the way. Group highly reccomended. -- Garfield Bond 3/16/2000
If it was crowded, not anymore. 3-5 people here on busy days. Decent loot and XP if dangerous. Bring a party unless you can take on 3 laigus lugians at a time, and possibly two lithos. If hunting outside (decent stuff there too, if you havent read above note) beware stamina eaters, weak monsters put in to make you lose stamina against the lithos. One really close to Forking Trail portal, they stop spawning though. -- Rimgar 8/30/2000

name: Abandoned Village
description:
Three houses along a road that doesnt connect to any other road. Lots of monsters in the area, Banderling Scouts, Guards. All types of Shreths, Armadillos, etc. Dangerous but good for xps. -- Abattoir
According to the map on the quick ref card this village is called Edelbar -- Finn Djhala 2/20/2000

name: Holtberg Lifestone
description: This is one of the recently relocated lifestones... -- Polecat

name: Deserted Ruin
description:
A dungeon for beginning characters. Low-end drudges. -- Nodralech
