Some nice stuff in here, treasure wise and a pretty scary respawn rate for a 2nd level mage whos soloing. -- Polecat 10/17/99
Town stamp at the entrance (as usual) and dungeon limited for lvl 1-20 (as usual with town stamp dungeons). Find one of Jong Mis writings in a chest behind a locked door and give it to Dai Ja the Scholar in Yanshi. -- Kara Gandharvi 12/25/2000

name: Bluff Lifestone
description: Nice resting spot between Zaikhal & Stonehold -- Alun Magus

name: Nevius Passage
description:
Reedsharks galore, a few desert/swamp rats -- Alun Magus
There is also a portal to the North Desert edge dropoff inside... -- Twisted Sword 10/19/99
Reedsharks, reedsharks, and more reedsharks. Watch out if youre heading for the desert portal, its possible to get jumped by 10+ sharks on the bridge. The last bridge spans a pit containing rats, at least one is a level 26 silver rat. Loot isnt real good, but the xp isnt too bad--good place to work off some vitae. -- Chi Domkwai 3/12/2000
The pit is the main attraction of this dungeon eventhough the locked chest no longer spawn good loot. The fall into the pit will do anywhere from 25-60 dmg depending on your jumping skill and if you hit the wall or not. As soon your feet hit the ground youll be surrounded by 3 sliver rats, 3-4 swamp rats and a few sharks...youll also suffer constant 3-4 fire damage from the heat. Bring your melee D and lots of stam since the spawn rate is furiously fast. -- Kexin 3/21/2000
very good place to lvl, from 10 up to 16 it took 2 days ,also good source for low lvl jewelery . I never jumped down the pit but when u want to get over the bridge u have to pull only one switch ,if u pull both the door will be closed again -- Shou Lin 6/28/2000
Someone seems to have neglected to mention a level restriction to this place. Im level 7, and cant get in. -- Alec DuThane 2/1/2001

name: Phyntos Menace
description: Stop #20 in the Undead Mechanic quest added in the October 2003 patch. -- Geomancer 11/16/2003Map of the dungeon. -- Geomancer 11/16/2003In addition to White Wasps, there are Harbinger Grievers here, and these seem to be prolific Organic Acid droppers (for Heiromancer Armor quest). -- Doc Feelgood 1/21/2004

name: Mines of Despair
description:
Need lockpick, south of Baishi -- Alun Magus
Lvl 12 - 22 -- ToBo 12/9/99
14-22 are the correct level requirements -- Valadon Grimm 12/15/99
I failed 30 times trying to pick the lock with a skill of 94. Nothing else to do here if you cant get inside. -- Nether 12/21/99
There is a location to get a key to get inside. You must give an item to a man somewhere and he shall give you the key, I wont spoil it and tell you where thou. Jain the Huntress 12/31/99
I dont know how to get the key but you can open two dorrs by using } key to get lever and then press R to open -- Lorthos 2/27/2000
Greetings Friends, I am planning on making a mapping run next week which I will announce on CODs HarvestGain board. I wouldnt mind a spoiler on the key since Im more interested in the internals. Going through the dungeon you will find lots of undead, Skele Captains, Liches, 3 lesser Mi Muyahs, a Greater MiMuyah, at the very bottom is a room with a lich lord (watch them bolts.) and a button. Also a room with a double button which I have not found what it does yet. -Liu Kui Unarmed Locksmith of HarvestGain -- Liu Kui 3/30/2000
I however, shall, Jain the Huntress. The point of the atlas is to give spoiler information about little-known areas, NOT to skulk around dropping vague hints and misspelling the word though. Ya give one o dem lich skull majigs to a guy at the interest point SE of the mines, coordinates 75.9s 57.3e for the key. Sometimes known as THE TURTLE... and the King o Bleh, -- Magwitch 5/24/2000
Take your little problems off ACspedia and complain elsewhere plz Magwitch. This is now the site for the Focus Stone Quest. -- Lifestone Golem 2/16/2001
Home of the Focus Stone as of Feb patch. Getting the stone requires two keys: they are acquired by giving Li Ae-Rae (nearby) a Lich skull (from Grievous Vault), and a High Acolyte skull (from the Three Towers Quest). He will give you two keys for doors in the dungeon. The Focus Stone itself comes from the Lich Overseer mid-way through. The stone must be charged up at the orange vortex at the end of the dungeon. There is switch and button pushing involved, and facing up to Decaying Warriors, Fleshless Warriors (60th, acid) and Unstable Magma Golems (fire). -- Doc Feelgood 2/18/2001
Li Ae-Rea now gives you both keys when you give him a High Acolyte Skull. -- Doc Feelgood 12/18/2002

name: Lich Lord
description: Crypt with Lich Lord & others, Lifestone, Yaraq Portal -- Alun Magus

name: Mysterious Cave
description:
Near Al-Jalima, Golems -- Alun Magus
Mud golems (level 10), Limestone golems (level 13), and 1 at once Sandstone golem (level 17) -- Isseshel 10/10/99
very small dungeon, one chest with a couple of gems on them... -- El Shrimpo 12/11/99
Great place for 2 or three level ~12s to get EXP. -- Bubba 12/19/99
/sarcasm on Great place for level 30s to come, for motes, when they ought to be in the Dires, leaving the beginner dungeons for those of a lower level who need them. /sarcasm off -- Goldhart 4/13/2000
On off hours you can have this dungeon to yourself, but I have never found a mote in here. Great XP for level 10-18. Expect lots of quiet time for contemplation as the Golems do not spawn as rapidly as one would like. -- Jann 9/29/2000
im 16th level blademaster and i went in with 15th level archer - he did actually get a mote, prompting me to tell him im going to become a pk just to kill him - this place similar toseaside lair in eastham but with golems (about 5 total), ok for solo but very boring otherwise -- Tereal 11/17/2000

name: Healer
description: This is a healer just outside the swamps SE of Yanshi....this is a dangerous area for an inexperienced adventurer. -- Louis Wu

name: Black Death Catacombs
description: There a portal that goes to Catacombs of Opposition down here which contains the Human Olthoi Hunters Camp.

name: Trophy Smith and Tailor - Hebian-to
description:
Trophy Smith in Hebian-To. Takes Armor. Hides and Golem Hearts. -- Ue
The hearts become Golem Maces (about 1500p a pop). He also takes Dillo spines to make Spine Axes out of. -- Polecat 12/3/99

name: East Direlands Swamp
description:
Dryreach portal to E Direlands. Exits at -- Alun Magus
Fairly dangerous. Exit has gold wasps, tumerok priests, and several silver rats. If you survive that, theres ash gromnies and a lich lord in the vicinity. -- Wormtongue 2/14/00
This is an ambush point. There are skeleton warriors, tumeroks of various levels, and drudge lurkers. These are all archer types and they dont chase. They are there to pepper anyone coming through. Fastest way out is to head up the hill. There are other mobile nasties in the area, and theres a portal to a small dungeon just north of the exit. This is something of a haven. -- Doc Feelgood 2/17/00

name: Enkindled Souls
description: Stop #7 in the Undead Mechanic quest added in the October 2003 patch. -- Geomancer 11/14/2003

name: GW tower
description:
Near Gw and fort witshire. Lots of veteran reed sharks. good for low lvl mages and archers. about every 10 min about 15 reed sharks come bursting out of no where so dont hang around on the low part of the stairs or on the ground. -- Matt
It's known as Hilltop. A few portals around Dereth lead to this place. -- Stu 1/1/00

name: Ancient Town Lifestone
description: A lifestone right near a tower and 3 portals. Ive made entries for the portals at the appropriate places. 1 is a dungeon two go elsewhere... -- Aliera

name: Cragstone Lifestone
description:
South of Cragstone -- Polecat
Good Spot 10/19/99

name: Yanshi Lifestone
description: Near the Yanshi training dungeon -- Polecat

name: Yanshi Tower
description:
Tower outside of Yanshi with Lich and undead... -- Polecat
There are no Undead here, only Drudges. -- Kueghan 11/17/99
This entry has been mis-named. There are a total of five drudges here. One outside and four inside. This place should be named the Yanshi Drudge Tower. -- Minas Tirith 2/26/2000
I didnt see any drudges outside. One of them is on the outside on the second level, usually facing the outpost nearby. The rest are inside. -- Rimgar 3/7/2000
Tower was not mis-named. During beta, it was full of Undead. They have since changed the spawn to drudges. -- Vold 7/1/2000
As above but when the drudges respawn and you are attacted large numbers of reinforcements arrive from nowhere out side. Looks a good place to level up as part of a fellowship -- Vidus Maximus 3/4/2001

name: Peddler
description:
Peddler on the road west from Glenden Wood. -- Dunc
Near the Underground Forest dungeon. -- Nether 10/15/99

name: Lifestone
description: Lifestone on plateau west of Zaikhal. -- Dunc

name: Holtburg
description:
-- Bonehead
Town magic componant vender never has Tapers. Makes it hard to stay in stock of magic componants. -- Chichel 12/28/99
hmmm ... its a quick portal to rithwic then to lytelthorpe and from lytelthorpe back to holtburg to get tapers and scarabs up to silver ... they have constant supply in lytelthorpe ... -- yobbo 5/21/2000
Aside from that Holtburg is a starter town. When have we ever seen tapers in starter towns? -- Kah Rin(Thisel) 11/11/2000
Tapers? There are a lot of them there... -- Gwidyon 3/2/2001

name: Leather Crafter - Baishi
description: Crafts Gromnie, Armoredillo, Reedshark and Mattekar Hides -- Caeryn Dryad

name: Leather Crafter Armorer & Weaponsmith - Cragstone
description:
Crafts Gromnie, Armoredillo, Reedshark and Mattekar Hides -- Caeryn Dryad
Also crafts Shreth and Ursuin hides for you. -- Lowika 12/31/2000
Weaponsmith Estorl the Ox buys your loot at 80% of value and sells it back again for 133%. Culthea Ironshaper the armorer has a 120% selling rate and 70% for buying. -- Immacolata 3/24/2001

name: Gharu'ndim Archmage
description: A lone archmage in the canyon NNE of Al-Jalima with VERY little to offer. He has a few Alchemy items too. -- Mother Tgoing to rename this so we can find the racial archmage. will keep original enteror -- senshin 1/20/2001

name: House full of Old Bones
description:
An old house surrounded and inhabited by Old Bones. Not much to it. -- Mother T
This is a nice place for lower level characters to stop on their way between Samsur and Al Jalima. Watch out entering the house, sometimes the Skeleton big brothers of the Old Bones will swarm in from all sides and surround the house. -- Jann 9/29/2000
Solo low-levels should be careful of running right up to the house as it will rain old bones. They will be so happy to see you theyll leap off the roof to slap you around. -- Hu Pong 11/2/2000

name: Holtburg Wilderness Lifestone
description: Protected building in the woods with shreths and monougas outside. -- Scott Honaker

name: Nanto
description:
As of today, this is the correct location of Nanto. -- Sun Tse
Lame place. Dont even bother trying to level up with a new guy here. Only start in this town if you plan to go to Mayoi. -- Yasiv 2/25/2000
Decent hunting between here and Mayoi. Zefirs, Lugians, Ravers and Limestone Golems to name a few of the beasties that will want to play with you. -- Warblade Prime 5/23/2000
As starter towns go, the hunting is a bit too rough. But is youre in your teens, its a Happy Hunting Ground. Run southwest from the weapons shop for about 1 minute (just past the waterfall) as you crest the hill, you will find many brown dots starting to appear on your radar. Lugians, mosswarts, monnougas, shreth, wasps, banderlings, reedsharks, and the occasional golem or zefir. The Rats Nest dungeon is located around this area. -- Zyban 7/7/2000
Nanto is a good place to start a mule that you want to get to one of the southern towns like Lin or Mayoi. Other than that, I havent found it that interesting. -- Jann 9/29/2000
Its an excellent area to get up into the teens, if you know the terrain. The provisioner pays quite well for lockpicks. -- Ognam 11/15/2000

name: Leikotha's Crypt
description:
I found this place while exploring the land, it is only accessible by running and there is no portal away. It contains 2 lesser Mu-miyah's and 1 greater Mu-miyah. Careful the greater can cast lvl IV warspells and is situated and the back of the tomb. Also very easy to get trapped in there so be wary. -- Origy
There is also a statue here of a demon or winged beast that strongly resembles the shadowy figure currently appearing in the Dereth skys (Shadows of the Past). -- Lita 3/4/2000 Greater Mu-miyah is Leikotha herself, who drops the Broken Haft, a piece needed for the Silifi of Crimson Stars quest axe. :) -- Lorelai 4/7/2000
One of the coffins inside requires a sturdy iron key to open. Don't know what's inside as I didn't have a key at the time. -- Sa'riq 8/12/2000 Location name spelling corrected thanks to Seeker 7/20/2004 Geomancer

name: Banderling Castle
description:
A castle full of banderling. Ranging from Raiders to captains. -- Prome
And Tumerok Workers and Warriors. This is your basic Direlands Tumerok open fort repopulated with banderlings instead. There is also one banderling Chief, and 5 chests with jems/food. Decent mid-level xp if you like killing piles of banderlings :) -- Lo Pang-Jo 1/2/00
Boy, did I get a funny surprise while exploring the little hidey-hole in the center of this fort. I got a Camping Expertise spell cast on me accompanied with an amusing visual. From the spells description, it Increases the chance of finding phat loot. -- Sixfingers 10/12/2000

name: Adventurer's Haven
description:
As a point of interest it is a large room with a Lifestone inside, a Rejuvenating Fountain and most importantly 3 portals leading to Samsur, Lytelthorpe and Yanshi. There is no monsters and the place is simply one big hall. Its purpose is probably to serve as a hall between the 3 worlds. -- Caeryn Dryad
Serves as a home for many various guilds. Including PK guilds and NPK guilds. Quite a nice hideaway =) -- Skorn 5/21/2000

name: Saadia's Retreat
description: Stop #6 in the Undead Mechanic quest added in the October 2003 patch. -- Geomancer 11/14/2003 This dungeon has been updated, it is full of mossie idolators, fanatics, zealots, and a soul trapper now. Bring your fire resistance. Not recommended for solos below level 30. -- Halcyon 1/10/2004

name: Stone Head
description: Stone Head overlooking the river. -- Dunc

name: Healer
description: Hearling in a house, north of the road (you can see it from the road) from Shoshi to Sawato. -- Dunc

name: Healer
description: House with a Healer out front. There are Lugians around, plus other monsters. in the middle of nowhere, south of Sawato. -- Dunc

name: Banderling and Mosswart Castle
description:
Castle with Banderlings (Guards, +) and Mosswarts (Feeders, +). Also an Interest point (Lower one between Khayyaban and Baishi). -- Dunc
Roughly two dozen monsters in and around the walls, and a rich mix of local fauna surrounding -- zefirs, drudges, golems, lugians. When I scanned I found no objects in the fort. -- Doc Feelgood 3/9/2000

name: Samsur NW lifestone
description:
-- Nether
Just west of the main town of Samsur on top of the advocate building is a portal to NW Samsur right by this lifestone. Theres also a return portal, so this lifestone pretty much server as the main one for the town. -- Nether 11/6/99

name: Sawato Lifestone
description: Moved to 28.8S, 59.3E from 28.9S, 60.6E -- Seeker 5/16/2004

name: Mosswart Tower in the Swamp
description:
NW of Sawato in the swamp. Take the NW road from town and keep going, youll run right into it. Shamans(at least 2), Feeders, Barkers, etc. I counted at least 10+. Becareful as theyll jump off the tower and gang up on you. -- Dunc
Only one shaman now, and no chest. I was expecting a chest at the top of the tower. A couple of Drudges or Gnawers guard the entrance. -- Minas Tirith 2/24/2000

name: Stone Head
description: A fallen over Stone Head in the swamp NW of Sawato. Anyone know what these are for yet? -- Dunc

name: A Ruin (Arwic)
description: No level restriction. So if you were wishing you had access to a small dungeon sparsely populated with Mites, but were level 60, heres your dream come true. -- Halcyon 9/14/2003

name: North Direlands Portal
description:
Portal from nowhere to in the North Direlands -- Ki Dung Sa Bong
Now has a Level 12+ restriction. -- Doc Feelgood 2/12/00

name: North Desert Edge portal
description: portal to on the N desert edge -- Ki Dung Sa Bong

name: S. Land Bridge to Mayoi
description: Portal to Mayoi -- Xian Liu

name: Rocky Crypt
description: Now has Iron, Copper, Granite, Glacial, and Unstable Magma Golems. -- Chupon 8/19/2004

name: Stone Head
description: Stone Head east of the road from Al-Arqas to Khayyaban. Stone Head purpose? I've seen one with it's mouth open leading to a passage to a Dungeon. Possible future quest site? -- Dunc

name: Tower
description: Empty tower on the desert edge. One in a series (middle of three?) of towers. -- Dunc

name: Desert Guard Tower
description: Empty desert guard tower. -- Dunc

name: Desert Guard Tower
description: Empty desert guard tower. -- Dunc

name: Translator - Zaikhal
description: If your text is of Dericost, Haebrous, or early Yalain, this person may be able to translate it. -- Buzz the Squid

name: Stonehold Lifestone
description: Stonehold lifestone. Closest there is, almost in town. -- Nether

name: Khayabban to Lin Portal
description: Exits at 53.9S, 74.1E -- Sir J Axemaster

name: Lost Garden Ruins to Mayoi
description:
near Lost Garden Ruins... -- Koban Cho
Was there yesterday. Killed by an Ivory Gromnie. No level restrictions. -- Lost Traveler 1/10/00
The portal exits at -- Hiemdal Olafsun 1/25/00

name: Tufa Lifestone
description: be careful, the desert can be hazardous. Hell, the town can be hazardous. -- Hung

name: Cave
description: Singles & pairs of Manouga. Nothing fancy. -- Kelly Royal

name: Swamp spot
description:
3 L8 undead guarding magic leather breastplate (at least when I was there) on ground. This is in the swamp east of Yanshi. -- Acumi
The undead are gone, but a square of standing stones and a triangular monument remain. -- Doc Feelgood 8/25/2000

name: Lugian Post
description: couple Gotrok Laigus, a Gotrok Obeloth, and a Gotrok Lithos

name: Beach Lifestone
description:
Lifestone on the southern beach, on the east end of the land bride to the Dires. To the north, in a canyon, are 6+ Skeletons guarding a chest... I didn't get a chance to kill them and see what was in there though... -- Dunc
There were 2 Skeleton Warriors and 3 skeletons. the chest had 2 jems and 2 rings, not of much value. DO NOT run to this from the road, you will jump off the cliff and die. Go back to the lifestone east and go down to the beach to reach this spot. -- Gune 9/2/2000
Why not get a separate entry for this amazing skeleton spawn... chest loot is not atypical for skeleton warriors and skeletons. Lifestone is one of the best direland border lifestones, with low to midlevel mobs near the stone and granite golems, banderling ravers, tumeroks and the like to the west. Also, to the east along the beach is a monolith with a permanent spawn of three sandy armordilloes. -- Afreyt 9/7/2000

name: Wintersebb Festival Stone
description: Festival Stone east of Qalabar. -- Dunc

name: Peddler and Shack
description:
Peddler and Shack on a hill. There are a couple Amploth Lugians (lvl19) around. Almost directly east of Qalabar. -- Dunc
Peddler buys: gems, weapons, keys, clothing and scrolls. Doesnt buy: jewelry, bows, armor, spell components, miscellaneous -- Doc Feelgood 3/19/2000

name: Kara Lake Lifestone
description:
Lifestone on a lake, near Kara. -- Dunc
This the lifestone of the blood monarchy but not for long...13-01-01 -- Reino 1/13/2001

name: Lilly of Glenden Wood
description:
She takes auroch horns and turns them into stamina potions. -- Acumi
Dont know what update it started but as of Jan/28/2001 she makes matty horns into health elixirs-Vexar Nightstalker of Wintersebb 1/28/2001

name: Farmer
description:
Sells containers, food, and cooking items. -- Acumi
Near Glenden Wood -- Cuttler Strongm 10/30/99

name: Eastham Lifestone
description:
-- Santos Houdini
Just follow the east road out of town. -- Polecat 11/16/99

name: Dry Well
description: A dungeon with mostly Druges. You can get a quest for water from the well in exchange for your welcome letter. There is also a trick door leading to a chest guarded by tougher magic-using monster (2nd portal out right behind it). -- Dmitri

name: Igloo
description: It's an igloo in the middle of the snow. Inside are 2 non-players, selling healing kits, and general wares. -- GreyHart

name: Monouga House
description:
2-story house full of crude, rough, and outcast monougas. Right on the desert border. -- Nether
Much safer than its companion house a little ways away due to general lack of irritating monsters camped nearby. Maybe 15 minute spawn time, which gives the enterprising group or solo adventurer time to move between the two houses for virtually unbroken action. Whee. -- Hu Pong 10/31/2000

name: Unfinished Temple
description: There is a rusty knife that a woman at the Al-Arqas West outpost wants inside the chest in the large room.

name: Mosswart Temple
description: Little Temple of Mosswart Chief, Mosswart Shaman, 5 Mudlurk Mosswarts, 5 Barker Mosswarts guarding a Runed Chest.

name: Mt. Lethe
description:
This dungeon is populated by the Lord Cambarth and his minions. The source of the Water of Lethe, rumoured to cleanse people of their memories and pains. There is also a PK Altar here created by Lord Cambarth and his men. The population include Virindi Masters, Magma Golems, Sear Guard, Obsidian Golem, Virindi Servants and Lord Cambarth himself and his Foreman Brelax. Note: You need to go to the very bottom to finish the Quest. -- Caeryn Dryad
Outside is the spawning point for the Sword of Lost Light infusion elemental. I believe it is a Hellfire or a Firestorm. -- Nocturne, LC 7/14/2002 -- Doc Feelgood 11/4/2002
This dungeon dates back to beta days. It is medium-size with good eye-candy and winding corridors. Theres a room with mild mana-sucking crystals. Lockpick is helpful. The exit portal room near Lord Cambrith has an easily missed corridor down, to the right of the portal. This leads to the waters of Lethe. -- Doc Feelgood 11/4/2002

name: Seedsow Festival Stone
description: A magical artifact and gathering point for special events and holidays. -- Polecat 10/19/99

name: Abandoned Outpost
description: Near Samsur Outpost. This small tent outpost has been wiped out and its lifestone destroyed. The tents are now infested with grey rats. -- Khrome-Khoran

name: South Direlands to Slaughterhouse
description:
This portal is close to a small Tower in the South Direlands, surrounded by some unfriendly Tumeroks. Its not far away from the place where u respawn when u take the portal from Mayoi to South Direlands. I jumped into it thinking it would be some kind of cool dungeon (Portal is called Slaughterhouse). Well - I ended up in a real Slaughterhouse - or better slaughter-area. U respawn between two castles/forts in the North Direlands. Tons of Golden Wasps, Silver Rats, Vorous Shreths, Tumerok Shamans, Granite Golems, Bronze Armoredillos, and Level 58+ Drudges. A Fort with shops and Lifestone is not far away from the Slaughterhouse (Fort: 1.6N, 71.6W). Dont even think about showing up here alone. There is no portal-way out of the Slaughterhouse. Next portal is at the Fort 1.6N, 71.6W which ends up at Hilltop (between Cragstone/Glenden Wood) -- Wishmaster
The fort is Fort Tethana and there is a lifestone a little south of it -- Daven 10/25/99
This portal exits at 0.4S, 80.1W -- Stern 12/25/99
Before you go through, pick up a key off one of the tumeroks in the tower. It will open the gate to the Slaughterhouse fort at the other end of the portal. -- Doc Feelgood 2/19/00
This USE to be nice place to go. Not anymore, unless you dont mind being broke that is... -- Yulof 3/15/2000
Just visited my favorite Tumerok/Cattle hangout. The portal *is* still there, right next to the tower. -- Ffafyrd 8/5/2000

name: Tower
description:
Mostly empty tower. A couple of Druges in it. -- Dunc
But definately an important part of some a quest. Here you will find three notes, an old note, a crumpled note and and odd note. -- Truthsayer 6/10/2000

name: Lifestone
description:
Lifestone and peddler here. -- Yomatsu Hisao
Actually, the vendor here is an Archmage with limited selection. -- X 1/26/00

name: An abandon
description:
These arent the exact cords but it is around here...Near where the river starts flow down south. A few wasps outside and some tuskers a little more North, maybe a good log off place. -- XxRiSkxX
A small temple with a calendar inside. -- Balo 3/19/2000
Also, two parts of a broken lifestone cradle growing out of the calendar. Are these new or just not mentioned before? -- Ivory Rose -- Red and Gold 9/28/2000
Were there from the begining, or atleast Febuary. -- Chyeld 10/5/2000

name: RiverBend Tower
description: Abandoned Tower thats good for staging. -- Yoshimura

name: Samsur Outpost (a.k.a. Samburbs)
description:
Not a town, but this merchant does have his own lifestone. -- Crick
Its not a town, whyd he write it as a town? Its probably an outpost or something (havent checked myself) -- Anonymous 8/5/2000
It is an outpost, manned mostly by low-level members of Ilhanas guild. -- Anonymous 1/28/2001

name: Drudge Tower
description:
Drudge tower. -- Crick
BIG fun for a small group with non-stop action and loot galore. Beware that if you go booming right up to the tower youll get to see every drudge camp in the area sortie and head your way. Be careful of straying too far from the immediate area as there are skeletons, armoredillos and rust gromnies around that will not mind putting the smack-down on you. Lifestone nearby. This is another must-visit Samsur attraction. -- Hu Pong 11/2/2000

name: Skeleton Warrior Tower
description:
This tower is chock full of skeletal warriors. The one outside ussually has a crossbow so approach with caution. -- Crick
There is also a skeleton captain at the top. Lotsa fun. -- Methander 4/20/2001

name: Skeleton Tower
description: This tower sits on a hill. there are a few wasps and a warrior out front as guards, and many skeletons inside. be careful, as the monsters around it like to come see whats happening when the fighting starts. -- Crick

name: Guarded well
description: There is a font here that restores stamina guarded by a skeleton warrior with a bow or crossbow. -- Crick

name: weaponsmith
description:
a simple weaponsmith on the road from samsur to al-jalima. a nice diversion during the travels. -- crick
Buys and sells weapons and trade notes, doesnt carry arrows, doesnt deal in other merchandise. -- Doc Feelgood 5/3/2000

name: Revitalizing Fountain
description: Fountain casts Revitalize Other I. Its in the atrium of the building across from the life stone. -- Polecat

name: Ran Le the Librarian
description: SHe sells parchments, books, and quest information. -- Polecat

name: The Stone of Ben Ten
description: This stone relates the story of Ben Ten, one of the first Sho on the island. This stone is in the atrium of the building across from the lifestone. -- Polecat

name: Drunken Madman Tower
description:
Drunken Madman here, speaking of removing Asherons protection. Want to be a red dot? Good hunting for lvl.7+ with ranged attacks(archer or magic) or higher for hand to hand. Immediate area has lugians (lvl.15+), golems (lvl.11+), Ivory Gromnie, mosswarts (creepers, feeders), Mattekars (white and snowy). Quite a run, better be tough and/or fast, careful not to get caught in unpassable mountain areas on approach. Not for the faint of heart. -- Lila
Official name: Ridge Tower -- Ghozer 11/8/99
The Drunken Madman requests a drink, I believe, I didnt have one to give him though -- Destructor 11/18/99
Drunken Madman requires one Saki for passage. -- Xirces 11/26/99
Its Sake.. Buy it in Baishi.. and hes been Fizzling from what i hear.. -- Shaggz Two Dope 12/30/99
Hes fixed. -- Eviloce 2/1/00
Now inhabited by Shadow Lieutenants... not a good place for beginners at all. The drunk guy is still there... but dont go unless you are well prepared. The way up is filled with shadows as well. -- Gnad the Large 3/29/2000
Shadows are there sometimes but not all the time. No spawn points inside. Dangerous but still not a bad place for 8th-12th level archers and war mages to powerlevel -- Tesslah 4/29/2000

name: Outside Accursed Halls
description: This fort is a staging area for the Accursed halls. At the Ridge Tower near Baishi you will find a Drunken Madman. Give him Sake and he will open a Gateway to the Walled portals. The outside Accursed Halls portal drops you out here. It can be tied, but not summoned. This is also a great staging point for the C-Note emissary to Aerlinthe Island. -- Yoshimura -- Nocturne -- Arrogant -- BuffDaddy

name: Mosswart Dwelling
description: 12 Mosswart Fanatics, 1 Mosswart Chief and a Runed Chest.

name: Skeleton Tent
description: Spawning Point for Skels, ran too fast for much more. -- F.O.

name: Drudge Camp (North of Zaikhal)
description: 4 Drudge Prowlers and 1 Drudge Robber guard this little camp by the road North of Zaikhal. A magic piece of food that can restore 18-24 points of stamina, and various scraps of paper with rumors spawn on the ground. -- Nether

name: Zabool Tower
description:
Theres a Portal at the top that takes you outside on the top of the peak. There is a Life Stone with in site when your come out and a Portal to the top of Mt. Alphus near by also. -- Stern 12/25/99
For those interested it has mostly rats (reds and blacks) a couple reedsharks, and two liches. -- Maneyen 2/3/00
on top of Mt Alphus Litchs room spawns 4-6 items good to sell to vendor for Superb lockpicks for 1200p, and pearless healing kits for 1000p. -- Le Q III 3/21/2000
go all the way to the top. Portal out to top of peak. Merchant there sell zoobal key. keys opens door in Alfreth Dungeon to get to Bander Cap that has key to Sylsfear Dungeon that has BDVI ruby for SoCS 5/27/2000
Picks? Healing Kits? In here???? NOT - As the writer said above - BORING - two liches, two sharks (a pup and an adult) and a handful of lesser rats...thats it - which sucks cuz this place is huge. Definately one to skip (LOUSY treasure). -- Bleys Icefalcon 5/28/2000
no the merchant is not IN the dungeon. go all the way to the top, take the mount alphus portal, you will find him there. it is part of the SoCS... 6/6/2000

name: Cragstone Library
description: A translator who will translate text from the empyrean era of lore, as well as a scribe is here. You can also read a bunch about the history of Dereth. -- Nether

name: Ice Golem Shrine
description:
Ice Golems all congregated around a shrine of some sort. About 15 Golems here. Also two portals are here, one to the North Direlands w/ lvl restriction, and other to North Desert Edge (dest is approx. 5N 2w). -- Yoshimura
now there are two golems here, long respawn. -- Vyper 3/15/2000
No, no. There was still a great many ice golems that spawn here. Theyll add up if you let them. Note: The life-stone hopping from Holtburg has gotten more perilous with the last AC update: you may encounter drudge lurkers or stalkers along the way. If your 13th-20th level with a run speed of 100 or greater, youll make it to Fort Drachensun (to the east) just fine. Lifestone there and come on out. Oh, and bring a flame sword... -- Sixfingers 7/28/2000

name: Merchant
description: General merchant on the road between Zaikhal and Al-Jalima. Close to the Crypt of Ashen Tears portal. Surrounded by Shreths and Dillos. -- Chak

name: Olthoi Outpost
description:
Three Olthoi workers on a ridge in the middle of nowhere. -- Ithron
I found 6 workers and 1 soldier when I was there 2/29/2000
A combination of an Olthoi rock formation and a dungeon portal rock, but with no portal inside. Olthoi spawn inside and out. Easy access from the road between Bandit Castle and North Castle. -- Doc Feelgood 4/10/2000

name: Mountaintop Lifestone
description: SW of Shoushi on top of a mountain. Shreths, rats and zombies in the area. -- Ch'akMoved to 33.9S, 64.9E recently. -- Charles 7/24/2004

name: North Eastham Lifestone
description: North of town -- Polecat

name: Abandoned House
description: Safe lay over spot to recover stamina or mana. -- Polecat

name: Folthid's Cellar
description: You can obtain the Dagger of Tikola from here.

name: Lifestone
description: Peddler and Lifestone -- Matsura

name: Shoushi to Eastham
description: Exits at 17.8N, 64.3E, right next to a lifestone outside of Eastham. Portal is on top of the mountain west of Shoushi. -- Chak

name: Dires Lifestone
description: Lifestone, tower, and portal to Qalabar -- Igthorn

name: South Direlands to the Isle of Tears
description: Three temples in a row going from north to south. Isle of Tears Portal is in the southern most temple. Exits at 22.1N, 51.7E -- Igthorn

name: Undead Temple
description: 2 Lich Lords outside, 2 Liches and a L62 Revenent inside. -- Igthorn

name: The Briar Patch
description: A large collection of critters south of Hebian-To, near the orange-ish dot. Reedsharks, shreths, and monoguas, oh my. -- Polecat

name: Mage Tower
description:
This is a tower in the Desert midway between Uziz and Kayyaban and East. Lots of Monsters surrounding it including Greeen Phyntos and Jade Grommies. Mage inside selling minimal stuff -- Stiletto
This spot may be of interest to beginning war mage/archer types. Good points: on-site lifestone, plenty of mid-level monsters within blasting distance of tower, and portal out. Bad point: a long run in. -- Doc Feelgood 5/31/2000

name: Mtn Retreat
description:
Mtn Castle with an Archmage, General Shopkeeper, and Weapon/Armorer. Lifestone and portal to a Hilltop near is here as well. Lots of Banders, Monougas and Mites nearby for good Mid lvl (8~14) hunting. -- Yoshimura
Tuskers can be found here as well... -- Polecat 11/25/99
addition: the merchant buys and sells lots of kinds of stuff, but the archmage offers a *very* limited variety of components -- dont expect to find what youve run out of... unless youve checked first. Only mana stones with tiny charge are sold. -- Doc Feelgood 2/3/00
As of the August patch there is now also a collector here for rat tails, wings, scalps, etc. -- Virginia Plain 8/10/2000
This is an excellent setup with one exception- not enough wildlife to hunt, A good place to overnight on the way to Stonehold or the Mountain Castle, but if you made it this far you will probably find youtself wanting to move on. -- Jann 9/29/2000
The good Doc is, ah, not entirely correct. The archmage offers all components including tapers, up to silver scarabs. His markup is 40%. He buys the usual mage stuff at 80%. The bowyer sells arrows, quarrels, and AP arrows/quarrels at a 30% markup. He doesnt sell AP heads, but he does sell arrow and quarrel shafts and normal heads. The merchant buys at 80% for most things
hes like a town provisioner. He will not buy gems or jewelry. So not a bad little minitown, except theres no place to sell gems or jewelry. -- Red and Gold 2/3/2001
Doc was correct until the Jan. or Feb. 2001 patch. Now all towns sell tapers and most comps. -- Servant-san 3/2/2001
Agree, the hunting is terrible. No Ravs, Stalkers or Lurkers, nope. None at all. No Copper, Iron or Limestone golems either. Not a one. No Great Matties. Nope, youll just want to move right along to somewhere else, especially since its soooo crowded with other people hunting the Young Banderlings and Red Phyntos wasps. The hunting is soooo terrible that Im only making 15K exp. per buff cycle (at level 16), mostly hunting within sight of the town. -- Dhambala al-T 8/31/2001

name: Mtn Retreat Lifestone
description: Lifestone inside the Mtn Retreat Castle. -- Yoshimura

name: Mtn Retreat to HillTop
description: Portal to Hilltop. Dest is 32.5N, 34.2E -- Yoshimura

name: Underground Passage
description: See Underground Passage at 32.8S, 73.3E. -- Dark Man - Sol You must be flagged for the final part of the Elysas Favor quest to enter. You drop into the basement of a dungeon at Fort Witshire. After working your way up, you will come to an area with pink diseased Virindi walls. This place is, of course, full of Hollow Minions. One of the rooms in this area has a portal to Fort Witshire. The exit inside the fort is covered with Hollow Minions. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/11/2004

name: Fount of Revitalization
description: Casts Revitalize Other I -- Polecat

name: Heabian Cove
description:
Its on the beach, east of town... -- Polecat
It is now in the water.. -- Blanthis 5/26/2001

name: Sleepless Sentinels
description: 55 Empyrean statues lined up facing east. I went the direction they faced and found an oasis. Couldnt discover the mystery of this place. -- Curunir

name: Four Braziers
description: A medium sized brick square with large braziers burning at each corner. -- Xian Liu

name: Fallen Tower
description:
Its as if some picked up one of the advocate towers and dropped it... Lots of tumeroks and other nasties... -- Polecat
addition: Monsters on the outside include Liches, Copper Golems -- Doc Feelgood 2/9/00

name: Mtn Halls Tower
description: Tower nearby the Mountain Halls dungeon. Nearby lifestone and great hunting. -- Polecat

name: Two Towers
description: Two towers filled with turmeroks and banderlings. Very Lame. -- Arcilite

name: Yanshi Namoon Lifestone
description:
On side of road from Yanshi to Sawato. Also a few merchants here. -- Shogo Akai
Merchants are a mage, healer, farmer and weaponsmith. Mage offers full selection of components for first level spells. This is an excellent base point for adventures into western Greenmire swamp. -- Doc Feelgood 6/10/2000

name: Archmage
description: Mage in Tower. Only a few Reagents. -- Myrddin

name: House
description: House with merchant, healer and mage (not many components), lifestone. -- Curunir

name: House
description:
Lifestone by house of merchants. -- Curunir
Part of Washingtons Way from North Castle to Stonehold -- a relatively peaceful way. Run north out of North Castle to the valley at 73.5N, 16.5E, then to this lifestone. Head due west to 17W, then south to Igloo LS at 70.4N, 17.3W, then into town. South of this route (due west out of North Castle) the monsters are thicker. (August patch) -- Doc Feelgood 8/26/2000

name: Master Celdiseth the Archmage
description:
Formerly known as Celdiseths Cottage
Cottage with nice hedge. Celdiseth has the full inventory of mage items, including pyreal and gold scarabs and Aluvian Master robes. (The 50,000p ones.) -- Curunir 1/22/00
Celdiseth is not a people person. His Unibomber-esque dream cottage makes him the most difficult Master Mage to reach by foot.
Celdiseth buys mage items at 80% and sells mage and alchemy supplies at 110%. He has the ultimate selection of mage and alchemist items
all spell components and scarabs, all Peas, Splitting Tool, Concentrated Aqua Incanta, Neutral Balms, Eye Dropper, Alembic, and Mortar and Pestle. He also sells Portal gems to all of the starter towns and a portal gem back to his shop. At 20k value, Celdiseths Portal Gems make great lightweight death items and are an affordable time saver for travel. Another must have death item, Faran Master Robes, are also sold here.-- Taarna Blood SC 10/14/04

name: River Bend Tower
description: A safe tower in the wilderness near Dryreach. -- RFH

name: Riverbend
description:
Portal to the River Bend Tower, in the Dryreach Wilderness -- RFH
The portal drops you at coords: -- RFH 11/29/99

name: Lifestone
description:
Lifestone near River Bend tower. Conveniently located between Dryreach & Yanshi. Wilderness is filled with Banderlings, Blood Streths, Dillos, Rats & Drudges. Happy hunting. -- RFH
Oppinion from Darktide: A good place until around level 10. Lots of veteran and elder reedsharks, hunter shreths and others. Lytelthrope is nearby and has almost everything a new mage or warrior can wish, also seems to be pretty quiet in the respect of PKs, you can usualy easely hit the town with your mule without being slaugtered by level 30+ ppls. This is a very good place to level up a newbie on Darktide. -- Oogy Wawa 12/6/2000

name: Winthura's Garden
description:
Exit portal right near entrance, but to explore dungeon, you must jump down into a pit. Another exit portal is located deeper in the dungeon. Mostly Tumerok Workers and Scouts in the upper part of dungeon. Most monsters trapped behind closed doors. A couple Rough Monougas guarding a chest with okay loot. The final gate is lever operated and will close behind you. We were unable to find a switch to reopen it. At the bottom, some Tumerok Fighters, Warriors and Priests guarding two chests. -- Streak
You can escape the lower level prison now. Next to the 2 tumerok warriors and the tumerok priest at the bottom is a lever. It will reopen the grate above. -- Lynn deLeslie 7/22/2001

name: Podium Lifestone
description: Due east from the Isle of Tears. Near the coast. Standing on this cool concrete podium. -- Annex

name: Tumerok Fortress
description:
Ash Gromnies, Drudges, Tumeroks, Skeles, all kinds of Direland fun. -- Gonzo
Approach from valley on north side. Door is on south side guarded by tumerok Warriors and Phantos wasps. Watch out for ambushers in the surrounding hills who show up when the fighting starts. -- Doc Feelgood 2/13/00
BDT (Big Dungeon Treasure) is three chests in one tower, modest tresure. -- Doc Feelgood 2/13/00
The treasure in the chests really is nothing special, non magical sub 500p jewellery. -- Goldhart 4/7/2000

name: Undead Holdout
description: A small holdout (i.e. small walled area) with 6+ undead and 2+ zombies. Just south off the road between Shoushi and Henian-to. -- Dunc

name: Peddler
description: Peddler by a small hut along the south shore of a lake, great for runs between Zaikhal and Plateau. -- Gaffgarron

name: Lifestone
description: Lifestone along the south shore of a lake, great for runs between Zaikhal and Plateau. -- Gaffgarron

name: Giant Flower
description: A giant flower, standing at the top of a small hill in the middle of nowhere. Maybe a Tremendous Mounuga will pick it for his girlfriend? -- Gaffgarron

name: Adventurer's Haven Portal to Yanshi
description: This portal dead smack in the middle of nowhere leads into an empty building with a Lifestone, revitalizing fountain, and portals to Samsur, Yanshi, and Lytelthorpe. -- Ling Joyen

name: Mayoi Beach Lifestone
description: Just thought Id add it because I dont think it is on the list. :) -- GimpyHud

name: Tower
description:
Has 1 granite golem inside that cannot come out -- GimpyHud
Good place to get exposed to granites in a safe fashion, if thats your thing. Tower is surrounded by blue phantos wasps, etc., relatively safe. Mud/water golem spawns nearby. A life mage can drain to death in short order, spawn rate 5 minutes or so. Didnt see anything of note inside the tower... 7/16/2000

name: Direlands Lifestone
description: Nice lifestone in the direlands, set on a platform with only a few skeleton warriors in the distance. A small moment of peace in an otherwise rough area. -- Destructor

name: Morgluuk's Castle (Noble Weapon Quest)
description:
This used to be a Sclavus Castle, untill Morgluuk moved in. Now it is the home to the Noble Weapon quest to slay Morgluuk. There are 5 main dungeons here, which appear to be floating stones. They dont show up as portals or items, but any 3rd party detectors will call them Vile-Smelling Refuse. You must be flagged to enter by giving Captain Krank in Linvak Tukal Toberiks Report. This report comes from the Renegade Fortress at 28.5S,65.5W. It is givable, so send one person to stock up.

Of the 5 main dungeons, 4 on ground level hold various ways to weaken Morgluuk, either by killing his Egg or by killing a Watcher and weakening his bodyguards. The 5th is in a room near the top and contains Morgluuk -- Taarna Blood SC

name: Shoushi Outpost Lifestone
description: this shoushi lifestone is prolly the nearest lifestone to dungeon mei where many beginners go when they reach level 6+ -- thalimax

name: Three Merchants
description:
Weaponsmith, Armomer, and Bowyer... -- Polecat
There is also a lifestone there now.. good spot for stoning if PK :) -- Aldur 3/21/2000
There is a portal here called North Desert Edge it comes out at 4.7s 3.1w -- mindset 4/21/2000
Merchants buy armor, weapons, clothing and tradenotes. They dont buy gems, jewels or food. Roaming Bowyer sells quarrels and arrows, regular and blunt, and limited quantities of arrowheads and shafts (no quarrel shafts). Banderlings, drudge, mites, monoguas surround the village. With lifestone, merchants, buildings and monsters all nearby, this is a prime XP spot for low-to-mid levels. -- Doc Feelgood 7/17/2000
Looks like the humans have been run out of town. I visited here recently and it seemed to be completely populated with Banderlings. On my three passes through town I couldnt see any merchants, and couldnt spot if any of the many many dots were yellow (I doubt it). -- Sturgeon 2/12/2001

name: Forgotten Temple Portal
description: Low level dungeon on upper levels, drudge skulkers and gnawer shereths, monsters dont attack in groups. -- Ragnorak

name: Tumerok Chamber
description:
a chamber with a couple warriors, priests and a officer, nothing special but a nice place to hunt. -- Ki Dung Sa Bong
Exits where you enter, 81.6S, 36.6W -- Igthorn 12/24/99
For a direlands place, it's rather weak. But, the interior looks like a HUGE cave. Very interesting. -- Soo Yung 2/1/00

name: Lich's Place
description:
Tower on the waters edge. These are the exact coords, but theyre close. Three Lich Lords and their buddies...Tumerok Officer. Think icky. We didnt stick around since this isnt what we were there for... -- Polecat
Let me just amend that with Banderling Gaurds, Drudge Lurkers, and other assorted nasties. From the water, looking up on the hill, you can see a couple more towers that may be part of a fort... -- Polecat 12/8/99
We cleared the towers : nothing there : no treasure, no chests, just a couple of tumeroks and banderlings -- El Shrimpo 12/12/99
Just down the cliff from N. Direlands 1/2 Fort. To get to the fort, climb the cliffs further south about a click. -- Doc Feelgood 2/8/00
No Lich Lords now - plain Lichs :( -- Jol 3/30/2000

name: A Small Ruin Portal
description:
Small place west of Lin containing banders. Youngs, Scouts, Guards, Ravers. Breeder and a Captain at the end with a chest. Decent stuff in the chest. Coolest part is the room with floating red and yellow particles. -- Maneyen
Also, must be 5+ to enter. -- Maneyen 12/10/99
Well, I can say that the chest is still there and is still spawning loot. I was there for about 20 minutes last night and not once did a monster spawn. -- Talthazar 6/1/2000
When we came out of the dungeon, there was a Hunter Shreth and a Reedshark Pup. While killing the Reedshark 1 or more Shadows spawned. Run back into portal. They will leave after a while. -- Rafe Caradec 6/22/2000
Now two to three packs with 2 vorous + 1 hunter shreths camp the close surroundings. -- Wolf der Hexer 8/30/2000
Talthazar I dont know what the hell you did but there are plenty of banderlings here and they do respawn faster than 20 minutes(though I dont know exactly how fast).The room with the odd lights floating around makes a nice screenshot and the chest spawns okay loot.I didnt stay long as I was level 33 and these pitful banderlings are weak. -- Sega Slayer 12/1/2000

name: Zombie Hideout
description:
Three building on a mountain top with Undead (lvl 8), Zombies(lvl 11) and a Lich (lvl 20). The hill was really hard to get up. I had to run all the way around to the North to find a path to climb. -- Elrabin
50.0N 5.0W Is the only place I found to get up on the mountain -- Owen 12/13/99

name: Farmhouse
description:
Farmhouse with a couple cows and a farmer who sells minor items. Nothing special. This is south of Fort Witshire. -- Nether
Farmhouse is no longer at these coords -- Devyn 3/22/2000 3/22/2000

name: Lytelthorpe Collector
description: Takes wings, scalps, charms, and all the usual junk. Located inside the pub. -- Nether

name: Beysta the Healer - Lytelthorpe
description: Healer sells at 160% and buys at 80% -- Nether-- Marcus 11/16/2000

name: Beltslore the Collector
description: Shell take charms, rat tails, armoredillo spines, and swamp stones. -- Nether

name: West Lytelthorpe Outpost
description: -- Nether

name: Golem Spire
description:
Interesting single level building. When I came upon it, there were 4 limestone golems outside it, and 2 zombies inside. -- Valadon Grimm
Also one Lich within and many other creatures about-12-14-99 -- Rizzelrun Grey 12/14/99
This is an Empyrean power station building, and it seems to have attracted highly magical creatures, zefirs and shadows are also nearby. -- Doc Feelgood 6/25/2000
not a spire at all but rather a power station.CAMPED.ran past and saw 2 mages camping the place.They were on the roof and it looked like they were draining things to death(#.@$% life mages).Did I mention this place is camped? -- Sega Slayer 12/1/2000
Ah Sega, you play your game well play ours, k????? Meleers -- Mith Solclaim 1/28/2001
ok life mage if thats the way you want it.on darktide me and my friend come here all the time to PK the life mages.have fun. -- Sega Slayer 3/30/2001

name: Dungeon of Tatters
description:
Shadow Lieutenants, Fire Wisps, Panumbris Shadow, Mist Golems


Stop #12 of the Undead Mechanic quest added in the October 2003 patch. -- Geomancer 11/16/2003

name: Ancient Town to Heartland
description: to Heartland at

name: Ancient Town to High Mountain Valley
description: to Hign Mountain Valley at -- Darksilver Updated exit to 65.2S, 60.3E from 65.9S, 59.7E -- Dutton 8/15/2004

name: Ancient Town to Hilltop
description: to Hilltop -- Darksilver

name: House
description:
Houses some rough monungas and outcasts. Revitalizing fountain inside house. -- Gimpyhud
Bring your bow. Some of the roughs can be picked off by lurking around the doorway and shooting inside. The outcasts will come out to play, but I havent seen the roughs do this yet. One came down to the doorway but went immediately back inside. -- Hu Pong 10/31/2000
Correction. That applies more to the companion Monouga House a little ways to the north. These roughs *will* come outside if you irritate them enough, and the critters camped nearby--hunter shreth, skeletons, rust gromnies, the odd broken fragment--makes this place a little iffy for low-levels. -- Hu Pong 10/31/2000

name: Evensong Festival Stone
description:
-- Gimpyhud
On the shore of the river Prosper, near Holtburg. -- Stern 3/8/2000

name: Olthoi Tunnels
description:
Olthois All Around -- Savage
There are only a few soldiers and workers b4 the noble. YES A NOBLE IS HERE. Its easy to use the walls such that you fight nmo more than 2 olthoi atta time. If you have 250 jump you can still pech at the start by playing super mario of an olthois head/ -- Sarec 6/14/2000
But Archers, dont get all excited. Perching here is pointless now because this dungeon has been ruined by a slower spawn rate. So the amount of time youd spend perching, compared to the chance of actually seeing an Olthoi is totally pointless. -- T-Bird (HG) 9/1/2000

name: Apple Seller
description:
Sells Trothyr's Rest Rumor and Key, and of course, apples. -- Lirisa
Not just any apples. He sells the legendary tart apples...+24 stamina at a bargain price. -- Johnnie 12/23/99
A bargain hard fought. If you're low lvl, beware. Many bandies nearby, and when you finish with those and go inside to see the Apple Seller -- Surprise. A couple of nice reedsharks waiting inside. -- Thirmon Kashkan 6/14/2000 No longer a deathtrap... the house is clear, although I saw a couple blue wasps in the area, they were easily avoided. The apples are stackable, basically the equivalent of lesser stam potions at only 50 burden and 11 py. nice for newbies. -- Halcyon 9/12/2003

name: Skel Outpost
description:
Small skeleton outpost set up the exact same way as the Lugian post near Qualabar. Skels, Warriors, and a Capitan. Some desert rats too. Two chests inside with some junk, misc junk laying on the ground. Sign in front says that theres riches beyond belief inside. If there is, I didnt see it. -- LUMINO.
Are you crazy? No treasure, one of the gems needed to make the silifi of crimson stars is here.. Either that, or the 25 hundred pyreal cursed ruby that I found on the captain was just another gem. A level 45 told me thats what the gem was for, so Im pretty sure Im right about this. -- Magwitch 4/4/2000

name: House
description:
House in the boonies surrounded by hordes of Mattekar. Ice Golem inside guards locked chest with junk inside. Grrrrrr. -- Powers al-Menta
The chest was nerfed in the December patch :-[ -- Nightwolf 2/1/00
White/Snow Matties, not that many. Chest was mundane gems/jewels. Many shadows around (Dark Thaw). Not worth visiting. -- Soji 2/12/00

name: Mage Academy
description:
Iron Golems, Swamp Rats, Zefirs, and Wisps. You know, all the neat things for an aspiring mage. -- Gonzo
Many dangerous Kefirs who casts Level IV+ Spells and many levers and closed doors. I opened all but didnt find anything interesting. Bad Xp and bad loot. The 2 irons are the only good xp in that dungeon. -- StrangerX 12/21/99
Thisplace has a sacarphagous that spawns al 139 armour... 3 item ever26 minutes. Itis SO camped and manipulated. Room at bottom of dungeon, at the last choice of turninng right or left go right (left all before that). Every one who camps is lvl 30+ so havea high quick for beating them cause they cant line up. Sandstone golemn spawns there. -- Hate Campers. 1/12/00
Eh, lets not forget the PK alter at the bottom .. watch out, though, you can trigger a door to open, unleashing many (and I mean many) swamp rats upon you.. Also, Shadows, and more Swamp Rats.. not to mention Swamp Rats... -- Vioxide 1/18/00
The above poster is correct, this is an amazingly good chest. The only problem is that in the last patch, they upeed its defence. Now the chest is gaurded by an iron and obsidian golem, and a level IV lightning trap. Scary for a dungeon with only a level 8 restriction. -- Togashi Kokuni 2/7/00
Correction and Addition... The lightning traps are lvl III, the chest is now locked, and casts imperil V when you open it. All the REALLY good loot was in it before the patch too.... it seems to have been lowered a little. Still good stuff tho -- Pitt 3/12/2000
chest broken...spawns nothing... tried all day one day :( -- George 4/23/2000
chest now requires study iron key 5/27/2000
The chest DOES spawn good stuff, you just need one of those stupid Sturdy Iron Keys found randomly on monsters, mostly dires monsters...i found one on a silver rat and one on a Shadow Lt. -- Sword Nut 6/8/2000
As of October patch, Sarcaphagous is now guarded by 2 Obsidian Golems. SIK does NOT open it anymore. -- Deskjet 10/15/2000
Additonal: First off the Stone key does still open the door infront of the now 2 obsids.. which coicidently yield ZERO experience, and are not targetable using radar and creature selection keys.. you must use your mouse thru a texture or edge.. Also the sarcophagus key is found on Lord Rytheran who is still guarding the other (unchanged) sturdy iron chest. His spawn however is OVER 1 hour long.. we were not patient enough.. only made 1 pull.. got 2-7 +7 attack BD V aluvian only dagger.. not bad for a worthless skill
) -- J.C. - MT 10/28/2000
- also as expected this has a quest time.. you have completed this quest to recently.. could not pick up Lord Rytherans Key again 2 hours later. -- J.C. - MT 10/28/2000
To reach Lord Rytheran the Cursed Key from Burial Temple is required..the back door to reach him has been removed in Oct 2000 patch. His key is no-drop and opens Lady Js tomb fka an Uber chest. Loot is still the same variety as when it was Uber chest. Lockpicker and patience required..Lord Rs spawn rate is too long..hope they change this since a group effort is really needed for this quest. See my entry at Burial Temple. Get his letter translated in Zaikhal i believe. BTW, no more campers here =). -- AllyMcAlchemist 11/1/2000
This interesting little tweak they did to the dungean came way to late. The dungean WAS camped but only before the SIK hype calmed down. Ive made several trips there since then and often the only ones who are there just want to attack the obbies and are glad to help you to the chest. Making this a non SIK chest ruins it in my opinion and that spawn rate is rediculous. The chest the last few months seems to have been spitting out items with a higher cash value than actual game function so perhaps Trialos is the place to go now... -- Rendar 1/7/2001

name: A Ruin
description:
This is an abandoned Ruin. Shadow Children & more. Near Glendon Wood Banderling Tower. Not for the faint of heart. 36 lvl Mage was able to kill them, but needed rest in between. -- Al-Jasmine
This is not actually a dungeon. Its on the surface, also called The empyrean power plant. Two small buildings with a chest (unlocked , junk loot) in each. Shadow LT with some shads and children about. Nothing worth visiting. -- Krag_Frostfell 1/27/2003

name: Tumerok Swamp Castle
description:
A Castle full of tumeroks, inside is a portal to dryreach. Behind the castle is a building with tumerok officers but you need a key to open it.. (PS Key is found on a tumerok worker near swamp portal in Dryreach) -- El Shrimpo
There are lots of tumeroks and drudges in the hills around the fort. They will swarm when you begin attacking the fort. There are also mountain rats and wasps around. Try coming in from the low building side. -- Doc Feelgood 2/17/00

name: South Dires to Zaikhal
description:
Portal to zaikhal, with 3 lichs and a couple zombies in a a cave nearby -- Ki Dung Sa Bong
Portal exits at 14.3N, 1.3E. -- Vexorg 4/5/2000

name: Kara to Sho Roadside Portal
description: Portal in the town of Kara leading to the civilizaed Sho lands. Drops out at 27.9S, 68.4E. -- Shogo Akai

name: Lich Treasure Tower
description: Tower has Liches, Lich Lords, Revenant, Obsidian Golem guarding easy pickable chest, SIk Chest, and unlocked chest.

name: Base of Mt. Syliph Portal
description: Drops out at -- Shinju Tonik

name: Thieves' Galleries
description:
-- Anonymous
Banderlings, and more banderlings. You exit right near the portal. Small dungeon. -- Truebolt 12/23/99
Chest near the end with gems, magic item, magic gem, or cups/mugs. Two to three items. Decent respawn. -- Savant 12/23/99
Maybe 10 banderlings total, ravers, young, guards. The chest at the back is guarded by a scout and raider. -- Chi Domkwai 3/12/2000
There are two chests, one is in deep shadow and is guarded by blood shreths and a Reedshark. -- Jann 9/29/2000
This dungeon only has banderlings, no shreths or reedsharks. -- Sleepycat 10/5/2000
cool dungeon design and there really are banderlings here.Didnt notice anything else as I only took a quick look around(banderlings arent worth your time when your level 30+) -- Sega Slayer 12/1/2000 Now hase Lich Lords, Copper Golems, Sewer Rats, Banderling Bandits, Risen Lords, Cutthroats, Shadow Wisps, and Revenants along with a Runed chest. -- Chupon 8/19/2004

name: Tumerok Fort
description:
Small above ground Tumerok Fort on top of a mountain. -- Wadi
I call this the 2-Door Fort. Tumerock -- fighters, warriors, priests, Drudge Slaves, Lurkers. Good Hunting for three to five if Tumeroks are your style. Approach by taking ridge south from Dires Lifestone at 4.2N, 63.9W. -- Doc Feelgood 2/12/00

name: Tumerok Fort
description:
Very small Tumerok fort with locked gate. -- Wadi
Shadows and a Gold Phantos Wasp guard the entrance. Tumeroks and drudges inside. One chest. A rock with cellar is just uphill (but no portal in cellar). Easiest pproach is from the west. To get here take the valley south from Direlands Lifestone at 4.2N 63.9W. -- Dco Feelgood 2/12/00
I call this Tumerok Redoubt. -- Doc Feelgood 2/12/00

name: Small Icecave
description:
An ice cave north of the Bandit Castle. Mostly Ivory Gromnies, Ice Golems, and Black Rats of the top three levels. Ran out of time before I got to the bottom. Ice walls and ice roof looks very cool. Worth a trip just to look. -- Shogo Akai
its part of the frost quest, at the very bottom is a room with 2 iron golems guarding a book. you can only open the door with the key you get from the madman at the gates of Bandit prison -- El Shrimpo 12/28/99
Shrimpo was right, the place is really cool looking. Me (17th lvl War) and my Monarch (21st lvl Archer) checked it out. 1st off, for you platemail wearing guys like me, the Ice Gromies blast a nasty breath of zub-zero cold. I took like 14-20 points per blast and a 38 pt critical. Be prepared, not like me standing with an Ice Tachi in hand. Big 0 damage. Down past about 6 of thease and a handful of Rats you come to a deadend room with a large opening in the middle. Lokk down, there is a bridge that you can safely jump too, but be ready for another Ice gromie. One way will go to a deadend with am Ice Golem. Not too tough, less deadly than the Gromies I thought. The other way lead around to another deadend, but with a room to jump down into. 1 or 2 Ice Golems here. There is a deadend hall one way, a set of stairs up the other and a door out. Up the stairs will take you to another bridge and you will see the Lich that was been casting all the spells on you while you were down below. Across the bridge is a locked door. This must be the one you need to have the key from, and there were 2 Iron Golems in there, 42nd level. (shiver) We didnt have the key so we went back down to the other door. Open this and there is a T intersection. If you are around our level, and you go right, you will go right to the lifestone, dont pass go, dont collect 200 pyerels. 42 lvl Iron Golem. Hit me with a spell for 55 pts dmg, and smashed my monarch for over 100, for an instant death. But, if you just haul ass to the left, you will see the exit portal. Good luck, - Vylarn of Harvestgain -- Vylarn 1/10/00
I did this level as a level 25 war/life/item mage - no real problems. Just take it slow. At the end, you will be under a rope/wood bridge. At the top, a Lich was powerless while I drained him. He didnt spawn for > 10 minutes. I went to where he stood, in front of the door, and drained the 2 iron golems. Used the key to go inside and get my loot. No real problem here. Cave looked really cool. Just watch out for ice golems and ivory gromnies. -- Vincent Price 3/31/2000
If you cant Drain or Harm your enemies try this out. When you get to the end of the dungeon, where the 2 irons guard the book, run up to the door after kiling the lich, then slide over to the left of it, 99% of the time one of the irons will come to the door while the other gets stuck on the wall, now you can chop his grimy arse to bits while he throws spell after spell into the dorr (not one came thru after more than 10 kills (for test purposes). Then if u have the key, go on in and take down the other at your leisure. One more thing, the Ivory Groms spit fire NOT ice, and there is one bridge that you shouldnt dilly on as it has a CHILL AIR patch on it and will give you the sniffles. -- Usagi Rai 5/6/2000 Stop #16 in the Undead Mechanic quest added in the October 2003 patch. Yes, you still need to make the specialized carrot soup to give to the guy at the Bandit castle. -- Geomancer 11/16/2003Cave was upgraded with wasteland rats and ebon gromnies. Fast respawn rate in upper level. See ACMaps for dungeon details. Good experience for the midlevel player who can take on the rats and gromnies with minimal damage. No level restriction, cannot summon, but can recall.

Salvage quality runs from 3 - 7 on average. Can make decent money from looting bodies. Made +100k per visit. Playing Lv56 tank axer on WE, made Lv57 in about 3 hours of play time.

Lifestone tie at Bandit Castle. Short run from there. Again, see www.acmaps.com for complete details of this dungeon

-- Loki Ironhand 5/28/2004

name: Lifestone
description: Lifestone next to an empty tower. -- Wadi

name: Lich Tower
description:
Tower with Liches and a Lich Lord. -- IgthornThis is where the famous chest resides that casts camping ineptitude on you.
Spell lasts 5 minutes, effects are yet unknown
)
If you always wanted to know how Allen Grey looks, this is your chance. -- Astral Dominae of Thistledown 8/30/2004

name: Empty Tent
description: Empty tent with a lifestone nearby. -- Igthorn

name: Lifestone
description: Near empty tent. -- Igthorn

name: Midsong Festival Stone
description:
Frosty the Giant Snowman is here at the moment... -- Polecat
1/8/00
update: difficult to approach as it sits on top of a long unclimable escarpment. Come in from the west, I think. -- Doc Feelgood 1/30/00
The giant Snowman (lvl 126) is still there and sells Snowballs (Poofy and Regular). Stone is surrounded by Stony/Sandy Arms (or like level monsters). -- Dunc 3/9/2000
Alas, I checked today and the giant Snowman had gone. The best way to get here, I think, is to go the North Desert Edge portal near Zaik then head NE. -- Zloth 5/6/2000
Hmm, its no longer on a cliff edge, and no longer difficult to approach from any direction. -- Doc Feelgood 11/25/2000

name: Recovered Temple
description:
Undead. Zombies and Liches as far as I went. Surface portal near the entrance. -- Xian Liu
We made it down to what I assume was the bottom. There was one Lich Lord that I saw, but he had several Liches with him. Bring your fire arrows. -- Brenna 1/3/00
Entrance is guarded by a pack of fast-genning skeletons and skeleton warriors, foyer is safe, spawn rate is slow. Dungeon layout is winding but linear, so it will be comforting for those who get lost easily. Several good wall working spots. -- Doc Feelgood 10/6/2000
Ummm... I used to hunt this dungeon a lot, and still take vassals there to help them level. Excellent for lvl 10+ to level if theyre not alone. No skeletons, only Zombies, Undead, Lichs, and 1 Lich Lord. Bring a Fire Weapon. -- Dezran Rogue 7/18/2001

name: Golem Bunkers
description:
A bunch of Granite Golems. Some in bunkers. Beware of going into the bunkers, as the golems surrounding the area will ambush you and trap you inside. Also a portal to Beachside nearby and a merchant in one of the bunkers. -- Ex-po
This location has been upgraded. Now has Direland Rats, Gold Golems, Pyreal Golems, along with the granite Golems -- Zen Tek Ken 6/27/2003

name: Tumerok Fort
description:
Tumeroks (workers to high priests) and a few liches. You get a High Priests Key from the Tumerok High Priest (where you use it is beyond me). -- Igthorn
Looks like about 40 blips in the area, some on the ground, some on the walls -- Doc Feelgood 5/19/2000
Doors to this fort is locked at 355.. I cant see a Cave portal either inside the fort as mentioned regarding the Cave.. -- TriGaidin 5/21/2000
Use the high priests key in the Tumerok Fortress North of Teth (if you cant pick the lock, or jump the wall.) Key has three uses, the High Priest respawns every 20 mins, and is in the far tower, up the stairs, next to the oh-so-worthless chests. -- Goldhart 6/5/2000
Front door is opened with the Heavy Tumerok Key obtained in the Cave at 47.8S, 83.7W. -- Nodoka 3/3/2001

name: South Dires House
description:
Little house near the lifestone and merchant. Good log out point. Be careful, though, as nasties do spawn around it... -- Polecat
Peddler buys armor, weapons, parchment, clothing, food, keys. Does not buy jewelry or sell trade notes. -- Doc Feelgood 2/20/2000

name: Household Merchant
description: In the house, near the lifestone in the South Dires. -- Polecat

name: Dires Great Lighthouse
description: Just like Tou Tous lighthouse. -- Curunir

name: Sclavus Keep Portal
description:
I didnt go in. This is what the map dot indicates. -- Curunir
Good dungeon layout. Scalvus are cool looking creatures, but weak for this lvl 34 unarmed - they should be buffed up a lot. A lot of switch pulling in this one. A portal to GW I think is immediately inside. A group of 15-25 level folks should be able to handle this place. Take S.Dires portal near Mayoi to S. Dires, and you are real close - I think. -- Elder 1/6/00
Portal to Riverbend 2.3S, 63.3E -- Darksilver 1/8/00
Went in with lvl 25 Warrior, and 28 Archer. Very cool dungeon, fun, but dangerous. Be aware .... after you pull the levers that will open a door, on the upper platform, there will be a series of floor traps that will open and close doors. If you let this main door close b4 you finish this section of the dungeon, you will be trapped. We looked for 3 hours, in about a 6 room area for a lever, button or something to let us out. Wound up commiting suicide and re-entering the dungeon. Maybe we missed something, but would be smart to have 1 member stand outside the door, to run back and reopen it if it closes. We didnt go any farther, as we ran out of time, but i think there is much more to the place. Take 3 people just incase. 1 last thing, when you incounter the little ZEFIRs go for the little Red Bastard 1st. He will hit you rapidly with lvl 3 and 4 spells. A warrior can hack them appart in 2-3 swings, but do it quickly. Good luck. -- Vylarn -Harvest 3/6/2000
This is a medium-size pull levers dungeon, with many traps on the upper level. The outside is infested, the foyer is clear. But, the portal to the surface is at the bottom, not near the entrance. Upper level is a mix of scalvi and zefirs, bottom pure scalvi. Gen rate is modest in most areas, fast in a few. -- Doc Feelgood 6/26/2000

name: Peddler
description:
Apparently near Thesali dungeon although I did not see it nearby. Not much on him but I died near this guy and was disappointed not to find him in the atlas when I had to recover my corpse 8-( -- Ling Joyen
Full service peddler, no gems, jewels or magic items. -- Doc Feelgood 2/13/00

name: Merchant
description: Merchant near a tent and lifestone. -- Igthorn

name: Lifestone
description: Lifestone near merchant tent. -- Igthorn

name: Folthid Area
description: Near Folthid Cave -- Paris Dragon

name: Ruined Cave Outpost Portal
description: Quest Dungeon - Levels 1 - 6 -- WeeWillieWinkie Now 1-20. Couldnt enter. -- Halcyon 9/12/2003

name: Golem Temple
description: A tiny temple with 3 Mud Goelms (lvl ~ 10) and 1 Mossward Feeder. Theyre guarding some nice diamonds and magical stuff. Its a very nice place for Life Mages because they can cast harm other through the bottom. First Entered by Cs Jamie and Cs Cindy (Members of Clan Shorena) -- Clan Shorena

name: Shoushi Trophy Collector
description: Collects rat, wasp, dillo, drudge, mosswart, and banderling trophies. Doesnt take hides. -- Polecat

name: Master Shoyanen Kenchu the Archmage
description:
Formerly listed as Tired Mages Shop (a.k.a. Mayoi Lighthouse / Tower)
Shoyanen Kenchu is just southeast of Mayoi and is the easiest Master Mage to reach by foot. She lives in a classic Sho archmage tower that is often mistaken for a lighthouse of some type due to its shoreline location. Low level characters should be wary of nearby spawns that sometimes run inside the tower or attack through the walls.
Shoyanen buys mage items at 80% and sells mage and alchemy supplies at 110%. She has the ultimate selection of mage and alchemist items
all spell components and scarabs, all Peas, Splitting Tool, Concentrated Aqua Incanta, Neutral Balms, and Eye Dropper. Curiously there is no mortar and pestle or alembic. She also sells Portal gems to all of the starter towns and a portal gem back to her shop. At 20k value, Shoyanens Portal Gems make great lightweight death items and are an affordable time saver for travel. Another must have death item, Suikan Master Robes, are also sold here.
--Polecat -- Obsidian -- Xeno Fen -- Garfield Bond -- Wolf -- Meepster -- Wodrith the Man -- NSciira deGris -- Zimbalt -- Taarna Blood SC


No longer there, was killed by a granite golem. -- Fayt -FF 7/27/2005

name: SouthEast mountains
description: On way south west of lin to mountains -- Netmage

name: Statue
description: Just a statue -- Rool

name: Lifestone
description: Right next to a portal to Cragstone. -- Lo Pang-Jo

name: North Mountains to Desert Ridge Border
Banderling Castle Lifestone
description: Conveniently located right next to a banderling fort. -- Lo Pang-Jo

name: Zefir Tower
description:
Three Jibrit Zefirs and a chest. -- Lo Pang-Jo
This tower has been updated so now it has a Sturdy Steel Chest at top guared by 7 Enku Zefirs. -- Zen Tek Ken 8/24/2003

name: South Direlands Tower QalabarPortal and Lifestone
description:
A very convenient Tower located on the hill above the Tumerok Chamber in the South Dires, not far from where the Mayoi portal drops you off. To get there, one must go all the way around the base of the mountain till you find a way up, then run all the way back. Why convenient? Because there is a Lifestone and Portal to Qalabar at the same spot. Moreover, a good high-level Dire spawn point is nearby (Golems, Tumeroks, Vorous Shreths, Gold Phyntos Wasps, etc.), within range of the Tower. -- Zuben Pasha
They moved the spawn point away from the Lifestone and Tower in the latest patch. Still good hunting nearby. -- Zuben Pasha 1/22/00
This complex is quite hard to reach from below. This mountain has two levels of prehistoric beach around it. The lower beach is easily accessible from the valley and has the Tumerok Chamber, Lightless Catabombs and peddler on it. The upper beach has this tower-portal-lifestone complex. One way to the upper beach is Escalator Slope around the far side of the mountain: 86.6 S, 37.8W for lower beach and 86.4S, 37.6 for upper beach. Circle the south side beach and its mostly Sandstone Golems. -- Doc Feelgood 2/20/2000

name: Lifestone by Farmer's House
description: Between Qalabar and Kara.

name: Row of Watchers
description: a row of 11 monoliths behind a tablet stone. Not much of a view, cant really see a purpose for it, but its there. -- Hiemdal Olafsun

name: Zombie Castle
description:
Castle full of Zombies, had some Auroch Bulls outside. -- Gimme
Not really a castle... Just some walls and two towers. One of the towers had 8-10 Zombies inside jumping down like crazy. DOnt rush in the lagg might get you. Entrance is behind a plant at tower base. Outside just some male/female Tuskers. Run to this place was easy and it could be a great place for low level mages/archers to powerlevel since most of the monsters spawn close to walls. -- Ni Hao 10/16/2001

name: Lightless Catacombs
description:
In teh South Dires. Near exit of Mayoi portal. 2 Lifestones nearby. One too hard to reach to be worth it. Portal to Zakhail nearby. never entered dungeon. -- Hanz Shadowspwn
Lichs, Undeads, Zombies, Lich Lords, Shadows and a Revenant. At the Bottom from the Dungeon 4 x Lich Lords, 1 x Granite Golem, 3 x Shadows and 1 x Shadow Leutnant. You find here a Dark Note. -- ToBo 1/9/00
I found a royal seal of dericost on my trip into the pit 2/1/00
This is where half of the Staff of the Nomads now lies. Most of the dungeon is Panumbris shadows... lots and lots of them. The staff is in an unlocked chest in the last room, guarded by a whole bunch of shadows (panumbris, umbris, paroxysm, and a tenebrous) and a couple of harrower grievvers. Easily soloable if youre high enough level to resist panumbris spells. -- Confucius of FF 4/10/2003

name: Mosswart Lair
description:
MW of Shoushi Grotto. 3 Gnawer Shreths out front, 5 Mosswart Creepers, 1 Shamman. In small cave in ground. -- Hanz Shadowspwn
There are no mosswarts here anymore since retail. Only drudges. Not worth to go to now unless your a newbie -- Metzie 1/22/00
There is no dungeon in the area just a building near by with drudges -- Alk 4/8/2000

name: Lich Archmage Tower
description:
A tower with 4-5 Lichs and a Lich Archmage -- Zardoz
There are now 8-10 liches guarding this spot. Much harder than before the recent patch. -- Cerebus 3/5/2000
The Lich archmage is a npc and sells all comps, scrabas from pyreal to iron, and mana stones from greater (1000) to the lesser ones, careful, hes been known to get angry and attack people who dont buy anything (NOT BS.) -- Lachdanun 8/21/2000
I bought a BUNCH of magic comps and mana stones and he STILL attacked me. -- Juicyfruit 9/2/2000
I was smited mightly by this guy. Pretty bad :). -- rmr11 12/28/2000
I found that the lich mage attacks you if you do somehting like portal away without closeing the shop window. MY vassel Rad did this while I was still shoping and I got punched in the face. As of the June update this guy now buys at 60% and sells at 110% just like the Racial Arch Mages. So dont bother unless you just happen to be in the area go to Mayoi. -- Dark Man - Sol 6/20/2001

name: Heart of the Obsidian Plains crater
description:
This is the center of the crater in the center of the obsidian plains. The coordinate is approximate, but within 1-2 degrees. The reason it is not exact will be apparent once you read this. This place is one of the nastiest in all of Dereth. It is black, save for a forest of tall mushrooms (3x human height), and blue gemstones... Densely spawned throughout the area are virindi - puppets, servants, and masters... along with tusker guards and obsidian golems. In the very center of this crater is a large pink fountain that is surrounded by tusker guards (no less than 20, perhaps as many as 30). I ran by very quickly so i didnt see the nature of the fountain. I will explore it again and add more later, or hope that someone else has discovered its secret and will add to my tale. -- Ryukyu
This place is about 5 - 10 mins away from the HOLL. You know you getting close when the mountains all turn black. Im only a level 30 fighter. I ran up to the fountain and ran out even quicker. Scariest place Ive seen so far. If you want a massive challenge go for it. -- Toekiller 1/13/00
Seeing your post I went there out of sheer curiosity. No joking about 100 virindi, 10-20 wisps, 5-10 Obsidian Golems, and 20-30 tuskers all concentrated in a about a 1 kilometer radius. I scanned through for inanimate objects, found nothing. I ran through the fountain and also nothing. However I never hit fountain dead on virindi were controlling my movements more than my keyboard I was bouncing off em. -- fyre 1/18/00
The fountain restores health, much like a mana pool in the meeting halls. -- The Mad Jester 12/15/2000
I finally got here and felt a little dissappointment. Not nearly as hard as the above description lead me to believe. I found only typical Obsidian Plains spawns. But it is still a must see area. -- Khaos 2/27/2001
It now drains mana and health. Not nearly as packed as it used to be. You stagger as 3 points of mana are drained by the mysterious crystal.. The crawling energies drain 5 points of your health. -- Krell (LC) 7/2/2001

name: Valley Lake Lifestone
description:
lifestone near the Interest Point to the far southeast of Qalabar near the beach. Its nestled in a valley at the beginning of a small lake among a chain of valley lakes. -- Jang Bo
ok, so its the lifestone to the NE of Kara and its a river, not a lake. -- Jang Bo 1/13/00
Judging by the looks of the place I would say this river is in fact a fjord. -- Vengeance 9/20/2000

name: Direlands Lifestone
description: Lifestone Very close the the Diaster Maze and other POIs -- Torren Leah

name: Wai Jhou
