description: Wai Jhou main building is here. Provisioner, Mage, Bowyer, Barkeep, Agent of the Arcanum inside. The upstairs makes a good perch, but dont get too comfortable there. Monsters spawn nearby and frequently come inside. This is right on the border between Direlands spawns and Obsidian Plains spawns, so you get a good variety. Good hunting grounds nearby.-- Senshin MT-- Polecat -- Daffyd -- Taarna Blood SC

name: Golem Tower
description: You can get easy to this tower near Mayoi. Just walk of the right-side of Mayoi-beach, till it makes a corner to the right. By that corner, walk up the hill, and then you will see this tower. There could be some golems and shallows round it and maybe even some zefirs. In the tower is a granite golem (lvl 32). Its REALLY though. It hit me for 67 health points once, it has very strong magic, so look out.. Greetings, Xaja -- Xaja

name: Khayyaban to Lin
description: Exits at: 53.9S, 74.3E -- Balder of Staal

name: Carved Caves to Cragstone
description: At the top of a hill that is surround by history markers.  Also a lifestone here.

name: north of Arwic
description:
This location is north of Arwic and north of the small cabin that is between the Arwic portal and the mite dungeon. There isnt much here except medium to high lvl monsters ( 8-22 that I have seen) guite a few limestone golems and of course banderlings...especially raiders. Be careful you could get caught trying to run and not able to climb the side of a mountian Of course I am the overly cautious type. At the moment I am a lvl 13 mage. I have killed some limestones by myself as well as some banderlings and some matakers but it has been hit and run tactics so be careful out there if your lvl is in the teens unless you have others with you. -- stargem
Couldnt find the cabin, but there are lots of Golems including Sandies. Also there are some High lvl Drudges here. -- Ching The Quick 10/29/2000
Banderling Strikers and Berserkers along with Drudge Ravenors are spawning in this area. Copper Golems and Great Matties are also very frequent. Fun place, good loot, quiet and some beautiful scenery. -- Jake the Dog 6/21/2001

name: Obsidian Enchanter
description:
Obsidian Enchanter... My speciality is creating magic orbs and potions from certian pieces of crafter obsidian... -- Dunc
If u give him an obsidian sphere hell give u an orb of black fire. No idea about the potion though my guess is that u have to have a black rock or stone. -- Critical Hit 5/7/2000
If you give him an obsidian jewel (which is made from a black stone) hell give you the potion. Potion heals 100 health, and is probably the best use for the black stone. -- Mr. al-Habib 8/4/2000

name: Weaponsmith
description: Weaponsmith with a good selecion of weapons. -- Dunc

name: Lifestone
description: -- Kendall

name: Northern Lifestone
description:
Lifestone with a tent and some fire holderthingies -- Arcilite
Still nothing else there as of March update. -- Doc Feelgood 3/7/2000
As far as I know, this is the closest Lifestone to Celdiseths Hut. Celdiseth is a master Archmage, with 45k Master Robes and Portal Gems, Peas, and more. Best prices anywhere. -- Satyricon / WE 7/29/2001

name: N-S Pass
description: This is a way to pass through these mountains in a north south direction. The ridge to the west is unclimable for miles to the south. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Town of Undead
description:
deserted town, has liches and zombies. Magic ripped me apart couldnt kill the 2 liches solo -- Boccobii
two empty Sho buildings here with bones on the ground..also 2 liches, a undead, and a skeleton warrior out in the open guarding the area. No treasures that i could see -- GeorgeKG 12/29/2000
This place is about as remote as anything in Dereth. No portals, so you must run in. The run is Loooong and dangerous. And frankly, you can fight the creatures in this town at a dozen different locations easier to reach than this. Yjr lifestone at the river valley appears to be nearby on the map, but it is actually quiet far since you have only one route through the mountains. In my opinion there is no reason to come here. -- JANN 3/29/2001
1 Undead, 1 Skeleton Warrior, 2 Liches. Town was placed here to make us wonder why the town was placed here. -- Seishin 10/30/2001

name: Lich Archmage
description:
This is THE best mage shop. Great mana stones, pyreal scarabs and all components at cost. Of course you do need to kill the 4 liches outside the tower to get in. -- Abdul al-Azred
This tower was difficult to get to since there are no fast portals to the place. It is surrounded by steep mountains. I was by myself when I got there and wasted all my mana killing just 2 of the five or more liches that guard the outside of this place. I sure wanted to by some Gold and Pyreal Scarabs at cost like many have said that you can do here but decided to just Portal Recall out of there and come back some other day with friends. -- ~~Fizzler 3/4/2000
It is possible to ignore the surrounding Lichs, run up the stairs, do your business with the archmage and portal-recall out with your life intact. -- Mote Dunraven 3/29/2000
I found that if I just rested after dealing with the Archmage, the liches eventually stopped attacking me, so I would rebuild health, stamina, and mana. I got trapped trying to run down the stairs, though, and died. -- Rolf the Healer 6/26/2000
Me and my patron killed all the liches, then looked at the archmages supply, didnt buy anything and tried to leave, and he attacked me. and hes a npc (NO BS.) -- Lachdanun 8/21/2000
I found that the lich mage attacks you if you do somehting like portal away without closeing the shop window. My vassel Rad did this while I was still shoping and I got punched in the face. As of the June update this guy now buys at 60% and sells at 110% just like the Racial Arch Mages. So dont bother unless you just happen to be in the area go to Mayoi. -- Dark Man - Sol 6/20/2001

name: The White Rabbit (Pookie)
description:
A cute little white bunny rabbit in a bunker, Pookie, per the AC Devs. It is Level 666 and breathes lightning.. run away .. run away. DO NOT ID IT, or it will attack you. Area is populated with high level monsters. At certain times of the year, there may be two level 230 white rabbit babies spawning here too. The white rabbit does piercing and lightning melee damage and has a 1 hit magic life drain move called Bunny Smite that is almost always fatal. It is very fast, and quite deadly. Debuffing it will cause it to counter buff. Overwhelming it with rending weapons can work well, although that takes a larger group. There are various ideas about the right strategy to use with this creature. When it is defeated, it Smites the one who did the most damage, usually fatal. It drops an Orb of the Bunny Booty, no drop, no give. It also has a givable carcass. You can use 2 of these to create white rabbit slippers. Hand one in to William Witty in Lytelthorpe, and then combine what he gives you with your other white rabbit carcass. Respawn time is about 15 minutes. -- Rick O Shay -- Arkayas -- Polecat -- Nightwolf -- Some Guy -- Garfield Bond -- Luci X -- Tak -- BURNED -- Life and Death -- Taarna Blood SC
Ahhh and more info, it will kill you in maximum 2 hits, it uses a hollow lightning attack for melee and Bunny Smite spell (drains 1-4000 health, I saw one person only get 200 health drained). The way to kill it: Make a wall of melees to just surround the entrance, make archers behind them to shoot it, and behind that mages with 400 buffed creature/life skills. Have them Yield it, then vuln 7 then imp 7 IT WILL SMITE THEM. Have at least 3 mages because the bunny may smite 2. The bunny will try to get to the mages who vulned/impd him so make sure you kill it quick before it kills the person who vulned it. After that it will kill melees and youll have a corpse for it to eat. So, yield, vuln, imp while the melees block it from getting to the mages/archers. Then archers unload on it fire damage. Boom hes dead, not too hard just have some high level melees/archers/mages and use this method. Ahh yes, and dont ID the sucker or he will attack you, up till then hes peaceful, and the rock isnt safe, he will smite you AND jump on it . -- Stay puff of MT 7/13/2001

name: Dires Fort
description: This is the POI marked on the map. A nice little fort with some Tumeroks (Fighters, Warriors, Officers, Priests and Scouts) and a few drudges and banderlings. Pretty dull XP spot. Door needs to be picked, could not locate a key. Jain the Huntress.

name: Sandy Armoreadillo Lair
description:
A below ground lair with Sandy Armoreadillos inside as well as above ground surrounding it. Too many (6+) for me to get a chance to look around carefully. -- J
This is a great place to come if you are a level 20-ish archer looking for XP. Chest inside spawns magic items, mostly jewelry. -- Jann 9/29/2000
There is also couple clickable A small pile of rocks around the cave.

name: Farm
description: Farm and Farmer. Farmer sells food and cooking supplies. The supplies are somewhat unusual, Batches of Rennet, Pots of Honey, Jars of Brine, and the more usual Rice, Beef, Chickens, Flour and fish. Area is surrounded by a large number of Reedsharks. If youre a Life Mage, the farm provides a number of places to trap. Then you can Drain them at will. But be careful, ALL the local pods respond to the death screams. -- Dunc

name: Serenghetti Plain
description: Follow the road from Zaikhal to Al-Jalima. Over the rise just beyond the Crypt of Ashen Tears Portal begins the Serenghetti Plain. Its a rich assortment of shreth, skeleton, gromnie, monogua. Great harvesting for a group of mid-levels. Base out of Zaikhal, Crypt of Ashen Tears or the merchant tent in the valley below the road. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Fortress
description:
Very nice design, in the middle of nowhere. All types of mummies, skeleton warriors and captins near by. Really cool place. -- Charlemagne
This is the Empyrean power plant type structure. Populated with many lesser and greater mu-miyahs, and a couple horrible mu-miyahs. Chest which spawns low value gems is behind a fake wall in the underground area. Worth a look if youve never seen the Empyrean Power Plant construction, but probably not worth going back to. -- Sao Yin 4/21/2000

name: Gloaming Festival Stone
description: Empyrean Festival Stone south of Fort Tethana. This Stone is very close to a small peak that has a floating power generator and lifestone on top of it. -- Chiun Zen

name: House of the Dead
description:
Small stone structure, with Undead within. I walked up to the doorway, and they took no action. I feared to enter the building, lest they take offense. There was something below, what it was I could not see. I anticipated a dungeon, but there was no portal to be seen. -- Ibn Schachabo
undead and one lich, one chest with lousy loot -- Charlemagne 1/31/00
Make that two liches. 8-10 undead or so. After all that, the chest only had two crude healing kits, definitely not worth trekking all the way out here for. -- Magwitch 4/5/2000

name: Cactus Stand
description:
A small grove of Cacti surrounds the skeleton of a lost explorer. However, some of his clothing and rations are still of value. -- Ibn Schachabo
There is now a Runed Chest near corpse.

name: Lugian Quary
description:
A Lugian spawning ground around an area with odd rocky pillers (looks like a quary). Lithos & lesser Lugians spawn here. A good place to work off viate in peace. South of Baishi. -- Sitting Duck
quite a few lower level lugians and some mattys nearby.might be a good place for sevral mid-level characters if you dont mind the run. -- Sega Slayer 12/4/2000

name: Direlands to Heartland
description: Located in a small building with a fountain out front. exits to -- Kor Uption

name: Small Black Hill to Small Hill Base
description: Exits at 62.0S, 50.0W -- Polecat Takes you from the top of the hill to the base.

name: Small Black Hill Tower
description: A tower on top of an obsidian hill. -- Polecat

name: Jewel Collector
description: This person takes gemstones from other collectors and Virindi Jewels, turning them into Virindi Gems (V+ spell gems) -- Balder of Staal

name: Empty Towers
description: 4 totally empty towers over looking a canyon. -- Charlemagne

name: Archmage in Igloo
description:
An Archmage in an igloo. Limited components offering. -- Doc Feelgood
Now sells scarabs through silver and all tapers. Taper cost is slightly less (by 2p each) than Stonehold itself. -- Birch 1/21/2001
Pricing is as follows: Buys at 90%, sells at 150%. Tapers for 38 p, no peas. Sells tiny mana charges for 525 pyreals, unlimited aqua incanta and neutral balms. -- Immacolata 5/3/2001

name: Igloo Lifestone
description:
A lifestone next to the Archmage in the Igloo. Archmage has a very limited selection of spell components. -- Doc Feelgood
No longer true, he renegotiated with his supplier. -- Immacolata 5/3/2001

name: Mountain Rat Tower
description:
A tower on the Bluff north of Stonehold. Filled with Mountain Rats and little else. Searched here for a clue to the Tremblant expidition during sudden season, found nothing. -- Doc Feelgood
You were very close. A little further up the hill (More North)is a large stand of big thick pines. The Standing stone is a little ways in. Try using the find nearby items keys once you enter. -- Sitting Duck 2/7/00

name: Frostfell Festival Stone
description: Festival Stone northwest of Stonehold, on the north running route from Carved Caves back to Stonehold. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Sho Tower
description:
An empty Sho tower on top of sizable hill surrounded by the blue lifestone crystal arrangements (but no actual lifestone), NE of Kara. -- J
Seems to be no way for getting up there I saw no crystals around in the area. -- neo 2/18/00
If you approach from the SE and come across the ridge you can get up there. Bunches of baby lifestones all over the place outside.. just one of those kinda cool places to check out if your into that kinda thing. -- Farookh 2/26/2000

name: N. Direlands 1/2 Fort
description: Three towers and two walls astride the ridge route into the North Direlands. A thick collection of monsters: Tumerok warrior/priests, Copper Golems, Drudge stalker/lurkers, Banderlings. Ground floors of the towers spawn, upper levels dont seem to. Good Hunting, if youre up to it. -- Doc Feelgood

name: South Mayoi Lifestone
description: Just south of town -- Polecat

name: Standing Stones (Bandit Castle)
description: This is where you find a part (1/3) of the transcription you need to get into Frore Dungeon. You need a Lich Seal to open this Standing Stone. You can find a Lich Seal off Lich Lords and Revs. -- Noah

name: Standing Stones (Neydisa)
description: This is where you find a part (2/3) of the transcription you need to get into Frore Dungeon. -- Noah

name: Standing Stones (Stonehold)
description: This is where you find a part (3/3) of the transcription you need to get into Dungeon Frore. Once you get all three parts of the transcription, put them together, and give them to the translator in Zaihkal. -- Noah

name: Dungeon/Fort
description:
Dungeon in a partial fort on the path between Fort Tet and the North Direlands entrance. This was a run-by so details are sketchy. Outside is rich, there are Skeleton Lords, Tumerocs, Shadows and Iron Golems. No details on portal or on inside. -- Doc Feelgood
The name of this place is Tumerok Base -- Shoto Fle-Alch 2/10/00
This dungeon is full of tumeroks. Mostly warriors, gladiators, and priests. 1 high tumerk and 1 high priest at the end. This dungeon is a long windy one way type of deal. You have to lockpick 5 or 6 doors. At the very end of the dungeon are 2 chests which spawn crappy loot. Dont come to this dungeon tumeroks are not worth it nor is the loot. -- Moe 2/10/00

name: Ridge Route to Direlands
description: The ridge route is an easy to navigate path from the North Direlands entrance to halfway to the Fort Tet area. Its a NE -- SW running ridge that starts at roughly . To continue to Fort Tet, turn west southwest acoss a valley and pick up another mid-height plateau. This will bring you into Fort Tet via the Ancient Lighthouse portal area. This last section of run is very thickly populated. Watch out. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Start of Ridge Route
description: Northern start of the Ridge Route into the Direlands. Ridge starts with a zig zag, then proceeds SW into the Direlands roughly halfway to Fort Tet. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Empty Igloo
description:
Empty igloo in forest on the run between Lady Nylissas Castle and Stonehold. This northerly run (west first, then south) seems a bit quieter than the southerly run (south first, then west). -- Doc Feelgood
Igloo with a lone Snowman, a survivor from the Sudden Season. One of the friendly level 2 Snowmen sitting in the back of the igloo that has the nice lighting and frost effects similar to the Small Ice Caves. -- Chiun Zen 3/7/2000

name: East edge of Lost Lakes region
description: This is the eastern edge of the Lost Lakes region, a high plateau pocked with steep-walled craters, many containing lakes. The western edge is Stonehold village -- . Easier travel is on the high ground in this region. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Renegade Tower
description: A tower next to an Empyrean ruin. It has Tumerok War Mongers inside along with a Raider Juggernaut at the top. -- Dr Nick -- Zen Tek Ken 6/24/2003

name: Advocate Tower
description:
This Advocate tower looks like it has fallen from the sky. Because doorway hard to get into. There is a rock at front to assist jumping in, but it is too close, you must jump in from beyond it. -- Doc Feelgood 4/30/2000
There are 4 Banderlings here 2 Savages and 2 Aggressors -- Zen Tek Ken 6/24/2003

name: Walled Portal
description:
This is where the Drunken Madmans Gateway drops you off. An Arena like fort with two portals and stairs along the outside. Some creatures along the outside of the wall. -- -Grasp SC
Feel exceptionally brave? From the walled portal take the outside accursed halls poratal. Climb the wall here and jump off and be prepared for some really good hunting. Run to original fort (21.5, 74.8w). The general radius of the first tower can get real hairy, especially the swarms of gold wasps. If you can, try to lure out the gold wasps one by one so that you dont have 3 or more chasing you while you run and most likely run into more tail. But once you get to the other fort (yeah I know a long run W) it will all be worth. Really good hunting here. Ravenors, Stalkers, numerous Copper Golems and the occasional fragments. I did this run at lvl 25, make sure you got high arse run and high arse life. ---Shiroi Okami no Kage, of Thistledown--- -- Hairy Kamikaze 5/2/2000
This is a respectable wall working spot for mages. And, if your jump is good, a respectable archery and melee spot as well because there are stairs on the outside that lead up to the wall top. But watch out. Monsters can use these stairs as redily as heros, and from the top they will jump inside. -- Doc Feelgood 3/5/2001

name: Ridge Tower to Baishi
description: Drops off at 53.0S, 61.1E. This is a way back from the Accursed hall. It lies within an arena like small fort. -- Grasp SC

name: Lifestone
description: Near tialos. -- Charlemange

name: Path through cliffs
description: A path through the cliffs between 2-door Fort and Tumerok Redoubt. Lower end of path is . -- Doc Feelgood

name: The Sawfooth
description: This is an unclimable escarpment consisting of a series of box canyons -- looks like a sawblade when viewed from above. Runs from N-S Pass at 5.2N, 4E on the NE to Chosen Way at on the SW. Separates mountains to NW from forest to the SE. Go north, go south, or bring your 500+ jump skill. Otherwise youre not getting through. -- Doc Feelgood

name: The Chosen Way
description: This is a way around the south edge of The Sawtooth. Its convoluted, and runs through a series of passes, but it gets you from the forest up or the plateau down. From the forest start up the pass at . -- Doc Feelgood

name: Giant Fijord Ford
description:
It doesnt show on the map, but theres long fijord cutting in from the west sea here. This is one place to cross it, there may be many others. This is on the route from Stonehold to Plateau. -- Doc Feelgood
Not a Fijord...its Lake Lithanen and the river that flows west to the ocean according to the original Asherons Call map. -- Sparky 2/14/00

name: Forsythia Tower
description: An empty tower near Plateau with forsythias planted in front of it. Nothing else of note. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Tumerok Fortress Portal (Overlord Quest)
description:
Home of the Tumerok Overlord and his uber chest. High lockpick is almost essential here. This dungeon portal is in the tower of the huge, heavily populated Tumerok Fortress. Level 20+, tieable, but not summonable. You can sneak around the back and tie to the portal without having to go in the fort. You can then portal recall inside. If you wish to save your tie, you can pick the entry door on the South side, the resistance is 650. There is also a key for this door, and keys for all the other doors in the dungeon. See the writeup at Maggie the Jackcats site for more details. After running around the dungeon a bit, you come to an octagonal room with blue gemstones. In the south wall near 2 blue gemstone pillars there is a secret passage to the final diff 700 locked door to the Overlords chamber. The Overlord is guarded by Virindi Preceptors and a few Tumeroks. He has a lightning Overlords quest sword that is no drop, and a no drop key to his chest. -- Doc Feelgood -- Anon -- Zimbalt/Hirachi -- Taarna Blood SC
He drops a key (1 week timer) for his chest which has 20-60 sing-quality items in it (good chance at something decent). Ive done this quest many times throughout the years, it does not require lockpick. There is a long quest for the keys, but they are not required either. The route is much longer without lockpick, but its doable. -- Driden of Frostfell 11/5/2003
Come and see the happy Tumerok Champions, as they jump on your head from above. Come see the Augmented Tumeroks, and Ascendants, who are always delighted to show off their magic. Come and have your toes nibbled by half a dozen Wasteland Rats. Come and unlock those locked doors and the Overlords Chest. Come and visit the imprisoned monsters and a bizarre floor full of mushrooms. Surrounded by about a dozen ever-friendly Virindi Preceptors is a Tumerok Overlord, who will be happy to slap you about a bit after youve been turned into a quivering wreck of weakness, frailty and slowness by his hooded companions.-- Goldhart

name: Huge Tumerok Fort
description:
Its big, Jim. Eight towers and over 30 tumeroks and drudges inside, about equal numbers guarding the walls on the outside. At least one High Tumerok. Approach from the east ridge line, west ridge side is full of shadows and gromnies. Front Door is on the south, and very hard to pick. If youve got an army looking for something to do, bring it here. -- Doc Feelgood
Inside it is easy to get overpowered by the Tumerok Officers, Gladiators, and High Tumeroks. There are also three Gold Wasps that do their best to get in your way. Checkout the tower with the dungon portal, which has some spooky lights. 4/7/2000

name: Mite Bunker
description:
One of those bunker-looking things. Must have been 50 mites inside of all types. -- Helios
Nothing selectable here besides the mites.. :O -- Mengar -LC 10/12/2000

name: Skeleton Ambush
description:
Looks like the entrance to Thasali Dungeon (a short way north), but its not. Its an entrance with no portal, but full of eight or so skeletons which spawn only after you come in. Look for a portal on your radar, if theres no portal, its this ambush place. -- Doc Feelgood
I walked in and the whole floor stood up.. Two skels, two skel warriors, and a skel captian. Chest seems to have less than the Captain. -- Tesslah 4/29/2000

name: Lifestone and Merchant
description: Lifestone and merchant. Servicing the Drudge and Skeleton towers. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Planar Mage (a.k.a. Mage looking for Black Rock)
description:
72nd level arch mage in a tent in the hills above Al-Jalima. Hes looking for a black rock that comes from the Burial Temple Dungeon -- which is in the valley on the opposite side of Al-Jalima. The Burial Temple is level restricted to 5-10th levels, and the likely holder of said rock is a Skeleton Lord. This is a crowd quest. -- Doc Feelgood
Skeleton Lord in the Burial Temple Dungeon does indeed hold the Black Gem. When you give the Black Gem to the Mage, he opens a portal to the Mage Academy (level 8+) -- Kinjou Dragoon 1/20/2001

name: Arch Mage Tower
description: Tower with Archmage, Lifestone and portal to Heartland, a farm just west of Fort Witshire. Tower is patrolled by some high level skellies and armodillos. -- Igor

name: Tumerok Fort
description: Entrance is to the South. It is full (Read: ton, Lots, Many,) Tumeroks including Prest, Scouts, Fighters, and Yes, Gladerors. -- Willow

name: Mushroom Valley
description: Follow the valley next to Fort Tethiana south and you get here. The valley starts to grow giant mushrooms here, and the golems change from Granite to Iron. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Liche Ambush
description: An innocent looking farm house in a glen, surrounded by Granite Golems and a Gold Phantos Wasp. They dont show up on radar until you get next to the door, but there are two Liches inside, also a chest. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Seacoast Tower
description: A lonely seacoast tower with a large braisure in at the top. Also two liches inside and a gromnie waiting at the base. No chests, no portals or other objects inside. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Tumerok Post
description:
On the south edge of a featureless and relatively quiet plan near Fort Tethiana. No level restrictions, no distinguishing features in the landscape around it, a couple limestone golems lollygagging around the entrance. I did not get inside. -- Doc Feelgood
The upper level is mostly Tumeroks -- scouts, warriors, gladiators, perhaps an officer. I didnt get below the 1st level. -- Doc Feelgood 5/1/2000

name: Lost Wish Range (a.k.a. El Badasso)
description:
A semi-circular knife cut in Dereth. This picturesque escarpment runs west from the seacoast at . It cuts off any overland travel north from Arwic, and east from Collier Mines. The northeast side is the high side and the views are spectacular. -- Doc Feelgood
This is actually the Lost Wish Range, its official name from Turbine. A better name to be sure. -- Sparky 3/1/2000
better name for sure? not if youre its discoverer. Im El Badasso, Docs scout. -- Doc Feelgood 4/12/2000
El Badasso is the impassible escarpment *in* the Lost Wish Mountains. -- Doc Feelgood 4/18/2000

name: East end of El Badasso
description: Hug the coast here, or you wont get through. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Cliff Break
description: The seacoast here is bordered by cliffs, with lots of Water Wisps on them enjoying the sea breeze. This is a break in the cliffs that will let you get to the beach. In the distance SE you can see an island. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Tower and 1/2 wall
description: Tower and half wall located near Tumerok Mine. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Lifestone
description: Lifestone just northeast of Qalabar. There is a peddler and a healer here as well. Decent hunting (mattekars, lugians, golems) nearby. -- Orbin

name: Peddler and Healer
description: Peddler and healer near lifestone. There is also a small temple here. -- Orbin

name: Mountain Cavern Portal
description: This is entrance to Lost city of Frore, the portal is located on top of a mountain peek. The only way to get to it is to bring Gelidite Standing Stone Translation to Mairisa bint Fuda in Plateau Village. She will then open portal and give you a treasure chest key.

name: Al-Arqas Meeting Hall
description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

name: Al-Jalima Meeting Hall
description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

name: Arwic Meeting Hall
description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

name: Baishi Meeting Hall
description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

name: Cragstone Meeting Hall
description:
Vast underground venue... -- Polecat
Drops out at 26.0N, 48.1E -- Willow 2/17/00 Moved to 26.0N, 49.1E from 25.9N, 47.1E -- Seeker 5/13/2004

name: Eastham Meeting Hall
description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

name: Glenden Wood Meeting Hall
description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

name: Hebian-To Meeting Hall
description:
Vast underground venue... -- Polecat
Use the meeting hall entrance to your advantage. Get a golem, gromnie, shark, whatever to chase you. Run in front of the steps to the meeting hall and then quickly dart around the corner. If done right, the monster will run up the steps to the meeting hall and get stuck. You are then free to cast spells and fire missiles at the helpless creature all you want. Be careful not to fire when they are running away from your position, because you will overshoot them. Best place to fire is between the pillar and the wall of the hall. Havent tried to get one in the actual portal room yet. I think they might not be able to actually go into the portal room at all. -- Regis 4/22/2000
Good staging spot for mud/water golem hunting, but watch for shadow children. They and wasps *will* follow you into the portal room. -- Ognam 11/15/2000 In town now, moved to 39.3S, 83.3E from 38.9S, 86.6E -- 5/13/2004

name: Holtberg Meeting Hall
description:
Vast underground venue... -- Polecat
This is a great place to buff for low lvls on DT. As it is better mana recovery then the stonehenge at Holt -- Ironimo 7/22/2003 Moved to 42.2N, 33.9E from 41.5N, 35.2E -- Seeker 5/13/2004

name: Khayyaban Meeting Hall
description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat Moved to 48.2S, 24.4E from 47.6S, 26.4E -- Seeker 5/13/2004

name: Lin Meeting Hall
description:
Vast underground venue... -- Polecat
A local allegiance uses this place as their 24 hour meeting hall. This doesnt mean that the place is closed off, it just means that you should expect a crowd there -- Rimgar 3/7/2000
on what server is there a crowd?usually empty when I go in there. -- Sega Slayer 12/1/2000 Moved to 54.8S,73.2E from 54.5S, 71.9E -- Seeker 5/13/2004

name: Lytelthorpe Meeting Hall
description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

name: Mayoi Meeting Hall
description:
Vast underground venue... -- Polecat
Moved to 61.4S, 81.8E from 61.6S, 83.4E -- Seeker 5/13/2004

name: Nanto Meeting Hall
description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

name: Qalaba'r Meeting Hall
description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

name: Rithwic Meeting Hall
description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat Moved to 10.9N, 58.2E from 10.3N, 57.0E -- Seeker 5/13/2004

name: Samsur Meeting Hall
description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat Moved to 2.8S,19.7E from 5.0S, 18.0E -- Seeker 5/13/2004

name: Shoushi Meeting Hall
description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat Moved to 33.3S, 73.0E from 33.7S, 71.0E -- Seeker 5/13/2004

name: Tou-Tou Meeting Hall
description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

name: Tufa Meeting Hall
description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

name: Uziz Meeting Hall
description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

name: Yanshi Meeting Hall
description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

name: Yaraq Meeting Hall
description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

name: Zaikhal Meeting Hall
description: Vast underground venue... -- Polecat

name: The Obsidian Bridge
description:
That huge Obsidian Bridge, the old coords entered put it somewhere near Plateau Village. Between Holrburg and Cragstone, you know the rest....or should. -- Krltplps
Even though I should, I dont, tell me more? -- Yulof 3/15/2000
The Obsidian span was only recently rediscovered after the powerful magics that hid it from sight were dispelled. Current theory holds that the Span was rendered invisible by the Emperyans in a futile attempt to hold back the Olthoi invasion, since Olthoi are known to fear open water. -- Necron 3/24/2000

name: Amperehelion Vault
description: This is where you get the Major Sparking Stone. Lightning Elementals and Sable Gromnies-- Geomancer

name: Jahannan Vault
description: You can get the Major Smoldering Stone at end of this dungeon. You may encounter Fire Elementals, Mountain Rats, and Zefirs.

name: Bridge
description: This is the Cragstone side of the new bridge - gets you to Arwic and back. Nice design very 1960s :-) -- Ostancragstone side begins at 34.6N,40.4E -- Ragnarok II 4/17/2000

name: Bridge
description: Arwac side of Bridge. -- Ostan

name: Coldeve Festival Stone
description: Your run of the Mill Festival Stone located just east of the most southern Town of Kara. -- Stern

name: Igloo
description:
Aluvian stone (ice) and book that needs translation. Several Ice Golems and Etherial Wisps guard the igloo. Random mattekar and monouga spawns nearby. On the run from Holtburg I must have slain 50 or so wood golems and not a single mote. -- Elric Kinslayer
Location of Minor Shivering Stone. Guarded by Ethereal Wisps and Ice Golems. -- Ignatius Loyola 3/9/2000
No Ice Golems in sight, but the Ethereal Wisps were there. These Wisps may be level 5, but they tend to use drain health. Be careful. My gfx card is maxd out on settings and I run in 1280x1024. When I walked inside, the smoke and steam caused my PC to lag. No monsters in sight. Relatively easy, but the run here can take forever.... -- Vincent Price 4/3/2000
YOu do not need to fight the wisp to get the gem and book. Simply run by or shoot at ice golems to draw them away from igloo. Then kill the ice golem and walk right past the wisps. The wisp wont attack you unless they are attacked or are near when you attack the ice golems. -- porkmaster 4/26/2000
You Dont even need to fight the golems just run right into the igloo and you will not have to fight anything the golems cant get you from there, and after awhile they see you as no threat and they go back to resting -- DV 6/21/2000

name: Mountainous Fortress
description: Populated with Shadows and Zefirs. Hamud ibn Rafik, the father of Devana bint Hamudi resides at the bottom of this dungeon behind a locked door. A key from Devana is needed to see him.

name: Slaughter House
description:
Near the exit of the Slaughter House portal in South Direlands. This is the Slaughter House. A large Tumerok fort with a single tower. High Tumerok in the tower, three or four priests on the grounds, numerous others, lots and lots of cows and auroch cattle inside, too. Lurkers and stalkers outside to the north and reenforcement tumeroks in the low walled building to the south. Approach from the east. Gate is locked, get a key from one of the Tumeroks in the tower next to the Slaughter House portal, or pick it... takes good, but not superb, pickskill (base 100 plus buffs and lock weakens). Good hunting if you can handle the spawn pace. Fort Tethana is a reasonable run due east. -- Doc Feelgood
Due to some strange spawning bug in the March update this area is now BLANKETED with gold wasps. There is a wasp right next to where the portal drop you so be prepare to fight or flight as soon as your feet hit the ground. Fort Teth is just a short run to the East if you can make it pass the gang of gold wasp guarding the area. -- Kexin 2/21/2000

name: Lifestone
description: -- TwistSternseher

name: Lifestone
description:
-- TwistSternseher
This is the East Yaraq Lifestone. Also a couple of shops here. -- Tantheos 3/26/2000

name: Serac Vault
description:
Huge place, when you first enter you are in a small room and hall, from here you must jump down to 3 lich lords(I left). No exit so portal out, die, or fight lich lords. Looks to be part of the March Quest, since I had never seen it before, and the huge room which you must jump into is snowwing so I presume it is the snow portion of the quest. -- Kamaitachi
Dont jump down. Jump across to the ledge. If you look hard, you will see it over on your right when facing the first pit. -- Heysun 2/24/2000
Not just lich lords. Many revenants and dark revenants around as well, all casting level IV+ debuffs and indirect attacks. Exit portal is guarded by at least 4 creatures, at least one of which is a Dark Revenant. -- Hiro 2/25/2000
Home of the Major Shivering Stone. -- Hazridi 3/10/2000
Beware of the spawn rate also. Just at the entrance there can be up to 4-6 Lich Lords and 2 Revenents. I accidentally went here and had some friends try to get me out. I lev 26 War, Monarch Lvl 30 Archer, Lev 33 Mage and lev 43, War. We couldnt kill them fast enough. All but the 43rd Warrior died, and only because he had lifestone recall. At the end we all made a mad dash to try to find an exit. At 1 time i had no less than 15 Lich Lords and Revs on my radar. *shiver* Last time i enter a dungeon b4 i have inof about it. Careful and GL -- Vylarn H-gain 3/16/2000
For those of you who got the Major Stone before the patch (like i did. =D ) your lucky. Now make sure you are buffed up and ready for some serious fightin. Now you arent put in the hall but youre dropped right in the pit to start. fun Fun. :) -- Xzeno 4/7/2000
Good place to camp dark revenants for thighbones.. only other choice is nexus as far as I know and more people came there :) -- mengar 6/13/2000
OK.. Heres a shortcut but you need at least a 270 jump skill. Enter the dungeon and clear the 1st room. Right in front of you when you enter is a passage with a torch above it and a large rock just in front of it to the right. Jump on top of the rock, use shift+jump to jump on top of the torch, turn 180 degrees and jump up to the ledge, follow the ledge back towards the torch, you will come to a pit. Jump diagonal to your left to the large ledge, there is a door there that leads to the end and the Major Stone. Good Luck. -- Crunchyfrog 9/14/2000
I did it with 250 jump, not 270 -- Fullcrum 11/4/2000
I did it with a 223 jump skill. -- Dezran Rogue 7/18/2001
Quite easy to complete. 80% of the time its got macroers or someone hunting the Revenants in there, and if you use the jump shortcut, you can complete this quest without firing one arrow, spell, or swinging the sword. -- Nocturne [LC] 9/3/2001
Right next to the stone you can find the Elaborated Scroll wich later translates at Cragstone translator to the Imperial Missive. David ibn Jensen -- David ibn Jense 1/20/2002
Entrance and Exit are quiet. Portals can be tied to and Recalled, but not summoned. The foyer is hot, covered by three Lich Lords and a Revenant. The only exit portal is at the far end of the dungeon near the Stinging Stone Room. Following a right hand rule will take you through some heavy fighting to a jump into a large, long room. At the far end of the room is the hall leads to the second floor, and ultimately to the Major Stining Stone. Following left hand rule will take you to a quieter section of the dungeon on the first level, and some dead end routes to the second floor. Dungeon is fast spawn with Lich Lords, Revenants and Dark Revenents. -- Doc Feelgood 10/7/2002
Correction: Shivering Stone, not Stinging Stone. -- Doc Feelgood 10/7/2002

name: Undead Ambush
description:
A House southwest of Yanshi full of undead which only show up on the radar when you enter. -- Finn Djhala
Nice spot for newbie Life mages to drain some good exp. -- Avaton 4/30/2001

name: A Lifestone
description: A lifestone close to the Plateau portal, but not on the plateau itself. -- Jakob Olafsun

name: Escalator Slope
description: This is a path up the mountain to reach the Qalabar Portal at . Great views from the top of the mountain. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Incunubula Vault
description:
This is part of Marchs Quest. It is where you find the Major Searing Stone for use in the new Pyreal Weapons. It is filled with Olthoi Soldiers. No workers at all. Watch out for the acid, as it burned me for 96 a few times. The stone is near the Surface Portal at the end of the dungeon behind a few Soldiers. Good luck. -- Noah
I found this by accident on 2/17/00 if you question this claim then ask aliera -- Atal 2/21/2000
The portal cannot be tied to. The foyer and the outside are both richly populated, so come prepared for non-stop trouble. -- Doc Feelgood 5/22/2000
This is really not that hard with the right group and acid & pierce protects. I did it with a group of 15 people levels 30-70. Only two were life mages. If you can survive the Olthoi Hordes Nest solo or with one other person, you should be ok here.-- -- Flowing Dragon 10/18/2000
TIt is suggested to tie at swamp temple in the dires and then run to Incubala Vault. Also there is a very nice perch spot for you archers out there, u need at least 250 jump to get on the perch and it is located near the middle of the Vault. I went there by myself but since im an acher with 210 melee D they kicked my ass bad, so i suggest u go wwith a group of between 2-5 to get thru the olthoi onto the perch spot. -- Darks Lord 1/16/2001
One note about the archer perch...heavily camped, and bickering goes on there quite a bit. I would have to say in order of population, this is tougher than OHN by far, especially when you go into the large rooms, Olthoi come out from 8 directions. Great fun though...if you live. -- Punisher Zod 1/24/2001
The perches were removed, as per the August 2001 patch. Tread carefully. -- Nocturne [LC] 9/3/2001
Good. Now if they just took life magic and bows out we might actually have a game going here. -- Sega slayer 12/27/2001

name: Impious Temple Portal
description:
Inside of the Four Towers. Restricted to lvl20+. May be part of the March quest (as it is new to the Towers). Four Towers Entrance portal still broken (restricted to lvl 5-15) as of this entry. -- Dunc
Contains no less then 5 Undead priests, who are level 41. Also found here a broken staff No idea as to its use -- Daffyd 2/26/2000
Broken staff is part of Impious Staff quest. -- Sol-Noir 3/5/2000
See the 4 towers dungeon notes I entered for more details -- Vincent Price 3/31/2000
Mostly Skeletons throughout much of the dungeon. Early parts of the dungeon are divided into 4 main sectors, 3 of the sectors containing a Skeleton Warrior behind a door with a key youll need later in the dungeon, and one section having a Skeleton Captain. Undead protect the wonderous Naqibs Journal giving you a total of 100 pages at the bruden of some 120. (or some other really low weight, better than buying a book.) You encounter the Undead Priests in the hall and room preceeding the doors you need to use your 4 keys (gathered earlier in the dungeon.) Bring lightning protection. Broken Staff itself is givable, the item has a timer on it so you cant pick it up again quickly (or maybe you can only pick it up once.) Final product is Gharundim. -- Garfield3d 6/24/2000
The comment about Dizah ibn Nadqabs journal not only has the name wrong, it is just plain WRONG. 11 pages, all full, nothing at all wondrous about it. YOu and your buddies can take turns reading it while you wait for the high priest to respawn. 7/30/2000

name: Devana bint Hamundi
description:
Devana bint Hamundi (Person). Part of the March Quest (as hes new to this location)? He says, I have slain others for speaking to me without a proper introduction. (Gee, nice guy). -- Dunc
Not a guy, its a she :D -- Kexin 2/21/2000
Give an ivory gromnie tooth to the Trophy Crafter (ivory crafter) in Zaikal to receive the intro letter for her. -- Tmas 3/1/2000
There are now four undead in the house that she stands in front of. -- Dunc 3/9/2000
I gave THREE ivory gromnie teetht to the damn ivory crafter, and all I got for it was 30 ivory tooth darts. Perhaps it is a different type of tooth? -Sometimes known as THE TURTLE... and The King o Bleh: 4/30/2000
You need to give an ash gromnie tooth instead. This is for the quest to get the Hammuds Pyreal Katar. Give an ash tooth and get a note for an introduction from the ivory crafter to the she who will then give you a key. -- Shiroi Okami no 5/1/2000
When you get Hammuds Pyreal Katar, Hammud will give you a letter to his daughter, Devana bint Hamundi. Give her this letter and shell give you Oswalds Dagger. -- Octavian (FF) 7/4/2001

name: Broken Lifestone
description:
Just the hull of a lifestone -- Boccobii
This isnt a broken lifestone hull. This is actually an Empyrean Portal holder of the type such as has Mage Academy and others. -- Senshin -MT 9/14/2000

name: 13 Statue Heads
description: On the shore of the inland sea ... 13 easter-island heads facing the water. Some upright, some akimbo. No obvious purpose. -- Blayd

name: 17 Pillars
description: 17 pillars aligned E-W stretch into the inland sea. No obvious purpose. -- Blayd

name: Abandoned Building
description:
Abandoned Building south of Holtburg at the road to Glenden Wood, 2 drudge sneakers inside. -- Finn Djhala
Be careful herre - If you go into the building and attack the sneakers, all of the drudges in the surrounding area come over to help em out :) -- Jol 2/23/2000
Try it if you want your radar to light up. Must have been 15 spots of light appear from nowhere. -- Joker al-Mekar 5/30/2000
Ideal for restoring vitae the SAFE way, get in, kill drudges inside, and wait by (one)open door for reinforcements to be killed one by one. -- Hagen II 11/22/2000

name: Abandoned Building
description: Abandoned Building near Holtburg, only one banderling scout here -- Finn Djhala

name: Swamp Temple
description: Need Carved Key in bunker to east to get past first set of doors.

name: Mage Tower To Heartland
description: Exits at 22.6N, 37.2E By Farm

name: Flower Area
description:
othing here but tons of Sandstone Golems and a great screenshot are. Huge towering flowers as far as the eye can see, in every direction. Looking for a great way to show that long forgotten special someone that you care more about them than about about Asherons call, try a flower screenshot. -- Cunnerman
Monsters have changed a bit, and the flower area now extends at least as far east as 30S, 61.5W. -- Doc Feelgood 4/8/2003
...and as far west as just beyond the Essence of Verdancy at 30.5S 75W -- Doc Feelgood 4/11/2003

name: Crater Pass
description:
A pass into the Crater, avoiding all the Zefs in the Crater Pathway. Stock up on Fire Resistance though, there are NUMEROUS Flares and Flammas gaurding it... -- Rhaziq
Not all THAT many, Id say 3 Flammas and 5 Flares when I ran through. If you have a respectable rn skill, they wont wake up in time anyway. -- CyndalT 5/7/2002

name: Black Rat Rock
description: One of these bunkers, filled with black rats. -- Finn Djhala

name: Fire Cave
description:
Cave with many Flames and Flares, contains the Minor Smoldering Stone, the Gharundim elemntal sourcestone. Spawns once an hour. -- Aris
Parchment w/msg from Asheron spawns right after stone - msg is in high Empyrean and must be translated -- Cordt 2/27/2000
Life mages have this one made. Just drain the Flares safely from above. There were about 5. As soon as you hit one, he darts around very fast. If you are not in front of the entrance, you should be ok. -- Vincent Price 4/3/2000
To clear up some possible confusion, there are three columns of fire that pulsate in front of the entrance. There are no Flammas here. Good idea to visit the Swamp Cave after leaving here. It is not too far away. Just be prepared... -- Vincent Price 4/3/2000

name: South Direlands Portal
description: Level 12+, Exits at 84.2S, 34.4W -- Gothmog

name: Desert Ridge Border
description: Exits at -- Gothmog

name: Castle Lifestone
description: This is a castle with a lifestone and two town portals -- scourgelord

name: Zefir Cave
description: Several Azael Zefirs are found here guarding a Runed Chest.

name: Swamp Cave
description:
The Minor Stinging Stone for the Atlan weapons. Guarded by Mosswarts Shamans and lots of Swamp Rats. South of Yanshi, west of Sawato, as per the rumor. -- Junko
I dont know if it was like this when Junko was there, but I have never seen such a dense population of any monsters anywhere other than here. You attack a Mosswart, about 75 more come to help their bro. Rats are not as bad. Be buffed, stay alive, prepare for a lot of lag. Radar had more orange than black - seriously. I used one Mosswart as a ladder to jump on top of the bunker. This took melee out of the picture. Drained the Shaman and rats one at a time. Took about 20 minutes to clear the place out. -- Vincent Price 4/3/2000
Good idea to visit the Fire Cave after leaving here. It is not too far away and is much easier than here. -- Vincent Price 4/3/2000
This is a one-room bunker. About 15 Desert Rats are packed inside, and the Minor Stinging Stone is on the ground at the back. If you want a small fight, you can wall work the rats from up top and well behind the entrance without exciting the mosswarts, then do a run in and grab. (June patch) -- Doc Feelgood 6/10/2000
All I can say is easy Quest there was nothing here maybe someone already killed them but that cant be true, cause 10min after i arrived the stone appeared and also a note???? Thats a secret. REGULATORS........ -- NikoliTheSavoir 8/10/2000
You dont even need to fight all the mosswarts inside. Just drian all the rats, then run in and attack the shaman from INSIDE and when all the other mosswarts come they cant get into the bunker. You can safely portal out or wait for them to leave then run off :) -- Nexic 11/10/2000

name: Artifex Vault
description: Get Stone Tool for Atlan here.

name: Dawnsong Festival Stone
description: On the End of a long Stretch of Flat Rock. Great View. -- ToeKiller

name: Wandering Bowyer
description: Hes behind the counter in a building about mid-way on a straight NW run from Sawato to Yanshi. A nice green patch of ground between swamps, and a good place to unload the weapons gathered from the mossies along the way. He wont buy the armor, though. -- Minas Tirith

name: Tower Lifestone
description: By a tower. A peddler also located here. -- Veldah

name: Empty Tower
description: Empty tower out in the middle of nowhere. -- Ravic

name: Rat Nest
description:
Bunker-like building full of black rats -- Finn Djhala
Now its three Mountain rats, and a Silver rat in a underground Tomb. -- Zen Tek Ken 6/21/2003

name: Zefir Ruins
description:
Just southeast of the Shoushi portal to Eastham. The area contains a tower with three to four Zombies and a couple of small dungeons populated by Zefirs and Black Rats. White and Snowy Mattekars, a Spikey Dillo, and a Laigas Lugian stand guard to the east of the buildings. Wood Golems can be found a little further to the southeast. -- Minas Tirith
This spot appears to broken. :( The only monsters that spawn there now, as of 01/14/02, appear to be a Liagus Lugian + Amploth, one Barker Mossie in the western most bunker, and a random spawn farther to the west still on the little hill of Wood Golems and Jade Gromnie. Reedsharks may occasionally spawn next to the lugians guarding the tower. -- Dazar Tae--DT 1/14/2002

name: Arwic Festival Stone
description: Arwic Festival Stone -- Dunc

name: Direlands Lifestone
description: Lifestone near a small Blacksmiths hut in the middle of the Direlands. -- Chiun Zen

name: Direlands Blacksmith Shop
description: A Blacksmiths Hut near a lifestone in the middle of the Direlands. The Blacksmith has armor for sale comparable to the larger towns, like Cragstone, not like the usual wilderness dealers. Buys items greatly reduced from actual value. -- Chiun Zen

name: Shadow Tower
description:
This is an emperyian power station-style building. This place has Pandemonium and Sinister Shadows, half the shadows spawn inside, half outside. Inside is a note-
Im not afraid to say it: Black Ferah is a fool. Assaulting a tomb to steal a relic? Even if this Anadil struck down one of the blessed Hopeslayers Thorns, the creature is dead. Despoiling its tomb does nothing to further our cause and right the ancient wrongs committed against us. And dont you sense the meddling of those cloaked creatures? Why do we waste our time on this pointless raid? Worse yet, we only retrieved a portion of the creatures staff and lost many our breathen in the process. If Black Ferah wants the piece, tell her to come get it, if she can tear herself away from her constant vigil by where the Hopeslayer fell. We are keeping it at the temporary staging ground at 82.3S, 35.2W Signed as unknown. -- Rufen -- Doc Feelgood -- Chrono Crest

name: Direlands Old Dead Camp
description: Old camp spot with three firepits in a triangle shape, a corpse, and some bone piles in the center. Just a landmark, no items type of corpse. Looks like it is just there to add to the Dires atmosphere. Actually one of the few spots in the Dires where you could safely take a break. Near a Lifestone and Blacksmiths Hut. -- Chiun Zen

name: Mountain Cabin
description: Just a small cabin inhabited by a Bronze Armoredillo. -- Protector SurgeThis Cabin has been upgraded since and has a Runed Chest guarded by a Hoary Armoredillo. -- 12/18/2003

name: Beach Pass
description: This beach route is the shortest way from Arwic to the lands north of El Badasso, all inland routes are blocked by cliffs. The southern entrance is at . Beach Pass is rich with wild life: shore armadillos, mud and water golems, mites, and one band of Olthoi. -- Doc Feelgood

name: North end of Beach Pass
description: This is the north end of Beach Pass. From here you can reach the highlands north of El Badasso. Just north of here is golem country -- lots and lots of wood golems and little else. -- Doc Feelgood

name: South end of Beach Pass
description: This is the south end of Beach Pass. From here you can reach the highlands between Arwic and El Badasso. West of here are mites, golems, banderlings and the Mountain Shortcut area. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Fumarole Plain
description: A high mountain area with fumaroles in it -- steamy, smokey holes in the ground ala Yellowstone. The fumaroles dont do anything... yet. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Mite Ambush
description: A dungeon portal entrance rock, but with no portal in it. It does, however, have lots of mites in it. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Drudge Plain
description: This area north east of Holtberg, beyond the river, seems to be thick with drudges and little else. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Lifestone
description: Lifestone next to small tower on the land isthmus west of Qalabar. -- Ming Lee

name: Mosswart Towers
description: Between Yanshi & Dryreach. 3 structures with tons of mosswarts. Didnt see a shaman, but it was probably hiding. -- Kael

name: Mount Naipenset Caverns
description:
North Direlands dungeon restricted to lvl 15 and upper. Lots of granite, copper and iron golems. Beware, access to that place can be dangerous . there are often gold wasps, silver rats and other nasty creatures at the entrance and waiting for you to take one of the two exit portal... Nearby lifestone at , near Mountain Halls. -- Shimroar
Two main sections of the dungeon. Upper parts has lots of granite golems, while the lower part is all iron and copper. LOTS of people now. Many people come in with acid weapons to hunt the irons and copper and cant take the golems. Watch out. They often lead a group of golems right to you when you are healing or something. Great place when no one is there... but always crowded nowadays :( -- Soze 4/14/2000
I meant some people cant take the granites -- Soze 4/14/2000 The golems have all been replaced with Gold Golems. This is stop #19 in the Undead Mechanic quest added in the October 2003 patch. -- Geomancer 11/16/2003

name: Direlands portal to South Direlands
description: This portal leads to South Direlands (), same destination as the Mayoi Portal to South Direlands. Restricted to lvl 12 and upper. -- Shimroar

name: South Direlands to North Direlands
description: This portal from south direlands leads to North Direlands (24.4N, 53.8W). Restricted to level 12 and upper. -- Shimroar

name: Underground Temple
description:
Underground temple, with a Greater Mu-miyah in it (at least when I was there [Twice]). -- Dunc
Confirmed as of 10/08/2000. -- Luci X 10/11/2000

name: Zephir Spawn
description:
Theres a spawn of 7 Olthoi (3 Soldiers, 4 Workers). Plenty of rocks to jump on for those mages and archers. -- Crazy Mad Faust
The rocks here are linked to the Olthoi. The three Olthoi sights in the northeast all have this same rock formation. -- Doc Feelgood 3/9/2000
No longer, now only zefirs spawn here...another olthoi spawn gone unfortunately -- Aeternus 4/22/2000
Use to be a Olthoi Spawn spot but now 7 Zofrit Zefir (lvl 28) spawn around the rocks. 3/6/2001
heh thats what you wise fuy archers and mages geet for being lazy and hiding on rocks to fight. AHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA.. -- Sega Slayer 12/27/2001

name: Ruined Causeway
description: Two rows of ancient pillars marking a ford across to a small island. Some of the pillars still glow at their tops. -- Xian Liu

name: Darktide Festival Stone
description: An unlabeled festival stone. All others I have seen are named for a month. This one is not. -- Xian Liu

name: Lifestone
description: This lifestone is part of a small village (name unknown) which has a few cows, a farmer and a wandering Bowyer who sells Armor-Piercing Arrows and Quarrels as well as fletching supplies. -- Trinidy

name: Tumerok Castle
description: Appears to be the map point of interest. Many, many tumeroks here, including a high tumerok. Beware of them jumping from the walls and landing on your head. Ouch. -- Xian Liu

name: Twin Towers
description: Twin Towers on the road between the Bandit Castle and Neydisa Castle. Lever at the top of the South Tower opens the entry door of the North Tower. Some Tumeroks in the North Tower, and Green Wasps, Rats in the South Tower. -- Dunc

name: Undead Pillar
description:
Pillars with an undead. Nearby spawn a shield. -- Xin
The Undead that spawns here guards a shield that is lying on the ground. The Undead isnt very hard to kill and gives rather good exp. I kill him every time I run from Samsur to Binar. -- Avaton 4/28/2001

name: Fort Witshire Broken Lifestone
description: Broken lifestone at Fort Witshire between Glenden Wood and Cragstone -- Finn Djhala

name: Glenden Wood Lifestone
description: One of three lifestones in Glenden Wood -- Finn Djhala

name: Glenden Wood Lifestone
description: One of three lifestones in Glenden Wood -- Finn Djhala

name: Edelbar Lifestone
description:
Lifestone at the abandoned village Edelbar -- Finn Djhala
A new macro site now too. Guess the meeting halls got old. :) -- Minas Tirith 7/17/2000

name: Lesser Mu-Miyah Tower
description: 6 Lesser Mu-Miyah, 3 outside, 2 downstairs inside, 1 upstairs inside. 1 locked chest at top of tower, sub-par treasure -- Balo

name: Shipwreck
description:
Remains of a shipwreck that have washed up on the shore...including the Undead pirate crew.
o) Standard loot in chests. -- Chiun Zen
This spawn has been changed. It now has Undead Captain, Undead Sailors, Undead Mate, Skeletal Swashbuckler, Skeletal Mate -- Zen Tek Ken 6/27/2003

name: Merchants Cottage
description: Healer and a Peddler, within viewing distance of Mite Maze -- Kor

name: Blackmire Swamp
description:
Quite a few Mosswarts and Swamp Grmnies nearby. -- Devyn
Best to jump up to the top of the lifestone before using it, quite a few monster generators within attack distance of the lifestone. Closest stone for gathering the Minor Stinging Stone -- Tametomo 4/9/2000
This life stone is also ideal for some level 6-12 hunt around here. Undead and Zombies are sweet target, plus the golems. -- Immacolata 5/18/2001

name: Felscuda's House
description:
An employee of Lady Folthid who will pay quite a bit of money for blank parchment - I think it was 150p, but Im not sure. -- Devyn
She doesnt pay for the paper, she just tells you how to get into the cellar. -- Hawat 3/18/2000

name: Crater
description: Crater left by a Spire

name: Leafdawning Fairgrounds
description:
These fairgrounds near the Leafdawning Festival Stone have a race track, targets for combat competition, plus a Roaming Bowyer and Farmer. -- H. Dunadan
Bowyer sells armor-piercing arrows/quarrels in addition to standard arrows/quarrels. -- Zyban 7/19/2000

name: Khayyaban Shadow Spire Crater
description:
Some kind of eldritch UFO has landed just outside Khayyaban. Its over ten stories tall, and it has carved a huge crater. It hums, it scintillates, its a huge Vegas style billboard for something... but what that is I dont know yet. -- Doc Feelgood
The Shadow Spire has disappeared. The blackened crater is still present and there are some coloured particles in the air at the bottom of the crater. -- Maglor Daefalas 8/13/2000

name: Yanshi Festival Grounds
description: a sprint track, hurdles. Several straw and oak drudges to try to best your competitor with. A Farmer and a Wandering Bowyer are here as well. -Grasp -- Silver Citadel

name: Sawato Shadow Spire Crater
description: Blackened Crater still there spire gone. Lots of mossy and serths in and around crater. Typical swamp spawns. -- Dark Man - Sol 10/10/2000

name: Crater Lifestone
description: How it could go this long witout being added is beyond me. I dont know how many mages wouldnt be able to go about living without being tied to this LS. -- Sargonas

name: The Chockablocks
description: A NE-SW running, medium high mountain range. The land is quite tortured here, producing steep cliffs and stunning views. Get to the top, and over, by climbing up the fingers, not the valleys. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Obsidian Enchantress
description:
Inside Building -- Jason Eldman
Gives you a Wand of Black Fire in return for an Obsidian Sphere. No idea what you get for an Obsidian Jewel. -- Critical Hit 5/7/2000
For an Obsidian Jewel, you get a magic gem which casts Armor V, 1500p value. The Stone Collector converts Black Rocks (from Magma Golem) into Obsidian Spheres and Black Stones (from Obsidian Golem)into Obsidian Jewels. -- Harkoth 3/7/2001

name: Qalabar to Hilltop
description: Portal to Hilltop 32.8N, 34.7E.  On the beach, next to the Desert Ridge Portal and just downhill from a lifestone.  This area could be an interesting place for portal people

name: Desert Gateway
description:
A group of stones that sort of look like a gateway on the road between Samsur and Tufa. Also there are two chests here guard by some Spiny Arms. Pretty weal loot, but if your on this road, you may as well stop... -- Dunc
I wonder if this is the Amoredillo Lair that the scribe in Samsur sells directions to? The note mentions you need to go Southwest towards Yaraq, and that the lair has nice treasure (I found a dagger). -- Immacolata 3/21/2001

name: Sean Huxter Signature
description:
If you look at this spot from above, it looks just like the US dollar symbol, $. Maybe a raised mound monument to the all mighty dollar, or just coincident? -- Dunc
Stumbled across this one back in december. Id say its the Micro$oft influence showing. Theres more of course: what seems to be the number 20 at 19.6S 29.3E - what seems to be a river forming a word at 8N 76W - a few signatures covering a large area in the Dires centered around 39S 65W - . --Arg the Enlightened, Frostfell-- -- Arg 3/17/2000
Actually, this is the signature of celebrated Lead Artist for AC, Sean Huxter. (He said so himself.) -- Wylie 12/22/2000

name: South Direlands Roaming Bowyer and Armorer
description: A bowyer and armorer on a small building in South Direlands. Portal to Glenden Woods too. -- Shimroar

name: Rat tail collector - Nanto
description: Wa Shi, who make his base in Nanto tavern will gladly buy from you all rat tail trophies, -- Silverion DD

name: Skeleton Mausoleum
description: 8 or more Skeleton Champions a Skeleton Hero, and a Primeval Skeleton. There a sik chest on a platform and a Runed Chest inside a building.

name: Drudge Tower
description: This tower has been Updated and now has from what I counted. 1 Peerless Drudge, 1 Drudge Cabalist, 1 Drudge Mystic, 3 Unconquered Drudge, 3 Drudge Bloodletter. Has a Sturdy Steel Chest to at the top -- Shimroar -- Zen Tek Ken 8/24/2003

name: Mummies cave
description: A small cave with greater Mu-Miyah and Gold wasps. A secret passage leads to an empty room under the cave. -- ShimroarUndead Soldiers, Skeletal Mates, Skeletal Shaswbucklers, and an Undead Captain. -- Chupon 8/12/2004

name: Tufa Lifestone
description: Another lifestone near Tufa. -- Shimroar

name: Empyrean Foundry Lifestone
description: Near the Empyrean Foundry. -- Korrig Vamier

name: Samsur Lifestone
description:
Another lifestone near Samsur. -- Shimroar
This life stone is up on a hill (as are many things around Samsur)on the South side of the road to Tufa. In the area are apt to be skeletons, spiney armadillos, outcast monouga, all types of shreath and others. This makes it an excellent hunting area for the level 7-12 adventruer. Be warned, at times the radar can look like a pumpkin patch and most of these critters like to gather in groups of three. -- Dei Ray 3/13/2000 Moved into town 3.0S,19.3E from 4.3S, 15.9E -- Seeker 5/13/2004

name: Lake Nothing
description: This is a lake. A few drudges in the area, and some shreths, all low level. Found during my travels to the north. -- Gonthar

name: SE Shoushi Outpost
description: Lifestone at SE Shoushi Outpost -- Pantera Firestorm -- P. Firestorm

name: South Direland Portal
description: Portal to South Direland, exit at 84.2S, 34.4W -- Rufen

name: River Ford
description: Lite River Ford, directing you to the Festival Stone. -- Dunc

name: Festival Stone
description: Festival Stone. -- Dunc

name: Tree Shrine
description: Cool building with a tree inside, lighting it up. Looks like a Tree Shrine. -- Dunc

name: Mountain Ridge to Glendon Wood
description:
-- Shen Chi
Exits at 28.9N, 26.3E -- Tyger 6/12/2000

name: Wandering Bowyer
description:
Near Yanshi festival grounds. A good stop for a starting archer
sells a Yumi for 520p. -- Wei Go Long

name: Accursed Halls
description:
Location of (IMO) the easiest to use PK alter. 1 young banderling and 2 captains are all you have to go through to get to the alter. To get there to the portal give the drink to the madman near bashi, and he will portal you to an enclosed area with a *direlands* shreth (actually halfway difficult if you arent expecting it). Then another portal and youre at the staging area. The dungeon has a vendor where you spawn in, and I found the PK alter in 5 minutes despite my poor navigation skills. The dungeon is *very* well designed, has a real nice feel to it. Go for the architecture if nothing else. -- machina
For the Drunken Madman, you have to give him sake to make the portal open... as well, the Vorous shreth is not always there, in fact there is usually no enemies when you get to the dires, inside the Walled Portals -- Daffyd 3/20/2000
If there are critters inside they came over the ladders outside. Usually drawn in by the wussy life mages who stodd in the wrong place. They usually bail out of one of the portals when they make this mistake. -- Gurth 5/1/2000
May not be a decent way of getting xp (us warriors hate it), but the walls are very populated with archers, as well as life mages draining, cheap and fast way to get xp. -- Skorn 5/21/2000
Entrance is safe, foyer is safe. Portals cannot be tied to. Design is early school with a very lived in feel. The gen rate is liesurly
the winding corridors lead to rooms, and the rooms have monsters in them. Good wall working opportunities. -- Doc Feelgood 3/21/2001

name: Direlands Floating Tower
description:
A Strange tower of some sort. I pressed the target key and there is a door inside but the tower floats above ground. There is no way to jump into it. :o( I hope someone figures out what this thing is. -- Vortigan
I entered the tower from the floating city it is in the last level and on top of a structure in the city. The only exit (portal) from the tower drops you in the Dires on the sw coast of the inner sea -- Pericles 7/12/2001
I entered the tower from the floating city it is in the last level and on top of a structure in the city. The only exit (portal) from the tower drops you in the Dires on the sw coast of the inner sea -- Pericles 7/12/2001

name: Samsur Festival Stone
description: North of the road between Samsur and Tufa on top of a hill. -- Dei Ray

name: Beachside (Granite Outpost)
description: Portal to Beachside () in with the two merchants at the Granite Outpost. -- Chiun Zen

name: Peddler and Healer (Granite Outpost)
description: Additional information on merchants in Granite Outpost. They are standard wilderness Peddler and Healer with usual poor quality items for sale, and buy items at significantly reduced value. Beware of the numerous Granite Golems and Mountain Rats which will swarm all over you. -- Chiun Zen

name: Adventurer's Haven Lifeston
description: Couldnt find this in the list. Is actually _IN_ the hall, not above ground. -- ChyEld

name: Lifestone (Middle Direlands)
description: A lifestone just about in the middle of the Dires. -- Chiun Zen

name: The Cauldrons of Green Flame
description: A square section of foundation with Empyrean tiles and four large cauldrons boiling with green flame. -- Chiun Zen

name: Swamp Temple (Dires)
description:
Sclavus bunker with a dungeon in E Dires. Level 15+ -- Alun Magus
The key to this place (a hideous key) can be found in the other Swamp Temple, the one not in the Dires. The highest level creature here is level 40, with sprinklings of lower fare, and swamp grommies. Some chests which seemed empty, except one which spawned several 1000p valued items. -- Goldhart 4/25/2000
Sturdy iron key opens chest at bottom -- Shoto Fle-Alch 5/7/2000
The key to get in here is a Grotesque one, and as noted above, is in the swamp temple near Sawato. Creatures in here are nearly all Sclavi--Se, Aste, Essa, and lots of Sata in the bottom. Bring your Superior Helm, because they throw Defenselessness 3 and Vulnerability 3 like theyre going out of style--expect your melee and missile defense to be 20 points lower from the time you walk in the door. They also like acid 3, frost 3, and shock 3. They drop wands, staves, and orbs like theyre going out of style, so if you need vassal magic gear, this is a good place to go. Also used as a staging area for the Incunbala Vault, which is north and west of here. -- Aliciana 5/27/2000
The outside is infested, the foyer is clear. This is a large early era dungeon with rambling corridors, large halls, and modest monster density and gen rates. -- Doc Feelgood 6/26/2000

name: Lugian Camp
description: Lugian camp with some 2 obeloth, 3-5 amplioth, and some 4 - 8 lagius Lugians, there is a tower as a nice log out or mule place but old lifestone which was near tower was destroyed in March patch, so nearest lifestone is in valley with 2 merchants. -- Silverion DD

name: Tower near Lugian camp
description: Abandoned tower is a nice log out or mule place but old lifestone which was near tower was destroyed in March patch, so nearest lifestone is in valley with 2 merchants. Tower can be used for lower lv archers and mages to pull lugians from a nearby lugian camp or to hit 3 spawn spots in range, spawning all from lugians, hunter shereths, mosswarts and banderling riders. -- Silverion DD

name: A Tower with Sho Furniture
description:
An Aluvian style tower with Sho furnishings on the inside, including a couch, fountain, storage crates, paintings, and a couple ornamental tachis above the entryway. The outside has some shrubery around the base. The structure overall is in good shape and does not appear to be abandoned but quite lived in, just no one at home presently. This tower is right on the edge of a very high, and very steep cliff overlooking a lifestone on the sandy beach below. -- Chiun Zen
Just checked it out today, still nobody at home. Judging by the time gap, it appears that nobody has ever been home. -- Ulious 11/3/2000
The furniture sure seems to be holding up well, though. -- Confucius of FF 10/13/2001

name: Guard Tower
description: Fourth tower in the chain, overlooking the road from Khayyaban to Al-Arqas. -- Ibn Schachabo

name: Twin Standing Stones
description: Two upright slabs of rock. Useful as a reference point or landmark, but that is all. -- Ibn Schachabo

name: Small Black Hill Portal
description: Exits at tower on Small Black Hill (62.1S, 50.4W) -- Sis. Immacolata

name: Lin/Nanto Festival Stone
description: Festival Stone between Nanto and Lin, right off the path on a mountain, cant miss it. Beware of Zefirs... -- Fyrecrypts

name: Undead Hideout
description: This is located in the Northern Mtns. in a kind of bowl or cove. There were several zombies and a single lich guarding a chest that was located in the middle of some pillars. Also near were some Banderlings. Found a piece of armor and some gems in chest. Mouth of cove is located at 55.1N, 4.0W. -- Derwood McGriz

name: Fairy Ring
description: A strange stone claw structure (like a lifestone without the center stone)with a ring of mushrooms. Had a Ghost wisp in it and a dark wisp near it. -- Liu Kui

name: North Syliph
description: Exits at 12.7N, 11.8E -- Shoto Fle-Alch

name: Syliph Tower
description:
Dillos and Bandis -- Shoto Fle-Alch
Not sure if this is a new dungeon from april update. Anyone know? 4/5/2000
No, this dungeon has been here for a while. -- Psy 4/7/2000
The dungeon has a narrow foot print, but is deep and winding. Navigating can be tricky if youre in a hurry, but backtracking doesnt take long. -- Doc Feelgood 6/17/2000
Not much in here but banderlings and then only youngs and scouts. There is a weapons smith down there that has a basic stock of weapons. No real point at the end of the dungeon. Just a one way portal out. -- Ryth-al-Rothgar 1/17/2001 Now populated with Silt Lurkers, Jungle & Dune Reavers. Granite, iron, and copper golems. and a couple of risen knights. -- Wolftear 10/12/2005

name: South Dalt
description: Exits at 14.1N, 12.7E -- Shoto Fle-Alch

name: South Gemm
description: Exits at 15.7N, 14.2E -- Shoto Fle-Alch

name: Nexus
description:
Entrance and exit are hot with local Dires Fauna, and, in fact, this is a good portal pop hunting place. Foyer is quiet -- no action until you jump across the pit. Revs, Dark Revs up top in a cluster of small rooms (nice wall working) and Shadow family on level below. -- Doc Feelgood 5/19/2002
Beyond the Revenant Rooms, the dungeon fills with Shadows. It becomes quite symmetric and leads you down though a series of three pits that you must jump into to continue. The bottom of each pit is lightning trapped and guarded by a half-dozen or so shadows ranging from Lts to Umbris. The BDT room is filled with Nexus fragments -- which dont seem to drop anything very often, if ever. There is a portal to the surface after a long climb on the far side of the Fragment Room. Spawn rate in the lower levels is slow. -- Doc Feelgood 10/7/2002

name: Signature Gully
description: This NE - SW gully has dark drainage lines in the bottom surrounded by lighter colored hills. From the air it looks like a signature. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Enchanter's Hideaway
description:
Secluded hut in desert cliffs. Watch for 2 lvl 43 Iron Golems at gate, and bring lockpicking. Give a skeleton Skull to woman for a book on the history of the Silifi of the Crimson Stars. First part of the axe quest, Id think. :) -- Lorelai
Also, bring the Broken Haft from Leikothas Crypt to receive the Repaired Haft, the next step of the SoCS quest. If your haft breaks later on attaching the spine, go back here to have it repaired again. :) -- Lorelai 4/14/2000
Does anyone know if there is a key around anywhere for this place? -- Thi (MT) 10/2/2000
There is no key but you DONT need lockpicking to get in. Try examining the building a bit more closely...the golems are on a 15 minute spawn cycle so you have time. =) -- Khrome-Khoran 1/17/2001
Um I don?t know what you are talking about, but you DO need a lock picker. After I killed the irons I searched that whole building top and bottom no lever, switch or hole. It is easy to pick tho, and my lock pick is only 125 -- Eclipsa (FF) 6/2/2002

name: Bellig Mesa to Gemm Mesa
description:
After exiting the Bellig Tower dungeon you end up on top of a mesa. This portals you to the next Mesa SW called Gemm. Only way to Slyph dungeon. -- Jalpa
Exits at . -- Xiao Leung 7/8/2000

name: Gemm Mesa to Dalt Mesa
description: Portal from Gemm mesa to Dalt Mesa. Part of the route to Slyph dungeon. BE aware of grommies waiting at the portal exit. Exits at -- Jalpa

name: Lifestone
description:
Next to an empty house. -- Fatima
This place is a trap - lots of Vet Reedsharks, Shreths, and other nasties that like to hide on the radar here. Theyre right next to the lifestone. Dont use it. -- Baroku 4/24/2000

name: Mosswart Tower
description: A tower with about 15 Barkers, Mudlurks, one Shaman and a chief. Good loot.., Assortment of elder and younger reedsharks nearby -- Michelle La-pui

name: Fort Tet Playground
description:
If youre going to make it around the Ft. Tet area, this is the place to start checking if you have what it takes. This flat area is Ft. Tets petting zoo -- filled with all your favorite direlands denizens: tumeroks, gromnies, copper golems, and monoguas having a wild time to name a few. Shadows and wasps come and go, as do lots and lots of heros. There are archer rocks near the north and south edges, and the Ft. Tet mage shop is near the archer rock on the north edge. -- Doc Feelgood
If you made it this far you are already at Ft.T. 4/13/2000

name: Skeleton Swamp Temple
description: Skeleton Captain, a few Warriors, no interesting loot on captain. In the southeast end of the swamp. Looks cool, strange translucent thing on the floor inside. Worth going for the looks of the place. -- Deaths Warrant

name: Drudge Cave
description: Small cave with Drudges and their food. 3-5 Skulkers/Slinkers/Sneakers. -- Ibn Schachabo

name: Two Statues
description:
Two Statues in the hills SW of Qalabar. Nothing really here (yet). Only a couple druges and Red Wasps near. It really looks like somewhere a portal would be... -- Dunc
Nothing here yet. Higher level monsters though, level 15 -20. 12/13/01 -- Ronnabs GF 12/13/2001

name: Cave
description: Layout is light and airy, an early-era design, fun to wander around in. Lockpick is needed to explore it fully. Populated with Augmented and Ascendant Tumerok, Augmented Drudge, and Wasteland Rats. Tieable, summonable, no level restrictions. Portal is inside a fort surrounded by Augmented and Ascendant Tumeroks. At the end is a locked door which can be picked or is opened with the High Tumeroks Key obtained in the fort at 34.5S, 49.8W. Inside is a chest that contains a Heavy Tumerok Key. This Key opens the front door to the fort at 50.7S, 81.8W -- Slim Shady -- Doc Feelgood -- Polecat -- Nodoka

name: Three Stone Monoliths
description: Three Stone Monoliths in a line that is east-west on top of a snow covered hill. There are no markings on the monoliths. -- Chiun Zen

name: Lifestone and a House
description: Nice little place to hunt around. Tuskers and mites galor. -- Arcilite

name: Tumerok Tower
description:
Tumerok Tower. A Warrior, a couple of scouts, a few workers. And no chest. -- Coulthard
The warrior can be sniped as he is standing in a window at the top of the tower, however, unless you have a lockpicker the loot with go with him as the door to this tower is now locked. -- Jann 9/30/2000
You cant pick this lock, unless you can handle a resistance in excess of 2000 difficulty. This tower is part of the Dansha-kis Ring and Gem of Portal Recall Quest.
