Her pack of spell comps is at the top of the tower. The key is found in the Tumerok House at 9.0S 73.7E, but you must speak to Yu Vuo-ki Gold at 6.6S 70.7E to start the quest. Need a Tumerok Insignia. -- Harkoth 11/20/2000

name: North End of Lost Wish Range
description: This is the north end of the Lost Wish Range escarpment. South of here you wont be able to cross from NE to SW until you get to Beach Pass at 44N, 65E. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Broken Lifestone
description: A non function broken life stone holder inside of a small stone building. Not very exciting, with little of interest in the area. The river seems to end/begin here. If you follow the river north west from Holtburg yuo will end up here. Why I went this way I do not know. If there is anything of note near this it is still a mystery. -- Malloc

name: Merchant & Mage Tent
description:
Just your standard low lvl Gharn mage (few comps and only lead scarabs) and merchant tent (leather and generic weapons). A Lifestone sits about two steps south of it. -- Ito Menya (FF)
I stopped by here on the way to Aerlinthe (for the first time) and I noticed that the mage now sells all spell components as well as scarabs up to and including silvers. -- Sixfingers (SC) 2/5/2001

name: Deep South Dires Lifestone
description: Lifestone south of a merchant/mage tent. Southern Dires Coast -- Ito Menya (FF)

name: Renegade Bunker
description: A bunker full of Renegade Tumeroks and Lugians. 2 chests at the bottom with poor loot. -- Taarna Blood SC

name: Signature Hills (Valley of Death)
description:
These hills are badlands. They are not high, but the slopes are steep. The trails through are torturous with many dead ends -- valley trails and crest trails can both end abruptly. Plan your routes through here carefully. The signatures extend from roughly 30S on the north to 45S on the south and 54W on the east to 71W on the west. -- Doc Feelgood
Now known as the Valley of Death as of the Jan 2003 patch, this entire area is filled with the most god-awfully overpowered monsters in the game. Drudge Seraphs, Bile Grievvers, and Tusker Obliterators are just a few of the high-octane, high-HP critters infesting this area
also sighted is the fabled Tremendous Monouga with 2 million HP. This is THE playground of the elite: come with a large group of level 80+ characters and watch the massive XP roll in like never before. -- Confucius of FF 1/27/2003
Also known as Skull Valley, another appropriate choice. -- Doc Feelgood 1/28/2003

name: Valley Crypt
description:
A secluded underground crypt in the Dire valleys. From what I could glean at a distance, it contains many Mu-miyahs (Lesser, Greater, and even lvl 42 Horrible), and a chest or two. I couldnt get inside for a closer look because a group of Panumbris chased me off... :/ -- Lorelai
As reported, but in fact there are two underground bunkers, think the horrible Mu-miyah is level 40. They cast feeble magic, and the entire lot can be cleared in five minutes. Chests are all empty, possibly bugged like all the others. Another worthless place that doesnt belong in the Dires. Most of the critters are around level 11. This place should have been filled with level 40s and up, otherwise why put it in the Dires? -- Goldhart 5/2/2000
This is where the other half of the Staff of the Nomads now lies. Its in an unlocked chest in the larger of the two bunkers, guarded by lots of high level Mu-Miyahs: Guardians, Imperials, Nomads, and two Royals. -- Confucius of FF 4/10/2003

name: Virindi Fort
description:
Coords are approximate. Various nasties near entrance portal (usually Iron golems). 3 Tusker Slaves spawn in entry room of dungeon. Of course, lots of virindi farther in. Didnt go very far as I was alone. Portal in entrance room leads back to the surface portal. -- Arioc
Its 4 tuskers in the entrance room. In the final room some mediocre (around 5k items) floor spawn. when u make the jump be prepared to take about 20 dmg and get swarmed by a dozen puppets..not really worth the trouble tho -- Heart Failure 4/28/2000
One of the doors going further in, up the stairs can be opened by the switch upstairs, go left facing the exit portal, open the door by using [key R] the side lever, and push the lever inside. You also need to control the levers on the ground floor, and then will be able to get further in the complex. Down some stairs, a brief respite as the tuskers and virindi are behind a closed door. Open the door, using a lever, and you are in another area with a couple of tuskers, and virindi. Another pointless empty chest, and an upstairs path that leads to switches to open an exit portal, and a door that leads to the final area. I would not recommend jumping down, as there is little hiding place from a dozen virindi puppets and fairy things, but an exit is placed there, back to the surface. -- Goldhart 5/2/2000
Well what can I say about this place...A great drain spot for lifers...But heed my warning If you see Krow or Ryucho zen in the harvest gain world and myself...get out I will never stop trying to kill them and I dont care who gets in my way... -- Krack of HG 9/18/2000
Goldhart, I would like to note, that your post above is a complete waste of text, and should be deleted. -- Fairy GodMother 7/3/2001

name: Lich Spire
description: Very tall spire with more undead than a George Romero movie: Liches, Lich Lords, Revenants take your pick. Probably about 10-15 total. They spawn on the spire but will jump down onto you if you get close (read massive impact damage). Lot of traffic through this area headed to the Virindi Fort, so usually all the liches end up huddled around the base of the spire waiting to bum rush you if you attack or get close. The spire itself basically has a wraparound path leading up to the top where there are two chests with ... drumroll please ... nothing in them. Usually Ob golems and high level drudges around spire as well. Unless you like lich xp and loot, skip this place and head over to the Virindi fort. -- Arioc

name: Small Black Hill to Black Hill
description:
-- Polecat -- Arioc 4/26/2000
This drops you into the middle of a nasty spawn. It is actually high up on a plateau across the river from Wai Jhou.-- Taarna Blood SC

name: Stone Head
description: A second Stone Head lies just east of the first at 16.6E -- Sundoro Taal

name: Empyrean Stones
description:
A double-circle of standing stones, on the road in Holtburg. Purpose at yet unknown. -- Trez the Handy
If you stand in the center of the stones it now restores your mana. As of 9/12/00. -- Brother Fish 9/13/2000

name: Fort Morntide
description: Nice place, great view. Lifestone nearby, banderlings in easy reach. Even has Revitalizing Vat in the lower level. You can get to the top od the plateau from -- Willow

name: Stone Formation
description: Stone formation at top of hill. A mud golem appears from time to time. Nothing more. Dont use this place as a rest area. -- Asharad Hett

name: S. Direlands Coastal Desert
description: This region between the big crater outer rim and the coast is composed of sandy circular pits surrounded by moderately steep walled ridges -- climable in many places but not all. The pits contain palm trees and plentiful numbers of monsters. The ridges are barren of vegetation, less populated, and easier to travel. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Rat Rock
description: A rock with cavern underneath. There are Desert Rats in the cavern and more come from around the hill when the cavern rats are attacked. Watch out. The rats can jump up and bite your toes through the ceiling. Treasure is high quality food (Auroch healing meat, fresh fish). -- Doc FeelgoodCave is now populated by 4 Banderling Aggressors and 2 Savages guarding a runed chest. -- Jungle Souljah 7/29/2004

name: East Nanto Outpost
description: Starter Town -- Big Red (FF)

name: Olthoi Rock
description: Just half a click south of the Olthoi Tunnels entrance. Never seen it before. This is in addition to the one 2 clicks north that has been reported, and yet another NEW one found 2 clicks east. -- FWH Saxxon

name: Cave
description:
A small cave with 4 outcast monougas. When you come back out, youll be near Cragstone. -- Xyblea
The exit does NOT drop you near Cragstone but at 18.4E, 62.1E. It shares this destination with the cave closest too the drop point. Perhaps a usefull way for a burdened warrior to make it back to Eastham but little else. -- Sundoro Taal 6/8/2000 This is actually the same dungeon as the one to the east of here, I tested by dropping a gem in this one and going into the other one, lo and behold, the gem was there. It simply has two entrances, one exit. A truly pointless dungeon in any case. -- Halcyon 9/12/2003

name: Ayan Baqur
description: Gharundim town located on the western coast of Direlands.

name: Uziz Portal
description: Next to the town of Ayan Baqur. Exits at 24.3S, 28.9E -- Halbarad D.

name: Baishi Portal
description: Exits at . -- Halbarad D.

name: Shadow Crypt
description: Small crypt filled with Shadow Spectres, Phantoms and Wraiths, Bane Grievvers and a Sturdy Steel Chest. -- Chiun Zen -- Chupon

name: The Deep Pit
description:
A very deep, wide, hole in the ground with no way down or back up. Nothing in the bottom could be seen. If you accidently fell in, and survived, the only way out would be to recall possibly. Location coordinates approximate from standing on the edge of the rim. -- Chiun Zen
I went out there with my Jump buffed to over 400 and jumed in to see how deep it is. It is no worse then the jump in the Arwic Subway. There was nothing in there and no way out other then a Recall. -- White Heart 1/12/2002

name: Skeleton Ambush Tent
description: An empty tent on the desert surrounded by a half dozen skeletons and a couple skeleton warriors. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Stranger in Town
description:
A 2nd villa south of Yaraq. Nothing there yet.
The Stranger in Town is now here which is part of the Elysas Favour quest -- Jaz (Solclaim) 1/23/2002

name: Farmer
description:
Just a farmer out in the middle of nowhere. -- Devyn
His selection is nice for a cook, however: rice, beef, flour, honey, fish, chicken, brine and rennet. He also sells prepared food. Now, wasnt there something about Dryreach being starved? Blockaderunning Chefs rejoice. -- Immacolata 3/23/2001

name: Lithos Shrine
description: A pair of flame-topped pillars and a pair of tall trees mark off the corners of a diamond. A Lithos Lugian stands between the pillars, and, when we were there, another roams around as a guard. -- Obunaga & Haak

name: Sunset Execution Stones
description: Two pillars, each with a dead body attached to it facing west. -- Zloth

name: Skeleton Crypt (a.k.a. Skeleton Trap Cave)
description:
This a spot similar to the Drudge house in Holt, or the newly added Skeleton Trap Tent. Z Black Dragon Z and I entered only to be attacked by millions of Skeletons. -- Lukan Shilh
There are 3 Skeletons in a Crypt. 3/3/2001
Not much of a trap anymore. 3 Skeleton Lords spawn here, and a Weathered Red Key spawns in the back corner, for use in Sylsfear, no timer on pickup. -- Hentaya (HG) 1/23/2003

name: Another Olthoi Rock
description: This one didnt make it the first time. East and slightly south of the Olthoi Tunnels, this brings to 3 the number of roakcs with 4 workers in the vicinity. Location might be just a tad off, but it is there nestled in a shallow canyon past on the other side of the mountain from the Dungeon. -- FWH Saxxon

name: Crater Entrance/Exit
description:
To my knowledge the only crater entrance and exit make sure to go to the exact coords to get in. You may see places where u can get in but u cant. Do not jump in one of these places because you will die. -- Critical Hit
A little unclear... you may see places where u THINK u can get in but u wont be able to trust me... only way is 65.2N 11.1E. -- Critical Hit 5/7/2000
Seems to be gaurded by 3 flames as of late... -- Pit the Fencer 10/31/2000

name: Skeleton tent
description: The tent has 2 Skeleton Lords inside along with a chest that spawned descent loot. Outside nearby there 3 Skeleton Lords around what looks like to be a sleeping area.

name: Farmer
description: Nothing here but a Farmer and his cow. Is a nice place to mule though. -- Big Red

name: Ma'yad ibn Ibsar
description: This NPC asks you to look for her missing brother (Abmim ibn Ibsar)and gives you a place to start. She also offers a reward of 300 pyreal when you return his jambiya to her.

name: Corpse of Abmim ibn Ibsar
description: This is the location of the corpse of Abmim ibn Ibsar. Gaurding it are 4 shallows sharks, and 3 shallows lurkers. on his body is Abmims Jambiya and couple misc items -- Bloodstorm

name: Tumerok Canyon
description: Canyon with walls at either end guarded by Tumerok warriors, priests, fighters, scouts, and others. Some sort of structures with zombies in them, not sure what else. Coordinates are for northern wall by beach. Canyon continues south, not sure if you can exit that way. -- Shiera

name: Mosswart Hangout
description:
A Lone building with bunches of Creeper Mosswarts, Mosswart Feeders, Drudge Prowlers inside and out. Theres also a lot of other critters in the area. -- Big Red - (FF)
There is also some very good loot off of the Azure Grommnies that hangout near the east tower..i once got a bd3 katar and a bd2 2-5 cestus off ofem, but I am currently camped there along with about 10 others so it is fairly hard to get xp and loot. -6/28/2000 -- Cuumark 6/28/2000

name: Mysterious Tunnels
description:
Near Nanto. No Level Restrictions. Mostly Drudge Skulkers, with a couple Prowlers. Gnawer Shreths down one tunnel. Contains a quest item for Miyako of Nanto. (Note: Quest item cannot be dropped, only given) -- Nonnus II
Restricted to levels 1-5. Portal out of dungeon at entry point is to Yanshi. Didnt explore past finding the book so it is unknown if there is a surface portal or other town portals. -- Cuttler Strngmd 8/26/2000
There are no other portals, only the one to Yanshi, this is to make the quest tougher, this is very harsh on newbies, who think they will appear near nanto, but instead are plopped in the middle of nowhere to hopefully find Yanshi nearby, took me 25 minutes by begging for help and finding portals to get back to Nanto, and thats all without the quest item. -- Sadness 9/3/2000
The Yanshi portal is now gone and has been replaced with a surface portal. Drudge and Gnawer Shreth. The dungeon is divided into four elemental sections. The fire section is real cool, a must see. -- Dr. Faustus 9/16/2000

name: Tower
description: Just a tower on a ridge ... nothing much except a good view at the top ... -- Blayd

name: Lugian Fort  / Third Lugian Raider Camp
description:
Lugians galore. Everything from Lithos to Laigus. About 8-10 lugians with a couple of limestone golems nearby. Approach the fort from the south, and you can hide behind the south wall until they run out of rocks. Lifestone and peddler and healer to the west. Banderlings, mossworts, and reedsharks in the surrounding hills. Mattekars (great, snowy, and white) in the mountains to the south. Good place for melee fighters from their upper teens to mid twenties. -- Minas Tirith
Bigger Lugians now (Gigas and Extas) and the Dread Mattekar can be found here. Spawn cycle is about 5 minutes. -- Tanu (MT) 4/21/2001
Location of the Commander and LTs for the Blade of the heart, used for the Spear of Purity -- Korgan (DT) 5/22/2001
The Lugian Commander drops the lugian paduons, used to get the helm of craig. There is LS at 67.3S 28.3E, pretty good place for level 30+. Lugian Titus raiders with hollow weapons spawn when the lugian commander at the 2nd camp is killed. -- BuffDaddy -MT 8/27/2001

name: Windmill on Plateau
description:
Ka Ku-To can be found near these three windmills up on the Plateau. Ka Ku-To sells the key that opens the Inner Dungeon Doors. (Also sells nice plate armor.) Area has a few level 15 flames - fire elementals - bring your fire protection. -- Blayd
The fire elementals are confirmed as flares. Also some Tiofor Ursuin near the windmills as well, but I believe the flares are more permanent. The key for the inner dungeon costs 290p, and Ka Ku-To does take trade notes. -- Duryn 11/26/2000

name: Castle on a Hill
description: Castle with four towers on a steep bluff, couldnt find a way up. Four towers glow at the top -- An Tse

name: Ayan Baqur Lifestone
description:
-- Amaranthae
Life stone in the town of Ayan, starting get laggy here because of the huge gatherings of people around it -- Ffej IV 9/28/2000

name: Bowyer & Farmer
description:
Bower sells armor p, 100 for 500p 4 cows... -- Alya
Farmer Pogget sells all thinkable kinds of bags, and a basket. Iron chefs might pick up chicken, meat, grapes, egg, cheese, cabbage, bread and apples. Immacolata -- 8/29/2001

name: Climbable slope
description:
The only place I know of that you can reach the plateau E of the LS/shop from. Beasties up here include Tumeroks, Granite and Sandstone golems, and Ash gromnies. --Rukkus Bloodbane
Only a problem north of this point, south the cliff is easily climbed for a long distance. -- Doc Feelgood 4/11/2003

name: Abandoned Tower
description: On the upper beach, just E of the Qualabar portal. Empty :(     -- Rukkus Bloodbane

name: Mountain Entry Point
description: Access from the upper beach into the mountains, just S of the abandoned tower. Beats running all the way around to the escalator slope. From these coords, head W into the little pit, then turn N. You have to run along some edges, but it gets you up there for some excellent good ole-fashioned Dires hunting.     -- Rukkus Bloodbane

name: Grievous Vault to Samsur
description:
Theres a portal to Samsur in the Grievous Vault. after the first drop, turn right and head down the corridor to a crossroads. The room to the left is empty except for assorted furnishings, an altar, and a flame trap. However, there are fake walls: one on wall paralleling the Altar and to its left (which leads to a bunch more traps in a small room with an empty chest), and another fake wall just right of the altar. This second one leads directly to the portal, no traps. I put it on the map and not in the vault section so that the Shortest Path part of Explorer will take advantage of it. Exit -- Orome
The triple-trapped chest hidden in the altar room has good loot. It is NOT empty. I found a pair of Impenetrability IV Steel Toe Boots and a high-base Simi inside. -- Jadok al-Siran 10/11/2000
The chest is not empty but it doesnt spawn anything near that good.I found some leather bracers and some darts.maybe they nerfed this chest?Of course nerfing it is better than what they are doing with all the quests in that game.you know.handing them to the lockpickers on a silver platter. -- Sega Slayer 4/16/2001

name: Direlands Swamp Life Stone
description: Lots of nice spawns around this one. -- VanyelAshkervon

name: 3 Pillars w/Pool
description: Not sure if the pool aids mana regen or not. I was too busy frantically trying to slay the 3 Dark Wisps before they got off too many IV and V bolts.     -- Rukkus Bloodbane 5/25/00

name: Healer in House
description: Healer in a house near Cow pen East of Holtburg. House is surrouneded by Drudges and a few young banderlings only 1 scout. Sells Good Healing kits and a few spells. Well casts revitalize. -- Lou Ti

name: Nanto Provisioner
description: The provisioner carries, among other things, Red, Yellow, and White packs. -- Polecat

name: Gonjoku Ryumi Shopkeeper
description: Armor, books, food, keys, miscellaneous, and blue, red, and purple packs. -- Polecat

name: Rahira bint Hisan
description: Shop Keeper of Yaraq, all of the usual provisioner stuff, including light blue, yellow, and green packs. -- Polecat

name: Lifestone
description: Lifestone -- Dresden

name: Tumerok Tower
description:
Right next to the Slaughter house/Fort Teth portal, this seems to be the home of a bunch of Tumeroks trying to be farmers...3 or 4 warriors, an officer, and a couple scouts overlook a swarm of cows and Auroch cows. -- Rukkus Bloodbane 5/31/00
Could this be a sighting of the cow riding Tumerok mentioned by the alcoholic town crier in Ayan Baqur? -- Raja Khamadan 6/3/2000

name: Tumerok Outpost
description: This is the low-walled reinforcement building Doc speaks of in his Slaughter House description. Lots of tumeroks here...nothing tougher than a Priest that I could see. Excellent hunting between here and the big Slaughter House...sandstone, copper, iron, granite golems, gold wasps, drudge lurkers/raveners, some dillos, and of course lots of Tumeroks. Oh, and the occasional Umbris/Penumbris spawn SW of the Slaughter House.     -- Rukkus Bloodbane 5/31/00

name: North Desert Ridge
description:
exits at . -- Doc Feelgood
Actually it now exits at 4.7S, 3.1W. -- Immacolata 5/21/2001

name: Desert Ridge Border
description: exits at -- Doc Feelgood

name: Portal Fort to Hebian-To
description: Inside Portal Fort, exit at 38.6S, 82.1E -- Blayd

name: North Edge of Beach Cliffs
description: South of here the cliff between the beach and the highlands becomes unclimable in most places until you get south of the Beach Pass region. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Golem's Stone
description:
3 golems spawn next to a standing stone, popular with campers -- Xang lo
4 golems actually. the stone is surrounded by fires that fill up with drudges and low level shreths. A little further down the hill, and youll find things like reedsharks & banderlings. A good place for a low lvl group to get exp. -- Al-Tuvah 8/8/2000
Four mud golems spawn right by the stone, with a fifth just down the hill. Downhill towards the south and particularly the west things like Dolls, low-level Lugians, and low-level Tumeroks can be found. There are also lots of Mites, Bandys, Wood Golems,and Mattys in the area. This area served as my main hunting grounds in my early and mid teens until I switched to the Lugian Citadel at level 16. -- Wylfghar 12/7/2001 There is one sandstone golem amongst the mud golems, warning to low-levels. There is a Runed Chest here, locked (diff 100). -- Halcyon 9/11/2003The Mud Golems that were here are now Sandstone Golems and the Sandstone Golem is now a Sand Golem -- Armin 5/26/2004

name: Two Pillars
description: Two pillars on top of a mountain in the Kara area. No apparent purpose to them. -- Khendra

name: Black Spawn Den
description:
Found by my buddy Joeis Mage, who was running ahead of me:-)..2 tusker slaves near portal entrance detered us from exploring further as we both had vitaes -- Karasawa Yukio
Hmm, strange, so maybe there are two? I was in the dungeon at . Tusker slaves on first level, guards starting from level below. Nice place -- Sargoth of OIF 6/7/2000
With the june patch, it seems they have added multiple entrances(two) to each major dungeon... -- Shugyosha 6/7/2000
Three. -- Mengar 6/7/2000
This place is solid tuskers. The top level is all slaves but the levels below it are guards. Awesome XP. Id suggest travelling with a group or else youll get overwhelmed very easily. -- Flake 6/10/2000
Dangerous place for the unprepared. Exellent xp if you can handle the respawn rate. Dont count on fighting individual Tuskers
expect at least 3 or 4 to attack you at once, usually more. One way tie to portal
you can only tie from outside so that you appear inside, and if someones dragged a score of Tuskers to the entrance and youre not buffed, then be ready for the LS :). Ive never managed to hit the very bottom, but have made it to the third level down before our party of six was reduced to two through deaths or playing the chicken :) Encountered Slaves on first level with the odd Guard, all Guards on levels below plus a Virindi (sp?) Servant in the main hall on the second level. If anyones gone further then let us know whats down there :) Massive value of loot just lying around the place because most come here just for the xp
however quality of loot is terrible unless youre after colour co-ordinated armour. Huge lag here, but that might just be my connection (I play from the UK). Expect to see a lot of people here during peak times. Be ready with the curses when that Tusker youre tanking starts being drained by some level 20 Mage who runs as soon as a Tusker turns on him :). Average level of player Ive seen here is 38. -- Laz al-Farah 6/16/2000
There are two ramps that go down. I have only taken the one to the right, and at the bottom of that once you go down the hallway, and if your solo youll die, there is a room with an uber chest 2 virindi masters, and i think 3 or 4 guards. Safest thing is to back into a corner when in trouble if your a mage, and just start imperiling the tuskers. Once imperiled the archers and meleers jump on em. Great xp for a lvl 40ish archer fellowed with the same lvl life mage. -- Theneler ( TD ) 6/22/2000
Lamest, the most idiotic dungeon of Dereth. Really efficient ruining of gaining levels with effort. Little over 30s mages running around at peak hours draining Slaves to 1/4 and then portal recall and same again. Most people dont even bother to finish off the tuskers at all - just waiting to someone else to get their attention. This dungeon is making more selfish and idiotic powerlevelers to Dereth. -- Finkish 6/29/2000
Rooms are big, hallways are wide, the tuskers move about easily, and wall working is hard. Life mages have compensated by innovating a gang work technique instead, and have prospered. (It is nice that this game can be played in many ways.) -- Doc Feelgood 7/1/2000
The left down ramp leads to a Servant and then several large areas with lots of guards. Following this a ways youll get to a big hall with alcoves on the sides of it, with tuskers in. At the end of this hall is another ramp down with about 12 Drudge Ravs and Stalkers, and a couple of Virindi. Theres a chest in the room with the drudges (uber I guess). Two locked doors after this, followed by a long hallway up and an exit portal. Why would a mage drain a slave to 1/4 and then portal out? Who kills the tuskers then? I never see anyone draining for 2/3 or 3/4 and running -- people kill what theyre fighting... oh well. Sorry your experience isnt better Finkish... =( -- Chen Kenichi 9/8/2000
BSD Ayan Baqur on DarkTide was nerfed, down to 8 tusker spawn near the uberchest, still alright hunting on a 7 minute spawn... -- -PsychoStarfire 10/13/2000
The XP is good...if you can get it. Three words best describes this place...TOO MANY MAGES. I spent too much time trying to find my own kills. In the end I gave up and began kill stealing, its the only way to get the good XP everyone talks about. My level 52 guy can easily take these tuskers on, but its a real fight trying to keep your kills. Its no better than Qualabar Citadel and the lag is even worse (at least at the Teth BSD it is). Mages are only after the tuskers and will flee when confronted by high level drudges and virindi. Back to OHN or Lugian Excavation for me. Loot is much better, XP is almost the same and Mages there are very rare. -- prok 2/19/2001
I dont know what everyone is smoking but I am lvl 38 mage and with my draining and my lvl 6 buffs, Tuskers are about as hard to kill as an ant. Trust me any mage which casts 6s will kick tusker ass, only problem with BSD is such a slow spawn rate, and it almost forces us to steal kills :( -- Ghandalf 7/25/2001

name: Hall of Metos
description:
New Dungeon near Ayun B with a portal that can be tied. Didnt go too far but Lichs and lots of them in the first room -- An Tse
There is a couple of key chests in here. When you get past the liches, you will find Obs golems and Revs. Nothing but a surface portal at the end. -- Tayway(TD) 6/7/2000
Additionally there are two rooms with quickly respawning granites and irons -- Timm 6/27/2000
The acid pits have 1 illusionary wall in them
its the wall facing the hallway as you jump over to get to the Iron Golems. So if you fall in, you can still make it out alive....once you get past the Revenants or have Item Magic. Additionally, there are 2 Obsidean Golem rooms...easy to get overwhelemed when being attacked by 5 of those puppies. -- Khaos 8/2/2000
PLEASE NOTE: The dungeon and suface portals can no longer be linked nor summoned to. -- Psy 8/9/2000
Dont know when they changed it but you can now Tie to the entrance portal and summon. -- Fleshreaper 6/27/2001
Geez, Turbine make up your mind. I get the message that I cant tie to entrance or surface portals when I try. I have not tried the one at the bottom though and will do so soon. 7/6/01 -- Hrothgar 7/6/2001

name: Cursed Swamp
description:
Couldnt enter, cap is level 5-15, but I am sure it is one of the new dungeons introduced with the june patch.6/6/2000 -- Sis. Immacolata
Many many mosswarts, from creeper to barker/mudlurk. No shaman. In many of the winding passages there are tons of traps, mainly acid. As you are entering the tunnels, the traps will miss you almost every time... But, if you are running out of the tunnel chased by mosswarts, you will be hit almost every time, so watch out. A few minor chests, not much else. -- Fenping-TD 6/7/2000
Area surrounding portal is clear, but the foyer is a hot zone with six or so mudlurks ready to greet you. Design is swamp dungeon, including solid cattails that act as barriers to movement and war magic. -- Doc Feelgood 6/9/2000
I was plaing on darktide and jumped in here to escape from some PKs who were camping the sho roadside portal exit.BAD IDEA..dont come in here unless you can solo AT LEAST FOUR mosswarts who will come at you FROM ALL SIDES. -- death to you ha 3/24/2001

name: Olthoi Horde Nest
description:
New dungeon discovered in the recent prop on 6/6/00, what ancient horrors await us in this new dungeon? PROBABLY OLTHOI. Level 30+ -- Embryodead
Dont bother going here i alrady killed all the olthoi. DEAD -- Dagger McGee 9/24/2000
This dungeon is not there at the mentioned coordinates. No sign of it. -- Brindle 10/21/2000
It is most definitely there. -- Adric the Red 2/4/2001
If you cannot find this dungeon via AC Explorer DO NOT goto 55.3S 43.45E. OHN is not there, you will need to go to 55.8 *NORTH* 43.5E to find it. Its not very far from the Bandit Castle OHN. -- prok 2/23/2001
It appears that AC Explorer is not properly updating dungeon info when theres a coordinate conflict such as this. I doubt this post will be of any help to AC-E users are they will never see it unless they come to this site. -- prok 2/24/2001

name: Black Dominion
description: Moved in the Treaties of Stone event (July 14, 2004), to 88.6S, 25.9W from 49.0S, 66.4W Tieable, Summonable, Exit to surface just inside. This is now where you upgrade the Blue Singularity weapons to Purple (Martinate Holding for changing Purple to Green ). Be careful in this dungeon, If you die with your Blue weapon, you will lose it. At that point you must wait a week to begin again. You need lockpick to get to the bottom, there is a 40 resistance locked door near the top. The top of the dungeon has altered drudges and as you continue down you meet Virindi Observers, Executors and Terberous Hollow Minions in good quantity. You can lure many of the Hollows into a pit near the bottom of a large room and snipe them from above. At the very bottom there is a room filled with blue crystals, a few SIK chests and a blue Virindi NPC (Virindi Castaway, level 11) that asks you to hand him a Singularity weapon for an upgrade. -- Buttros -- Brassyl -- Virindi Inquisitor of TD -- Seeker -- Lila_MT

name: Olthoi Horde Nest
description:
Level 30 and above. So I could not enter it. -- Pounce, HG
Well, first floor full of workers, about 15 second respawn time, go one ramp down and full of soldiers, same respawn time, very narrow hallways, if someone is being attacked and runs, those who wait to late will die. They will be trapped within this mess. Farther down you come to a room which everyone calls the ""flood room"". Not sure how many have been here. Narrow hallway going into this room, soldiers swarm in. I did not have time to approximate the number of soldiers here because there was just to many to count. I would say at least 50 hit this room at once if not more. 3-6 uber chests found so far. Unless you like vitae, I wouldn't go to far down. -- Eichschet 6/8/2000
Spawn time is now more like 2-4 minutes. It isn't bad if you are alone in there, but with 5 or more people running around, it is a mad rush to try to get some bugs to yourself. -- T-Bird (HG) 9/1/2000
If you're coming up from Zaikhal, make SURE to come at this dungeon from the east. It's in an impassable box canyon from the west. I hate mountains. Stupid, stupid, stupid design. Wasted 45 minutes running around trying to get down, so at least you get to save time if you go. -- Arisana 11/25/2000
The surface to this dungeon is very quiet, great place to buff and also has a nice view of the landscape. At the bottom of the dungeon usually has a surface portal, but not this one. No the Zak OHN has a portal at the bottom that takes you to the Bandit Castle OHN (surface of course). This is great for when Zak OHN becomes too camped, but then again so is Bandit OHN. There are 2 Uberchests in the dungeon, I would fully ignore the 2nd chest on the 3rd floor (in the flood room where about 20-30 Olthoi Soldiers spawn in a large room with a narrow entrance hallway). Ive gotten nothing but crap (Gems.? Stam elixors.? im insulted..). Note: Olthoi Soldiers become alot easier to deal with when using Level V protects. Acid and Piercing IVs just dont cut the mustard. -- prok 2/12/2001 Has been moved to 40.4N, 34.5E from 48.9N, 12.9W. -- Armin 12/12/2004

name: Ridge Citadel
description: Gotrok Montok, Gotrok Extas, Extas Raider, Gotrok Tiatus and a sik chest.

name: Dungeon of Corpses
description:
Millions of Drudge Raveners, Stalkers and Lurkers and some Virindi Servants, really fast spawn. At least 2 uber chests. -- Snake
Less ravs, more stalkers and lurkers. Virindi are servants, not too many. 2 uber chests in the same room. another chest that I check repeatedly but never got anything. -- Theneler (TD) 6/9/2000
Warning to people without item magic, it is possible to get trapped in this dungeon, without a way out. There is a lot of jumping from this to that in this dungeon, and there is one spot near the end that you cant get out of without recall or summon. I counted at least 4 chests when I was there. -- IpNomad (LC) 7/23/2000
Lots of Stalkers and Lurkers. Only a few Raveners. No Altered Drudges. There's about 3 Virindi Servant spawns in there. Be careful now that the virindi cast bludgeon vuln, the drudges can hurt while they're kicking... The above poster was correct, there is one room that has no way out unless you can recall. 2 uber chests, 2 chests I didn't check, and 1 chest-not-so-uber. -- Garfield Bond 8/5/2000
This is a great place for lifemages 25+, tons of stalkers and such to drain, and once there all dead (nearly an endless supply of them) you can jump down, and collect your uber loot. Really nice. ;) -- Tiabin 9/21/2000
Dunno about collecting ""uber loot"". I usually jump down and collect a fish or two, a gem or two, and a heavy virtually worthless shield or two. Stalkers here seem to drop even worse loot than outdoor Stalkers and I've never found a Rav gut here (although it seems Turbine has lowered the gut drop rate considerably everywhere). Fun place to meet some wall-huggin life mages and perched archers, though ;) -- Janx Spirit 10/18/2000
The above post about not being able to exit the last room is incorrect. The room in question is the one with the 2 uber chests and the virindi in the middle. If you take the tunnel opposite the stairs and go left, at the end you will come upon a set of iron bars. Those bars can be opened. Jumping down puts you near the main entrance. Makes a great escape route in case you get ovrewhelmed. -- Kisama Ryoken 11/21/2000
Your incorrect about the non-drop of Rav Guts..I have gotten 6 guts there....but it took me from level 25-30 to get them... -- Rykar Stonestel 1/19/2001
guts, keys and Xp best place i have every been too. It is a power lvl Powerhouse when it's not camped. Lots of fun stuff out side when it is camped -- the dead 1/23/2001
If you're a mage with melee defense you can buff with 6's and jump down into the ""pit."" You will get many more kills using war spells than the life mages will camping on the ledge....but it does take some big balls to pull it off against 7 or 8 stalkers. -- Happy Spellmore 6/16/2001
How times have changed... now a lonely place. -- Doc Feelgood 1/4/2003

name: Village Lifestone
description: Near the North Desert Edge portal and Three Merchants NW of Zaikal -- Wei Kou Gai

name: Hills Citadel
description: Gotrok Obeloth, Gotrok Lithos, Gotrok Gigas, Gotrok Montok, and still has a SIK Chest. -- Zen Tek Ken 9/19/2003

name: Lugian Barbeque
description: 8 Laigus Lugians and a Litho Lugian having a barbeque in the mountains. -- Erik of Frostfell -- Erik

name: Direlands Life Stone
description: Surprisingly a lifestone in the middle of nowhere. -- Buttros

name: Location of Bai Den's Gem
description: The gem is part of the shoushi starter dungeon quest. 6/7/2000

name: Murk Warrens
description:
North of Zaikhal. No entry restrictions. Full range of basic Mosswarts in early stages and most of the Banderling race in the later stages. Spawn is very rapid and large groups are encountered. Always some more rushing to help the current bunch youre fighting. Didnt find much beyond the locked doors except a surface portal leading to the entry point. Theer were parts of the dungeon we may have missed through our exploration and constant battling. Found by Agamemnon. Fought through by Katsumii, Agamem, Chibi and God. -- Katsumii
This place is Full of Mossworts, mudlarks barker, shamans at least as far a I got, which Wasnt far. The respawn is fast and I only got a little way in by myself before I was ankle deep in mossie corpses.. It is rather large and you should definately take a group just to keep up with the respawn. Or take lots of stamina potions.. -- Stranyr alQroni
Futher Down you get knee deep in Banderlings, Breeders, Captains, Ravers, Guards, Raiders .....made it to the end and thats about it -- The Vampire 6/24/2000
Great place for levels 15 and up for experience. Re-spawn rate is incredible. Above notes correct, bring stamina potions with you...preferable in bucket loads. -- Leifson 6/26/2000
This is the ULTIMATE place for a mid sized lvl 15-25 group to lvl. You want a challenge, you wanna see some of the coolest battles in all of dereth? Youve come to the right place. Murk Warrens has only 2 BREEDS of monsters. Mosswarts (Feeders-Cheifs) in the first half, and Banderlings (Scouts-Ravers) in the second half. In 1st area if the dungeon, the monsters only rush in at the front (about 5-15 at a time). As you progress in the dungeon, they come in about 20 at a time, in front, and 10 rush in from the back. Oh, and remember that the respawn time is 2 mins, so alot of times, as you kill 1 wave, another wave will spawn behind you. I didnt know my way around too well, because it is dark, and so is my monitor (it REALLY REALLY sucks), but when you get to a locked door in the mosswart area, DO NOT GO IN FOR GODS SAKE. There are about 10 moss cheifs and 50+ other mosswarts that will rush out as you open it. Besides that, when you are fighting that group, youll get side rushed by a group down another hallway. There is also a room in the banderling area with the same situation, but diffrent look. Just look for the locked doors. This place IS NOT reccomended for mages =P. I know because I am one (lvl 22 all schools mage), and I went with a group of Melee fighters. If your a mage, stay in back and cast de-buffs on the stronger guys and heal, & infuse stamina on your allys. If you waste mana using war spells, your done for because theyll start to rush YOU. If your in a group, make sure all the melee fighters are lvl 20-35. Mages can be any level (we had lvl 11, 17, 21, 24, and 32 melee fighers, and me, as a lvl 15 mage). -- Al-Tuvah 8/8/2000
The dungeon is new school with heroic physical dimensions and spawn rate. A nice place for mixed levels to work on leveling. Entrance and foyer are both safe. Running in from Zaikhal (south) is safer than running in from the north. -- Doc Feelgood 10/8/2000
Dont even bother coming here unless you have a small army of low level people with nothing better to do than kill mosswarts.too many for anyone to kill them all alone.Nobody is ever here.why did turbine even make this place? -- Sega Slayer 11/15/2000

name: Collector
description: There is a new collector here. She will take all the normal stuff rat tails, wings, bandies, dillos etc. but no hides. -- Stranyr alQroni

name: North Nanto Lifestone
description: Lifestone near North Nanto Outpost and Training Dungeon. 06/08/2000 -Hidesato -- Hidesato

name: Asuger temple
description:
i just saw a lvl 60 banderling berserker in here. i engaged it with my sword from behind a gate and to my shock and surprise, the dang thing opened the gate and hit me down to 4 hp. at lvl 10 with sword 144 i had no chance. next time ill not try hitting him thats for sure. the rest seems accurate enough. -- Tattoo 1/23/2002
The above changes in the dungeon are because it is now part of the Elysas Favor quest. I will put the details under the Fort Witshire entry since that is the last dungeon you need to go through to complete the quest. -- Krell (LC) 1/23/2002 Mid level Banderlings and Hollow Minions inhabit this dungeon. Toward the end is a large room full of Hollow Minions. This room has a Storage Chest containing a Glass Spherule. Find the key on a hollow, then return the Spherule to Sir Rylanan -- Taarna Blood SC 10/11/2004



The notes below are out of date and for historical reference only.



Really nice banderling temple NW of Holtburg. Cotains Young Banderlings and Scouts at the top and Banderling Guards and Raiders further in. Found 2 chests with gems and 1 level 2 magic ring. Nice design and graphics. I assume this is a new one since I havent seen it posted anywhere else. -- Pyreal Hawk
Level 5+ restriction 6/8/2000
Not the greatest loot, but it does provide some excellent sniping spots for archers and mages, but nothing completely safe. Fun dungeon with nice mists. -- Yoshi Suji 9/12/2000
Yup, went there today with level 10 archer and two mages. We had a blast fighting our way down to the bottom and up again. There are two paths to take. Lots of narrow tunnels and few open places means its possible to have a meat shield protect the flimsy mages. One of Dereths better low level dungeons. -- Immacolata 5/12/2001

name: Black Spawn Den (2)
description:
Seems to be similar to the one at 56.6S, 86W. 3-4 Tusker Slaves at entrance, lots more deeper in. Managed to get my first +20% vitae at this place but the xp is incredible... Not sure if theres another level (I didnt find one) but didnt go all the way through. -- Steve Al-Thos
Level 20+ -- Steve Al-Thos 6/8/2000
This dungeon really sux. -- BaelZevuv 6/8/2000
Sucks? Its awesome. I can earn a million xp in maybe 4 hours max. its awesome. -- Theneler ( TD ) 6/22/2000
Its pretty easy to die in here if youre not careful, but its a great place to get XP. There are no safe rooms here. The front room occasionally has tuskers in it because someone brought them up there. This is a great place for a small group of mages to lvl up. The surface portal cannot be tied to, only the entrance portal. Just be sure to bring all your bludgeoning protects. -- Garfield Bond 8/5/2000
this place is easy if you are buffed with pros and banes -- Gordan 8/19/2000
I dont have anything against mages, just mages who insist on casting on the tusker im fighting when there are 10 tuskers on me. Get your own tuster buddy :) -- Fullcrum 11/4/2000
Good tying point for Obs Plains hunting. Steel chests nearby. -- Khazeh al-Qunat 7/13/2001
Level 20 restriction, but in reality, no 20th lv player will survive in there without serious help. Robe mages beware: if youre not casting at least 5s in item and life you will not survive (and I mean at least.) Great xps if you can get into a fellowship. An OG/BM combo works great in here. -- Tuspec of MT 12/30/2001
This dungeon is amazing, after the monster rebalancing, these tuskers are worth about 20,000 XP per kill. This BSD inparticular is really never camped, because not alot of travelers know about it, and therefor you can make mad levels in no time at all. -- Rush of WE 4/13/2003

name: Nor's Folly
description: Nice dungeon, good place for a party of chars L5-8 or so. Tons of Drudges (Prowlers, Slinker, Sneakers) on a pretty quick respawn. Found two chests, one locked, the other with typical low-level loot. Just be careful as the Prowlers are pretty smart about finding a path to you -- its easy to get swarmed if youre alone. -- Ibn Schachabo 2/24/2001

name: Swamp Temple Key Bunker
description:
This holds the key needed to enter Swamp Temple. Key is lying on the ground at the back of the bunker. It's a Mosswart ambush point, when battle starts a dozen will show up inside and a couple dozen will close from outside. Grab and run works... if you don't get stuck in the crush. -- Doc Feelgood
Stock AL 50 Chain Hauberk and Stock Tachi also spawn in here. If you can, get into the bunker and kill everything in there, and wait for the swarm to go away before heading back out. -- Kinjou Dragoon 1/30/2001

name: Greenmire B&B
description:
This is a lugian house-style dungeon: no portal but three levels deep in the wilderness world. There are about 20 swamp rats and a granite golem greeting you outside. Swamp Rats are lightning breathing brothers of Mountain Rats -- just as ornery, but only half the level. Inside are at least 2 shadows, another granite golem, and 3 liches. Approach from the life stone and arch mage hut just to the north. -- Doc Feelgood
This place has MANY hidden passages and rooms and makes excellent use of optic tricks to hide them. Search Carefully. -- Senshin -MT 9/14/2000
3 liches? Try like 10. A lich lord, 2 shadows, 4 shadow children... this place is really good if you can survive it -- I was able to solo it at level 24. Bring your healing kits and stamina potions, as the liches drain through walls and you WILL need to heal. Oh, and theyre not just optic tricks -- some of the walls are fake and hiding more liches, shadows, and treasure chests. I made 75k XP in about 20 minutes here, which was quite nice for my level. -- Daija of HG 11/26/2001

name: Lugian Citadel
description:
Level 15+, can be tied. Outside entrance is protected by three lugians. Foyer is a hot zone protected by six lugians -- obeloth on up. First level architecture is mostly big corridors. -- Doc Feelgood
Heh. Possibly the only worthwhile thing the Doc has posted in 4 months. -- Son of Spam 6/11/2000
The dungeon is big and essentially one level, with two long arms off the entrance. Its filled with fast, group-genning lugians and little else. Great lugian EP... if you can handle the pace. -- Doc Feelgood 6/14/2000
This is an Exact Replica of the other 2 Citedals. -- Bin Ibn Tabar 11/5/2000
Correction: neither entrance nor foyer are hot, unless someone has been dragging in nearby monsters. -- Doc Feelgood 4/27/2001
In one of the turbine discussions, one of the developers mentioned an invisible door here. Anyone know where it is. I assume it is here because they said the citadel near quab. --Svetlana The Homeless -- SvetlanaTheHome 7/20/2001

name: Le-Ai Rea
description: Just a small house with an NPC called Le-Ai Rea. When you enter he says Lemme alone. And keep my door closed. Not far from the City of the Dead and Mines of Dispair. If you give them a skull from the High Advocate, you will receive the gold key which lets you in, a special 1-use key that opens the door at the bottom of the Mines (to the home of the vortex that powers the Focusing Stone) as well as 12000xp. The High Advocate skull comes from the Three Towers Quest on the South Landbrige -- Windspear -- Ryth-al-Rothgar -- Chia -- Doc Feelgood

name: Empty Aluvian House
description:
Pretty boring. -- Flash
Isnt empty, the lady just doesnt appear on radar and she is right outside. Bring here an insignia from a Tumorok and shell tell you how to save her sister. She says she rewards well. -- Soo Many Voices 10/29/2000
The woman is Yu Vuo-ki Gold. After you give her the tumerok insignia, she tells you that her sister is on the edge of Dryreach and you have 30 minutes to find her. Go to the house at 9.0S 73.7E, and she is locked in the cellar. Her sister, Dansha-Ki, will tell you that she needs her spell components to escape. Tumeroks took her belongings north, just moments ago. After you talk to her, a tumerok guard will spawn. Kill it and it drops bone key, which you must have. Her belongings are in the Tumerok Tower at 6.3S 73.6E. Use the bone key to get in and her pack is at the top. Take her pack to the Tumerok House and give it to her. She will give you a Gem of Portal Recall and Dansha-Kis Ring, which is Magic Resis III & Lightning Resis III (diff: 110). You can only perform this quest once in a set time frame. Not sure how long. Not sure why youd wanna do it more than never. Lots of Tumerok Warriors, Fighters, and Scouts. -- Harkoth 11/20/2000
The Dryreach or Portal Gem Quest is broken. I gave Yo Vuo-Ki (2) Tumerok Medialion and she does nothing. Found further information that Turbine has permanently discontinued this quest because of the portal gem. --Keltor Trynos 05/22/01 -- Keltor Trynos 5/22/2001
Not true, I handed Yo Vou-Ki a tumerok insignia, and she started off the quest. I didnt get to finish it though, due to a disconnect. But I assume since she starts you off when you hand over the insignia it isnt broken. -- Fistandantillus 7/14/2001
Well, I spent 2 days looking for her and she was nowhere to be seen. We killed every Tumerok for miles (inc. Officers) and there were no Insignias dropped. We also could find the Bone Engraved Key. I tend to agree with the theory that Turbine have retired this quest... -- Jaz 9/20/2001 9/19/2001
I just completed the quest fir the portal gem and Dansha-Kis Ring. I found the gold insignia on a Tumerok officer up the hill from the East Direlands Swamp portal (8.1S, 74.4E). 3/16/2002

description:
Clone of the other thoi horde nest dungeon east of Colier. Lots of bugs...better call the orkin man. Lvl 30 limit on this one too. -- Surtor
this OHN,just like the other OHNs, is WAYYYY to camped allmost all the time.come at midnight if you choose to some at all.This OHN is near bandit castle and is easy to walk to from there if you dont have portal magic but keep in mind that bandit castle has no jeweler so you wont be able to loot much if thats where your headed back to. -- Sega Slayer 3/24/2001

name: Hall of Metos
description:
Level 15 and up. Probably a copy of the dungeon by Ayan Baqur. -- Niethra
Liches, Iron Golems, pits of acid (have to jump) -- Krylos (TD) 6/25/2000
Pass liches and jump to acid pit. you will find a secret passage there. there are a lot of revenant here. they cast lvVI spells... -- Elder Merlin 7/20/2000
I have been here several times in the last month and have yet to see anyone else here, probably due to the LS being a long run away. -- Renroc 11/9/2000
The portal here is tieable, the entrance is clear, as is the foyer. Fast gen Lichs and a Lich Lord just beyond the foyer, golems and other monsters beyond that. -- Doc Feelgood 11/26/2000
I spent most of my time hunting here, but got sick of it. Too many level 15 archers camping the Iron room. When a level 15 archer can take on 7 Irons at once, and survive, you know theres something wrong. Anyways, rant aside, I dont know how it is now. If its like the above comment, Im going to grab my tie back there again. But I highly doubt it, since this one is the easiest of the three to get to. -- Duress 11/26/2000
LOTs of revenants (8 in the first part and another 8 passed the Obsidian golems). Heavily camped, but good XP, lots of SIKs, and peas -- Neoson 7/30/2001 Iron Golems, Liches, Great Revenants, Granite Golems, Obsidian Golems, This is a great place to pick up motes and hearts -- Druxus (MT & FF) 6/13/2004

description:
Very Small complex (like a fort) Entrance on the North Side with a Single Tower. I didnt explore, a few Tumeroks and Banderlings outside to take a swipe at you as you run past. -- Heman
Locked front door is opened with the Tumerok Gladiators Key thats found in the Tumerok Mine dungeon at 7.9N, 61.3W. Inside a High Tumerok drops the High Tumeroks Key which opens a door in the Cave dungeon at 47.8S, 83.7W -- Nodoka 3/3/2001

name: Hall of Metos
description:
This dungeon is the one with Liches, Revenants, and assorted golems. Very cool architecture. -- Aphex - HG 6/17/2000
Entrance is clear, restriced to 15+, foyer is clear. But beyond the foyer the gen rate is spectacularly high. Liches and Lich Lords on what seems a one minute gen cycle. -- Doc Feelgood 6/19/2000
Oh thats complete garbage. YOu try to jump across, a simple procedure, yet, hit your head and fall into a pointless acid pit. Remove this CRAP TURBINE Increase the ceiling size or put a portal there. Its nonsense to lose things because of such a stupid stupid feature. -- Goldhart 7/23/2000
There is a wall you can run through at bottom of acid pit. You stand in the middle, jump, then run like heck through the wall to get to other part of dungeon. -- Ceasar Camerion 7/23/2000
In the very beginning, there are, as stated, liches and a lich lord on short respawn. After you run through a little complex full of undead, you can choose between left or right. If you choose left, you have two options. The straight ahead one takes you to a room with granite golems, but the right one leads over an acid pit (jump 130+) and after that a corridor which winds down to a room full of irons on a short respawn. This is a great place for melees of level 25 and up, who can handle the multiple spells. Room also holds a sturdy chest. If you pick right in the corridor you can jump over another acid pit and get to another iron room. In this room there is another corridor leading to multiple Revenants. -- Mr Briefcase 8/12/2000
They call it Paradise for Archers, get some acid arrows and lvl really fast (5000 xp for every iron) -- Neoson 7/30/2001

name: North Mountain Portals
description:
The area between roughly 48N,43E and 61N,52E frequently spawns temporary portals to Aluvian towns and landmarks (Heartland, Hilltop). They appear and disappear at random intervals, with random destinations. There are no permanent portals near here except for Collier to Holtburg (57.5N,37.7E) and Bandit Castle to Eotensfang (65N,49.5E). Dont bother entering the locations of any of the temporaries
I gave up after finding more than twenty of them. Oh, and if youve read this far, I should mention that the entire area is pretty well-stocked with mattekars (white, snowy, and great), golems (limestone, ice, and sandstone), bronze armordillos, and the occasional party of high-end banderlings and monougas. Mites are relatively uncommon, but are usually sentries and squibs. Shadows are rare. Good place to hunt solo for motes, hides, horns, and portals. Warning: since the June patch, diamond golems have appeared a few times, always near other golems. -- jgreely
Excuse me, thats what used to be high-end banderlings
dont worry, they aint the vicious new spell-casters that haunt the Dires. -- jgreely 6/19/2000

Now this place is the home to the Ostentatious Farmer from the Elysas Favor quest. -- Wylfghar 2/28/2002 Sells Carving Knife and Noodle Cutter. Trap door in back leads to basement (only if one is flagged for Elysas Favor quest), where the candle on the wall opens the fireplace. Inside you find lvl 16 rats and a Guard Uniform. Return the Uniform to Sir Tenshin to advance the quest. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/11/2004

Do you write in to describe anything of value? Put your work to better use. -- Morphos (FF) 6/24/2000

However, personally I think this entry fits well. It took at least 10 minutes for a good friend and I to get around these cursed plateaus. If youve ever tried this area, Zaikhal is situated inside a plateau range, truly is hard to find a pass unless you follow a road out of town. These coordinates are helpful, keep them here. -- Garfield3d 6/24/2000
Agreed. Keep up the good work, Doc. I used these coords too. Glad they were here. -- Minas Tirith 7/1/2000

name: Tumerok House
description:
Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat
Actually two houses- one at 8.9S, 73.2E, and the other at 9.0S, 73.7E. They are within sight of each other. Many Scouts, Fighters and Warrios in both, the one to the east seems to be a barracks of some kind and is more crowded. The whole area is full of Tumeroks and they seem to rise up out of the ground. Warriors throw lvl II and sometimes lvl III bolts. Cant give better description as I was almost killed marking the coords. -- Jann 9/30/2000
Eastern house has a cellar, the stairxase is near the northern door. Both houses have two chests upstairs, no loot. There is also what I will call the Tumerok Picnic Area west of the western house, at 9.0S, 72.9E, where a warrior, two scouts and a fighter are having kunch around a small table. Anything you attack in this area will cause reinforcements to come running, but they dont seem very interested in fighting. -- Jann 10/1/2000

name: Tumerok Officer's Camp
description:
Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat
5 or 6 Tumerok warriors, an officer, and 1 or 2 grunts occupy a one-sided defensive barricade. Most are on the ground behind the wall, a couple are on the ramparts. This is a dangerous spot to attack alone as the Tumeroks will not allow you to tease them into single combat, and the firepower coming out of this position, especially the back side, can have a mid level warrior running for cover. Level III magic bolts, and arrows fired by level 20 Tumerok Warriors. The loot is heavy, mostly magic weapons and armor, but Dryreach is visible from the wall. -- Jann 9/30/2000
WOAH. Did I forget to mention that the Officer throws level V bolts?? One shot took almost 100 points off. Also, if you kill a Tunerok within range the others seem to get a fix on you and you will suffer a rain of arrows and magic bolts. -- Jann 9/30/2000

name: Tumerok House
description:
Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat
A little military style combat. Dryreach is under siege, and the Tumeroks have set up this roadblock to restrict travel into the city. You cant really see the house from the road. You will know you are getting close when you see the tower off to the left. If you are travelling on the road you will not see the sentrys until you are caught in a crossfire of quarrels fired from behind the protection of roadside bushes. Best to start from the outside and work your way in. About 4 fighters and 5 scouts guard the road, and sometimes the back side of the house. 2 Warriors are either in or near the house, and they will occasionally fire level III bolts at you. But this is a defensive position, and the Tumeroks fight like humans. They wont chase you far. You have to go in and get them. They like to stand behind cover, bushes, trees, rocks, so archers make sure you have a clear shot. A mid level warrior can handle the grunts pretty easily, but watch the warriors and bring your magic resist or your heal kits, because those bolts sting. When you attack the house itself you may trigger a massive spawn of reinforcements, but they dont seem to want to cross the road, and I have never been able to engage them in battle. Where do they go?? The loot is heavy, and mostly magic. But take it. You will rake up in town, as the prices are quite high. -- Jann 9/30/2000
There are actually two spawning points here, one directly in front of the house and the other is a little ways north. Depending on how long it has been since someone came through and cleaned it out there could be as many as 20 Tumeroks between the two spawns, 4 or 5 of them being warriors. The warriors WILL chase you, especially if they have you injured. -- StoneCold 9/30/2000

This portal takes you to the top of the dungeon listed as Zoobool Tower (21.7N, 19.4E - which you must have just come through, as its the only way to get to this mountain top), just above the dungeons exit portal. There is no exit portal at the bottom of this dungeon, so the only reason to use this upper entrance is to enter, blast the lvl 20 lich, exit back here to the mountain top to heal/recover, and go back in again to blast the lich some more. Not fair for the poor lich. -- Larce Mantoll 10/3/2000

name: Olthoi Stones
description:
Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat
This a a stone which you can jump on and if you stand in the right place you can kill the 5 Olthoi Workers that spawn like clockwork. If you stand in the wrong place you will get killed. This stone is very heavily camped, in fact, some people have moved mules onto the rock and never leave. If you fo during the heavy times you will probably have to share space with 2 or 3 other people. If you are not a high level archer you will get next to nothing out of it. -- Jann 9/29/2000
As of June 01 patch, there are still olthoi workers spawning. Is camped pretty good too by archers. Watch out for a group of Drudge Lurkers, Stalkers and the new Dark Claws that spawn nearby. If you get there attention they will cast level 3 and 4 wars/debuffs on you. -- Jake the Dog 6/21/2001

Three Stone heads lying in the mire. One stands upright and has an entrance in the mouth to a chamber. Its a mosswart ambush spot. -- Doc Feelgood 7/6/2000

Give Lou Ka his Yaoji, found to the west in Drudge Grotto, and he gives you a Stone of Discipline to take to Oi-Tong Ye in Shoushi. -- Immacolata 4/1/2001

description:
Entry is courtesy of -- Polecat
One of the Start Destinations. Advocate Spire, and a merchant, along with newbie quest inside the building. Double click the woman standing by the fountain for a quest involving kitchen knives. -- Punisher Zod 1/24/2001

This is an

name: Direlands Lifestone
description: -- Firath

name: Stone Head
description: A stone Head that looks like the one leading into Sclavus Keep (Dires), but there is no portal, just a little room. -- Niethra

name: Murk Warrens
description:
Murk Warrens: NorthEast of Baishi. No entry restrictions. Full range of Mosswarts and very very rapid spawns. Good for lvl 15+. Didnt get far into dungeon since i was alone. -- kang Wong-Li
Lots of Shamans. Further on you run into Banderlings, then more Mosswarts inlcuding a Chief. We were running low on supplies, so we fought our way back to the exit and left. Still lots to explore... -- Siergen 7/15/2000
If you are 25th or below, this is an excellent place for sellable loot. You can kill/re-kill the first two spawns (regens every minute or so) with little danger and (by being selective) easily make 30k a trip. Portal or LS recall is recommended as this dungeon is quite far from town. -- Sooyoonow 2/10/2001

name: Toppled Stone Head
description: A toppled Empyrean stone head in the middle of a swamp. -- Niethra

name: Murk Warrens
description: West of Stonehold. Probably a copy to the other two Murk Warrens found to date. The top level is full of mudlurk and barker mosswarts, spawning very quickly. Did not go any further. Many banderlings, tuskers, and wood golems around the entrance - not a safe place to rest from the dungeon. Exit portal near the entrance point. -- GladiusHawkwood

name: Lugian Mine
description:
South High Mountains, Near Baishi And Qalabar. Dungeon added During Julys Patch, Contains Ore at the end of the dungeon -- RaidenTheVampir
Rather sparsly populated with Laigus and Amploth lugians embueded with the charming ability to ignore any and all magic, include banes, vulns, war spells, and protects. Magic users: You have been warned -- JA 7/11/2000
The above poster was right. If your a mage you NEED to whip out your atlan, and got get some armor and shield. You can buff you weapon, and stats, however watch out for the dispel magic traps. Mages in robes
be ready to be 1 or 2 hit. Imagine yourself running in there naked. . because you are. -- Theneler 7/12/2000
Get your low quality ore here, makes a hollow weapon same damage as superior atlan but useful for pk as it cant be buffed and ignores armor/imperil/impen/banes -- mengar 7/12/2000
I think its medium quality ore. And yes, mages are screwed here. I got killed in one hit by an obeloth (oops). Mages can avoid the mana drains by running alongside the walls while going through here though. If youre a mage going through here, bring warrior friends to kill for you. -- Garfield Bond 9/9/2000
Poster above is incorrect, it is low-quality ore that you can mine here. Again, mages should just keep the hell out of here. Melees in the high teens to low 20s can make it as long as there are two or more of you. You only need one ore deposit as they are No Drop and useless except to make the Hollow weapon of your choice -- Syndi 9/19/2000
This mine is also a decent place to level if youre a melee. Groups of 3 amploth and laigus up top are no problem, the toughest part will be once you get down to the mining floor/caves about 8 can come at you from both sides if youre not careful. Oh, and if youre looking for the ore, go straight ahead (going around the rings as neccesary) until you get down to the bottom floor. Then go right, and youll find a portal to the surface and the ore. When in doubt, go right. As above, not too tough for a melee in the high teens or low twenties. Remember though, your Armor jewelery is pretty much useless. -- Jadok al-Siran 10/5/2000

name: Garaena the Emissary
description:
Portal to isle called Aerlinthe. Same as portal from Chalicmere Fortress but you dont need picklock and there is no need to fight, of course its 40,000 pyreals more. -- Zoran&SilvrDrgn -- Chia -- Silverion DD -- DaOlthoiKiller
Very near Candeth Keep. Give her a D note and she will summon a 40+ portal to Aerlinthe Island. She will accept and give change for an M note. Many annoying monsters will rush you. -- Taarna Blood SC

name: Catacombs of the Forgotten
description:
Skeleton warriors, captains, and lords. This is the resting (not quite actually) place of Mi Krau-Li. -- Xinister
A note is in the sacrophagous. The Jitte can be found near the Sacrophagous, guarded by a skellie lord. Its not so obvious, I missed it twice. -- Xinister 7/18/2000
Did this quest the first day of the patch, the Jitte is infact lower down the dungeon after the sarcophagous with the note 2 branches lead deeper left and right. Actually they both end up the same way but the Jitte is on the floor in the room farthest to the left guarded by a couple of skele lords and other misc skeles. Be warned the second part of the quest is alot tougher i soloed this place at lvl 34. -- Sem 8/10/2000

name: Chalicmere Fortress
description: This is Chalcimere Fortress -- an oasis in a drear direlands plain. The Gates to this castle are guarded well, the Door has a lockpick resistance of 242. There are reasonably easy jump-up points on the north wall. The fortress is inhabited with Revenant, Mu-Myiah, Obsidian and Diamond Golem, and its a good Diamond Golem hunting area. Spawn rate is slow. Falahda The Emissery opens a portal to Aerlinthe for a C note. -- RaidenTheVampir -- Doc Feelgood -- Silverion DD -- DaOlthoiKiller -- Temunji Sakura -- Taarna Blood SC

name: Lugian Quarry
description:
New for July Patch.Get your red hot medium level ore here. This ore is for the dispel magic potions. Lugains protecting this are carrying hollow weapons (i.e. goes through buffs) Lithos and Oboleths, plus mana drain traps. -- Brother Za
Correct name is Lugian Quarry, this makes it much easier to find when searching for it
) -- Ardak Eaglehear 6/20/2001

name: Krau Li Labyrinth
description:
Hill was only approachable from west side. I assume this is where you take your jitte for new July jitte quest. Top level is all Skel captains and Lords, lower levels were lords and Skel Bone Knights. Oddly never saw an acid weapon. Doors are all lever activated off torches. But I wasn't able to get back to any of them with a 269run in time. must take at least 2 people. Bring friends. -- Senshin-MT
Ok talked to Makish and the final section is Bone Lords,Bone Knights, and some misc. Skel Lords behind the doors. Switches are aparently a major pain. Be sure to be about 35+ lvl to hit the Bone Lords. -- Senshin -MT 7/12/2000

name: Aerlinthe Reservoir
description:
Goes from Dark Revs at the drop in the beginning, to many wasteland (annoying...) rats on you. Then, if you get past the golems, it turns into olthoi city with workers, soldiers and some nymphs. Got stuck at a locked iron door. Not sure if you need lockpicking or a special key--would guess you need a key. -- Parabolic (DT) 9/4/2000
Entrance and exit are hot with Diamond Golems and Alerinth spawn. Foyer is hot with two Dark Revenants. -- Doc Feelgood 11/12/2002

name: Peddler (and farm)
description: Peddler south of Rithwic. Sells armour, paper, clothing, lock picks (plain, crude), food, healing kits (plain, crude), weapons, etc. Only seems to buy weapons though. -- Dunc

name: Setab's Barracks
description: Level 1-10. Small dungeon with Druges. Skulkers, Sneakers, etc. A couple of chests with a few Ps in them. Nothing else special in here. -- DuncNo level restriction. Otherwise looks the same. -- Halcyon 9/12/2003

name: Northwest Direlands Portal
description: Restricted to 35+. Exits 5.5N, 87.5W. This portal is on top of a small obsidian hill, and is yellow. -- Niethra

name: Northwest Direlands Portal
description:
You need to be on the new isle to get to this portal. It lets out at... -- Savage
The portal has a level 35 and higher restriction on it. Good to know for those of level 45 or higher that has access to Aerlinthe. -- Immacolata 9/9/2001

name: Burun Cathedral
description: No level Req. Part of the 40+ Renegade Stone Clasp / Renegade Herbal Kit quest. Contains a locked door near the top (resistance 124). Entrance is clear. Layout of the dungeon is medium-size with large rooms. The main room on the top level is so big that you can get into some interesting in-sight-but-beyond-radar battles. Contains Burun Ruuk Louts and Fiends near the top, with Seers and Soothsayers at the bottom near the chest room. Spawn is quite fast. To open the chest, use Strong Iron Keys from the Small Complex just north of here. Chest contains a Stone Clasp (bracelet), 10 Renegade Herbal Kits and some lore titled "Correspondence." -- Dotto and Temunji Sakura -- Khaos -- Doc Feelgood -- Taarna Blood SC

name: Banderling Camp
description: A banderling camp with banderling captains, guards and raiders, mite diggers and brown rats. They are guarding two unlocked chests that spawn low level loot, didnt wait around for a respawn. The surrounding area has more banderlings, tuskers, mites and wood golems. -- QBahn

name: Farmer
description: A farmer standing by the Baishi-Shoushi road, just south of Shou-Zin villas. She sells carrots, water, mushrooms, milk, grapes, eggs, cabbages and apples. She also stock ingredients of sacks of rice, sides of beef, rennet, honey, fish, chicken and brine. Selling price is 150%. -- Immacolata

name: Two Sandbars
description: We noticed this spot while hunting the beaches south of Mayoi. Two completely flat sandbars on the water. The northern one had lots of various spawns. The southern one had no spawn and offered a brief respite. Nice quiet, if remote, area to hunt. -- Woochan/Peipei

name: Dark Wisp Pool
description:
4 or 5 Dark wisps hang out here all the time... -- Skeeve
How did you find that? :) -- Notright 8/8/2000

name: Tower
description: Tower near Ft. Teth. Inhabited by 2 veteran reedsharks and several banderling guards. There was a group of banderling enforcers and thrashers nearby, but I think that was a random spawn. -- Mr. al-Habib

name: Lifestone
description:
Must be new for August update...good lifestone location for the Artifex Vault. Also a hut with a peddler and trophy collector. Lifestone surrounded by various beasts (mud/water golems, azure groms) 08-08-00 -- Ahmed al-Turas
Also a portal to plateau that exits at 44.5N, 43.1W -- Ahmed al-Turas 8/8/2000

name: Peddler/Collector
description:
Peddler and Trophy collector located in a hut on the beach. 08/08/00 -- Ahmed al-Turas
This is just a regular collector, *not* a Trophy Smith. -- J 10/4/2000

name: Mountain road Lifestone
description: A lifestone on the road between Qal and the south dires. Also has a tent with a mecrchant / mage dealer and an armorer. -- Faelon

name: Arena (Yaraq)
description:
This is one of the arena portals added in the August patch. Lifestone right when you enter. Some neat lighting effects at the judging station. -- Fyrecrypts
This place looks like a Q3 Deathmatch Map
) -- Al-Tuvah 8/8/2000
Becauseful when you go to the Judges Platform, there are some levers that open doors, if the doors are not open and you jump down, there is no way for you to get bak out. Youll have to call your patron or one of your vassels to come free you =P -- Maldovix 10/10/2000

name: Lifestone
description: Lifestone on the road between Neydisa Castle and Bandit Castle -- Enosh

name: Roaming Bowyer
description: Roaming bowyer between Neydisa Castle and Bandit Castle. Sells arrows, quarrels, fletching supplies and armor peircing arrows. Armor peircing arrows are 500 pyreal per 100 as of the August prop -- Enosh

name: Leather Crafter - Rithwic
description:
Leather Crafter - Julian the Bashir of Frostfell, May 28, 2000 -- AllyUnion
Across from the meeting hall. -- Slash 9/28/2000

name: High Mountain Valley
description: A one way portal to High Mountian Valley. High Montain Valley Portal exits at . Also as far as I can tell, this is the Interest Point between Arwic and Eastham. -- Dunc

name: Changing Random Portal
description:
This is a portal near a travelling Mages tent on the road from Qalabar to the South Dires land bridge -- Ty Phoo
This is no longer a portal to Tufa, it now goes to Uziz -- Salmoneus 9/14/2000
Its a Floating City portal now, looks permanent. -- Ladonna 11/5/2000
Exits 4.7s 3.1w on the Northern edge of the desert 11/30/2000
Nope, I see a portal to Qualabar, no level restrictions. It appears that this a permanant portal, yet randomly changes its destination. Someone should put a portal mule here and periodically check to see if any interesting portals are found. -- prok 3/4/2001
Todays portal is to Tufa. Obviously this portal spawns to random locations. -- Rojon 6/23/2001

name: Travelling Mage and Weaponsmith
description: A Mage and Weaponsmith on the road from Qalabar with portal to Tufa nearby. Weaponsmith has basic weapons but no arrows etc. Mage has limited supply of comps (maybe stuff sold by other visitors) also sells Tiny mana charges for 490p, Aqua Incanta. -- Ty Phoo

name: Igloo w/Snowman
description:
This i snew as of August, it has a level 182 snowman who sells magic iceballs used in cooking. Hes inside the igloo, each ice ball costs 100p -- Darthakia of MT
The Magic Iceballs can be used by a Cook to make Ice Cream. Any Cook worth his Salt would love to have some of these. -- Maisland 8/13/2000
Important note -- snowman only takes cash. He will not accept notes. Run from Qalabar is easy. -- Kudce of HG 8/23/2000

name: South East Direlands Lifestone
description: Its a lifestone baby. -- Alkitron

name: Peddler
description: A peddler nothin special sold as far as I can tell -- Alkitron

name: Sawato Portal
description: Exits at 29.1S, 58.9E portal to sawato neeto. -- Alkitron

name: Arwic Mines to Old Mine
description:
Inside the arwic mine, a newbie dungeon, down a little ways, there is a portal to the old mines. Goes to the old mine, a lugian dungeon with Laigus at the beginning. The surface portal there drops you at 79.1S, 27E -- Julian
Portal Exit coordinates takes you to the Old Mine. 8/23/2001

name: Dryreach Lifestone
description:
The new and improved lifestone near Dryreach added with the August 2000 update. -- Khaos
Completely surrounded by Banderlings, Reedsharks, and Small Shadowchilds. A low level character could get killed trying to use it. -- Jann 9/30/2000

name: Hill of Bones
description:
A field of bones that leads up a hill to a statue of Baelzharon. The dead are not peaceful here though as a horde of skeletons, skeleton captains and lords guard this strange place. -- Tekkiw
No statue or undead. Copper and Ice golems, as well as mid-level drudges (i.e. Lurkers and Stalkers.) Also groups of low level Bandies (Gaurds, Raiders and Ravenors.) -- Jake the Dog 6/21/2001
As of 1/24/2002, no golems, just drudges, manougas and lugians -- Ognam 1/24/2002

name: Plateau River Lifestone
description: Me and my friend Myrridin found this lifestone while exploring the river area for fragments. We also found a Zhaikal portal near here, which then dissapeared when we went further. There was also a Qalabar portal right by the Lifestone but when I reloged the portal was gone. The lifestone is a good staging point if you are hunting in the River area. -- Nexic

name: Healer
description: The healer has very limited supplies, but sells excellent and good healing kits. Lifestone and archmage right near. -- Nexic

name: Archmage
description:
The archmage sells very limited components, make sure you are stocked up before you head here... You most likely wont find what you are looking for . -- Nexic
This patch (Jan. 2000) added tapers to this mage, at 38p a pop =) -- Shal 1/13/2001

name: Shimena Keep
description: A castle situated on a small islet north of Aerlinthe Island, also mentioned in the Aerlinthe Record . Inside there is a Floating Advocate tower building with a North Yanshi Advocate Building Portal. There are about a dozen Ancient Coral Golems surrounding the keep, with some high level undead and more Ancient Coral Golems around the back of the keep where the entrance is. A broken bridge crosses from the mainland to the castle. There are Pyreal, Platinum (1), and Sapphire Golems (level 120) inside. There are also a number of Diamond Golems inside the keep, along with Relic Bones. -- Fin McCool -- Nightwolf (LC) -- Invictus -- Seeker

name: Wandering Bowyer
description: Armor piercing bolts and arrows are the highlight here. Good supplier for an archer lost in the woods. -- Domo

name: Dillo Rocks
description: Group of rocks just off the beach, with a submerged chest in the middle of them, guarded by 6 - 8 shore dillos. Chest spawns low-grade gems/jewelry/misc. items, comparable to what you get off the dillos. Good spot if youre looking for spines or large hides. -- Adric the Red

name: Jolly Snowman
description:
Jolly Snowman in an igloo. Sells Magic Iceballs for 100p (for cooking?) -- Belhphoebe
The Magic Iceballs can be used by a Cook to make Ice Cream. Any Cook worth his Salt would love to have some of these. -- Maisland 8/13/2000
Went there and Magic Iceballs were 39p each -- Warhammer 8/30/2001
The snowman does not accept tradenotes. Bring cash. -- Nocturne [LC] 9/3/2001

name: Water Golem Shrine
description:
I came accross a small shrine in the water which had 4 Water golems at it. It is just south of the hut/lifestone near the river, nw of Holtburg
12/08/00 -- Nature Stud
During the December 2000 patch I was up here found 3 of the new Tainted golems -- Armin 12/27/2000

name: PK Only Arena
description: This is an exact copy of the other PK Arena, but it is restricted to pks only. Hopefuly this will end the debate of weather or not the arenas are PK only or not by proving there are 2 arenas, not one. A PK only and PK/NPK (located at 18.5S 3.7E) -- Sargonas

name: Lifestone
description:
