Near a portal to Baishi and another to North Desert Ridge, a mage, bowyer and healer are nearby -- hailesmail
portals are random spawn -- Doc Feelgood 12/17/2002

name: Shop by the Sea
description: Shop just off the beach in the trees. There is a blacksmith with minimal selection and an archmage with less. -- Dysphgia

name: Shop by the Sea Life Stone
description: Life Stone next to the shop -- Dysphagia

name: Lifestone
description: Wilderness lifestone on the beach just south of the ice isle -- Enosh

name: Roaming Bowyer
description: Bower standing on the beach near a lifestone. Sells Armor Piercing arrows/quarrels at 500 Pyreal per 100 as well as normal arrows/quarrels and fletching supplies. -- Enosh

name: Stonehold Portal
description:
Portal to Stonehold on the northern beach. Just south of the ice isle, and near a lifestone and wandering bowyer. Exits at 68.7N, 21.8W -- Enosh
random spawn -- Doc Feelgood 1/2/2003
Its perfectly static. Has been for years. Still here. -- Immacolata 6/13/2003

name: Outpost
description: Has a Life stone, an empty tower, and a house with a roaming bowyer. One of 9 new lifestone locations I think. Good place for level people around level 10 to hunt. -- Gordin II-SC

name: Empyrean Temple
description:
An Empyrean Power Station type building with a white flame burning atop the spire. Inside, gazing up into the interior of the spire, one sees dozens of small floating motes of light and two spheres. The larger sphere is a mottled reddish-gold. The smaller sphere is green. Both are about a foot in diameter and slowly change position with the passage of time. A model of the two moons perhaps? Found by Haak al-Qulus. Entered by his pupil
Obunaga -- jameslawrence
Now taken over by 6 Raider Juggernaut -- Zen Tek Ken 6/24/2003

name: The Jolly Snowman
description: The Jolly Snowmanhas moved to the area west of Stonehold, sells Magic Snowball used to make icecream. He only sells the snowballs and only takes cash. Mostly matttekars and banderlings in the area, but with the migrations, Drudge Stalkers are not unknown. Choclate icecream is a healing food that does not require alchemy to produce. Snoballs cost 100p each. Mustafa Al Uziz, Scout for the Legends of Dereth Leafcull -- Mustafa Al Uziz

name: Lifestone/Peddler
description: Lifestone and peddler (basic peddler items). Portal to Baishi nearby. -- Less

name: Baishi Portal
description: Portal to Baishi, exits 49.3S, 62.9E. Lifestone and peddler nearby. -- Less

name: Aerlinthe Isle Portal
description:
Talk to Galaena the Emmisary and then hand over a D note. She will open this portal... be very careful. Run and jump off the ledge immediately
there is a spawn or three right at the landing. -- Milinda (TD)

name: Archmage
description:
Archmage in a hut. Doesnt carry much. -- Skysong
On the contrary, my good fellow. He has a good choice selection now. Selling at 150% and buying at 90%, he offers tapers at 38 p, up to silver scarabs at 375 p and greater mana stones at 7500 p and tiny mana charges at 525 p. For the trekking alchemist he has alembic, aqua incanta and neutral balm. -- Immacolata 3/25/2001

name: Archmage Lifestone
description: Lifestone in wilderness near archmage. -- Skysong

name: Bandit Castle Portal
description: Portal to Bandit Castle (65.0N, 49.3E) -- Skysong

name: Aerlinthe T-Shirt Vendor
description: This is the tent where you can buy an Aerlinthe souvenior T-Shirt. My Monarch/Patron went to Aerlinthe, and all I got was this lousy shirt. The shirt is Fealty IV with a diff of 155. -- The Spectre -- Bin Ibn Tabar 8/23/2000

name: Aurlanaa's Gromnietross Aerie
description: Aurlanaas Gromnietross Aerie mentioned in the Aerlinthe Record, RE241. -- The Spectre

name: Tenkardunn Foundry
description: part of the Aerlinthe Isle Quest.  The Sluice Gate Bar, and the Smith Golem are lcoated here.

name: Aerlinthe Undead Cemetary
description: Home of Smith Ejan, The Charred Book (translates to Aerlinthe Record), and the location of the portal to the Aerfalle Keep dungeon. -- The Spectre

name: Mt. Tenkarrdun Volcano/Behemoth Spawn point
description: This is the location the Behemoth (Aerlinthe Isle Quest) spawns at. -- The Spectre

name: Aerfalle Keep
description:
Approximate location of Aerfalle Keep dungeon portal, spawns during the Aerlinthe Isle Quest. Discovered by One Man Army of FrostFell. Main Gate is locked and requires lockpick skill. Known to be the home of the powerful undead, Lady Aerfalle. When killed she drops a key to the chest upstairs in her room and a note regarding the shadow wars. -- The Spectre 8/24/2000


No Recall, No Tie Portal. Beware the Level 7 Dispell Trap between the first two doors. Full of Relic Bones, Diamond Golems, Umbris Shadows, Firestorms, Cursed Wisps and Rats. With the quest update during From the Darkness Born this dungeon now has 2 level breaks. In order to get the Recall Scroll, you MUST give the Sacrifical Dagger from Aerlinthe Reservor to The Ghost of Galaeral who is inside this dungeon. He is located near the start on the right side near the exit portal and is behind a lever door. The Dagger weakens Lady Aerfalle and activates the 45+ quest. If you do not hand in the dagger, Lady Aerfalle will be the 80+ version. In the high level version she is very dangerous and should not be taken lightly. She dispells and casts Self protect spells if debuffed. Lady Aerfalle has around 5000 hp and looks like a living Empyrean woman, a very mean Empyrean woman. Use rending weapons and War to defeat her. She will lock onto a single person, debuff them, and then beat them mercilessly. Bring Healer Hearts, dispell gems, and a well organized group. She also has some VOD type undead bodyguards. Regardless, she drops around 9 keys in both 45+ and 80+ versions. The spawn does not stop and maintains its relatively fast rate. Run up to the chest room, minding the 2nd Level 7 Dispell Trap at its entry. Use your key on the appropriate chest. The 80+ Version does NOT get the recall scroll, however the items are much better than the 45+ version. The 80+ Ashbane can be given to its old owner for 10 million XP while the 45+ Ashbane gives 500k. --Taarna Blood SC 10/13/2004

name: Chalicmere Fortress to Aerlinthe Isle Portal
description: Portal from Chalicmere Fortress to Aerlinthe Isle, drop you out at 84.1N, 47.1E -- The Spectre

name: Aerlinthe Isle to North Yanshi Advocate's Tower
description: Portal inside Shimena Keep drop you out at 12.5S, 45.5E, the North Yanshi Advocates Tower -- The Spectre

name: Life Stone
description: A lifestone next to a peddler and a Archmage. -- Darvin

name: Peddler & Archmage
description:
A Peddler and a Archmage. The Peddler sells the normal stuff and the Archmage only sells a very few things. -- Darvin
Archmage now sells all tapers and scarabs up to silver, suprisingly at very good prices (30p tapers). Only sells tiny charges though =o( There are Portals to Baishi and Sawati nearby so you can go to one of these citys for your mana stone needs. -- Zenogias of MT 4/30/2001

name: Drudge Grotto
description: This is where you get a Yaoji to give to a vendor in the shop by the lifestone directly east of here. The vendor then gives you one of the 4 stones that you take to a guy in town that gives you a Key and direction on where to find the next stone. -- Takagi Shouga

name: Point Despair
description:
For the most part the Mayoi beach is just like every other beach with Azure Gromnies, Blue Phantos Wasps, Water and Mud Golems... until you get to this location. I have seen a number of mid-level characters hunting the beach only to get to Point Despair and get jumped by Shadows, Shadow Lieutenants, Lithos, Gigas and Amploth Lugians, Great and Snowy Mattekars or Ash Gromnies. The spawn is different on a daily basis. The best suggestion, check out that low, dark shape as it approaches you... what you think is an Azure Gromnie will more than likely be an Ash or two, or three... Also, there always seems to be a Bandie or two in the mix just to stir things up. -- Ool
Even saw a Diamond Golem here. A group of us just stood there trying to decide whether we should attack it or not... decided not was the best answer. 160th level was the read on it. -- Ool 9/16/2000

name: Path down
description: Path down off the plateaus north side -- Doc Feelgood

name: Small Crater
description:
Small Crater, a little west of the Broker Sigil Hermit and south west of the Dark Spire. Strange rock protrusions around the rim. Volcanic crater? Left over from the Beta? Who knows, but its visible on the AC Explorer map... Nothing else exciting. -- Dunc
This is where one of the Shadow Spires erupted from the ground. It has since drifted away. -- Siergen 8/28/2000

name: Peddler
description: peddler in sho building. some cooking supplies but no fletching. entered for clarity -- Senshin -MT

name: Statue of Bael'Zharon
description: This huge statue seems to ooze black fog. If you stand too close the four empyrean heads that surround it cast Whirling Blade III at you. Says its a magic trap. -- Elphin

name: Hill of Pines
description:
THis is the site of the great battle mentioned in Aerlinths letter. She claims the battle held back the enemy forces while BaelZharon was imprisoned. The hilltop is occupied by dozens of Skeleton Warriors (level 11) and a Skeleton Captain (level 18). The whole hilltop is covered with bones. -- Elphin
Now includes at least two Skeleton Captains, a Skeleton Lord, and while we were there, a level 5 dillo. Still trying to figure out the dillo part... -- Siergen 9/2/2000

name: Stone Marker
description: A blank stone marker on a snowy hill surrounded by 3 Ice Golems. Greater/Snowy/White Mattekars are in the immediate area. -- Khaos

name: Lake Pillar
description:
Pillar in a lake guarded by 2 Water Golems and 1 Granite Golem. 2 chests are submerged next to pillar
spawn poor loot. -- Khaos

name: Pyramid Shaped Colunms
description:
2 Pyramid Shaped Columns in the water
one is knocked over. -- Khaos

name: Path up
description:
Path up the cliffs into the highlands, part of Rochesters Way from Zaikhal to Stonehold. -- Doc Feelgood
This is the west end of Angiels Face. -- Doc Feelgood 9/30/2001

name: Plateau Village to Base
description: Portal off the mountain. Exits at 45.3N, 44.3W. -- Polecat

name: Qalaba'r Archers/Mages Perch
description:
This is the best perch near Qalabar (maybe the only perch near Qalabar). Shown by my patron, Nevir of Frostfell, this perch allows you to shoot or target at monsters overhead. Because of the steepness of the slope in front or on the side of you, the monsters can not climb to attack you. It is my recommendation that you come from the direction of 77.8S, 25.5S so you can climb on to the perch. Basically, its a ledge of a mountain. Very neat spot. It oversees a valley filled with Lugians, Matties, and other monsters. - Julian the Bashir of Frostfell 9/5/2000
I decided to give this place a try. The perch spot itself didnt yield much xp, but in the surrounding area I met: Golems (copper,ice) Armadillos (bronze) and white, snowy and a single great mattekar. This must be one of the least camped places in the eastern parts of Dereth. Spent a couple of hours there and didnt meet anyone. -- Chucara(MT) 11/22/2000

name: Base of Mt. Alphus
description: Exit: Base of Mt. Alphus (19.6N, 17.0E) -- Dunc

name: Cragstone Shadow Spire Piece
description: Another piece of the destroyed Shadow Spire lies in a small crater here. -- Wylandt

name: Empyrean Shrine
description: A shrine similar to the structure south of Eastham. This one has crystals growing within the triple arch. -- Ravic

name: Paul & Babe
description:
....has to be seen to be beleived. -- Jaiph Windlass
The Title should speak for itself have a look up north and see the tremendous monouga Paul and his buddy the baby blue auroch. No joke. -- Goshen
Paul Bunyon and Babe the Ox.. lol turbine outdid themselves -- Tabero 9/13/2000
Wow man this is really cool.You should see the stats on these two I wont spoil it but if we ever have to fight these watch out is all I can say.hehe too bad they are only NPCs for now...we came all the way out here to try and kill them oh well.Almost due north of stonehold... -- Krack + Dralix 9/14/2000
If you want to now how big they are, you can seem em in birds eye view. Nice stop if your going to the frozen Wasteland:) -- Wodrith the Man 9/23/2000

name: Ring of Crystals
description: Small ring of blue(nexus like) crystals embedded into the ground. One larger crystal at the top of the ring.

name: Aluvian House
description: House with Roaming Bowyer and Archmage with limited supplies. Handy spot with lifestone and portal to northwest dires nearby. -- Doktor Megatrip

name: Lifestone
description: Lifestone. -- Doktor Megatrip

name: Northwest Direlands Portal
description:
A yellow portal (level 35+). Exits 5.5N, 87.5W -- Doktor Megatrip
At least this portal seems permant. Was here and its at the correct spot. That was at leafdawning 14th, evensong-and-half -- Immacolata 5/7/2001

name: Lich Camp
description:
In the middle of nowhere, a Lich has decided to set up a sort of improvised throne room in the middle of a grove in the swamp, with a cohort of zombies (I counted 6). One chest with dull loot. -- Borgun Fistanvl
has been here since beta -- Qalan 9/14/2000

name: Crystal Ring
description: This is a blue crystal Circle identical to the one at 46.9S, 55.2E. Is this the ring mentioned in the Geomancy Note?.? -- Zenaxe

name: Tower and House
description: There is a tower here with a small house at its base. I have been unable to find a way up there yet. -- Salmoneus

name: Portal Holder
description: This is actually an Empyrean Portal holder of the type such as has Mage Academy and others. -- Salmoneus

name: Mud Golem Stone
description:
4 or 5 Mud Golems lying around a Stone. Be carefull cause they are within range of many other creatures surrouding the area. I am lvl 36 and had to run cause there where so many creatures. Including: Mud Golems, Mosswarts, Gromnies, Undead, Zombies, Sharks. Most of which will attack you if you are near the stone. -- Bin Ibn Tabar
Should be 24.3 *S* 67.3 e -- Ruffian Godsun 9/16/2000

name: Menhir Rings (a.k.a. Empyrean Stones)
description:
Just like the Holtburg Stones. When standing in the middle, mana is restored. -- Samsun and Rasa
Shendolain Menhir Ring Dungeon use to be here, It spawned Dual Fragments. The Dungeon been removed, only the Menhir Rings are left. 3/2/2001

name: Body with note
description:
Theres a body here with a note that gives you directions to a fort that a bunch of crude monogues took over. About 16 of them at fort and about 8-10 on way in. Didnt clear the fort since I was alone so Im not sure if theres any thing worth while there. -- Neosithlord
Not Really a fort more of a town on the ridge coupla chests there but the thing I found interesting was apparently if you had a empty container you could fill it with stamina If I understood right -- Bert Badas 9/16/2000
This note leads you to the monouga overrun village. Didnt find anything good there except a acid axe. Rendar 9/16/00 -- Rendar 9/16/2000
The letter has a funny trait, it is a Always Drop on Death item. At first I thought Cool, new Death Item. But alas it is just an additional item you drop next to your usual quota. So dont bother. And here I was carrying around 3 letters for over a year. Bah, humbug. -- Immacolata 7/20/2003

name: Roaming Merchants
description: Three merchants here. A Roaming Bowyer, an Archmage, and a Healer. -- Hamid(RS)

name: Caulnalain Menhir Ring
description:
This is one of the new Mehir Rings that came with the Sept. 2000 patch. -- Anonymous
Esper Menhir Ring -- x 9/21/2000
Caulnalain Menhir Ring Dungeon use to be here, It spawned Fragments. The Dungeon been removed, only the Menhir Rings are left 3/11/2001

name: Menhir Ring
description:
This is one of the new Mehir Rings that came with the Sept. 2000 patch. -- Anonymous / DT
Fenmalain Menhir Ring Dungeon use to be here, It spawned Broken Fragments. The Dungeon has been removed, only the Menhir Rings are left. 3/11/2001

name: Mehir Ring
description:
This is one of the new Mehir Rings that came with the Sept. 2000 patch. -- Anonymous / DT
Took a look.. not sure if its a Menhir ring.. CLOSE.. Ouside ring is familar but the inside ring looks like its for a huge Lifestone. -- Katra 9/20/2000
This one should be called: Menhir Ring with Broken Stones -- XxX 9/21/2000
Linvak Menhir Ring with Broken Stones -- XxX 9/21/2000

name: Plateau Lifestone
description: Unlike the other lifestone close to Plateau Village, this one is actually up on the plateau. It is not new, surprised no one has entered it in all these months. -- J

name: Sclavus Cathedral
description:
seems to be a copy of the one in the east dires swamps. Probably added in the july update. -- Llanwy
Entrance and exit are quiet, and summonable and tieable. Foyer is quiet. This is a good staging point for Essence of Verdancy. -- Doc Feelgood 5/19/2002
Layout of the dungeon is medium-size with large rooms. Fun for archers. Populated with sclavi up to Satas (40th). Spawn is slow except in final flood room where it is fast and pure Sata. SIK chest there. If you want to stack Slavi bodies deep looking for skins or other parts, this flood room is a good place to do it. -- Doc Feelgood 11/4/2002

name: Stone Formation
description:
Stone Formation same as one listed at [82.7N , 21E]as a Mehir Ring. -- Arion Dukat-HG
(SP)Menhir.. Not sure it is one that this quest is looking for.. the one at 67.9S, 40.1E was a false post.. I think it was posted by the same person that did the 82.7N,21E one. *shrugs* -- Arander 9/20/2000
Dont Lie. Those other rings ARE NOT fake, there the Fem. Menhir Rings -- Wodrith the man 9/24/2000 Updated with a Tempest, Stasic, Corrosion and Strife Wisp and a few Enku Zefirs. -- Chupon 8/12/2004

name: Portal Arch
description:
An arch like that which covers the portal to Mage Academy. There is no portal in it currently. I wonder if this is a location for one of the August portals. There are 6 ice golems circling it. -- Heysun
With all the things that have changed in this area, this hasnt. The six golems are still here. -- Doc Feelgood 3/1/2002

name: Snowman Spawn
description:
Not a random spawn, been back here 4 times now. Lvl 8 Snowmen on the top of a hill, get your iceballs and carrots here. -- Typhoid V
I can confirm this. Any one know the spawn tho? I killed both of em, when to get some low ore, came back, and had to wait 20 mins for then to small. To bad there not the regualar snowballs, these ones hurt.:) -- Wodrith the Man 9/23/2000

name: Banderling Camp
description: This is the camp mentioned in the parchment Banderling Camp Directions and is located inside one of the smaller creater bowls. A small number of banders spawn in this camp including a Banderling Bandit who will spawn at random a Fire Spear, quarter staff of fire, or fire arrows or sometimes nothing. On occasion he will also drop two of these items. The camp respawn rate is 15 minutes. The other banders include youngs, scouts and one captain. A nearby chest usually spawns food. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Sclavus Cathedral
description:
Just NW of the Shipwreck, this is a pretty simple dungeon. What makes this stand out was the Sata Sclavus at the bottom guarding a SIK chest. There were about 25 Satas on a 60 second spawn. No match for a lvl 50 swordsman, lvl 53 mage, and archer. We made short work of them. Alot of fun for the fact of nothing else to do. Btw, only about 2k exp per kill. Its not worth the effort for experience. Oh yea...the SIK chest is a low quality one (lvl 4 enchants and spells). -- dcp-cystemzero
This description is a little dated I think. Check the description for the other Sclavus Cathedral near WaiJhou for a more detailed description. The larger Sclavus drops a hide occasionally that can be made into a snake skin coat - Armor Level 130 with decent protections. The coat is like a breastplate with sleeves so it can be worn with Shreth pants or Amuli. In 1/2 hour I got 3 hides near the bottom. -- Blau (MT) 4/15/2001

name: Baishi Portal
description: A portal on a peninsula near the sand bars. Oneeye Archar, Silver Citdael, leafcull -- Oneeye, SC

name: Sawato Portal
description: A portal on a peninsula near the sand bars. Oneeye Archar, Silver Citdael, leafcull -- Oneeye, SC

name: Eternal Flame
description: An eternal flame, corpse and unlocked chest guarded by 10 Gold Wasps. Chest contained low level junk loot, but I didnt stick around for it to respawn. -- CiphersnowThe Gold wasps have been replaced with high 8 high level drudges, 4 peerless and 4 drudge cabalists. The chest is on a one week timer and spawns high level loot. -- Gelior Drake, Solclaim 9/12/2003

name: Caulnalain Menhir Ring (a.k.a. Esper Menhir Ring)
description:
Esper Menhir Ring with Missing Stones -- Darktide
Caulnalain Menhir Ring Dungeon use to be here. It spawned Fragments, but Dungeon been removed only the Menhir Rings are left. 3/11/2001

name: Plains Crystal Ring
description: Plains Crystal Ring -- XxX

name: Sclavus Swamp Crypt
description: Contains 4 Se Sclavi. In the crypt there are 2 chests with very bad loot. Also on the floor is a Diamond with NO DESCRIPTION AT ALL (ie - Well-Cut Onyx, etc.). Possibly part of some quest. -- Kimura Shigenar

name: Shendolain Dungeon
description:
Location of the Shendolain Soul Crystal in the Obsidian Plains. Use Shandolian gate key (duh). Dimond Golems, Dark Revs, Skel Bone nasties, etc. -- Brassyl
The Outside area is very ugly at times, and the enterance drop off is good reprieve, however, if you're level 35, not 36, and try to enter the portal for retreat, you will be horribly disappointed... -- Garfield3d 10/8/2000
The Shendolain Gate Key is used here, yet the Shendolain Crystal is not here. The dungeon isn't really all that hard, but you must have someone camping the switch room for you. One can get to the switch room by following the Right hand wall from the start. Only hard part of this dungeon is a room with 3 plasmas that jump down onto your party. They usually jump down one at a time however, for some odd reason. -- Flamelord of LC 10/14/2000

name: Caulnalain Vestibule Vault
description:
According to ACTips this is the Caulnalain Vestibule Vault for levels 26-35. Havent been there yet so I have no idea of the monsters. The key to this vault can be found on shadows. -- Rendar
100% true - Starts out with 2 not so big jumps, after the 2nd jump there are pairs of shadows, the textures are even worth the visit alone. -- Richard the B. 9/23/2000
woah boy-I did not like this place.It starts out just Shadows then LTs. Oh and then a panumbri. My party of 4(one archer and 3 meleers) killed the panumbri, then further in met another that killed me and another of my comrades, NOT A FUN PLACE.. -- Dark Stryder 10/2/2000
This place has the eeriest feel Ive ever encountered in AC as yet, nothing compares - not Olthoi dungeons, not anything. Its gruesome and scary and quite wonderful.. :) The key you need for the gate at the end only drop off Shadow Lieutenants, so if you are in this dungeon the Fenmalain key is useless to you. I got to the very end with a party of 4 and I only saw 2 Pans the entire time. We didnt really know the way, but it seemed as the purple portal mist got thicker we were heading in the right direction, and we did indeed find the gate. -- Silvermoon 10/2/2000
Ok, This Place is Sorta Kool, I ran Through it last Night, I tried to solo it but Didnt get too far due to the Magic Happy Shadows, I went with me, and Archer, and a Mage, ended up meeting 5 more at the entrance, and 3 on the way there making the place WAY too easy, Umm, You go through a Buncha Shadows, then a Couple LTs, a Couple Pans, A Couple of shadows that are Labeled Caulnalian Guardians or something, not Sure what they could be, I was able to Hit them Grat with Axe mastry 4 on, But when it dropped I couldnt hit them with my 235 Base, so whatever they would be, You Put yer Key in the Gate and It Gives you a Portol Gem,, I think that you Could LS recall, and Re-Stock or get level 6 buffs from someone or what not Because I think you can Use the Gem that takes you to the Second Part of the Dungion NP, I think the Hardest Part was Jumping into the Pi with a Buncha shadows in it, Just Because most everyone was afraid they would be the only ones to Jump and Would Die, besides me and a COuple others who did Jump, I think that my Party would have Made it but it would have been Hard, If you are Going in a Small Party Be sure to Bring a Mage as a LOT of them could Just as Easily Be Drained, at the end of the Dungion there was the Cauln Crystal which I averaged about 15 - 25 Per Swing on, I usually got like 6 swings whatever that means in a Big Party, there were 2 r 3 other Crystals that Spawned there, Not Sure of the Names but they were also Easy, I would say that the only troubles that I had Was the Caulanian Shadows when my Buffs Dropped, I got the Shield, SL 140, Like 1300 Burden, +10 to Health 15 or 20 to stanima I forget, Invuln 4, Cant be casted on, its Kool Looking but about worthless lol, I ran there from Holtburg, was a Very Short Easy Run, was able to Avoid Mountains until about that last 2 Clicks, Just be Careful in there, A Melle Mage Might have a Chance Soloing the Place, and a Good Melle Would have slim to none, the shadows woud have to keep magic at a Minimum, Kool Scenery, a Fun Place -- Crystal Knight 11/1/2000
New level restrictions: 26-40. -- Path 12/21/2000
Geez. I wish People would take some time when writing their notes. The one above sounds like it was written by someone on drugs. Get it together Knight. -- Artek 1/18/2001
Jump thru the portal at full power, when you exit the other side you will land on a ledge, the vault will be right infront of you, may be 1 or 2 shadows near the vault, just grab your key and recall. Best to run here from crater. -- BuffDaddy -MT 8/27/2001
The upper level limit for this quest has been removed. -- Kovich of TD 5/17/2003

name: Lugian lakeside Camp and Chest
description: Three Obeloth Lugians camped out and guarding a chest. Chest had little of interest (a few ps, food, Good healing kit, etc) -- Dunc

name: Koga Hideki of Kara
description: Koga Hideki says, I have improved my armor skills, but my craft is not yet perfect.... sages have discovered ways to improve my armor during my weakness. Have you read Aliesters Corollary? Bring me fused gems to make armor, and the book will show you how to improve my product. -- Dunc This is the NPC that creates Shadow Koujia Armor from Crystal Shards and Shadow bits. -- Taarna Blood SC

name: Water Golem Shrine
description: A pillar surrounded by several water golems -- Fr3nsyc

name: Lake Watched by Statues
description: A small lake between Holtburg and Crater, the east and west edges are overlooked by abstract statues of people (like those at Festival sites) facing each other. A water wisp spawns in the middle of the mushroom ring next to the eastern statue. Hunting around here is a woodland mix, including tuskers mixed in with the hunter shreth. -- Red and Gold

name: Plateau Portal
description: Shortcut to Plateau, Brings you at the plateua village. 44.0N, 43.5W -- Yobe the Mage

name: Top of Mt. Zabool to Top of Mt. Alphus
description: Drops out at 19.7N, 17.8E -- Larce Mantoll

name: The Shop at Mt. Alphus
description:
Stonies and Skeletons. A shop keep, too. the place sells peerless healing kits, thanks Crick for noting this on the newsgroups.. However.. the guy, who also other miscellany, doesnt accept even V trade notes. Why?. Whats the damn point. The only way is to bring cash, use portal tie and lifestone to take cash and bring back kits to a mule, or friend. -- Goldhart 6/4/2000 Merchant is Zalphoo, who also sells Zalphoos key and peerless lockpicks, too. He buys armor, weapons and scrolls, but not arrows, gems/jewels or spell components. Nearby is a mushroom ring inside a ring of upright stones. Watch out. Theres a gen point just outside the shop producing up to Skeleton Captains. -- Doc Feelgood
Zalphoos Key can be purchased here for 900 pyreals. It has 3 uses and will open the door in Alfreth Dungeon that allows you into the Banderling area. Once there you can kill the Captain and get the 1 use key that works in the Sylsfear Dungeon. It opens the door that is just beyond the Granite Golems if you take the right passage at the start of Sylsfear. -- Ryth-al-Rothgar 1/30/2001

name: Forest - Desert Boundary
description: North and west of here are Banderlings and Shreth, south of here are Armadillos and skeletons. -- Doc Feelgood

name: North edge of Recovered Temple Escarpment
description: South and east of here is an unclimbable cliff that cuts between Recovered Temple and the coast. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Small Blackmire Temple
description: Small temple structure in the swamp, inhabited by a shaman and some mudlurks. If you fight inside the temple expect lots of helpers to come in from the surrounding mire. -- Doc Feelgood

name: 3 Collectors (Uziz)
description:
3 brothers at Uziz who speak of powerfull gems they can make items from. One will make a bow, the other will make a shield and the third will make a orb. I dont know what type of gems they want though. All 3 guys are lvl 30+ -- Wylandt
These guys are where you go after youve completed the new shadow key quests. -- Otho Hiro 10/8/2000
Those are For the Fenmalain, 10 - 25, Caulnealen, 26 - 35, and Shendolain, 36+ Quests, Use Shadow Keys to get under the old Frag Dungions, Kool Shield, Never Seen the Stats on the Bow or the Wand =? -- Crystal Knight 10/20/2000
I believe the (x)bow is (150%)110%, Unenchantable, fires Crystal Tipped Arrows/Quarrels made from Tiny Shards. Also fires Mnemosyne Arrows. Shield is AL 180 and casts Layerable Spells (Warriors Vigor, etc.) -- Nocturne [LC] 9/3/2001
XBows are +100%, +130%, +140% respectively
casting BD, XBow Mastery, and SK in levels 3, 4, and 5 respectively. Sheilds add to Health, Stam, and cast Invuln on the wielder. The dungeons are called Vestibules and have the same name as the gems within them. The keys, which are named after the dungeons whose gates they are used upon, are found on Shadows. Fen keys are found on Shadows. Cauln keys are found on Shadow Lts. Shen keys are found on higher level Shadows. -- Rushesin [SC] 2/4/2002

name: Lytelthorpe - Cemcera the Shopkeeper
description: Sells at 110%, Buys at 20% -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Lytelthorpe - Grocer Cortarn & Gylfolma the Scribe
description: Grocer: Sells at 120%, Buys at 85% Scribe: Sells at 150%, Buys at 50% -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Lytelthorpe - Sathagg the Jeweler and Mage Den Ou
description: Jeweler Buys at 150%, Sells at 60% Mage Buys at 110%, Sells at 70% -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Taryla the Bowyer &Dafrida the Taylor
description: Bowyer Sells at 140%, Buys at 43% Taylor Sells at 160%, Buys at 90% -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Selflora the Barkeep and Trophy Collector
description: Barkeep sell book of advocates, general advice, Lost Distillery Directions, and Lytelthorpe Portal Directons. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Blacksmiths Baltiff & Sitrath
description: Baltiff Sells at 120% and Buys at 90% Sitrath Sells at 150% and Buys at 60% -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Peddler
description: This Peddler Sells at 100%, Buys at 60% -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Baizai En
description: Weaponsmith who Buys at 100% and Sells at 200% -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: The Royal Firkin
description:
Rithwic Pub where you can find barkeep Ricetha and Celcynd the Dour. -- Cuttler Strngmd
Celcynd the Dour is now Society Rep. in Rithwic. Gives a guide and rewards you if you deliver stamped society letters to him. You can also deliver a love letter from Mindorla the Collector in Rithwic East Outpost to him. He rewards you with healing potions and 500 cool xp. -- Immacolata 3/30/2001

name: Ynarre the Grocer
description: Gorcer Buys at 67%, Sells at 167% -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Bowyer Trothyd Fletcher
description: Bowyer Buys at 80%, Sells at 100% -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: The Gilded Tome
description:
Shop contains- Wylreda the Scribe who Buys at 72% and Sells at 133% Urnolt the Jeweler who Buys at 67% and Sells at 120%
Correction: Scribe Buy: 75% -- Tinc Metals 12/11/2000

name: Brisin the Healer
description:
Healer Buys at 84% and Sells at 116% -- Cuttler Strngmd
Correction: Buy: 85% Sell: 115% -- Tinc Metals 12/11/2000

name: Luthin the Smith
description: Luthin Buys at 70% and Sells at 100% -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Ji Tenyien
description: Tenxiens Garments Buys at 40% and Sells at 250% -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Dortold the Tailor
description: Dortold Buys at 60% and Sells at 110% -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Mage Nulsymber & Jeweler Soldona Wotmad
description: Mage Buys at 95% and Sells at 110% Jeweler Buys at 50% and Sells at 150% -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Skull and Flagons Pub
description: Run by barkeep Erludd the Cur, The Weary-looking man who sells Dryreach Keys can be found behind the stairwell. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: The Flaming Phoenix
description: Barkeep Kiun Baicho runs this establishment. She sells directions to Dungeon Mei and The Web Maze. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Healer Fun Lun-Kou
description: Healer Buys at 90% and Sells at 110% -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Scribe Denki Sokuto
description: Scribe Buys at 66% and Sells at 110% -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: The Soaring Shaft
description: Bowyer Jyi Zheme Buys at 905 and Sells at 150% -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Jeweler Nuro Misho
description: Jeweler Buys at 85% and Sells at 120% -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Blacksmiths Lobo Shui & Shen Ai-Shen
description: Armor Lobo Shui Buys at 80% and Sells at 120% Weaponsmith Shen Ai-Shen Buys at 70% and Sells at 130% -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Weaver Zhoyong
description: Tailor Zhoyong Wa-Son buys at 90% and Sells at 140% The Leather Crafter resides here too. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: The Laden Bushel
description: Grocer Muoyen Han Buys at 90% and Sells at 126%. Baishi Spice Merchant Sells at 220%, she will not buy spices back. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Ginan's Goods
description: Shopkeeper Ginan Wah Buys at 80% and sells at 100%. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Lifestone at Fycheck
description: I have seen two rumors regarding Fycheck (one was handed to me by someone in Holtburg...didnt get his name... and the other I found on the ground near the West Shoushi Lifestone). Both rumors were entitled The Fycheck Outpost. Here are the two rumors, as written on the parchments. Fycheck was a Noble Sho warrior, known for his skill with the blade and for his being prone to wanderlust as no other Sho ever has. Indeed a great warrior, it is rumored he met his demise on a mountain plateau west of Shoushi. Hidetaki, his faithful Sifu heard of his students death and summoned warriors throughout the land to extract revenge on the creatures that caused the demise of his friend and student. Hidetakis forces were never seen alive again. As Hidetaki and his band of loyal warriors were extracting revenge on the creatures that killed the noble Fyckeck, four of the warriors panicked and fled the battlefield. After discovering a safe haven in an abandoned tower far to the south, the dishonored warriors were grief stricken that they had dishonored themselves by fleeing. Before they could commit Sepuku, to regain their honor, they were killed by a nearby wisp. Since they died with dishonor, they now haunt that tower as undead, hating the living with great passion. -- Grundak

name: Seven Stars Tower
description: Archmage Ku Min Buys at 70% and Sells at 150%. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Path up
description:
Path at the head of a canyon from the lowland forest to the North Mountain Plateau. -- Doc Feelgood
This is the east end of Angiels Face. -- Doc Feelgood 9/30/2001

name: Xarabydun
description: Underground town with a unique open landscape dungeon feel.  Full of shops and NPCs.  Locked door (diff 82) seperates you from a couple of quest dungeons at the bottom with Crystal Nodules needed for the Impulse gems.

name: The Floating City (Primary)
description:
Ive replaced the lots of speculation with a dissertation done by Dereths leading Floating City Expert. Ladies and Gentlemen, without further ado I present you the savant Tyr on HG
-- Immacolata 7/20/2003
Yes this is a random dungeon, yes there are allready a billion and one entries for it (edit: no more, cleaned out a kajillion of those, thanks to Doc Feelgood), yes I am apolagising for entering another one, but I tried several times to add to the Floating City (Primary) thread and managed only to put in one line... so here is what I was trying to say, assuming this adds itself. There is far too much speculation and rumour on this thread, so, since I know virtually everything there is to know about the city, let me set a few things straight. Firstly, portals may now be tied and recalled to, they cant be summoned but if you see one on the landscape, tie to it, and camp it for any friends who may want to tie too (random portals only disapear when the landblock resets, so if your watching the portal it wont go anywhere). Secondly, there is no pattern to the portals appearing, they are RANDOM. Thirdly, multiple portals can spawn on the surface, the city is broken up into 8 different landblocks (7 called The Floating City, and one The Golem Sanctum), and I think all of them can be created as random landscape portals. I think the golem sanctum only spawns in the dires but I cant confirm that). Thus all these reports saying when you enter go this way are useless because it all depends on which part of the city you have entered. Now, when you enter the city, your first step is to do a /loc and work out which landblock your in, then before jumping off anything or going through any portals, check ACMaps.com which has maps of the city (done by yours truely). So far Ive only done 6, Im waiting on the random portals to take me back to the final two landblocks. That raises another point, many of the portals between the different parts of the city are random as well, which is why you should tie to the first one you found, as you may not be able to get back to explore more. Inside the city, all exit portals, and lots of the internal portals (all helpfully called just The Floating City) are random, but unlike random portals on the surface, they are allways in the same place, but every month (on patch day) they change their destination. On the maps I have made all portals are identified as either stable or random, stable portals all have a return portal next to them to facilitate two way travel. Lockpicking is not required, but does make a little more of the city accessible, it is I believe posible to get everywhere by random portals but random portals are of course random. The toughest door is resistance 322, and worth picking if you can because it leads on to a stable portal to another section. There are what apears to be two significant points of interest in the city, one is the golem sanctum, an absolute labyrinth of tightly twisting passages and more junctions than I can count, all filled with Iron golems, and at the end one obsidian with a dispell trap and a chest of crap loot. The other point of interest is something everyone should see at least once in their life, a floating advocate tower in the direlands (3.7S / 69.2W), about as high above the ground as the tou-tou lighthouse is tall, and with a bright pink energy fountain inside it. On top is a random portal to the direlands somewhere. At the begining of the Golem Sanctum is a stable portal back to the city, and a random direlands portal, I have seen these portals go to North Direlands Valley Junction, and my old favorite hunting ground North Direlands Land Bridge. During this months patch I also found a portal whos name and location I didnt write down, but the drop was so hot I died before I materialised. Shortly after that they did a server rollback and the portal changed again. Within the city you will find a number of Strained Books, which cannot be picked up but give you some interesting lore about the place, and some interesting insights into the Empyrians past. In all I would say this whole place is priety much a place only to come if you like exploring and lore, the monsters inside are for the most part, low level undead and a few banderlings, there are 2 virindi servants, and 2 revanants, and thats about it for the high level monsters. However, it does make a wonderful alternative to the Abandoned Mines as a subway, because while the portals change every month, there are a lot of exit portals and they drop you in often rare towns like Kara. A few non town portals spawn, but rarely, and all Ive noticed is Heartland which has to be one of the most common random portals (and the most boring). Anyways, Im begining to ramble on without really saying much, so I will just say that the floating city is a great place to visit, and a nice place to tie to and use as a subway (incidentally the exit portals can be tied to and summoned, so when you find a Kara portal, take a copy of it for your guild, its a nice quiet town that sells level 6 scrolls for those rich enough to afford them). Should anyone be interested in learning more, go take a look at ACMaps.coms maps and post a message on this thread, I look at it occasionally, alternatively if your on harvestgain, just tie to the city and use it to get arround, Im sure well bump into each other there (tho its never happened yet, portals in are VERY rare). -- Tyr on HG 12/3/2002

name: Lightless Tunnels (Xarabydun)
description: This dungeon is located at the bottom of the Uninhabited Area Portal found in the Xarabydun sewers.  It is 1-25 restricted and cannot be Recalled, Tied, or Summoned.  It is also the place where the Crystal Nodules for the Gem of Impulse are.  You can pick up as many Crystal Nodules as you want, but there is a 1 week turn in timer.  They are givable.  There is also a Mid Direlands Portal at the bottom of a 40 damage pit (with Bludge pro 7 and 110 jump)  It is Tieable and Summonable, restricted to 18+.  This exits at 37.1S, 65.9W and is actually the Valley of Death hot drop, which is very hazardous for any lowbie that goes in. -- Taarna Blood SC

name: Linvak Tukal Castle (a.k.a. Fortress)
description:
Im not quite sure what is inside this place yet since i haven't found a way in. Its located up on a mountian near Serac Vault and is surrounded by Lugians. The lugians near here seem to be new with the october update, at least their names are different. These lugians are called raiders and I've seen every lugian type except Laigus here, even Extas and Tiatus raiders. They all seem to be using hollow weapons like the lugians in the ore mines. -- Jandrel
Couldn't get in either :\ oh well.. easy to find tiatus are sweet. -- Mengar -LC 10/11/2000
These Raider-caste Lugians are very mage NON-friendly. With a 230 skill and rank V's, I couldn't affect the lvl 29 raiders, let alone the 108's and 178's. They are either EXTREMELY resistant to magic, or completely immune. Melee-type people have it a bit easier here though, and a mage is still useful in a (sigh) support role. Extas are 8 k, Tiatus are 15k. And yes, it's a beautfiul, yet bizarre structure. -- N'Sciira deGris 10/15/2000
this is a tower i saw that was not on ac explorer and though there was an entrance to but as i could not figure the entrance to this castle out i decided to post it to see if anyone else could find the entrance. there are various luggies on the outskerts with the name of raiders, such as litthos raider, gigas raider, and even taitas raiders. -- Darkmessenger 10/17/2000
The ""raider"" Lugian variants around this Castle are weilding hollow-equivilent weapons. Mages beware. -- Kystanto 10/26/2000
This is truly a wonderful sight, but I see no way in. I also saw no high level Luggies in over an hour of hunting there. Where are the Extas and Titas Luggies??? Highest level thing was a Lythos Raider. -- Shoku Kang 1/3/2001
Someone mentioned this place will be populated in the feburary patch. Another comment was made that the size of the fortress is the largest the game engine will allow. -- prok 1/10/2001

name: Twin Statues
description: 2 Statues watching the lake below, nothing much else to see. -- Vengeance (DT)

name: Banderlings "Temple"
description:
Some kind of Temple with Banderlings -- Bui Chon-po
Not really worth the trip. Just 3 or 4 Young Banderlings & a Banderling Scout. -- Oshun 11/27/2000

name: Mosswart Maze
description:
Second part in the new October midlevel lost explorer quest. no level rest. Mostly mosswarts including many shaman and a chief. 4 chests, 1 locked. The banderling ceremonial mace head is here guarded by 2 Goldenback Tuskers. Also the second journal of the missing explorer is here. clues point ever on westward. both head and book are the first east/right passage as you come in. then first right for book, or straight and stay left follow the glow for the head. Entry room is not safe and the only 2 surface portals exist here. Nice layout, fun traps and maze feel. -- Senshin -MT
Actually, it is 2 Goldenback Tuskers that guard the mace head at the end. Also, the exit is not in the entry room, but if you head left and stay left for a ways you get to a surface portal. There is another surface portal down off a long side passage by the tuskers. -- J 10/13/2000
If you are looking for the second part of the ceremonial mace (the haft), its in the Banderling Conquest Dungeon (29S,50.5E) -- Monkey3 2/4/2001
Also, theres a locked chest in here. When you enter the dungeon, just go straight. The passage goes into a spiral (right turns), and ends with a locked chest. I didnt have lockpick, so I have no clue whats in it. -- Obsidianblade 4/7/2001

name: North end of W's Face
description: North end of unclimable NW-SE cliff in North Mountains. -- Doc Feelgood

name: South end of W's Face
description: South end of NW-SE unclimable cliff in North Mountains. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Washington's Face
description: An unclimbable cliff stretching from 79.2N, 6.6W to 84.7N, 10.6W -- Doc Feelgood

name: Stone Obelisk
description: Stone Obelisk with lone Skeleton Guard -- Habidakus

name: Sotiris Dungeon
description: The portal in is tieable, summonable. The exit portal is tieable, not summonable. Entrance and exit are hot with Obsidian Plains fauna, the foyer is quiet. Its a good portal pop hunting place. The dungeon layout is Lugian citadel-style and has a lot of symmetry. The big corridors and simple layout mean that monsters can come in from miles around, and the fighting tends to be clumpy -- big swarm, then nothing. Spawn rate is modest. Soltiris Hollows are 55th level and drop decent loot. -- Doc Feelgood 11/2/2002

name: Tower
description: A tower with a locked door and no switch cant be picked........ cool place for a newbie archer ls near it. -- Solarfire

name: Mayoi Mountain
description: This mountain spawns decent mid level creatures, good for leveling from around 15th level to 20th level. Expect to find White and Snowy Matties, Lugians, Spiny and Bronze dillos and some low level grommies. Respawn is decent for a single hunter. Occasionally, shadows will spawn up here, and I have seen up to Shadow lts. -- Lynn deLeslie

name: Neydisa Lifestone
description:
Lifestone is inside the courtyard of Neydisa Castle. -- Chiun Zen
(Amazing this has never been added to the database) -- Chiun Zen 10/22/2000

name: Archery Fextival Grounds
description:
This is an archery Festival grounds. Oak and straw target drudges, two tents with a bowyer and farmer, and various other interesting features. It looks almost like a shooting gallery. Quite interesting. I can see contests and fairs set up here
it would be perfect. -- Penne al-Dente

name: Banderling Camp
description:
Banderling Training Camp - Lots of mosswarts and banderlings, including a banderling captain. The respawn is really quick -- Lan Mar 11/1/2000
This is one of those monster training camps, as the Banderling Captain drops the note from his General. Population at this one includes up to a dozen Mudlurk Mosswarts, up to a dozen Barker Mosswarts, two Shamans, a Chief, and the Banderling Captain. The spawns for Mudlurks and Barkers is 30 seconds--insanely fast. Spawn time on the others is two minutes. If youre an archer, bring fire arrows and run like hell
if youre melee, bring friends and stam potions. Good place for mask heads and brown beans, though. -- Arisana (SC) 11/4/2000

name: Floating Spire
description:
This place has also been called the flosting power generator, the entrance to this place can be found int the floating city. As I found the place by accident, and many of the portals in the city move as well as the ones leading to it I can give no accurate directions, other than to say that I passed a portal guarded by several lichs and a revenant to get to the portal leading inside. Ill be giveing pictures taken to my guild on solclaim which can be reached at www.valour.acsage.com And to give credit where it is do I was asked by Epsilon Alpha to list his name here as well since he was with me when we entered. The tower is empty but has some interesting scense inside, worth a visit but not a return. -- Corus Firebrand
The tower was not empty when I when there, ...it had a Direlands Desert NE Portal in it with the drop point of 82.1S, 59.0W...which coincidentally also is close to another portal, the South Landbridge Portal (drop: 83.3S, 19.2W) at 81.9S, 59.0W. -- Sword of Truth 12/11/2000
I confirm that the entry to the final section of the floating city is a portal in the Revenants bedroom closet. The Portal in the spire dumped out at Northeast Dires junction when we visited (2.3N, 65.2W). -- Doc Feelgood 2/2/2002

name: Valley Junction Portal
description: Exit at 2.6N, 65.1W at the valley junction east of Teth. Maybe one of this random portals? Level 25+ only. Be ready to run as soon as you hit the ground... guess why... -- Kara Gandharvi

name: Mattekar Lair to Bandit Castle Portal
description: Portal to Bandit Castle located on lower level of Mattekar Caves where the Ice Golems Spawn, drops out around 66.3N, 50.7E -- Milrace

name: Kryst
description:
New city of Kryst, on the far south east islands. -- Hyawatha Khan
Are there even shopkeepers here? -- Se?or 11/14/2000
Neat little town, despite having some of the cooler surroundings of the towns in the game. Occasionally the odd swamp rat/mudlurk mosswart pops into town, particularly to the mage shop (which is just a bit west from the main town). Most of the dealers will buy at > than the value of items, and the mage sells peas (the tool is 72k there, however). -- Ruiner-Eraser 11/15/2000
The mage wears a purple faran, different color than the master robes. Also, dont sell anything to the weaponshop, bowyer pays around 50% more. Has an Ivory Crafter/Leather Crafter. -- mengar 11/15/2000
Vanten (Archmage) - Sell:110% Buy:180% Brita (Barkeep) - Sell:100% Buy:150% Kamira (Grocer) - Sell:80% Buy:160% Sharon (Bowyer) - Sell:130% Buy:160% Imad (Jeweller) - Sell:110% Buy:160% Illic (Weaponsmith) - Sell:90% Buy:170% Padira (Armorer) - Sell:100% Buy:160% Sanami (Healer) - Sell:110% Buy:130% Natalie (Scribe) - Sell:100% Buy:150% Sanami the Healer sells potion spell components as well. Cheaper than the archmage. -- Jadok al-Siran 11/25/2000

name: Large Span Bridge
description: Big Bamboo Bridge with Diamond and Obsidian golems -- Yobe the Mage

name: Floating Advocate tower
description: Floating Advocate Tower -- Yobe the Mage

name: Adja's Memorial
description:
NPK Alter on SW island. -- Yobe the Mage
Bad Coords, should be 82.3S, 93.3E -- Doc Feelgood 12/17/2002
Fixed. -- Immacolata 05/16/2003

name: Treacherous Tunnels
description:
Forsaken Portal inside. Lots of tentacles and moarsmen. -- Po
Look for a hidden lever to open the first locked door -- its disguised as a plant. After that, if you bear right you get slithis and low level moarsmen
if you bear left, you get sulthis and high level moarsmen and a portal which will take you further into the islands. Be careful not to mistake the high level stuff for low level stuff. It is possible to run past the sulthis tentacles easily, but be ready to deal with the putrid moarsmen beyond. -- Red and Gold 11/21/2000

name: Rumuba's Hidey-Hole
description:
No level restrictions -- Yobe the Mage
The mosswart NPC inside makes what you need for the spear quest, and there is a section for lockpickers only (not needed for the quest). Fun change from spellcasters but at this time on Leafcull there are 30 people wandering through the dungeon. -- mengar 11/14/2000
This place has a uber chest in it that spawns weapons, gems, armor, and cloths. Only race restriction I saw was gharundim. Uber loot is of medium qualtity. -- Rendar 11/15/2000
Entrance is clear, foyer is clear. Top looks like a small ""Q""-shaped place if you miss the corridor heading down. Lower level is big and meandering. Fanatics and idolators up top, zealots below. At least one locked door. -- Doc Feelgood 11/19/2000
The Uber-Chest is behind a locked door which you need to pick. It is guarded by a few Zealots and a Soul-Trapper. Made 3 pulls off the chest and all of it was expensive but sellable crap. 4 floors to the entire place, mostly Fanatics and Idolators until you hit the 4th floor. The bottom end is anti-climatic, nothing but a dead-end. -- Garfield3d 11/24/2000

name: Moarsmen Muck
description: Top contains several Rank Moarsmen. Go further in and youll get to a bit with a whole slew of Foul Moarsmen and a Putrid Moarsman (level 72), as well as a Jungle Phyntos Wasp. Even farther in are several more Putrids and Foul Moarsmen. Bring acid, fire, and lightning protection, and bring a bunch of melee friends and stamina elixirs. Use of a shield is highly recommended. A very ambitious dungeon for the level restrict. -- Accident 7/7/2002

name: Nearest Kryst Lifestone
description: This is the nearest lifestone to Kryst that I've seen. Located very close to an crumbling tower that makes an excellent perch of mages or archers. Those Jungle Wasps are 5K a pop and not very resistant to magic. -- Sixfingers

name: Northeastern Lifestone
description: If you like battle Moarsmen, this is the lifestone for you-- located spitting distance from the (shudder) Moarsmen Laboratory. -- Sixfingers

name: A Small Ruin (Island)
description:
This place resembles a component from the Empyrean Power Plant. I was playing a 17th level mages and I was alone, so I didnt chance it. -- Sixfingers
Gone down a few levels so far - lots of level 60 sclavi - throwing lvl 5 war spells. Site is guarded by 2 Cursed Wisps (lvl 89) -- Quixis Blight 11/16/2000
Deeper: Ulu Sclavus (60), Faisi Sclavus (74), Slithayr Tendrils/Tentacles/Eye Stalks, Liches, Lich Lords. Didnt find anything of interest beyond that. -- Kelyn Blackwolf 11/19/2000
Entrance is hot with wisps, foyer is quiet. You have to jump down and run through a big Ulu Sclavi-infested room to get to nearest exit portal. Upper levels can be wall worked. -- Doc Feelgood 12/31/2000
This ruin isnt very small. -- Keef the Thief 1/8/2001
Yes its actually quite small, its not even truly 9 rooms. Its only 3 floors, and there are less than 50 creatures total, respawns are about 3-4 mins though, so it can seem large. (also note this is a duplicate entry, I entered all this months ago. READ people) -- Shal 1/13/2001

name: Moars Laboratory
description: A few Level 75 and 47 Moarsmen and a few mossies, a rabbit in a huge cage. This was all I found. Very nice looking place, have to jump down to go thru (25 hp jump) -- Blacthorn 11/15/2000

name: Yanshi Portal
description: Between Al-Arqas and the Desert Mage. The portal is underground in a crypt structure amid a field of cacti. There are dead bodies in the crypt also.

name: Idol Spawning Grounds
description: Entrance is hot, dungeon foyer is hot, come in prepared for a fight. Top is winding and filled with idols, fanatics, idoltors, a few zealots and a dread idol or two. Lower down the dungeon wall pattern *is* wild -- flashback to the sixties. -- Doc Feelgood 11/19/2000

name: Moarsmen Hideout
description: Entrance is clear, foyer is clear. Have to jump to get from foyer into rest of dungeon... some lever pulling. Lots of rank moarsmen behind doors, on the upper level, so it's one of the few good ""wall working"" places on the isles. -- Doc Feelgood 11/20/2000

name: Slithis Pit
description: Lots of Slitharyr Tendrils, tentacles, and Eye Stacks.  Need to jump down from first lvl to get any where.

name: New'ic
description: Little area that appeared after Arwic disaster.  Now since Arwic been rebuilt not much is here just olthoi hunter and couple buildings.

name: A Small Temple
description: A VERY small temple, Ulu Sclavus (lvl 60), Slithis, chest with lame loot that does not require key. -- Ardak Eaglehear

name: MacNiall's Freehold
description:
Interesting back-story for this town. (in relation to Kryst, and Bandit Castle...) Quite dangerous, as high level baddies seem to stroll right into town frequently... Side note:Bowyer sells Armor Piercing, Regular, Frog Crotch, and Blunt Arrowheads, as well as bolts and arrow shafts., and Archmage sells Tapers, as well as Gold and Pyreal Scarabs... Majiya Bint Branith, HG -- Majiya bint Bra
Expensive shops and they dont give near what Teth/Ayan Bakur do, some starter towns pay better. -- mengar 11/14/2000
Arrgh, me hearties, a wickeder pirate town is hard to find. These merchants will skin ye coming and going. But the mage does offer shiney gold and pyreal, and shell service ye with dispell magics should ye have the need. -- Doc Feelgood 11/20/2000
This town along with the vesayen isles themselves can now be seen in your user friendly in game map thanks to the new December 2000 patch. -- Archbow 12/12/2000

This is the starting pt for the January Bandit Castle handle quest. Give MacNial a idol gem and he will give u letter to his cousin in bandit caslte. -- Saint Thomas 1/9/2001

name: Moars
description:
I didnt spend much time inside but guess what I found.... Sometimes the name says a lot. -- Shoyu Suru
This appears to be a dungeon of little point, the end part with 3 putrid moarsmen appears to be it - however this room is very tomb Raider in design, Id like to see where somebody with a high jump skill can get to - there are other monsters in here that cant seem to be got to. Contains 3 lvls or moars - (the easy ones), rank and putrid, plus there are shallows destroyers, jungle wasps, and a water golem (????). -- Typhoid V 11/16/2000

name: Eastham Beach Portal
description: Portal on beach on Kryst Island. -- Adra Mar Sula

name: Moarsmen Spawning Grounds
description:
No level restrictions. Found with Stranyr Al-Qroni -- Ardak Eaglehear
Full of mossies???? Lots of low lvl mossies, mostly mudlurks, lame dungeon, except for looks. -- Stranyr Al-Qron 11/14/2000
If you make a left instead of a right near the end, you run into a Clinger. Kill it then continue down 2 spiral staircases and you find Dark Revanants and a room with a pit with moarsmen inside. this room has many exits..I had to leave since I was alone -- Darcphenix 1/9/2001

name: Empyrean Magical Defense Battery
description: -- Ardak Eaglehear

name: Mud Cave
description:
Tough little dungeon for 3 mid-20s players. On top were Shallows Destroyers, Island Dillos, and a Jungle Phyntos Wasp. We didnt go further, because they were too tough for us. -- Adra Mar Sula
Can you say OUCH? The abover poster is correct on the creatures Id seen so far. A Destroyer is waiting in first corridor while 2 island dillos and the wasp are in the open room the hall leads to. Just like the above poster I didnt go any farther, 15 vitae in about 10 min on a lvl 28 life/war/creature/ua changed my mind :P -- Rendar 11/15/2000
Levels 10-30 only. In my opinion, the level restriction is very low considering whats inside, and considering whats on the island where this dungeon resides. You go from Mosswart Shamans on the island to suddenly being greeted by Island Dillos (lvl 38) Jungle Phyntos wasps (lvl 65) Shallows Destroyers (lvl 37?) and Shallows Devourer (lvl 50-some). I would recommend a group of at least 6 to 8 decked out level 25-30 people to even attempt this dungeon. Be ready for some serious tanking. The dillos and destroyers are immensely painful. I went in here with 3 lvl 26+ Melees and we got wasted hard, I ended up with 15% vitae Personally, I feel this level restrict needs to be fixed. On the other hand, the exit portal is a great place to tie to if you are levels 10-30. its close to the lifestone as well as the new city -- Jadok al-Siran 11/15/2000
I got a wee bit further in (just past the wasp) and ran smack into a ghost wisp. barely made it out alive after that with dillos spawning in front of my escape. -- knockturn 11/18/2000
Ugh.. Finally got to the end of this surprisingly small cave. After the Wasp, there is 1 island dillo, then 3-4 destroyers going straight followed by a brutal devoueror. TO the right was a wisp, and maybe another dillo. Both paths end a short way from the fork. Big thanks to Shemsu, and Zyrel on Frostfell for helping me finish exploring this place. -- Adra Mar Sula 1/18/2001
Today I soloed the place in 10 minutes as level 29. High melee defense helps a lot in here. Beautiful but disappointingly small. -- Immacolata 3/22/2001

name: Small Temple
description:
-- Ardak Eaglehear
Has 2 SIK chests, both had garbage when I tried them. Dungeon contained Sclavas and Revnants -- Fenrus (MT) 11/15/2000
Entrance is guarded by Sclavi, including one who blocks the doorway. Exit is hot with same sclavi. Dungeon is a single room filled with Slavi, undead and a tenticle. Foyer is modestly hot. I found two chests, one was SIK the other was open. Entrance and exit are recallable, but not summonable. -- Doc Feelgood 12/16/2002

name: Vesayen Isles Portal
description:
To 72.5S, 81.3E South of Bandit Castle -- Vixx (HG)
There are NO Level restrictions on this Portal BTW. There is a Portal back to Eastham just up the Beach on the Exit side of this Portal also. -- Stern [LC] 11/15/2000

name: Mayoi Beach Portal
description:
Found on a run of the islands Exits at 60.8S, 82.8E -- HawkofStonehold
Changed portol to portal in name. --Geomancer 8/16/2004

name: Floating Advocate Tower
description:
Floating advocate tower (open type of dungeon), lots of dark revs (nothing I conned was lower than lvl 111), probable entrance to this place is at the portal that is by town on big island (portal loc is 83.1S, 93.2E, HEAVY concentration of undead, bring BIG group). -- Kylos
Confirmed the entrance portal is Perimeter Portal. -- Fenrus 11/15/2000
Just to clarify: the majority of the higher undead are not in the Advocate Tower, but in a nearby castle. Dark Leeches, Dark Magus, False Dark Revs, Revenants, Skeleton Lords, and Scalvi too. -- Oceanus 11/17/2000
The Perimeter Portal near Santuary has been removed, so there is no longer a way to enter this tower (that I know of). Also the portal to Chalicmere that was inside seems to have been removed. -- Firilisun 12/14/2000

name: Tent camp
description:
Desserted town on big island (nov patch), BIG concentration of undead, slavius and putrid hoarsemen, got portal that might lead to floating advocate tower (also found on same island). -- Kylos
Hardly a town, more a small tent camp guarding the approach to Ithaenc Cathedral. These days I only see a couple of high level Bones in the camp. -- Immacolata 5/1/2001

name: Bridge
description: A bamboo type bridge linking the two islands together. -- Vengeance -DT

name: Bridge
description: Bridge connecting the islands -- Gyco of FF

name: Tower
description:
A tower surounded by Mosswarts (Idolator, Shaman), Jungle Wasps and Island Armoredillos. -- Vengeance (DT)
Bring your lightning protection. -- Spam Scud 12/14/2000
A good wall working spot. Jungle Wasps gen at a modest pace on top and inside the tower, but they tend to fall off and end up buzzing around the bottom. The wasps have low magic resistance so they are fine stock for an aspiring life mage who has high-level backup. -- Doc Feelgood 4/27/2001

name: Ithaenc Cathedral
description:
Very nice looking Cathedral, invisible(on radar) level 153 Dark Rev, very tough, Kelderams Tomb, Adjas Memorial (npk). -- Ardak Eaglehear
This is the firthest point in the New Island chain. It is on top of a large mountain that has waterfalls coming off of it. Undead camp on the way up the mountain to the Cathedral. Lots of nasties, Diamond Golems, Skeleton Bone Lords/Knights, Mourseman, and all those. Fairly difficult but I managed to make it to the Cathedral at lvl 35....just ran...didnt stop at all. This is am amazing site to see, the trip is well worth it. Note: there is no LS close to this so be careful. -- Chogall - FF 11/15/2000
Abondon castle by town on big island (nov Patch), top most floor got a eirie cathedral music with chest off unknow difficulty, basement got a cript, with a altar to turn pk into non-pk. This castle is a archers and mages perch paradize. -- Kylos 11/15/2000
The name of the place is Ithaenc Cathedral and the spell Recall the Sanctuary takes you right into the middle of the Cathedral, a safe spot these days - no high level Undead camping here. Its a wonderful staging point for forays into the western part of the island. Run to the tent camp south of here to find a ramp down. -- Immacolata 5/1/2001
Staging point for Dark Magus / Leech hunting
also Catacombs of Ithaenc quest starts here [Healers Heart / Recall Scroll ]. -- Nocturne [LC] 9/3/2001

name: Jungle Shadows (aka New Subway)
description:
Full of shadows and portal hub at bottomIncorrect portals and map

North:
Al-Arqas
Tou-Tou
Uziz
Stonehold
Kryst

East:
Al-Jamina
Rithwic
Lythelthorpe
Lin
Kara

South:
Sawato
Glenden Wood
Arwic
Freehold
Kayyaban

West:
Xarabydun
Nanto
Eastham
Samsur
Plateau -- Nutkenz 11/15/2005

name: Jungle Shadows to South Dires (level 12+)
description: Exits 84.2S, 34.4W -- Shoyu Suru

name: Mosswart Nest
description:
A small winding dungeon filled with newer, tougher, religous fantatic mosswarts, 35-45 levels. Entrance is clear, but monsters are nearby, foyer is clear. Tieable, no level restrictions. -- Doc Feelgood
This place has been in the data base for 24 hours. Please check before you enter your finds. -- Stop the Spam 11/16/2000
Correction: the entrance can be hot. -- Doc Feelgood 11/22/2000

name: Mosswart Hideout
description:
Right near MacNialls Freehold. Swarming Mosswart Idolators, Zealots, and Soul Trappers, Shadows (small children to Lts), a room with kneeling small chadow children in a circle, and at the bottom a Harrower Greivver, a couple Goldenback Tuskers, drudge raveners, and one Sotiris HollowMinion standing over a large bloodstain with Sir Martines Journal (excellent lore, btw). Creepy dungeon. -- Kerrara
The entrance can be hell - you can be gangbanged by 10-15+ mossies here - not too bad if theres no Zealots among them but those guys musthave been going to the same armorer as the bone lords cos those fire swords reaaaaly hurt :). Bring LOTS of stamina potions. -- Typhoid V 11/16/2000
Entrance is hot, foyer is *very* hot with fast-gen fanatics and idolators. Zealots get dragged into the foyer by fleeing heros (sorry, fast advancing backwards heros) -- Doc Feelgood 11/20/2000
Okay, this is the place for the Virindi Essense, which is a necessary part of the Singularity Weapon Quest. You need to use a Sturdy Iron Key on the chest in the Sotiris Hollow Minion room. Take the essence and leave. =) Nothing else is here unless you WANT to waste your time with some weak shadows. =) -- Gynax 7/5/2001 The thick spawn of Soultrappers makes this a fine place to hunt for Life Magic Ruined Amulets (for Sunstone Gauntlets). The other mossies here drop Ruined Amulets for War, Item and Creature, as well. -- Doc Feelgood 1/21/2004

name: Auroch Feeding
description: 2 Auroch Yearling, 2 Auroch Cow

name: The Lee Side Of The Mountain
Lighthouse
description: This is the right Coords. -- Ricko(MT)

name: Fallen advocater tower
description:
Is a fallen advocater tower, with 2 island wasps inside, and one outside. You need 225 jump to get inside the tower. Chest found inside, need lockpick skill to open it. Loot regular -- Okupa
The wasps guarding this tower are Jungle Wasps, actually. The chest inside is no longer locked, but produces low-quality weaponry loot. -- Confucius of FF 6/29/2002

name: Jungle Shadows to Plateu Portal
description: Destination location 4.5N, 43.1W -- Okupas Clan

name: Jungle Shadows to Glenden Wood Subway
description: Exits at 28.9n, 26.3E -- Okupas Clan

name: Jungle Shadows to Zaikhal Subway
description: Exits at 14.3N, 1.3E -- Kylos n Okupa

name: Jungle shadows to Tufa Subway
description: Exits at 14.8S, 6.1E -- Kylos & Okupa

name: Jungle Shadows to Neydisa Castle Subway
description: Exits at 69.5N, 17.9E -- Kylos & Okupa

name: Jungle Shadows to Baishi Subway
description: Exits at 49.3S, 62.9E -- Kylos & Okupa

name: Jungle Shadows to Eastham subway
description: Exits at 17.8N, 64.3E -- Kylos & Okupa

name: Jungle Shadows to Hebian-To Subway
description: Exit 38.6S, 82.1E -- Kylos & Okupa

name: JUngle Shadows to N. Direlands
description: Level restriction of 12+, exits at 24.4N, 53.8W -- Kylos & Okupa

name: Skeleton Tent
description: Desert tent with 4 skeletons in it. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Scenic View
description:
The most beautiful view in all the lands. The cathedral overlooks a fallen advocate tower, a floating advocate tower, and spectacular 3 level waterfall. After standing here for about 15 minutes, the message You need to find the key first. appeared. No idea what it means. -- Cyphersnow
That message still shows up once and in a while. I wonder what it refers to - the Mistress Chest perhaps? Anyway, this place has a sculptured guardian stone looking west, and there are nearby benches one can sit on to enjoy the view over the waterfall and Ithaenc Cathedral. -- Immacolata 5/1/2001
There is a PK altar down stears. The need to find key message is shown when someone doubble clik the altar - without a key -- Loke 8/27/2002
please note that none of the comments about messages and altars has anything to do with this view point. Its just a nice view point. -- Doc Feelgood 12/17/2002

name: Key Gorge
description:
A huge key shaped gorge with a group of undead at the center. No special loot or messages appeared when I killed them, no other items in the gorge. -- Cyphersnow
When we went in the gorge spawn was cuomo sclavi, the highest level ones, so it is a random spawn. 100 pt jump down from the walls around it. -- Aelryinth 11/20/2000

name: 3 Pillars and a Corpse
description: The Three Pillars are all pointing to a center and center is glowing, corpse next to the stones. Been here since beginning of game -- AR

name: Treacherous Tunnels
description: No Level Restriction, You can not tie. -- Truthsayer

name: North End of "Brick Wall"
description: The Brick Wall is an unclimbable escarpment running south from here to the Desert Gateway (7.6S, 13.2E) and well beyond... at least to 5.5S, 12.5E. So named because it rises steeply out of the desert floor. The top of the Brick Wall is a large mesa. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Sho Roadside
description:
Destination 27.9S, 68.4E
this is between Sawato and Shoushi -- Kara Gandharvi

name: Jungle Shadows to Tufa Subway
description: Exits at 14.8S, 6.1E -- Lenny & Carl

name: Northwest Dires Lifestone
description: Lifestone Near a tower. -- Crunchyfrog

name: Northern Point
description:
Found this in my golem hunting travels. Portal exits at 93.5N, 7.7E There are two portals near the exit point for Northern Dires Ridge and Zaikhal. -- Chen Gong
Its an ambush at the exit point. Better buff before enter. I didnt buff and jump

name: Lifestone - East Lytelthorpe
description: Convenient for hunting Setabs Barracks, Forgotten Temple, and the Lytlethorpe-Rithwic road. -- Marcus

name: Rifflyffa the Shopkeeper
description: Normal entrypoint shop. Sells at 140%, Buys at 80%. -- Marcus

name: Wing Collector - Lytelthorpe
description: Ercel the Wing Collector

name: Dires Lifestone
description: Not too far from the Amperehelion Vault -- Twae di Diji

name: Healer
description: sells stam elixirs and up to excellent kits...--Richard the Lion-heart of Leafcull -- RichardtheLion-

name: Bowyer and Ivory Crafter - Eastham
description:
Bronwyn sells at 120%, buys at 80%. -- Marcus
Bronwin sells fletched normal arrows and fletched blunts/arrows. He only has a limited supply of shafts for fletching. I didnt see any heads, perhaps they were sold out by Easthams many yeomen tourists. Ivory crafter lives upstairs and she only takes gromnie teeth, auroch horns and skulls. -- Immacolata 3/24/2001

name: Aderna the Lapidary
description:
Aderna sells at 133%, buys at 75% -- Mar
Jeweler she is. -- Immacolata 3/24/2001

name: Farnum the Provisioner
description: Farnum sells at 110%, buys at 80% -- Marcus

name: Getram the Armorer and Rundiscar the Smith
description: Rundiscar sells at 125%, buys at 70%. Getram sells at 100%, buys at 40%. -- Marcus

name: Mage and Healer - Eastham
description: Belbeca sells at 110%, buys at 95%. Sodyla sells at 140%, buys at 100%. -- MarcusBelbeca has moderate mana charges for 1650 and small for 715. Her selection includes up to silver scarabs, and also alembic, neutral balm and aqua incanta. -- Sis. Immacolata 1/23/2001

name: Farmer
description: This farmer sells at 140%, buys at 40%.  For some reason, reedsharks and wasps like to hang around this farm (probably not for the bargains on food, however.)

name: Mushroom ring
description: -- Jart of SaH

name: North Direlands Valley Junction
description: Exits at 2.6N, 65.1W, The portal is in a building that goes underground, Restricted to lvl 25+ -- AR

name: Nomad Tower
description: A ruined tower containing 2 Nomad Mu-miyahs. Might be new content from the November update. I wasnt able to ID their lvl, but they cast level VI war and life and are not too challenging to kill. -- Dotto

name: Vesayen Isles Portal
description:
Exits at 72.5S, 81.3E. A second permanent portal to the isles, didnt have time to write down exit coordinates because I got killed in the exit. David ibn Jensen, Dreamfollwers, Solclaim -- Davidibn Jensen
Exits at 72.5S, 81.3E, the same spot as the other Vesayen Islands portal. Immacolata 11/22/2001

name: Mosswort Prayer Group
description:
Cluster of 4 Zealots, 1 Soul Trapper, 1 Idol on the top of the hill in the center of the island. Several fast spawn groups of Idolators and Fanatics guard the approaches. This is a nice place to go to fight the new mossies without a lot of distractions. Fast, reliable spawn. -- Sol Chen
Danger.. Zealots are very bad dudes, and if you attack one you will be attacked by all of them. Along with the mossies there are Jungle Wasps on the hill (if you dislike Gold Wasps you will HATE these), Island Dillos and Shallows Destroyers on the beach (the baddest Dillos Ive seen yet). There are no structures, there is no place to hide, and if you get injured on the hill the dillos on the beach will make you run for your life. Of course, first you have to get to the hill. Did I mention the Island Dillos? -- Lars Larsson 2/1/2001

name: Crafter for Amuli Shadow Armor
description: Give Jibril ibn Rashid Gems that have been made from shadow specks and fragment shards and hell craft you Amuli shadow armor. Glimmering Gem = Low Quality Sparkling Gem = Medium Quality Scintillating Gem = High Quality -- AR

name: LS with 2 ports
description: Just a lifestone with a direlands northwest shore portal and a direlands valley portal. Did not take either, just running by... -- Blaze Lawless

name: Glenden Wood Portal
description: Portal exits to 28.9N 26.3E I found this in the middle of nowhere, while trying to outrun the boredom of the Lugian Citadels. Monsters in the area include all forms of Banderlings, Shreths up to Hunters, Fragments, Urusins, Mattekars, and Drudges upto Stalkers. -- Juliho

name: Yaraq Portal
description: Exits at 21.9S, 2.1W -- Nanies al-Fylin

name: Obsidian Stone Triad
description:
This is a curious set of three irregular obsidian columns, arranged in a triangle in the middle of the snowy forest. Nothing of note around it
nothing inside it. Perhaps a future portal or dungeon location? -- Path

name: Training Camps
description: Coords are a bit off, as there are 2 of these camps within a few meters of eachother. From last months story line.... this is one of the locations where you can find a training camp. In a small ring you will find 3 Drudge Raveners, and up to 5 or 6 Tusker Guards, and a Virindi Master. They are being trained by 3 Tumindeon Hollow Minions. The spawn rate of the monsters is a bit crazy, if you can clear the camp in about 2 minutes you should do fine, goodluck. I havent found out the true meaning of this area, as it seems that the storyline took more of a turn to the PK god. There are not many that know of this location, but dont be surprised if someone is there camping the tuskers. -- Partycrasher

name: Ivory Crafter and Tailor - Glenden Wood
description:
In Glenden Wood. -- Sis. Immacolata
There is a Ivory crafter on 2.nd floor of the house. -- Sis. Immacolata 2/19/2001

name: Mosswart Field Camp
description: Small Mossie field camp on the foot of a small hill, SW of Dryreach, with 2 Shamen and a Chief, as well as Barkers and Mudlurks, all on a reasonably fast spawn. The Chief has reasonably good magic loot, like lvl III Magic Items. Banderling Captain spawns very close too. -- Moriah

name: Archmage and Society Rep.  - Nanto
description:
Shin-Ro serves as representative of Dereth Exploration Society, decembers new initiative for newbies. Talk to him to receive A Book of Quests for New Explorers, describing the Stamped Letters Quest, and Nanto Information Guide with coords of various points of interests. -- Sis. Immacolata
Name of the Shop is The Oak Talisman. Home to the Nanto archmage Jo Ji-Shen and her apprentace Shin Ro. Jo Ji-Shen buys her wares at 67% and sells them at 167% Shin Ro buys broken tapers and accepts the water from the Water Temple as well as the stated information above -- Cuttler Strngmd 3/17/2001

name: Three Swords Hall
description: Pub in Shoushi, with Nin Hong the barkeep and Oi-Tong Ye. The latter is looking for the four jojii stones (newbie quest), and also is a Dereth Exploration Society representative. He gives you a Book of Quests for New Explorers with information on Stamped Letters newbie quest, and a Shoushi Information Guide with coords on interesting spots nearby. -- Sis. Immacolata

name: Southern Mt. Esper
description:
Found this while exploring southeast of Tufa. Level restriction of 12+. Destination 56.4N, 12.9E -- Nakita (MT)
I came across this portal during the march 2001 patch and it was surounded by a thick blue mist. -- Armin 3/24/2001

name: Chakron Flux Dungeon
description:
BaelZharon High Level Quest Dungeon, Entry level contains virindi (inluding observer), tuskers, hollow minions. -- Afreyt
Virindi Masters/Observers, Tusker Slaves/Guards, Hollow Minions. Level restriction 36+. Bring 2 large groups. Halfway through the dungeon splits into 2 sections with a 36-45 restricted portal and another for 41+. Both groups must work together as there are a series of buttons/levers that will open doors for the other group. At the end of the high level area spawns the Singularity Fragment which when combined with the Heart of Shadows and the Skull opens a portal to BaelZharons lair.
