It spawns on the floor between 2 large crystals. The spawn time is around 5 minutes. Be prepared for Bludgeon Vuln 6 from the observers combined with hollow bludgeon damage from the minions. There are some hot spots. The floor at the bottom of a ramp in front of a lever door will do damage and a couple of the large crystals will drain mana. The 36-45 group is rewarded with the Virindi Amulet. Item Mastery 6, Mana Conversion Mastery 6, Exhaustion 5. An easy approach is from Black Dominion or the Obsidian Rim portal exit. Run up the back side of the hill to get to the dungeon. There is an exit at the entrance as well as in the final room. -- Krell (LC) 12/27/2000
Virindi Servants Amuljet was upgraded in Aug 2003 patch to Moderate Item Magic, Minor ManaC, Item Magic VI and ManaC VI. Portal isnt summonable -- Jaz of SC 8/31/2003

name: Shade Stronghold
description: This is part of the December quest. There are actually 2 portals here, reqs are 26-35 and 31-40 higher is full of shadows,LTs and grivers.lower is shadows and children. each side must pull levers for the other. final parts are Dark Heart of the Shadow from the high, and Shadow Captains Heume from the low. -- senshin -MT

name: Empyrean Cloister Portal
description:
New lowest level quest dungeon(s) for December 00 update. One portal levels 15-30 enters a place that then has 2 portal levels 15-25 and 15-30? inside. results are the Skull of Palacost, a new Obsidian Dagger (4-8?) and the Barbed fletching tool? Was unable to enter myself, just sat and buffed my vassals and others. undead, liches,etc inside. -- Senshin -MT
Portals are *not* tieable here -- closest tieable are in the Yaraq area. Foyer is clear, top is clear... barely, mid-level desert monsters are easily brought to top area by heros running in. Top exit portal is guarded by a lich. Dungeon is large, winding, and populated with lich and higher level undead (Risen Soldiers and Risen Knights). The quests are designed to be attempted by large (8-16), well organized parties (know your route, know your levers, plan your body recovery). -- Doc Feelgood 12/25/2000
All liches, lich lords, and Risen soldiers(26)and knights. risen do not cast but have excellent melee. bring your ~190+ jump and as much run as you can. There are acid pits here I have yet to see a mage cross ;( -- senshin 12/27/2000
Inner portals are: lower (15-25) and upper (21-30). Upper side acid pit can be jumped with 148 jump/150 run (a mage doing it ;->). For a quick jump check, see if you can jump on top of the tall rock at the entrance. If you can, you can probably jump the acid pit. Upper and lower parties must coordinate their lever pulling to get through. Lower group gets the dagger and archery tool, upper group gets the skull. There are surface portals at the jump down point and just beyond the party split point. -- Doc Feelgood 12/28/2000
update: there are *three* acid pits to jump, the second requires 199 jump, third is easy. Upper level guardian is Mausoleum Director (55th). Whatever size group you think you need, double it. (20 would be comfortable). -- Doc Feelgood 12/31/2000
Well, as for the acid pits on the high side which is lvls 21-30, i cleared all 3; the first 2 with a jump of 200, and the last with 220. (this was a standing jump mind you). Also you can do this quest with only 8 people, we had 4 for the high side and 4 for the low. wasn't too bad, just watch for the respawn at the end, if you're not ready for war magic, you're dead. -- Elhanan Jabar 1/5/2002

name: Chosen of Asheron
description:
A man that looks like a fire elemental, but made of light stands on the top of this hill. He one of the Chosen of Asheron. If you talk to him, he gives you a book titles Asherons Missive. The book tells how we can finally defeat BaelZharon. Found on: 12/22/00 -- Al-Tuvah (HG)
I just past by that hill and he is no longer there. Must have past on, along with the BaelZharon quest. -- Zenaku (WE) 2/4/2001
Chosen of Asheron is now in Zaikhal near coords 14.5N, 2.5E. He/She is on a small plateau, cant miss it. You receive Asherons Second Missive. -- Octavian (FF) 7/4/2001

name: Snowman Igloo
description: On the way to the new Luggie Castle from Qual. An igloo with a few lithos around. Inside a lvl 128 snowman selling Magic Ice Balls. Only to be used for cooking, not throwing. -- Tatian-Mane

name: Shipwreck
description: Another skeleton shipwreck on the coast. This one has a Lord, 2 captains, and a bunch of warriors around a chest, many barrels, etc. much like the west coast wreck. Chest had low level junk like excellent kits, lockpicks, food, gems, etc, but about 8 items. -- Senshin MT

name: Hidetaki's Warrior's Tower
description: This is the tower four of Hidetakis warriors hid in after fleeing the battle field to avenge Fychecks death. The warriors were killed by a nearby wisp and now haunt the tower as zombies. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Fycheck Outpost Stone Monument
description: A stone monument south of Fychecks outpost that spawns 2 zefirs. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Master Tawa's
description: Tawa Matama the archmage sells at 125% and buys at 70% of value. He carries the first four scarabs and all other components. Moderate and Small mana charges are available too. The jewel collector resides upstairs. She will take gems that have been crafted by other trophy collectors and give you money for them, but her true specialty lies in the jewels from the strange masked creatures. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Fensen House
description: Healer Xidan Fensen and Scribe Hiruhi Fensen share this shop. Xidan carries health, mana, and stamina potions as well as excelent and good heal kits. She buys at 80% and sells at 120% Hiruhi carries all standard books plus the Path of Strife parchment. He buys at 60% and sells at 130%. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: The True Shot
description: Bowyer Bukai Fu-Ya specilizes in blunt arrowheads, arrows and quarrles. He buys at 70% and sells at 131%. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Emerald Unicorn
description: Jeweler Chueh Kaigin buys at 95% and sells at 140%. The sho mask maker Tsua Kagemata resides upstairs. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Smithy
description: Smith Son Jaiken offers better deals at this shop then his counterpart Tong La-Chin. Son Jaiken buys at 90% and sells at 115%. He deals in weapons, clothing, and armor. Tong La-Chin buys at 60% and sells at 140% and deals only with weapons. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: The Bending Reed
description: Barkeeper Ite Kenzen carries a number off replenishing foods, beer steins for tosting and the book of advocates. He buys at 30% and sells at 120%. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Yunen's Wares
description: Shopkeeper Yunen Ye offers a large selection including a metal press and baking pans, torches, and lockpicks. He buys at 60% and sells at 105%. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Food and Garments
description: Grocer Pon Hau-jo offers a number of standard cooking tools. He buys at 85% and sells at 140%. Obtain a Yifan Dress from Tailor To-Ping Ra who buys your clothing wares at 80% and sells hers at 120%. The leather crafter is upstairs from To-Ping Ra. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Abandoned Campsite
description: Looks like someone set up their camp site, went for a swim and never came back. Randomly spawns basic food and clothing. Good for true newbies to earn a couple of pyreals. -- Comothinon

name: The Leaping Stallion
description: Barkeeper Byrdara sells a verious foods, lockpicks, and beer steins. She does not have any rumors for you however. She sells her wares at 110% but she will not buy anything back. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Food Garments
description: Parsal the Grocer buys at 80% and sells at 126%. Cynsela the Tailor buys at 50% and sells at 100% -she sells a Kireth Gown with band as her dress. Scribe Degel Parson buys at 80% and sells at 150% -he stock basic books plus Directions to the Eastham Sewer and Path of Strife Rumor. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Peddler
description: Weary-looking Man sells the parchment Dryreach Rumor and Dryreach Key. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Blacksmith Shop
description: Rundiscar Smith gives better buy back deals by buying at 70% and selling but he sells at 125%Getram buys back at a low 40% but sells at 100%. The Aluvian Mask maker Alexander the Deft resides upstairs. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Platform
description: A large platform surrounded by stones and 4 previously unknown portals. Discovered by the LKODs Banneth and Xorg. -- Xorg

name: Catacombs of Ithaenc
description:
Located on top of the Cathedral. The key to the Mistress Chest is located here on a Putrid Moarsman on the bottom. The chest is also located on top of the Cathedral and contains the Healers Heart (Heal Other VI, Healing Mastery VI. Life skill required: 245, Diff: 105). Inside is high level Sclavus, Cursed/Affliction Wisps, Foul/Putrid Moarsman. Not sure if it can be done solo do to the levers. From the entrance, take the ramps to the bottom and pull the lever. In the lever room the Putrid Moarsman with the key is on the other side of a fence. You can kill him but unless your lucky you wont be able to loot it through the fence. This lever will open the south door on the 2nd level. Go through the south door and down one level and you will find a room with 2 levers. Watch the dispel trap on the ramp down and the mana blight and stamina blight floor traps in the doorways to the dual lever room. These 2 levers will open both the North and South doors on the 2nd level. Run up and through the North door on the 2nd level then work your way down. At one point youll need to jump off a ledge with affliction and cursed wisps waiting at the bottom. Work your way down to a room with plants and a cage overhead. The Putrid Moarsman with the key will run in to meet you there once your in range from the original lever room nearby. The easiest way to the dungeon is with the Recall the Sanctuary spell (Copper Scarab, Brown Taper, Comfrey, Personal Taper, Orange Taper, Cobalt, Personal Taper, Rowan Talisman) or take the Vesayen Isles portal south of Bandit Castle at 61.7N, 48.6E and run the length of the island chain. -- Krell (LC)
You need lock picks to open the door, at the buttom lever room -- Qq 1/19/2001
Good strategy to make it through is to throw melees in the front, and have archers / mages behind them firing away and healing. Form a wall with the melees so everyone gets the benefit of the shield. -- Nocturne [LC] 9/3/2001
Entrance and exit are quiet. Foyer is hot with Chomu and Ulu Sclavi. Spawn rate is modest. Entrance and exit portals are not recallable or summonable. -- Doc Feelgood 10/20/2002

name: Training Camp
description: A little group of creatures, looking kind of like a camp because of the number of creatures, and the rate of spawn. A Bander Captain, Mosswart Chief, 2 Mosswart Shamens, and more than a dozen lower level Mosswarts in the imediate area. Super quick spawn. I was lvl 28, and I had fun keeping up with it. Nothing else of interest, but didn't stay to look around. -- Adra Mar SulaUpdated to Obsidian and Oak Golems, with Ferocious, Cruel and Brutish Monouga nearby -- Chupon 8/19/2004

name: Forest's Blessing Bows
description: Lins bowyer Ri-Gau Ro buys at 80% and sells at 175%. He carries armor piercing arrows and quarrels but sells only standard piercing arrowheads. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: The Pine and Fir
description: Lins Barkeeper Vuo Nin sells at 70% and sells at 152%. He carries the book of advocates, and Directons to the Thieves Galleries. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Gems of the Woods & Tekai the Scribe
description:
Lins Jeweler and Scribe share this abode. Jeweler Lo Ma buys your wares at 95% and sells his at 200%. Scribe Tekai Shou buys at 60% and sells at 175%. She carries most standard books plus the Alter of Asheron rumor. -- Cuttler Strngmd
Looks loke the Alter of Asheron rumor-Book is gone. -- [twisti] 4/29/2001

name: Lin's Armor and Weapons
description: Armorer Bu-Chi Long and Weaponsmith To Za-I run this establishment. Bu-Chi gives a better buy back deal as he buys at 67% but he sells at 180%. He stockes yoroi and chainmail but will accept weapons and clothing. To Za-I buys at 60% but sells at 130%. She deals in only weapons, however. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Forest Magical Supplies
description:
Lins Archmage Ta Ban-Yu buys at 70% and sells at 150%. She sells starting comps (ie, no tapers, only lead scarabs) -- Cuttler Strngmd
Now she also sells up to platinum scarabs (at 60000) and full selection of tapers. Tiny mana charge for 525. -- Sis. Immacolata 1/30/2001

name: The Tree of Healing
description: Lins Healer Kai Kou buys at 100% and sells at 180%. She stocks stamina exilirs, mana and healing potions, execlent and good healing kits. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: River Mouth Portal
description:
Portal I discovered in my wanderings, Exits at . Which is Shop by the Sea. Lvl 12+ to enter. First discovered it around 20/12/00, so it has been here 3 weeks from the date of this entry. -- Davros DT
The exit is pointing in the wrong place in AC Explorer. The exit co-ordinates I entered are correct. -- Davros - DT 1/9/2001 Looks like a bug in AC Explorer. -- Polecat 9/25/2001

name: Desert March
description:
A new dungeon for Januarys patch. Tumeroks are outside guarding the place with Drudges, Virindi, and a pair of Hollow Minions deeper in. Has many portals to obscure places, including several deep in the dires and the Obsidian Plains. -- Optim Shi
The portals at the bottom are in the three wings off of the room with the minions. North Wing -- Bandit Castle (65.0N, 49.3E), Surface (6.4N, 3.9W), Obsidean Rim (48.0S, 65.0W / lvl 35). West Wing -- South Mt. Esper (56.8N, 12.9E / lvl 12), South Dires (84.2S, 34.4W / lvl 12). East Wing -- Black Hill (62.4S, 52.3W), North Dires (24.4N, 53.8W / lvl 12). -- Mariko-san 1/15/2001
The 3 wings are long hallways from the center room which contains the 2 minions and a Virindi Master on a fast (About 2 minute) spawn. No way to run by without taking some hollow hits. -- Krell (LC) 1/21/2001
Upper levels of the dungeon are all turmock warriors and priests. Going lower you will meet high priests and officers then finally gladiators. Watch out after the gladiators. There is a mass group of high drudges. Swarming can become pretty bad. The Master is guarded by high drudges and hollow minons. I couldnt solo the group of drudges at level 41 before the ones behind me respawned. Bring a group if your after masks. -- Dragonbait org 2/2/2001
In ACexplorer, the exits of this portal are wrongly displayed. This causes great inconveniences when trying to plan routes =( -- AquilaT 5/11/2002

name: Bunker
description:
Small cave filled with 7 or 8 Wild Monougas. Appeared with January 2001 update. -- Disturber
Spawn has changed to several Extas Raider, and Tiatus Raiders, the cave has some misc items on floor of cave. Nothing special. -- Zen Tek Ken6/27/2003

name: Essence of Strife
description:
If you hand this creature a level VI war scroll, it will teach you a level VII war spell of the same damage type (i.e. a Frost Bolt VI Scroll will yield Icy Torment, 110-180 points of Cold Damage) It adds the spell directly to your spell book, so in order to learn these spells, you must come here in person. -- Optim Shi
Since Oct 2002 patch (Festivus) this location is the start of the Gaerlan Citadel quest for Lvl 40-59 (I think). The location has assorted Fire Elementals -- Jaz of SC 11/12/2002

name: Everchanging Portal
description:
On diresland road at the lifestone and mage/weapons shop. -- BA
Its now a Plateu Portal, not Qblar. -- NonSequitor 1/13/2001
Mislabled -- Doc Feelgood 11/10/2002
Changes every patch. always has. -- Shal - MT 11/13/2002

name: Tusker perch
description: A good place to perch and hunt tuskers in the ob plains. -- Rocker

name: NW. Samsur Advocate Building Portal
description:
Portal from Samsur to Samsur NW outpost. On second floor of the Advocates Spire. -- Sis. Immacolata
Portal no longer works. The NW advocate building has been overrun by Hollow Minions. -- Goldor 12/29/2001

name: Desert March to Bandit Castle
description: Located west of Al-Jalima, near the Inner Sea Coastline.  Very dangerous dungeon.

name: Lone Snowman
description: A lone snowman you cant seem to attack it and it does not have a level - Archer From Hell -- Archer From Hel

name: Upper Shade Stronghold
description:
Dungeon restricted to levels 26-33. Didnt explore deep because there wasnt any close lifestone. Really detailed dungeon with red for and shadow children and shadows, maybe part of a new quest? -- Leafcull
Sorry about the spelling, it was a detailed floor. Looking for any info on this dungeon? Fryar -- Leafcull 1/16/2001
This is where you obtain the Captains shadow heume. You will need a group to go into the lower Shade stronghold to move levers while you move levers in the Upper dungeon for the lower dungeon. With a large enough goup in the lower dungeon you will be fine in the upper...the captain is like lvl126 i think but he wasnt a problem if there is enough of you...and he drops the heume...theres a timer as well but unknown length. -- Roland Chase-HG 1/18/2001

name: Empty Tower
description: Just an empty tower overlooking the pass below. -- Ryth-al-Rothgar

name: Wilderness Mage
description: A lone archmage in the canyon NNE of Al-Jalima with VERY little to offer. He has a few Alchemy items too. -- Mother T

name: Snowman Salesman
description: A level 229 Snowman that sells Poofy Snowballs and Snowballs try not to piss him off or he will attack you. Really mean varmit..casted Defensless V, Cold Vul. IV, and nasty frost spells at me..but luckily i didnt die -- GeorgeKG

name: Trophy Collector and Bowyer - Nanto
description: Collector and Bowyer in Nanto. Collector lives on 2nd floor and collects rat tails, wasp wings, armoredillo spikes, drudge charms, mosswart stones and banderlings scalps. -- Sis. Immacolata

name: Travelling Archmage/Tower
description: He is inside the Tower next to the Lifestone. Up until the January patch, he basically had noting to sell. Now he sells all components up to level 4 just like any other mage shop. -- Milrace

name: A Ruin to Baishi Subway
description:
Easy travel from Mayoi to Baishi. Enter the ruin, follow the left hand wall strictly untill you descend one level, take right fork for portal to Baishi. -- Immacolata
Ok, easy is relative. Be prepared to fight black rats, a water wisp, several mosswarts and a shaman. You newbies better be a wee bit careful in here, or you will be swarmed and killed, unless you manage to outrun the foes. For your first time in here, take a friend. -- Bro. Shadwell 2/27/2001

name: Jo Ji-Shen Archmage of Nanto
description: Tapers for 42p, up to silver scarabs, tiny mana charges for 585. Buys at 67%. -- Sis. Immacolata

name: Najmima the Archmage - Khayyaban
description: She buys at 80% and sells at 190%, the scrooge. That means moderate mana charges at 2850 pyreals, small mana charges at 1250 and tapers at 48. Highest scarab is Platinum (at 76000 ). -- Sis. Immacolata

name: Marnai ibn Ayyar the Mage - Al-Jalima
description:
Another pennypinching mage. Buys at 80%, sells at 190%. Tapers 48 pyreals, moderate mana charges 2850, small mana charges 1235. Sells silver scarabs. -- Sis. Immacolata
Also located in this house is Healer Hansur al-Hirwak. He sells Stam exilers, mana and health potions, and excelent and good healing kits. He buys at 85% and sells at 140% -- Cuttler Strngmd 2/9/2001

name: Magus Guthima the Wise (Arwic)
description: Antisocial Mage with a shop outside of town. Buys at 90%, sells at 155%. Sells up to Great Mana Charges, Silver Scarabs. -- Sis. Immacolata -- Taarna Blood SC

name: Archmage Philomon - Neydisa Castle
description: Philomon buys at 50% and sells at 180%, which translates into moderate mana charges for 2700 and small for 1170, tapers for 45 p and 72.000 pyreals for a platinum scarab. -- Sis. Immacolata

name: Lai Jhong the Archmage - Tou-Tou
description: Buys at 70% and sells at 150%. So you can get your tiny mana charge for 525 pyreals, tapers for 38 p and up to silver scarabs (at 375 p each). -- Sis. Immacolata

name: Archmage
description: Buys at 90%, sells 150%. That means tiny mana charges for 525 p, tapers for 38 and up to silver scarabs (at 375 p). -- Sis. Immacolata

name: Melia Thorn the Mage - Bandit Castle
description: Buys at 100% and sells at 180%. Moderate mana charge at 2700 pyreals and small at 1170. Tapers 45 and highest scarab is silver at 450. She offers dispells for all levels, 12600 for Nullify All Magic. -- Sis. Immacolata

name: Coral Golem Spawn Site
description:
Not a Dungeon but still an important outside xp spawn point. Coral Golems be here along with usually those with illegal island ties (illegal ties were removed eventually
ed. note) whacking away on those great big mountains of walking xp called Coral Golems. -- Phoenix Wolfsun

name: Cragstone Waterfall
description: This is a really nice place to hang out and rest after a long hard journey. The waterfalls are very peaceful and make a good place to mule from. There is also a water golem spawn here tht will help lower level chars get a few levels fairly quickly. -- Michael Highlan

name: Hebian-To South Roadside Hunting Spot
description: Found that at this exact location you can expect spawns of high level critters on a regular basis. On occasion Ive witnessed Linvak Ursuins, Limestones, multiple Vorous... usually during the day to boot. The best part about this is that its 25 seconds from the south Heb lifestone. I camped this location for many a day so it should be pretty stable. -- Zenaku (WE)

name: Chosen of Asheron
description: Near Cragstone, Chosen of Asheron gives you a book called Asherons Second Missive... -- Kruntus Maximus

name: Tusker Training Camp
description:
Tuskers, Hollows, Virindi and aparently alot of Kool d00d who have been hoarding these spots to the exclusion of others. Most on a 2-4 min spawn cycle (Kool d00ds included). Usually divided into four seperate camps so this is an approximate position, circle round about .5 to 1 click and you should find all four parts. A lot of people use these places to level newbies or to powerlevel. They also contain the chests which contain the spell scrolls need to learn the Level 7 spells for the Jan patch. P.S. Thanks to Sorren on TD for the coords. -- Phoenix Wolfsun Oh and thanks to Senshin of MT for pointing out its a POI not a dungeon. Anyway the information is back in as a POI so that it shows up on everybodies database. Enjoy the xp. -- Phoenix Wolfsun
On Leafcull here, there is a level 79 (as of this date) sword user for which the concept of sharing is beyond his feeble grasp. A real S&^. Hes here a lot. There are 4 camps in the immediate vicinity, and he just must have all of them. Look out, folks (Im UA, BTW). -- Zimbalt (II) 6/11/2001

name: Tusker Training Camp
description: Tuskers, Hollows, Virindi and aparently alot of Kool d00d who have been hoarding these spots to the exclusion of others. Most on a 2-4 min spawn cycle (Kool d00ds included). Usually divided into four seperate camps so this is an approximate position, circle round about .5 to 1 click and you should find all four parts. A lot of people use these places to level newbies or to powerlevel. They also contain the chests which contain the spell scrolls need to learn the Level 7 spells for the Jan patch. P.S. Thanks to Sorren on TD for the coords. -- Phoenix Wolfsun Oh and thanks to Senshin of MT for pointing out its a POI not a dungeon. Anyway the information is back in as a POI so that it shows up on everybodies database. Enjoy the xp. -- Phoenix Wolfsun

name: Hebian-to Portal
description: -- Hexxor

name: Al-Jalima Smithy
description: Blacksmith Busbawasa risides here. She sells buys at 70% and sells at 140%. She deals in standard weapons and armor. Also found in this building is the Gharundim mask maker Janda Sulifiya. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Al-Jalima Supplies
description: Shopkeeper Sunah bint Arfiz and the Spice Merchant share this tent. Sunah bint Arfiz buys at 60% and sells at 150%. She deals in a large number of items as well. The spice merchant sells oregano, cinnamon, and hot peppers for 125% of their value. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Al-Jalima Bows
description: Bowyer Rah Bint Khurdig buys at 70% and sells at 125%. She deals only in standard fletching supplies but sells armor piercing arrows and quarrels. She does deal in lockpicks, however. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: The Blade of the Desert
description: Armorer Hinfiya Bint Ju and Weaponsmith Mura Bint Muja share this shop. Hinfiya Bint Ju buys at 80% and sells at 140% Mura Bint Muja buys at 70% and sells at 125% -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: General Supplies
description: Shopkeeper Najsuf Al-Afan, Scribe Tashwi ibn Sayat, and Jeweler Hawtala Bint Arsha reside inside this building. Najsuf Al-Afan buys at 85% and sells at 140%. He sells many standard supplies including meet grinders. Tashwi ibn Sayat buys at 85% and sells at 140%. He sells many standard books and the parchements Alter of Asheron Rumor, Story of Winthuras Gardens, and Enkindled Souls Directions. Hawtala Bint Arsha buys at 60% and sells at 130% -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: The Skeleton's Mug
description: Barkeep Mausin ibn Hi buys at 67% and sells at 120%. He sells food and The book of Advocates, and the parchments Call for Adventurers. and Nevius Passage Directions. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Desert's Respite
description: Tumina the Healer sells stam exliers, mana and health potions, and exelecent and good heal kits. She buys at 60% and sells at 130%. Grocer Sina bint Idnun buys at 73% and sells at 132%. She sells containers, food, and cooking supplies. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Zayjay's Clothing
description: Tailor Zayjah buys at 60% and sells at 106%. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Safruya's Bows
description: Bowyer Safruya bint Bilak sells at 70% and buys at 135%. She carries only standard fletching supplies but does sell blunt arrows and querrels. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Safe Hill
description: Being chased around by a few dozen rough monougas, tuskers, and high level drudges from the valley to the north? The cliffs are all unclimbable, so head to this hilltop to shake them off and have a bit of a rest. -- Sturgeon

name: Path up
description: You can climb the slope here to get up on the bluff. -- Sturgeon

name: Floating Vase
description: Just a little vase floating about 2 meters in the air. Whee. -- Whim

name: Tall Mushroom
description: Here on the beach between Nanto and Mayoi stands a mushroom twice the height of a man. It stands alone. -- Ibn Schachabo

name: Forsaken Portal
description: Exits at 71.2S, 93.7E. At the bottom of Treacherous Tunnels dungeon, cannot be summoned or tied. Lets out in the cave where the other Treacherous Tunnels entrance portal is located. -- Adric the Red

name: Diyas al-Yat - Virindi Translator
description:
A new Npc. A Virindi Translator located outside the Zakhail Library.2/15/01 -- Catdancer
This translator cannot translate the February Unreadable Text -- Sixfingers 2/15/2001
Translater will take a shard found on directers..from the hollow dungeon... did say much...said virindi are taken hollows as there new body gaurd...boy do they hurt -- The dead 2/19/2001

name: Essence of Artifice
description:
Essence of Artifice is here. Give him level VI item scrolls and he teaches you a new Level VII item spell. -- Zenogias of MT
So everyone knows not to waste their time I gave this guy Portal Recall, Life Stone Recall, Summon Portal One, and Portal Tie and he gave me nothing back...:) Cheep Bastid...:P Just wanted to confirm that only lvl 6 scrolls will do. -- Dark Man - Sol 2/16/2001
Since Oct 2002 patch (Festivus) this location is the start of the Gaerlan Citadel quest. The location has about 6 assorted Frost and Electrical Elementals (Avalanches, Chills, Blizzards, Scintillas, Statics) -- Jaz of SC 11/11/2002
Start for the Gaerlan Quest, level 80+ -- Kermit of LC 12/18/2002

name: North Tumerok Vanguard Outpost
description: In the first several rooms and hallways you fight drudge slaves, drudge servants, various reedsharks, tumerok fighters and tumerok warriors. These are all level 10-26. I went deeper and found a level 95 tumerok high priest and got out of there fast. -- Falcon of Fury 7/29/2005

name: South Tumerok Vanguard Outpost
description:
Pretty much the same as the North Outposts description. -- Elias Kai
Vangaurd crossbow and amulet on boss. -- JZ 2/16/2001
Too easy in your late 30... did it just fro the fun and the Xbow for my younger toon.. tumeroks can get overwelming as they come out like 10-15 at a time in places...if in your 20s dont go alone -- the dead 2/19/2001
I am in my low 20s and I second that . However, there is good money to be made from the critter loot. I made 15K from the first room with reedsharks and tumeroks. -- Yellowbeard 2/19/2001
I'd say this is tougher than the North Outpost, though easier to find your way. (Go south.) I'd say don't go alone in your low 30's either. -- Thenn 3/5/2001

name: Humming Crystal
description:
There is also a door above the crystal. You cans see it visually, but you can ID it. You can also double click on the crystal, but nothing happens. I also tried a Fenmalain key on it - it let me use it, but then said you cannot use this key here. So me thinks SOME kind of key may do something??? -- Ho Mang 2/17/2001
Ok want some help..heh...get your old dagger (bludge dagger) combine with Harrower acid and u get a key...use key in this place... -- The dead 2/19/2001
Yes, combine the Organic Acid from a Harrower Grievver with the Peculiar Old Dagger. This will result in a key that can be turned in to the giant crystal for a Lyceum Recall Gem. This will take you to the Lyceum where your War magic skills will be tested against Nephol Golems for the chance to obtain the Thaumaturgic Plate armor. The Lyceum is also where you turn in the Blue Orb to the trainer to receive the Globe of Auberean. The peculiar old dagger is found on a random merchant in the south dires. I found him not far from the south land bridge portal exit at 82.1s 35.7w. -- Krell (LC) 2/21/2001

name: Jewel Collector - Baishi
description:
Jewel Collector tells you, I collect only the rarest of trophy jewels. I will take gems that have been crafted by other trophy collectors and give you money for them. But my true specialty lies in the jewels from the strange masked creatures. -- Sis. Immacolata
He is referring to gems created by the stone collector from black stones and rocks. Better to give them to an obsidian enchantress. He also makes items out of virindi jewels. -- Stormcrow Grey 2/24/2001

name: Wing Collector - Baishi
description: Wings of Phyntos wasps only for pyreals. Gold wings for xp. -- Sis. Immacolata

name: Wing Collector - Cragstone
description: Get XP and pyreal for all Phyntos Wings. -- Sis. Immacolata

name: Stone Collector - Qalaba'r
description: Takes virindi jewels, swamp stones, iron, copper, and granite golem hearts, banderling trophies. He specializes in black rocks and black stones. -- Immacolata

name: Leather Crafter - Kryst
description: Crafts stuff from hides of armoredillo, gromnie, reedshark, or mattekar. -- Sis. Immacolata

name: Lyceum
description:
This is the Ishilai Lyceum spoken of in the lore book On the Proper Use and Care of Thaumaturgic Plate. The Lyceum as it is commonly called, was founded by Exarch Hieromancer Sephrena Mirenndae, who later became Priestess of the Adjanite Sisterhood of Ithaenc. This will be your destination if you are on the Mage Armor quest. I would suggest Level 60+ for this place.
The Lyceum is on the top of a sheer cliff and can only be reached by using a Lyceum Recall Gem (which you must construct). It is no recall, so dont die. One of the gem components is on a week long timer. After you construct and use a Lyceum Recall Gem, you will be transported to a safe area within the Lyceum. The friendly NPC golem Eaushi the Trainer is there to greet you. Do as he asks and you will receive crystals. Give them to him for the uncharged mage armor. You can also give him a Blue Orb from the Heiromancer Halls and you will be rewarded with the Globe of Aubrean orb. Or you can give him a Sunstone Geode, a very rare random drop on the Nephol Golems within the Lyceum, for a Heiromancer orb.
The entire complex is very interesting and worthy of a look. There is a cooking dress in one of the locked chests in a building. The guard golems hold a key to this. There is also a Lightweight Tome hidden in the library at the mountain peak. Although this tome is suprisingly heavy, it can be written in. You can get outside by using a lever or jumping over the wall. If you have a low jump you may need a friend to stay at the lever in order for you to get back in. If not, you may be able to jump from the hillside and clear the wall. Whatever you do, dont fall off. You may lose your corpse forever. -- Taarna Blood SC

name: Advocate Tower
description: Just east of Shoushi -- Whim, SC

name: Hebian-To Scribe
description: Fenza Tan will buy your books and parchments at 70% of face value, then sell them at 180%. -- Kedri

name: Hebian-To Armorer
description: Lai Konsho buys your armor, weapons and ornate tableware at 67% of its value, and sells it all at 180% of its value. -- Kedri

name: Hebian-To Archmage
description: Shikiru Nohon will buy your magical items at exactly half their value. He sell everything at 133%. Moderate and Tiny Mana Charges can be purchased here for 1995p and 865p, respectively. -- Kedri

name: Hebian-To Tower Archmage
description: Anyao Zai buys your magical items at 70% of their value, and sells them at 150%. Moderate and Tiny Mana Charges may be purchased here at 2,250p and 975p, respectively. -- Kedri

name: Hebian-To Armorer
description: Rayyib al-Afij will purchase armor from you at 75% of its value. He sells his wares with a 150% markup. -- Kedri

name: Hebian-To Weaponsmith
description: Aldera Brunall will buy your weaponry and ornate tableware at 90% and will sell it all at 133% of their determined value. If youve got weapon and dish loot to unload, this is the best place in Hebian-To to do it. -- Kedri

name: Wing Collector - Glenden Wood
description:
Wing collector on the balcony of The Overlook Pub. Enjoy the view, provides the most beautiful spot in Osteth to quaff your froth mugs. -- Sis. Immacolata
Wing Collector pays more than others Ive found. -- William Drinker 6/19/2001
...whilst quaffing my frothy drink(s) -- William Drinker 6/19/2001

name: Trophy Collector - Rithwic
description: Trophy collector takes rat tails, drudge charms, banderling scalps, swamp stones, wasp wings. No hides. -- Sis. Immacolata

name: Sho Roadside Portal
description: exit at Sho area 27.9S, 68.4E. Seems - as there are so many entrys - that this portal changes positions sometimes. Maybe always the same portal just other coords... -- Houlai Kami

name: Ivory Crafter - Kryst
description: -- Sis. Immacolata

name: Standing Stone
description: standing stone -- Senshin -MT

name: Building
description:
The terrain here has been changed, a Meeting hall syle building with 3 Empyrean stones and a portal holder is now here. -- Senshin -MT
This is actually the dropoff for the Mainland portal found inside the Lyceum nearby. -- Confucius of FF 10/20/2002

name: Qalaba'r Portal
description: Portal dumps out close to Qbar, may be random portal, not sure. -- Spliffa

name: Roadside Vendor
description: A basic roadside vendor. Sells basic newbie items and buys just about everything including gems, but not jewlery and dishes. -- War Mongress

name: Vanten the Archmage - Kryst
description:
Vanten buys at 110% and sells at 180%, meaning tapers for 45p, moderate mana charge for 2700p, small for 1170p and up to silver scarabs at 450 pyreals. -- Sis. Immacolata
Forgot to mention, but Vanten also sells component peas. -- Immacolata 3/21/2001

name: Archmage Shop - Claude the Archmage
description: Full choice of components at 300% of theyr price, except Golds, Pyreals, Platiniums Scarabs and Peas. Buy magical items like wands, orbs and staffs for 120% of theyr price. Full set of trade note. Heve a funny look (Vinrindi) and a friend named Leopold. -- Kevin Kaldor

name: Cooking and Food Merchant - Berkholt the Burly
description: More choice here, some food, cooking itmes and books. Buy the same. -- Kevin Kaldor

name: Cooking and Food merchant - Nihara bint Umar
description: Some food, cooking items and containers. Buy same. -- Kevin Kaldor

name: Tumerok Dungeon
description:
This dungeon is located inside a Tumerok Fort. The dungeon itself has all kinds of Tumeroks. There is a big room with what looks to be a sacrifice table with a body on it and BZ statue Standing over it, there?s even a dagger on the ground... I looked all through the dungeon only thing of interest is SIK chest
Monsters inside have been updated. Ive seen a Diamond Golem, plate armoredillos, Banderling Enforcer, Ascendant Tumeroks, Augmented Tumeroks, Great Skeletons, Wasteland rats, Altered Drudges, Augmented Drudges -- Zen Tek Ken 6/27/2003

name: Plateau Top
description: Exits out at 44.4N, 43.5W

name: Inner Dungeon to Eastham SEE NOTES
description: Exits out at 17.8N, 64.3E Portal is at the bottom of Inner Dungeon should not be used for route finding. its a long fight to the bottom to get to the portals -- 4/11/2004 Ill agree that if youre talking about a level 1 character you wouldnt want to use this portal as a route, but I dont want to delete it because ACSpedia is also a repository for knowledge. Ive added SEE NOTES to the title and hopefully people will do so and read these words before routing with it. -Geomancer.

name: Monouga Camp
description: Theres 3-4 Outcast Monougas waiting around a open fire

name: Empyrean House
description:
Empyrean House with furniture inside, plus a lifestone right outside the door.
No furniture vendor present. Appears ready for a future AC update to populate with a vendor. -- Tyana 12/27/2001

name: A Mosswart Nest
description: very small cave, mosswart feeders and creepers will attack upon enter -- Black Hand 4/16/2001

name: Drudge camp
description: Small camp of drudges, one prowler and two skulkers. Battered remains of humans with mining tools scattered around. -- Lothar

name: Collector
description: He is interested in monster trophies from common rats,  red phyntos wasps, armoredillos, drudges, mosswarts and banderlings. If you give him such an item, He will reward you with money or an item. He dont deal in hides, however.

name: Wandering Bowyer
description: Buys at 50% and sells at 113%. Sells Armor Piercing and regular Arrows/Quarrels.

name: Death Shore
description: This is the beach just under the Granite Golem tower. Spawn is decent. Good for leveling LVL6 to LVL11, any class. You will find water and mud golems, as well as gromnies and the broken fragment. -- Latheoth

name: Monster Camp
description: I seen like 3 camps of monsters, one with a Banderling Captain and couple ravers around a pot over a fire, one with Drudges and a pack of shreth and Reedsharks near by. I believe the Banderling Spawn is perm since theres 2 chests one spawned newbie stuff other just spawned some pyreals. If you are a lowbie might want to bring couple of your pals to clear it out.

name: Leather Crafter - Qalaba'r
description: Get your hides of gromnie, armoredillo, reedsharks and mattekar crafted into armor. -- Sis. Immacolata

name: Ivory Crafter and Pub - Zaikhal
description: Pub is called The Open Book. -- Sis. Immacolata

name: Direlands Valleys Portal
description: Exits out at 42.9S, 63.5W Level Restricted to lvl 25+

name: Anadil's Tomb
description:
This Crypt is heavily guarded by Horrible and Nomad Mu-miyah, at the bottom lies the Tomb of the Sand King Anadil, which holds his most prized possession the Staff of the Nomads.... The Tomb is locked and has a resistance of 350.
Warning to those wanting to get the staff. Stamina traps galore. And the nomads arent the 50th level variety, but the 100 + variety -- Fon Win SC 10/20/2001

name: Wing Collector - Mayoi
description: All your phyntos are belong to us. -- Sis. Immacolata

name: Flaming Pillar
description: A tall pillar topped with flame. The stumps of six other pillars form a small circle around it. -- Adric the Red

name: Small Hut
description: A small house occupied by 2 white rats between Rithwic and Dryreach, and nice for muling. -- Gisela Solclaim

name: Jewel Collector & Archmage - Hebian-to
description: Archmage Anyao Zai buys at 70% and sells at 150%. Tapers for 38 p, moderate mana charge for 2250 p and silver scarabs for 375 p. The Jewel collector lives on his balcony, upstairs. -- Sis. Immacolata

name: Trophy Collector - Shoushi
description: Takes rat tails, phyntos wings, armoredillos spines, drudge charms, mosswarts stones and banderling scalps. -- Sis. Immacolata

name: The Touch of Healing
description: Healer Le Ben shares this building with Scribe Lashi Oi. Le Ben buys at 60% and sells at 120%. Lashi Oi buys at 70% and sells at 150%. He sells standard books. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Southern End Tavern
description: Barkeeper Wah Chon buys at 40% and sells 106%. She sells food and beer steins plus the parchments of General Advice, Empyrean Garrison Directions, Nanto Portal Directions. -- Cuttler Strngmd

name: Bowyer - MacNiall's Freehold
description: Lin Hanza is the most well stocked bowyer of Dereth that I have had the pleasure to visit, but quite the penny pincher. Buys at 50% and sells at 200%. But you forgive her when you are able to buy fletched normal and Armor Piercing arrows and quarrels (1000 p for 100 APs), as well as normal, blunt, frog crotch and armor piercing arrowheads for 2000 to 6000 p respectively. -- Immacolata

name: Kaza Nijina the Archmage
description: Located in MacNialls Freehold

name: River Bridge portal
description: Across the river to Cragstone. Exits at about 27.2N, 47.5E -- Chodley Chodson

name: Soul Fearing Vestry
description:
This is a great mid-level quest. The tower to the West is tower 1, the southern one is tower 3, and the one kind of in the middle (and highest one) is the 2nd. Kill the lich in the first, run up inside the thing and hit the lever. Then run inside the second and kill the undead (run inside to get them to spawn) it will open 3rd tower door. Run inside there and kill the undead that spawn outside. Kill the lesser LAST or the quest may break (and youll PISS OFF alot of people). If you learn the spawn points you can jump over the traps and not fight monsters, but other than the liches I found the place easy. On the high acolyte Ive never had a problem and Im lvl 33. You can leave your guy in that last chamber where he spawns and come back every 5 hours if you want to get a bunch of Yucky Keys (4 pulls per key). I recommend doing the chests when theres a few people around, 1 is uber weapons/armor/jewelry/clothes/wands/gems/etc., one is uber weapons/armor and the other is crap. Usually if you go there at hours when a decent amount of people inside there will be a few to tell you which chests are which. All in all its a pretty easy quest if you know what your doing, but if you run ahead and start hitting traps and spawn too many critters (especially in the last section) youll get yourself and others killed. @tell me if you need help. -- Ken the Feeble Either play the tower lever-pull game, or more simply, wait for the Lesser Acolyte to spawn (every 15 min.)in front of the towers, and kill him for a portal to appear for access to the dungeon. Dungeon is split into three sections, first section is Zombies, second is Skeleton Captains and the last by Liches. Creatures appear on spawn traps. You trigger the trap, and the creature spawns. Most traps are in the corners of rooms and hallways, but not always. At the end of each section is a Lesser Acolyte that you must kill to make a portal appear to access the next section. Lesser Acolytes improve in level the further you go, until the last one which is level 48. Sadly, I did not loot each acolyte as I went, apparently they have the keys for the 4 chests in the room that have lockpick resistance of 9999. SIKs do not work on said chests. There is also a lousy chest on the west wall that gives crud. Great looking dungeon, lots of neat light effects. Entered by Grundas the Dark 8/8/2000
An arrangement of 3 towers, each with buttons and/or levers on the inside. The button/lever in one tower opens the door to another tower. Ooodles of little trigger steps
entire dungeon quest would be fun for a few mid-levellers, alas, the run to get to this spot is not mid-level at all. -- Garfield3d
VERRY important note, when nabbing the 4-use yucky key from te high acolyte at the end and hoping the portal to the chest room, you be be MUCH hapier if do NOT use the key on the 2 chests that are on the same wall together. Those 2 chests have TERRIBLE loot compared to the other two, which par with Uber Chests. Be sure to juts wait out the 15 minute spawn on the chest on the bench and the one to its left, youll thank me later. -- Sargonas 8/13/2000
THE safest way to get there : go to Qalabar, take the road that goes south, follow it till it ends, then stay on the serpentine forested hill, it goes to the bottom in a gentle slope. Once there, just follow the valley to the Towers. Youll find some Tumeroks, Mattekars and low level Drudges and Skeletons. Its a little longer, but that way its a mid-level quest. I made the trip with my 10th level mage, without any problems
-) -- Jestra of MT 8/18/2000
The chests are on a 5 minute spawn, not 15. Also, to confirm the 2 chests on the East wall have really bad loot.. they DO. The North chest is mainly wands/gems/clothing, while the West chest is mainly armor/weapons. The North chest HAS given some GREAT helms though. All in all a great quest. Fun for 1st timers too, who have no idea whats going on. :) -- Dorn Axehaft MT 9/5/2000
Ok heres the real correct info on acolyte towers....first of all I need to say its a 7 minute spawn on chests as well as high acolyte.This quest can be done every 5 hours...when you get to the final room there will 2 pairs of 2 liches that spawn as you head towards acolyte the spawn is activated by floor traps...after the liches do NOT enter room solo...unless you can handle it.You can sucessfully stand at the very end of the hallway with out triggering acolyte or liches and buff up for the battle but watch your back people coming behind you will with any regards to you trigger the spawn(I speak from experience here)There are also individuals who will attempt to kill you at this spot(at least on hg)The west chest spawns armor and weapons of various qualities from UBER to UBER CRAP.The north spawns jewelry wands gems and the occasional armor weapons spawns here are usually AWESOME and in my opinion worth the wasted pulls to get that one good one...The best way to get here to my knowledge is to head west from Qalabar then follow beach (northern edge)when you get to the equitarial axis stop and put lightning protects on if you got them~hehe and run like the wind.There is a LS here and i recommend using it.One other important note:There are some people who enjoy disabling the dungeon and then stay in the area...in order to reset(fix) the acolytes spawn to enter the area must be cleared for 15 minutes for the land block to reset...That mean totally cleared the best way to accomplish this is just to log off for 15 minutes...1st and 2nd lvls are cake 3rd gets tough but if you can handle 2-3 liches at a time solo I recommend coming here best chests in the game... -- Krack of HG 9/9/2000
Definitely follow the coast. I went through one of the valleys headed west and saw shadow lieutenants, berserker and striker banderlings and a few other high level baddies. -- Mothgog 9/30/2000
The south coast route has spawn points which can produce Bone Knights and Bone Lords
Ive heard the north coast route is better. -- Red and Gold 10/6/2000
Just follow any coast. =) Spawns are random and you could see Armoredillos to Shadows to Bone Lords. Even by taking the North shore, you have to cross back South through dangerous land since the towers lie in close proximity to the Southern shore. Run fast, keep your mini-map open... -- Garfield3d 10/9/2000
The Acolyte towers are actually due south of 87.6S 10.6W. All three towers are visible from these coordinates. -- Slyzzr 11/25/2000
Most of the previous posts are crap... The real scoop is that the end of this simple quest are chests that are lootable 4 times with the yucky(lucky) key. For an added bonus you also get a skull worth 12,000 exp to an ivory crafter(great to save these for quick vitae burners). The problem is choosing the right chests at the end to open. The chest positions in the room change constantly(previous posts telling what ones are good are worthless posts). Out of the 4 chests 2 are uber loot. 1 contains primarily weapons/armor and the other contains magic items like wands and jewelry. The best approach to finding the right chests is to either save your keys until you show up in the chest room with someone that has already located the uber chests or go with another adventurer so at most you both only waste one try with your key. Note: Unless you are lvl 40+ or you have a nice size party I would suggest staying just outside high acolyte room and draw him out with ranged attacks or spells(evil presence is the killer in the room not the acolyte). My technique is to cast imperil 4 on the high acolyte to where I can 1 time him with ease when he charges me and leaves his room. The ONLY drawback to this quest is that you can only do it every 5 hrs. Another note... The spawn rate for the high acolyte is only around 4-5 minutes. BTW another nice technique to conque

name: Ivory Crafter - Ayan Baqur
description:
Ivory Crafter tells you, I am interested only in gromnie teeth, auroch horns, and skulls. For those I will reward you with useful items I make myself. -- Immacolata
This is now a Virindi Ivory Crafter. -- Khazeh al-Qunat 4/1/2001

name: Jeweler - Ayan Baqur
description: Daryam ibn Zubed sells at 260% and buys at 125%. Sometimes he offers the most amazing level IV stuff here, and a bit not-so-dazzling level V. -- Immacolata

name: Dark mosswart gangs
description: This northern part of the third Vesayen Island has several groups of mosswarts that always respawn. Each group has at least one Soul Trapper that debuffs you at large with various vulns, weakness etc., and the rest is either the fire loving Zealots or the not-so dangerous Idolators. One group in the center sometimes worships a Dread Idol. -- Immacolata

name: Collector - Samsur
description: Collector tells you, ""I'm interested in monster trophies from common rats, red phyntos wasps, armoredillos, drudges, mosswarts and banderlings."" -- Immacolata

name: Provisioner - Samsur
description:
Julsama bint Sakim is your jack-of-all trades. Backpacks, lockpicks, armor etc. And she now also sells an Intricate Carving Tool for 11,000 pyreals. Description says: A multipurpose tool used to sculpt golem hearts and virindi artifacts. Hmm, is this part of lock pick luv? -- Immacolata
The Provisioner no longer sells the Intricate Carving tool for lookpicking. However she has picked up the new UST for tinkering skills -- Zen Phish -HoCD 7/19/2002

name: Three Brothers from the Shagar Zharalim clan
description:
Anid Al-Fadee the Undead Hunter and Ya-Bint-Al-Hawa the Trophy Collecter. Ya-Bint-Al-Hawa carrys the Staff of Nomads and Shendolain Shield. I gave Ya-Bint-Al-Hawa a Unlocked Large Mnemosyne and recieved 10 Treated Healing Kits. I believe the bigger the unlocked Mnemosyne the more kits you get. Anid Al-Fadee will give you dispell potions, I believe he gives you a couple lvl VI dispell potions if you give him the Unlocked Large Mnemosyne.
Notice there is a third table with arrowheads on it. the Healing kit brother metions hes mentor lost near uziz..look for arrowhead guy there :) 3/23/2001
The mnemosynes do not need to be unlocked for the reward. The smaller the mnemosyne, the less potent the reward. A Small gets you Nullify gems which remove 2-6 V and below spells. Or 5 treated and 5 peerless kits. The arrowhead man is NOT in-game at all, he was removed due to tech reasons, ie the arrows didnt work like they were supposed to. Probably look for him in the next patch. -- Fistandantillus 3/24/2001
A Large Mnemsoyne gives you 3 Gems, that nullify all negative spells -- Dos 4/5/2001
Now the Three Brothers of the Shagar Zharalim. The speculations on the empty table here and on the CoD-boards were true. Gabal Feteh says he can make you magical arrows if you give him a memnosyne fragment (even Turbine cant spell it.). You get the heads only, and need fletching skill to attach them to shafts. Despair, life archers without fletching. Also he claims you need a Shendolain Crystal (X)Bow to fire them. I wonder if Fenmalain and Caulnalain bows will work as well? -- Immacolata 4/17/2001
Ya-Bint-Al-Hawa now dispenses 3 Peerless Healing kits for a tiny mnemosyne. -- Mishiko 4/23/2001

name: Inner Dungeon to Zaikhal SEE NOTES
description: Exits out at 14.3N, 1.3E This portal at the bottom of Inner Dungeonshould not be used for route finding. its a long fight to the bottom to get to the portals -- 4/11/2004 Ill agree that if youre talking about a level 1 character you wouldnt want to use this portal as a route, but I dont want to delete it because ACSpedia is also a repository for knowledge. Ive added SEE NOTES to the title and hopefully people will do so and read these words before routing with it. -Geomancer.

name: Inner Dungeon to Hebian-to SEE NOTES
description: Exits out at 38.6S, 82.1E This portal at the bottom of Inner Dungeonshould not be used for route finding. its a long fight to the bottom to get to the portals -- 4/11/2004 Ill agree that if youre talking about a level 1 character you wouldnt want to use this portal as a route, but I dont want to delete it because ACSpedia is also a repository for knowledge. Ive added SEE NOTES to the title and hopefully people will do so and read these words before routing with it. -Geomancer.

name: Drudge Camp
description: 2 Drudge Slinkers and a Drudge Prowler around a pot over a hot fire, plus theres 2 human corpses, 1 dillo Head and 1 Auroch Bull Head. The camp is hidden behind some brush

name: Wing Collector - Eastham
description: Wing Collector collects only phyntos wasp wings. He rewards gold phyntos wasp wings with xp. -- Immacolata

name: Drudge Tower
description: A locked tower with three drudges in it. Didnt have a key nor lock picking. The door frame is decorated with two human skulls. -- Immacolata

name: Leather Crafter - Arwic
description: -- Immacolata

name: Pub and Ivory Crafter - Cragstone
description: The pub is called Thorstens Rest in celebration of the Isparian hero Thorsten Cragstone. Drink a toast in his name and get your gromnie teeth, auroch horns or skulls crafted while doing so. This pub can be quite the entertaing place to be at times, lots of player fun here at times. -- Immacolata

name: Bowyer - Cragstone
description: Scildith Dyrson has fletched normal and blunts quarrels/arrows. Charges at 140% while buying at 90% of nominal value. The DIY archer can buy both kinds of shafts and normal heads, but in limited quantities only. -- Immacolata

name: Bowyer - Hebian-to
description: Bowyer Yatenyu Zhuong has arrows and quarrels, and also broadhead arrows and quarrels. For fletchers he has shafts and normal heads plus the broadheads. Sells at 175% and buys at 80% -- Immacolata

name: yaraq cows
description: lots of slow stupid level 10 cows here that arcers and mages pick on with hit and run tactics.good place for low levels to level or work off viate(but dont let the cows catch you.)DO NOT COME HERE ON DARKTIDE..either a PK will kill you or an Anti-PK will call you a PK and kill you anyway.and if you kill someone here they will come back with their level 40+ main character and kick your ass time and time again.EVIL.......... -- death to you haAhh... the Yaraq Cows... I knew them well... First, the cows were nerfed to sixth level, then the Training Dungeons were enhanced so you came out fifth level, and finally Olthoi Arcade was opened so you could get to 20th level in two hours. But in their day... they were a prime gathering place for newbies, leeches and wannabe patrons. -- Doc Feelgood 1/14/2004

name: Maria's Retreat
description:
This is the EVER elusive place in Yaraq to turn in your gold letters. Hopefuly noone else will have to go through as much trouble as I did to find it. -- War Mongress
Also the lady who gets congratulations from NPCs near Yaraq North and Yaraq East. -- Doc Feelgood 7/7/2003
She lives inside the house, take the main entrance and the left back room door, follow the passage down. -- Immacolata 7/19/2003

name: Healer of Stonehold
description: Has good and excellent healing kits, elixirs. Sells at 190%, buys at 60%. -- Immacolata

name: Merchant - Stonehold
description: Vivaina of Stonehold has it all (at 180%) and buys it all (at 70%). Youll finde AL 150 heaumes and armets, food, arrow shafts, cooking utensils in form of baking pans and metal presses. And a complete selection of lockpick, from crude to peerless (at 5400 p). -- Immacolata

name: Archmage - Stonehold
description: Ta Ri Sells at 160% and buys at 60%. Tapers at 40 and up to silver scarabs at 400 p. Moderate and small mana charges. She also sells aqua incanta, neutral balm and alembic. -- Immacolata

name: Bowyer and tinker - Stonehold
description: Gerhi of Stonehold sells at 180% and buys at 70%. He carries regular and armor piercing arrows and quarrels. Also both kinds of shafts and normal arrow heads. Barnar the Tinker lives in his attic. He claims he can carve a crossbow stock from a wood golem heart -- Immacolata

name: Fire Auroch Pastures
description:
New for the 03/2001 they changed the spawns south-west of GW all the way to Zaikhal, this particular area is very interesting however, because up until this patch a very limited number of Fire Auroch BULLs existed in game at all. Now anyone seeking to make a White xbow, or bow has more locations to fight the Fire Bulls and get their horns. Note: for all those who have told you otherwise, horns on your comp affect only 1 thing.. + to defense on your comp bow/xbow.. NOTHING else.. if they tell you otherwise, theyre ignorant ^_~ -- Shal of MT
The aurochs are here, along with some dolls and mannequins plus a mu-miyah or two in the more desert-like areas around the plains. Interesting place to hunt. Note that if youre loking for fire auroch horns, kill all the fire aurochs you can find -- I got one horn off of a Cow and another off of a Yearling. -- Pandarus 4/3/2001
Still a fair ammount of Fire Auroch bulls. Lots of Broken Fragments as well. Fire Yearlings and cows drop horns, but are not useable for the ivory colored Composite. The guy who carves the horns will take them and not return. They need to be specifically Fire Bull horns. Drop rate is similiar to Great Mattekars. I spent a couple of hours out there, got both my horns, well worth the effort. Gives you only 2% on defence mod, but looks dayam cool. -- Neo Taciasun HG 6/20/2001

name: Wooden pier
description: A small wooden pier going out into the channel separating Osteth from the presumed Asherons Island. I wonder what a pier is good for since there are no boats in this world? -- Immacolata

name: Shopkeeper and Collector - East Rithwic Outpost
description: Shopkeeper Hydeatha sells at 80% and buys at 140%. She have a bit of everything. Mindorla the Collector accepts phyntos wasp wings, armoredillo spines and drudge charms. She also gave me a love letter to bring to Celcynd the Dour in Rithwic. -- Immacolata

name: Panopticon Complex
description:
New dungeon activated April 1st, Residents include a full range of Virindi, Hollow minions, Tuskers and Drudge Raveners. At the end all of the normal Ayan Baqur NPCs stand, some say some interesting things. Surface portals up the ramps from the NPCs. I didnt check past the surface portals so there may be more. -- Zenogias of MT
Hmmm, for April Fools Day the Virindi take over a town? -- -giggles 4/1/2001
Lots of Tumideon Hollow Minions, one SIK chest, and the townsfolk of Ayan Baqur. Bring stout for Ulgrim. -- Khazeh al-Qunat 4/1/2001
Surface portals can be tied to. Welcome to Ayan Baqur everyone. -- Virginia Plain 4/1/2001
The Panopticon Dungeon is outside of Ayan Baqur. The Entrance portal is not tyable and is level restricted to 32+ BUT a surface portal inside is tyable which makes AB no longer a non gatable town... Inside you will find Drudges, Tuskers, Virindis, Hollow Minions... and most of all you will find all the former NPCs from Ayan Baqur in one room. -- Zeeb 4/1/2001
SiK seems to smuck. The now-former townsfolk of Ayan Baqur are reduced to wailing now, cant buy or sell. -- Garfield3d 4/3/2001
59.1s 84.6w nope no dungeon at those cords must be wrong.... -- Byren 4/4/2001
Correct location is 59.1S 84.0W -- Zopem 4/5/2001
The entrance and exit are covered by local Dires fauna, the foyer is quiet. The hallways are large, and the layout of the first part is simple. The first part is a good place for ravener and virindi puppet hunting. The back is a complex of corridors that circle back on a main hall. The back is where you will find the Hollow Minions, higher virindi, and their tusker pets. -- Doc Feelgood 8/21/2001

name: Archmage - Shoushi
description: Buys at 25% and sells at 180% Eeek. Stay clear, mages. Chen Wah-Ji is a hawker and a tout she is. -- Immacolata

name: Note spawning
description: Ive seen a note lying on the ground here numerous times. I think its a new rumor from time to time. -- Immacolata

name: Hunting Grounds
description: Good hunting area from here to 2K in any direction for Higher lvl Mu-miyahs, Dolls, Marrionettes, Monougas, Dune Reavers, Silt Lurkers, and some Frags. -- Ching The Quick

name: Tuskers Camping Spot
description:
Red Kates Personal Spot... Come and get it powerlevelers -- ibn IceHole
roflmao Poor Red kate..... -- Zenogias of MT 4/30/2001

name: Soul Fearing Quest - Tower 1
description: These are the correct coordinates for the NE tower of the so-called 3 towers quest properly known as the Soul Fearing quest. This is the first tower which must be assaulted (kill the lone Lich) before proceeding to Tower 2. -- Alif of HG

name: Soul Fearing Quest - Tower 2
description: These are the correct coordinates for the NW tower of the so-called 3 towers quest properly known as the Soul Fearing quest. This is the second tower which must be assaulted (kill the group of Liches inside) before proceeding to Tower 3. -- Alif of HG

name: Soul Fearing Quest - Tower 3
description: These are the correct coordinates for the SW tower of the so-called 3 towers quest properly known as the Soul Fearing quest. This is the third tower which must be assaulted (kill the undead/zombies and enter the tower to cause the Lesser Acolyte to appear outside. Kill the Acolyte to cause portal to be opened which allows entry into the Soul Fearing quest). -- Alif of HG

name: Adventurer's Haven Portal to Samsur
description: exits 2.7S, 18.9E -- Neo

name: Adventurer's Haven Portal to Lythethorpe
description: exits 1.9N, 51.9E -- Neo

name: West Aerlinthe Lighthouse
description: Very old large lighthouse like the one in Tou-Tou. You can run to the top. This isnt far from the T-Shirt vendor. -- Blau (MT) -- Vigilantie (TD) 4/18/2001

name: Advocate and Sentinel Shrine
description: A shrine to the Advocates and Sentinels that served the AC community until recently. An epitaph reads To Those Who Server. -- Maudib alDornac

name: Novedion Lugian Merchant
description: Novedion tells you, Greetings. I and my two brothers have been sent to some of the Isparian Arrival points to offer our fine wares. While many Isparians have only dealt with our less refined cousins, the Tukal smiths are masters of many arts. These particular gems have been crafted by some of our finest master gem crafters and imbued with helpful magics which I am sure will be useful to the Isparian adventurer. I also am selling Benevolent Calm, a necessary ingredient to fashion the Staff of Clarity. Gems Sharp Topaz 1,000py A gem of slashing protection Thorned Garnet 1,000py A gem of piercing protection Lightning Saphire 1,000py A gem of lightning protection Fire Ruby 1,000py A gem of fire protection Cold Moonstone 1,000py A gem of cold protection Force Opal 1,000py A gem of bludgeon protection Armor Gem 1,000py A gem of armor protection Acid Emerald 1,000py A gem of acid protection Miscellaneous Benevolent Calm selling for 10,000py Skam Jim-One (Leafcull) -- Skam Jim-One

name: Monty's Golden Chest
description:
Trade in your pyreals for the chance to have valuable items drop right in your lap. I just installed a shard-encrusted toilet with my winnings. Come and watch Dereths economy fall apart before your eyes. -- Sixfingers
Yeah thats right, finally the people who cant camp the Frag dungeons (Fenmalain, Caulnalain, and Nexus), or dont have the time to spend hunting the beach countless hours for a set of armor that is mediocre at best, can come and trade their pyreals in for shardage. The current average on shards is about 350k. That sounds about what they were going for. Now you can get them from NPCs. Can we say Lootomatic shards? I however think it will revitalie the economy by making pyreals worth trading for. OVer and out. -- Sun Pao 4/18/2001 Moved with The Calm patch (December 2004) to Holtburg - 40.9N, 33.6E from 42.8N, 25.1E. -- Seeker 12/8/2004

name: Tomb of The Dead
description: Dark Wisps, Risen Soldiers, Risen Knights, Shadow Wisp. There is 2 chests, 2 Sarcophagus, and a SIK chest in here with low value loot. You can obtain Alloy Contraption here for Undead Mechanic Quest.

name: Sand Shallow
description:
Your mainly running down a hallway fighting Dune Reavers, Silt Lurkers, Dread Mu-miyah, and Ancient Mu-miyah. I didn't find anything other then these monsters through out the dungeon.
There are at least five levels -- all long corridors, curving or straight, with alcoves containing fire urns. Otherwise, as described above. Using the item locating keys at what seems to be the bottom revealed nothing. -- Cen Vint (HG) 2/1/2002

name: Arshid's Den of Iniquity (Gharu'ndim Casino)
description: The Gharundim casino, southwest of Al-Arqas. Ashadi bint Samaq sells tokens for low, medium, and high stakes chances at winning (everything from apples to shards to a key to the mysterious Golden Chest). You gamble by purchasing tokens, which are no-drop, and giving them to the appropriate gambling NPC. -- Khazeh al-Qunat Moved with The Calm patch (December 2004) to Yaraq - 21.5S, 0.7W from 37.9S, 7.5E.-- Seeker 12/8/2004

name: Advocate and Sentinel Memorial
description: A monument in memorium of the hundreds of volunteers who gave up considerable time and effort to assist the players of AC, report bugs and enforce the COC. -- Bob Down SC

name: Second Lugian Raider Camp
description:
This is the place to get the Sceptre of the Mind. This place is a crater of sorts which has Gigas and Extas lugians up on the rim, and towards the bottom is a spawn of 2 Dread Mattekars. They have about a 5 minute cycle. In the spot they spawn is where the Lugian Commander and Lieutenant spawn, and the Lt. drops the Sceptre of the Mind. On the rim and in the crater are about 4 spawns of Dire Mattekars as well. None of the lugians use hollow weapons. Part of the April 2001 release. -- Sun Pao
North of the crater is a steep rise, best to approch the commander from this side, You must bring someone with spear skill of 250+ to pick up the staff and bring it back to linvak to create the staff of clarity, there is a timer on the staff not sure how long it is so dont bring 1 spear guy and expect to get enough staffs for all your friends. -- BuffDaddy -MT 8/27/2001
Good spot to hunt for Mattekar Trophies for the Claw and the Glove. -- Nocturne [LC] 9/3/2001

name: Linvak Tukal Entryway
description:
Portal cant be tied to or recalled to.


This is the long awaited dungeon leading to Linvak Tukal (the Lugian Fortress). It is full of Lugians and Raiders. There is an exit portal just inside, and at the end is the portal to the fortress proper. The fortress is full of many beautiful sights to see, and shops, too. Dont forget to pet Balor when you get there... -- Thel
Portal cant be tied to. -- Immacolata 4/19/2001
The portal cannot be recalled to either. The portal to the Linvak Tukal City, inside, is also not-tieable and non-recallable. There are regular lugians and the new raiders who carry hollow weapons. -- Sri 4/20/2001
This place is a lot bigger than the citadels and darker too. Its hard to see where youre going and easy to get lost from the entrance portal. I would suggest going in with a group as I went in solo very deep in and ran into a spawn of Extas, hard for me to take on more than 2. -- Darcsun 4/20/2001 Lugies have been upgraded slightly. Starts out with Gotrock Gigas and Gotrock Montok and goes up from there. The portal is now recallable/tieable/summonable.

Entrance is usually surrounded by Raiders throwing hollow boulders, but the Foyer is quiet as long as no one has dragged the nearby Montok spawn to the Exit Portal. -- Shemp 6/8/2004

name: Giant Commemorative Statue
description:
A beautiful statue overlooking a fallen shadow spire. Plaque at the bottom reads, To Those Who Served. -- Gisela of SC
A memorial for the Advocates -- wishbone 4/18/2001

name: Gan-Zo's Den of Iniquity (Sho Casino)
description:
Gan-Zos Sho casino is a short run west from Sawato. And remember those pack dolls stashed on your mules? Wager a pack doll with Gan-zo and get a key to the golden chest. -- Gisela of SC
You can also get a pyreal pea or a golden gromnie pack doll for your wager with Mi Gan-zo...beware. -- Khutulun 4/18/2001
Yeah but yal forgot the Big payoff, The doll can also be gambled into a small shard. out of 6 dolls i got 3 small shards, 1 golden key and 1 gromnie, and 1 pea. -- w00t 4/19/2001 Moved with The Calm patch (December 2004) to Shoushi - 34.2S, 73.6E from 29.9S, 49.3E.-- Seeker 12/8/2004

name: Bowyer - Linvak Tukal
description: Omerik is your friendly local Lugian bowyer. Sells lugian rocks for your throwing pleasure. At 180% though. He (or she - who can tell) buys at 70%. Has normal and AP quarrels/arrows as well as normal heads and shafts. -- Immacolata

name: Linvak Tukal
description:
No longer protected by Kifandals powerful magic, the Lugian Fortress is now finally open to the public. Enter via a portal at 76.6S, 28.0E, and brave the Lugians and Raiders inside. (note that the raiders have hollow weapons, which cut through creature enhancements to armour). At the end of the dungeon, there is a portal that will take you to the inside of the fortress. Overseen by Lord Kresovus and his faithful companion Balor, it is complete with shops, towers, and lots of lore. A beauty indeed, there are many sights, including some paintings, and nicely sculpted architecture. There are also some hidden areas and tunnels to explore, one of which leads to what may be the highest point in all of Dereth. There are quest completion points here as well. The exit back out is one of two ways: you can jump off, or take the exit portal at 77.4S, 28.0E, which takes you just north of the dungeon entrance. -- Thel of SC
Coords a bit off, besides, its the finest place I ever saw in Dereth, but notch down those graphics details settings or see your game slow to a crawl. Be also aware that you cannot portal recall to Linvak Tukal. -- Immacolata 4/19/2001

name: Gredaline Consulate
description:
Located in the mountains northeast of Qalabar. Drudge and Doll family -- Cuttler Strngmd
This dungeon part of the April patch. Its where you get the 2 new Life Spells and 1 War spell. You can enter the dungeon safely with no fear of being ripped upon entering. To get the new spells, there are 3 Named Virindi to kill and loot the scrolls. Head North gets the health scroll, Head west gets the Mana Scroll and to the East gets the war scroll. Very easy to do for level 55 Mage, only druges dolls and virindi. If you jump off the platform and head south there are Tusker guards and Hallow Mindors, ..nasty to a mage, I didnt get to explore much of the south passage but did come across a Virindi that Dropped a Virindi Shard, ...maybe someone can work out what its for. Once you have the scrolls take them to the guy standing out the front of Zaikhals Scribe shop. -- -= Aratar =- 4/19/2001
The Shard the virindi envoy drops is an event lore scroll. Take to same guy that translates the new spells for a translated text of the shard. -- AllyMcAlchemist 4/23/2001
The Envoys shard can be translated in Zaikhal. Apparently the Virindi are in league with the lugian rebels and are to embark on the destruction of Linvak Tukal in return for supplies of chorozite. Theres nothing else down the South Passage and to reach the Envoy keep to the left wall. :)- Bloodastral and Draxus de Fallon -- Bloodastral 4/24/2001

name: Monty's Den of Iniquity (Aluvian Casino)
description: Montys Aluvian Casino is a short run west of Holtburg. Gamble your pack dolls away with Monty or cash in your notes with Boddry and visit the many other High, Medium, or Low Stakes NPCs here. You can sell your healing items, potions, books, parchments and food to Boddry if you just cant leave when you drop all your money. -- Kuan LiDurhm Low tokens are 5k, mid are 25k, high are 50k. You can win some nice XP turn in items. -- Taarna Blood SC Moved with The Calm patch (December 2004) to Holtburg - 40.9N, 33.6E from 42.7N, 25.1E -- Seeker 12/8/2004

name: Outside Linvak Tukal
description: Exits at 75.7S, 28.2E. Portal untieable and unrecallable. The only healthy exit from Linvak Tukal. Else you have to jump off the walls and escarpment for a long fall and a rough landing. -- Immacolata

name: Mage - Linvak Tukal
description: Kifandal the Imbuer is a lugian mage? Now Ive seen it all. He lives in the cool, tallest tower of Linvak Tukal in the North west corner. He has a splendid view of the town through his painted glass window. Mage or not, at least he sells magic supplies at 160% and buys them at 60%. Moderate mana charges at 2400 p and tapers at 40, up to Platinum scarabs. Carries unlimited peas, aqua incanta and neutral balms. -- Immacolata

name: Aurutis - Linvak Tukal
description: The Lugian Noble gives you the book Arm, Mind, Heart which describes the philosophies of Lugian society. Aurutis gives you the quest to find The Cloth of the Arm, the Sceptre of the Mind, and the Blade of the Heart, to be found on a Raider Commander in Linvak Tukal Entryway dungeon. -- Immacolata

name: Master of the Hunt / First Lugian Raider Camp
description: Reported location of the Master of the Hunt, new for the April event. The Commander and Lts will spawn once the Commander in the Linvak Tukal Entryway at 76.6S 28.1E is killed. -- Dunc

name: Aerbax Laboratory
description:
This Virindi laboratory contains the secrets of Aerbax and his apprentices. Within its halls you will face its guardians: a variety of dolls, marionettes, dark marionettes, and virindi puppets before reaching Aerbaxs central haven. -- Sri
Aerbaxs Apprentice (Virindi Master Type) is located at the end of the Haven portion of the dungeon. He dropped the Orb of Clarity which is a 7-page event lore item. The Orb only dropped when we first killed him..killed him twice more and it didnt drop.. -- AllyMcAlchemist 4/26/2001
Be prepared to face as many as 7 or 8 dolls as soon as you enter. The portal out is close (behind you when you enter) but dont enter casually. -- Szu, Solclaim 5/2/2001
IMPORTANT NOTE: This dungeon can take several hours to complete if you plan on clearing the whole place thoroughly. Your best and easiest path is simply to buff yourself up with all sorts of magic protects and run all the way through to the end and fight the Appretice. It is important to note, however, that halfway through this dungeon is another portal that leads to the interior of this dungeon. Also, rather than plowing straight ahead in the first section, you will want to take a left once you enter the first big room. Otherwise you will be walking in a loop. (I wont mention that it took my patron and I 7 hours to get to the end of this dungeon. LOL. That was a lot of loops. =p Bewaret he Apprentice. Our first try we got him down to critical and he pulled some magic thing that wiped us both out. The next person who went through must have found at least 8 mage robes so, lol. We were too tired to keep going and called it a night. Running through only takes about 5 min. (duh.) Remember Virindi have high immunity to cold and electrical attacks but are average against the rest. There are also dolls here. These are mainly Pristine and Innocents. Manequins and Dark Manequins make up the rest. These pretty much are the same as the Virindi as far as immunity. Although Fire seems effective on the manequins. ----Svetlana the Homeless 7/20/2001
Entrance and exit are quiet. The foyer is hot with a half dozen or so Pristine and Innocent Dolls. The layout is large, but simple in shape. Following right hand rule took us to the mid-point portal in about 15 minutes. Be prepared for gangs of half dozen or so dolls and marionettes. The second half has more Dark Marionettes. No level restictions, and the portals are tieable and summonable. -- Doc Feelgood 2/26/2002

name: Exit Portal
description: Exits at 4.5S,84.4W. One of two get-aways from the Humming Crystal. Not tiable or recallable. -- Immacolata

name: Exit Portal
description: Exits at 4.5S,81.2W. Other of two get-aways from the Humming Crystal. Not tiable or recallable. -- Immacolata

name: Stone Circle
description: Some apparently harmless Etheral Wisps hang out here. They didnt attack me before I IDed one. If you run throug the center of the circle, the door in the nearby tower opens -- Immacolata

name: Tower with Peddler
description: On a hilly island in a beautiful lake at the southern tip of the mountain plateau. Peddler on top floor, he sells crude and cheap stuff. -- Immacolata

name: Well
description: Right next to a cottage and a life stone. Restores 11-20 points of stamina. -- Immacolata

name: Danby's Outpost
description:
Fletcher, Mage, Alchemy supplies, Leather Crafter -- Ardak Eaglehear
As someone said Oh look, a mini-Teth. Merchant sells peerless lockpicks and healing kits. Great sell rates on almost everything, but hard to get to (no portals here?) and no lifestone nearby. -- Confucius of FF 5/16/2001
If you plan on following the inner sea, toward the Dires, counter-clockwise, looking for Dires-type critters, the first spawn point is located at 13.6N, 46.4W. Along the way you will encounter a few Shadow and Broken Fragment spawns, but the bulk of your encounters will be Water Golems, Blue Wasps, etc. -- Lila (MT) 5/20/2001
There is a portal from Zakhail Located at 16.7N 1.6W They seem to buy everything except Gems. Nice Fort-like place. -- Catdancer (HG) 5/22/2001
This place is surrounded by Tumerok Overlords and Commanders. They are of the Grommnie faction so beware. I am not joking when I say they are everywhere around here and in groups of three and four. The lifestone nearby the fort was camped when our party was here with at least 6 Overlords and 2 Commanders. Not a pretty site at all. Scary. -- Wildstar 9/3/2001

name: Danby's Outpost Portal
description:
Exits at 23.2N, 29.9W, You cant tie to this portal. -- AR
Note that you also cant recall this portal, even if you havent learned portal tie. -- Mourning Star 7/18/2001
