name: Armorer and Bowyer - Zaikhal
description: Here in Qufana al-Khurtis forge you sell armor and weapons at 85% and buy at 105%. She has a cap on how expensive stuff she wants to buy, though. Believe it is around 3000 pyreals. Maftaltub al-Sur is the bowyer and sells all varieties of wrapped arrow heads. Ready made ammo in normal, bludgeon, frog crotch and armor piercing flavors. His prices are 120% for selling and 90% for buying. -- Immacolata

name: Bunny Master Lifestone
description: Lifestone right next to place the quest to become a bunny master is. -- Armin

name: Bunny Master
description:
The quest to obtain the Bunny Master title is here. You go inside the hut and get the parchment just lying on the floor. Then on the other side of the barn there is an NPC you give the parchment to and he sends you to a dungon where you have to kill enough bunnies in time to get the title. -- Armin
I visited there today...no bunny master..yet there was a piece of paper..a buying order form of some sort...it didnt respawn after I picked it up... -- Teh Quatre 7/21/2001
The quest for the tittle is broken, they are trying to fix it -- Dark Knight 7/28/2001

name: Eldrist the Adventurer
description: Eldrista lives out in the forest and sells directions to Hunters Leap dungeon as well as Lilithas Arrows (100 for 420 p). -- Immacolata

name: Guild of Bestowers - Lin
description: Sho branch of the Bestowers Guild. Get your Adventurer title changed by purchasing a skill puzzle piece and combining it with one that spawns on the floor of the tent. Deliver to Examiner for title change. Permanent, unalterable. -- Immacolata

name: Trophy Smith - Qalaba'r
description: Trophy Smith expresses interest in Armoredillo spines and golem hearts. -- Immacolata

name: Banderling Tower
description: Update to this location. The following are at this tower: Banderling Ravers, Banderling Breeders, Banderling Captain, and a Tumerok Warrior. All are lvl 12 monsters except for the warrior who is lvl 20. Nobody camping the area anymore. Also respawn rate was pretty fast while I was there. be prepared to run since they like to mob you. good for experience if you are at least equal or lower then monster levels. Ravers have a tendency to try and cast spells on you. In my case they never landed. Surrounding area has low to mid level monsters. -- Alcuk Flet-cha

name: Larry the Rabbit Master
description:
The starting point for the quest to get the title Bunny Master. Located west of the West Lytelthorpe outpost. -- Shuka Chon-Po
Next to his barn is a spawn of Pumpkins. Quite handy if you have a cook. -- Wylfghar 2/28/2002
This quest has been broken since Christs first coming. Honestly, it was working the first 1-2 days and broke during a hotfix and I dont think its worked since, despite many promises by the devs. Dont even bother coming here unless you want pumpkins. -- Confucius of FF 3/3/2002

name: Magma Vent
description: Havent seen a vent like this on the Obsidian Plain before. It spews red/pink fumes. Point of reference and a place to buff. Chrysophylax Dives - Leafcull -- C Dives

name: Essence of Enchantment
description:
This is the location to get your level VII Creature spells. Hand this NPC a level 6 scroll in the school of Creature Enchanment, and you will have the level VII equivalent entered into your spellbook. -- Optim Shi
Portal to Sennon Valley, Essence of Enchantment ... 32.9N, 59.4E -- Soelrath of HG 3/23/2002
Since Oct 2002 patch (Festivus) this location is the start of the Gaerlan Citadel quest for Lvl 80+ (I think). The location has about 6 assorted Frost Elementals (Shivvers and Chills). -- Jaz of SC 11/11/2002
Start of Gaerlan Quest, Level 20-39 -- Kermit of LC 12/18/2002

name: Danby's Outpost Lifestone
description: Just a bit NE from Danbys Outpost. -- Krymsun

name: Inculcation Cells
description:
Home to a lot of Raveners, a few Virindi and some Sotiris/Tumideon Hollow Minions. Has the usual bsd look to Virindi dungeons with some blue lights and purple glow on the floor. A named virindi at the end of the dungeon drops a portal magic scroll and a lore shard when killed, if you were quick in doing this dungeon on your server couldve also fought Virindi versions of the Ayan Shopkeepers. -- Merubin LC
In order for this dungeon to appear, the Staging Complex Director in the Land Bridge Staging Complex must have been killed. -- Optim Shi 6/16/2001
Note the portal magic scroll is a scroll of portal recall. Nothing to get excited about. About the only real use for this place is a good way to get to OP, and for 40th lvl + char ther e is alot of Masters you can kill pretty easy to get masks. -- Dark Man - Sol 6/23/2001
Dont think you need to do anything to make it appear I use it as a starting point now for OP hunting and it is always there. -- Shaddai 7/1/2001

name: land bridge staging complex
description:
both entrance and exit portals can be tied to. open entrance with surface portal. has drudge ravners and lower virindi in it. very easy dungeon. at the end is the directors majordomo. and he tells you, Another flesh petitioner. The director is very busy, altered one. are you not aware of all of the additional work he has to do since our experiment in the human desert town went awry? He then tells you, If you do not have one of the Quiddity orbs as your token to enter, i must insist that you turn around and join your squealing fellows. I heard that this is a two part quest and the other dungeon is restricted to lvls 23-35 but I dont know where this other dungeon is. entered by At Patrick Drake -- of sloclaim
The 20-35 level dungeon is summoned whenever you kill a Black Claw Raider (around the southern and northern mountains.) In those dungeons is how you acquire the Quiddity Orb. As for this dungeon, the place also has Stalkers as well, but at least no Tuskers. -- Garfield3d 6/16/2001
This dungeon is way easy, Im level 45 UA, and it was a walk in the park. Hardest point was 4 ravs and a virindi puppet. The dungeon is very large, which makes me wonder why they didnt add a ton more drudges. All in all, with size and the spawn, the dungeon seems empty. -- Githzerai 6/17/2001

name: Archmage
description: Tufas Archmage. Had every kind of taper and comp when I looked. Also had a lot for alchemy items. -- Alpha-Blast

name: Jolly Snowman
description: In an igloo on the top of this mountain, just ran into him by accident. Sells iceballs at 39p. -- Seph Al-Ahpod

name: Base of Mt. Syliph
description:
Portal to base of Mt. Syliph. Been here for a long time. 99.9% chance its random. Exits at 11.6N, 12.3E -- Dunc
Not random. -- Mourning Star 7/18/2001

name: North Blackclaw Leader (North Quiddity)
description:
Around this area (June 01 patch) you will find the North Blackclaw Leader (a ravener-class drudge)hanging out with a bunch of ravener cronies. Kill him and he will open a portal to the North Quiddity Dungeon. The portal is not summonable or tieable. The foyer is safe. The dungeon is filled with pure drudge -- from lurkers to raveners. Its a fine drudge XP source. But sadly, its new school design so there are few wall working opportunities. The BDT (Big Dungeon Treasure) is a Northern Quiddity Fragment, carried by the same Blackclaw Leader you dispatched to get in. Spawn on the leader is fast (about 4 min). Theres a one hour quest timer on picking up the fragment. -- Doc Feelgood
Dungeon is fast spawn. Expect Lurkers at the beginning, more Stalkers as you get to the middle, more Raveners at the end. The above report is inaccurate in two minor respects: youre looking for the Northern Black Claw Raider to get the entrance portal, and he can be found with Lurkers and Stalkers, not Raveners. You will want to kill the Northern Black Claw Leader for the Northern Quiddity Fragment at the end, though. Also, note that the level restrictions are 20-35. I havent located the exit portal -- theres not one right next to the end of the dungeon, but when I do Ill post coords. Oh, and this dungeon is not a duplicate of the Southern Quiddity dungeon. -- Constantine 7/8/2001
The exit portal at the entrance pops you out to 61.9S, 77.5E. Theres also an exit portal at the end, way past the Leader -- 12.6S, 47.5E. -- Constantine 7/9/2001
Latest development changed timer for pickup (not spawn) of the shard to one week... No More Camping :) -- Bocephvs 7/12/2001
A Northern Blackclaw Raider found as far west as 73.4N, 15W. -- Doc Feelgood 8/21/2001
In November patch Blackclaw Raider was spotted just south of Bandit Castle (66N,50E) -- Doc Feelgood 11/25/2001

name: South Blackclaw Leader Range (South Quiddity)
description:
Around this area, in the snowy areas between Q-bar and Old Mine, (June 01 patch) you will find the South Blackclaw Leader (a ravener-class drudge)hanging out with a bunch of ravener cronies. Kill him and he will open a portal to the South Quiddity Dungeon. The portal is not summonable or tieable. The foyer is safe. The dungeon is filled with pure drudge -- from lurkers to raveners. Its a fine drudge XP source. But sadly, its new school design so there are few wall working opportunities. The BDT (Big Dungeon Treasure) is a Southern Quiddity Fragment, carried by the same Blackclaw Leader you dispatched to get in. Spawn on the leader is fast (about 4 min). Theres a one hour quest timer on picking up the fragment. -- Doc Feelgood
Dungeon is fast spawn. Expect Lurkers at the beginning, more Stalkers as you get to the middle, more raveners at the end. Exit portal leads to . The above report is inaccurate in two minor respects: youre looking for the South Black Claw Raider to get the entrance portal, and he can be found with Lurkers and Stalkers, not Raveners. You will want to kill the South Black Claw Leader for the Southern Quiddity Fragment at the end, though. -- Constantine 7/7/2001
Oh, and I have no idea where Doc got his level restrictions from. Thatd be levels 20-35. -- Constantine 7/7/2001
Quest timer has now been extended to one week. The raider has been spotted as far east as 70S, 48E. He covers a lot of ground. -- Doc Feelgood 7/14/2001

name: Singularity Bore
description:
New dungeon with the July 2001 patch. Explore with at least 10+ level 60 or higher. -- Homer the Wise
There are augmented drudges on the first level, then the new *painful* hollow minions and new tuskers. You need like 380+ meele to even think about hitting the them, and it is very hard to evade them as well even with very high meele defence. If anyone knows anything else about this dungeon please add it on. -- Homer the Wise 7/11/2001
Exit portals at the top are Obsidian Rim portals. -- Constantine 7/12/2001
A decent pair of lvl 60+ melees should be able to solo this place. At the bottom there are four different ways to go, all lead to a Guardian of Singularity with different monsters in his room. Whoever gets the kill on him is flagged to go to the new Singularity Caul island (a portal to it is up the ramp N from entrance dropoff) - 5 or 8 minute respawn. Tusker Guards/Virindi Masters to start with, a little more inside and its new hollow minions and Rampager Tuskers. Further in youll find Augmented Drudges and Virindi Observers (fire vuln VI and both cast bolt VIs) Jumping in the pit to the South is a shortcut and a way to avoid most tuskers and hollows, bring lightning protection if youre planning to jump as you may get hit by 3+ Lightning Streak VI traps -- Merubin (LC) 7/15/2001
a new sickle is found there, its good -- bob 7/18/2001

name: Essence of Verdancy
description:
This is the Life Magic Essence that gives you your Lvl VII spells in life when you give it your lvl VI scrolls. Keep the prots up, as dires spawn is close by. -- Crimsonthorn
This is also part of the Giant Flower area. -- Doc Feelgood 5/19/2002
Since Oct 2002 patch (Festivus) this location is the start of the Gaerlan Citadel quest for Lvl 60-79 (I think). The location has assorted Acid Elementals -- Jaz of SC 11/12/2002
To get here: Go to Baishi and buy sake from the bar Give Drunken Madman the Sake, he opens portal (53.1s, 61e) Jump over the wall once you are through the portal Run south for 10 clicks -- Jaz of SC 11/12/2002

name: Twisted Advocates Tower
description: Has a crystal with a placeholder that looks like a lifestone below it with magic and black bubbles swirling up to it.

name: Swamp Garden
description:
Give your small green seeds to Therese to get dye plant. Entrance is hot with local fauna
foyer is quiet, but taking a few steps in will bring on the first reedsharks
the exit is quiet. The dungeon is small and straightforward in layout. You will face about a dozen reedshark adults/elders on your way to the NPC. -- Doc Feelgood 8/21/2001

name: Virindi Crafters
description:
A ring of ten Virindi NPCs, one for each weapon class and one for an orb. Bring your Quiddity Ingot here. New for the July 2001 event. -- Lila (MT)
The easiest way to get here is to take the Axefall Glen portal from Qalabar, which drops you off in a neighborhood about 3-4 clicks away. -- Confucius of FF 7/15/2002

name: Stable Rift
description:
July, 2001. Found by Magi on MT. The dungeon is full of dolls of all types. In order to enter it you must have already killed a rift and gotten a message to the effect of the power of the rift enterd you Hopefully something in this patch will trigger somethign besides dolls in here. -- Feral
The Warden Dirrich is now spawning at the very bottom of this dungeon. He drops Shackles of Obedience
be warned that these are no-drop and no-give. Even to NPCs. Dont pick em up unless you want to keep them for a long long time. -- Constantine 7/17/2001
It should be noted, to enter the portal you have to continually attack spawning dolls and rifts till you receive a message that you have been changed, then you may enter. The entrance area is safe. All you need to do is head down the hallways either running past the pairs of beaten and battered dolls or killing them. You will also meet the occasional narrow rift. You will come to a large area that you must jump over - be warned if you do not make the jump you drop into a caged area from which there is no way out except to recall. Continue down after the jump till you finally reach the caged area where the virindi that has the quest item spawns outside of the cage. The dungeon is more for a mid level player as I soloed this easily at lvl45. Loot is fair to poor. Dungeon atmosphere is pretty nice with the hot red colors -- Jox the Burley 7/18/2001 -- Jox the Burley 7/18/2001

name: Dark wisp monolith
description: This is a thing that looks like a festival stone, but with a dark wisp at the centre. it has a dense spawn of med-level bandies around it and is west of collier, on the way to the carved caves. -- Cidd Highwind

name: Desert March to South Mt. Esper
description: -- Mourning Star

name: Desert March to South Dires
description: -- Mourning Star

name: Desert March to Black Hill
description: -- Mourning Star

name: Desert March to North Dires
description: -- Mourning Star

name: Auroch herd
description: 15-20 Aurochs huddled together. Not just close spawns. -- Thrush of DT

name: Holtburg Portal
description: There is a portal within the Mountain Keep which lets out at 44.8N, 32.4E (near Holtburg). -- Chin-Wa

name: Shadow
description: Shadow in the Hills, If you view your map, you will see the word Shadow written here, I havent trekked here yet, but I will now that I have seen this. Anyone have a clue as to whats out here? -- Chytina

name: Mattekar Training Grounds
description: Tons of Mattekars here in the valley. Had some packs of Shadows up to Lt when I was there so watch yourself. Great Mattekar, Dires Mattekar and a few White and Snowy Mattekars. Didnt see any Dread Mattekars here but I assume they probably spawn too. Individual spawn rates arent great but there are enough of them to keep the action going. Approximately 20+ mattys in and around this valley, most of them Great Mattekars. -- Silverwolf VAC

name: Zaikhal Reinforcements Tower
description: -- Synthahol

name: Zaikhal Middle-Guard Tower
description: -- synthahol

name: Grocer Riku Ryu (Mayoi)
description: Riku Ryu sells carrot, water, grapes, noodle cutter, baking pan, rennet, flour and fish. -- Immacolata

name: Merchant and Pub - Al-Arqas
description: Qufar ibn Ijtalwa got packs, assorted items and you cooks can get empty flask, grinder, frying pan, flour, water and apple from him. Itir ibn Ativ sells beer stein and milk. -- Immacolata

name: Tumerok Spawns
description: Seven permanent Augmented/Ascendant Tumerok spawn points in the area. -- Three [WE]

name: Bestowers' Guild (Qalaba'r)
description:
Right outside of Qalabar. Darsida al-Qawa tells you, Hail and welcome to the Gharundim branch of the Bestowers Guild. Have you come to seek a title? Speak with Nerezi, my assistant, to learn about our application process. The base piece for the examination is available in the tent. But beware, you will only be allowed to conduct the examination once per day, and you can only hold one title at a time. It seems to be some sort of test and the puzzle pieces cost 10,000 each. I have not read the book yet, so I am unsure what you must do. -- Logan the Wyz
This is the base of the Title-Changing Quest for Adventurers (those who started with Custom Characters instead of the Templates.) Theres a rumored skill check of 250 for the base titles, and 300 for the advanced. However, ACs system allows you to succeed with numbers lower (and even fail with numbers higher) than the skill check. Quest Timer 24 Hours. -- Nocturne [LC] 9/3/2001

name: Bane Grievver
description: A static spawn of one Bane Grievver. -- Three [WE]

name: Yanshi South Homesteads
description: Five cottages surrounding a sqare with a fountain, off the road between Yanshi and Sawato. -- Immacolata

name: Swamp Temple Place
description: Eight cottages placed around a small, dead end road. Nice view over the putrid Black Mire Swamp on the other side of the road, huh? -- ImmacolataI believe this housing area has been renamed to Swamp Temple Place. -- Charles 7/28/2004 This is a Yanshi settlement. Item is an Iron Heart. -- Chupon 1/22/2005

name: Baishi North Homesteads
description: A spread out housing area of eight cottages. Local fauna is hostile, alas. -- Immacolata

name: Baishi North Mansion
description:

description:

It seems that only cottages have visible Storage chests in them. Apparently, Storage is accessed via the House Portal for the larger houses. -- Adric the Red 9/17/2001
On Morningthaw, Sho Mansion has been renamed by the House of Elder to Kelci Mansion in loving memory of Kelci Gittamad who passed in real life on February 20, 2002. May God bless your soul, Barb. We love and miss you dearly. -- Elder 3/1/2002

Mm, dessert. Or did you mean desert? :P -- Confucius of FF 9/19/2001

name: Northern Infiltrator Dungeon
description:
New Quest Dungeon, tie-able. Beginning is filled with low level tumeroks. Middle portion contains drudge lurkers and stalkers. At the end are the simulacra, who look just like humans. The Northern Infiltrator Leader drops the Shield of the Simulacra (Impen IV, Strength IV, Coord IV, Diff 35, Melee 180+) -- Suriel, MT
This is September 01 patch. Entrance is sometimes hot, foyer is quiet. Dungeon is small and the layout of medium complexity. Interior is decorated in an intense red with an eery sort of twisted pattern. Fun to see. The similacria come in Crafty (15th), Sneaky (33rd), and the Northern Infiltrator Leader (70th). The Leader is *very* tough to hit. But, if you group assault him for long enough, he will run out of stamina and succumb to normal attacking. -- Doc Feelgood 9/17/2001
If you went through the Southern Keep before coming here, be advised that the Northern Leader is much harder to hit. Soloing this one is impossible - a party of three or four, including a mage and archer, is recommended to minimize your chances of dying. -- Wylfghar 12/28/2001

name: Mansion
description: Mansion in the middle of the rolling feilds -- Yobe the Mage

name: Southern Infiltrator Keep
description:
This is the other new dungeon in the September patch. Head South if you get lost. Tumeroks in the beginning, Stalkers and Lurkers in the middle, and Simulacra at the end. The Southern Infiltrator leader is a Gharu woman who debuffs with level 6 life spells (bludgeon vuln 6) and uses war 6 spells too. She drops the Helm of the Simulacra (Impen IV, Invuln IV, Impreg IV, diff 35, melee 180+). Thanks to Leaver, Kieintie, and Wolf Temptress, who stayed and helped me get mine. -- Suriel, MT
Entrance can be covered by local desert fauna. Foyer is quiet. The dungeon is small and of medium complexity. First part of dungeon is basic brown walls. Inner part is simulacrium pink. It is essentially one level. The similacriums come in Crafty (15th), Sneaky (33rd) and the South Leader (70th). The south leader did not seem nearly as tough as North leader, but perhaps both are more vulnerable to archers than meleers. -- Doc Feelgood 9/22/2001
While this dungeon is significantly easier than its cousin near Zaikhal, dont underestimate it. Soloing is virtually impossible. The spells cast by the helm compliment those by the shield well, making the set the equipment of choice for mid-level melee fighters. You can later improve the stats of these items by imbuing them with an Asteliary gem. -- Wylfghar 12/28/2001
I got through it alone fairly easily (level 37). The boss never left her room so I could shoot her from down the hallway. Even though I had bludgeon vuln 6 on me she never fired a shockwave at me. I used greater frog crotch arrows and they worked well on everything in the place. The place isnt too big so I found my way quickly. -- Moi 4/27/2002

name: Jinianshi
description: Cottages -- Yobe the Mage Sawato settlement. Item is an iron heart. -- Chupon 1/22/2005

name: Mansion
description: Mansion -- Yobe the Mage

name: The Asteliary
description:
The New Quest dungeon, full of simulacra, virindi servants, and at the end, The Crafter. Head South if you get lost. The crafter drops the Asteliary Orb, and the Infusing Gem -- Suriel, MT
Located on top of a mesa, there are pathways up the nearby cliffs. Entrance can be hot, foyer is quiet. Flashy Fire-Red interior decorating, somewhat complex in layout. Your first greeters are Drudge Raveners. Similacrea come in Sneaky (about 33rd, meleers), and Subtle (about 45th archer/mages with level 5 war). Crafter is higher still and much harder to hit. They are radar resistant. Just a few virindi to spice the place up. There is a timer on the orb and gem, perhaps a week. -- Doc Feelgood 9/16/2001
Use a Bow on the Crafter and you can drop him in a hurry. Cuz my 350 UA skill was barely hitting him.. -- Eclipsa 9/20/2001
Orbs and Gems are scatted on the floor as The Crafter is Camped for his Other loot, anyone who meets the level requirements can walk in an put up both without any problems -- Vo Mimbre 9/23/2001
Subtles are level 60 and drop expensive loot
Crafter is level 80. Timer on orb/gem is longer than one week. -- Doc Feelgood 9/24/2001
According to the Sep Dev Chat, the timer appears to be three weeks. -- Asetti 9/28/2001
To get to the end of this dungeon, take nothing but lefts... youll go up a ramp, then down another. Once you go back down, go straight on and the Crafter will be in an open room in the middle of the lower level. She is guarded by several Subtle Simulacra, who appear to have infinite mana (I watched one blast away at a wall between us dozens of times and saw its mana ticker STAND STILL... creepy). Level 50+ should be able to solo, but I recommend a group anyway, especially if theres no one camping the Crafter. -- Confucius of FF 10/1/2001
The timer is higher than 4 weeks. -- Ga Lee Lea (MT) 10/11/2001
The timer is higher than 4 weeks. -- Ga Lee Lea (MT) 10/11/2001
The timer is higher than 4 weeks -- Ga Lee Lea, MT 10/11/2001
The timer for the Asteliary Gem & Orb is 4 weeks + 1 day -- Just to thwart my test of the 4 week mark. -- Mitsuya 10/17/2001

Drop is VERY nasty with Vapors, Virindi Executors/Observers, Armored Tuskers, Chaos Wisps and other Northern ML stuff waiting for you. But it IS the closest porta drop to Martinate Holding. -- Rojon 2/7/2002
Exit: 56N, 75.1W -- Doc Feelgood 12/17/2002

name: Agent of the Arcanum and Furniture Maker - Cragsto
description: Bartholomew Steiner the furniture maker, his furniture selling apprentice and an Agent of the Arcanum. He says: Greetings, adventurer. I have been sent here by the Arcanum to provide Writs of Refuge in return for various items needed to prepare for any coming turmoil that threatens the Isparian presence here on Ispar. Nuhmudira has informed us that creatures of old may soon be stalking the earth. And these creatures hold items of value. Items that we can use. If you come across a Crest of the Falatacot, a Ring of Mummified Skin, or a Quiddity Crystal, I am able to exchange a Writ of Refuge for any one of these items. What we need may change at any time, so be prepared. Agent of the Arcanum tells you, Apparently the creatures who hold these items may not be abroad in the land quite yet. When they first appear, we shall herald their presence and repeat our warning for as long as they stalk the earth. Agent of the Arcanum tells you, Once you possess the Writ of Refuge, then you have satisfied the main requirements for acquiring a home. The Covenant Crystals also require money and other minor items, but those items should not be in short supply. Enjoy your homestead. One note: Nuhmudira has set aside a small number of palatial estates for those allegiances thought to be most worthy of their ownership, and the most generous with their resources. She has not opened them up yet, but she will soon. Well, exciting -- Immacolata

name: Ecorto the Lost Director
description:

If your chizel does not break, you may get lucky and carve two slivers of singularity material. Mages beware, this material is very dense at 1000bu each. Combine with the other slivers. -- Gaetano 10/10/2001
Slivers for chipping are found at the back of the three Singularity Repository dungeons: pyreal, chorozite and obsidian. These dungeons are level floored and capped, so youre going to need help from your lower level friends. -- Doc Feelgood 6/24/2003

name: Seat of the New Singularity
description:
This dungeon is the staging point for the New Singularity, the splinter group of rouge Virindi. In order to access the dungeon, you must bring to Ecorto the Lost Director a Fragment of the New Singularity, which is made up from a Sliver of Singular Pyreal, Obsidian, and Chorizite, gained from 3 separate dungeons. Once inside, you will face a Virindi Masters and Directors as well as Tusker Guards in the beginning areas. The further down you go, there are more and more Virindi Directors and Executors, Tusker Rampagers, and Terebrous Hollow Minions. In the last room, you will find Levistras, the Speaker of the New Directive (level 85 Virindi), as well as an absolutely INSANE number of Rampagers, Executors, and Terebrous Hollows. Make sure you bring a huge group or you wont last very long in here. Bring HIGH AL ARMOUR or youll be fricaseed by the Hollow Minions. New Singularity Director (Levistras) spawns every 5 minutes or so and drops a Virindi Shroud, a cloak with Impen V, Invuln V, Magic Resist V, and Willpower V. If youre lucky enough to be the FIRST person on the server to loot Levistras, youll get a unique item called the Shroud of Levistras (same as Virindi Shroud except with Invuln VI and Magic Resist VI). -- Confucius of FF
Now also the home of a portal to Caul Island. Portal is near the entrance. -- Doc Feelgood 6/24/2003

name: Rithwic to Greenspire Portal
description: New exit coords: 43.2N, 66.8W (was 42.9N, 68.1W) -- Dutton 7/11/2004

name: Holtburg to Redspire Portal
description: This portal has been moved to 42.6N, 33.4E from 42.5N, 31.1E -- Armin 12/8/2004

name: Singular Obsidian Repository
description:
The third of the Ecortos (and turbines brilliantly thought out completed-in-half-a-second-quest-to-end-a-nine-month-story-arch-quest) dungeons where you must get a sliver off one of the four Singular Obsidian Pillars in the end of the end of the dungeon. First there be Tusker Guards and virindi puppets. Then servants and masters. At the bottom you meet Rampagers, Tumideon Minions and the Director, plus a gang of Masters guarding the Pillar room. The Director drops a Directors Mask. The respawn rate is maddeningly fast, about 2 seconds, and I have spotted many corpses down here already. Mages stick to the rampagers, and meleers make sure to take out them rickety but hard hitting tumideons fast. The antechamber to the pillar room is narrow and will be place for heavy battles. It is possible for a person to break out of the fight, run across the room down ramp and into the pillar room unscathed. In here you can either dash further down and hide at the exit portals, or run up-ramp to the pillars (ramps are at the left and right at the end of the room). You can perch this place in relative safety. The entry portal cant be tied to, but the surface portal can be. -- Immacolata
This is a good place to level up on Tusker/Virindi. The antechamber to the sliver room is very difficult to negotiate: Guards and Rampagers will block the narrow entrance corridor three deep, and lag will pop heroes in and amongst them, but not let them run through in an orderly way. Luring the mob out of the antechamber is unpredictable -- they often get stuck on each other. -- Doc Feelgood 12/11/2001
Level cap removed. This is now a 45+ dungeon. -- Doc Feelgood 7/8/2003

description:
Dungeon of october 2001 patch. Has the pyreal pillars that one needs to chip off a sliver from, using the chisel given by Ecorto. Toughest foes are Raveners and Innocent Dolls - the rewards is the Doll Leader Charm, a bracelet with War IV and Focus IV. -- Immacolata
Very easy dungeon with level 6 buffs. My level 34 spear life item guy had no probs even with his own buffs. The toughest spot (besides the end room) is maybe 4 ravs at once with 2 dolls. Mostly it is 2 dolls at a time or 3 ravs at a time. Very easy to find end room. I took west hallway and always take the down and North option. The only place this doesnt work (a large room with those small niches lining the walls) take an east passageway, and then continue with the down and north advice, after you pass three little cave rooms with a mound in the middle of the floor you are at the end. -- Spearit of WE 10/12/2001
Entrance/Exit is quiet, foyer is quiet. Another austere new school dungeon, but it slower spawn rate than most new school dungeons. Mostly Innocent Dolls and Raveners. Coming to the dungeon from Tufa or Samsur is straight forward. Coming from Al-Jalima will require negoiating some cliffs. -- Doc Feelgood 10/14/2001
The final room has a fast spawn of Raveners and dolls, and is much tougher than the approach to it. Dolls change from Innocent to Pristine. -- Doc Feelgood 10/15/2001
Level cap has been lifted. This is now a level 24+ dungeon. -- Doc Feelgood 7/8/2003

name: Singularity Chorizite Repository
description:
I found this while roaming the mountains. Its restricted to lvls 35-46 and being only lvl 31 I couldnt get in to check out what was inside. The entrance couldnt be tied to either 10/12/01 -- Rezal al Malik
The very best strategy for this place is to put on shadow garb and throwaway shield helm and boots. Go in with nothing else but your chisel and 5 cheap gems. Get a level 6 or 7 life buff, which wont help on the Hollow Lugians, but sure will help with the virindi war spells. RUN LIKE HELL DUE NORTH. You cnat get lost, just dodge a few Luginas and virindi, and as soon as you get to the room with the chlorozite pillar, go to peace mode and use ur chisel as many times as you can b4 it breaks. I got 3 pieces this way easy, then LS recall, or be killed by the horde that has now gathered and it killing you. We also went in with three meleers and a mage, and owned this place. We got the cool looking but basically worthless death mace, not a bad place for exp. -- Spearit of WE 10/12/2001
Entrance/exit clear, almost barren (October patch), foyer is clear. The dungeon is as austere new school as you can get: the BDT is straight ahead, to the right and left are flood rooms filled with giga, exta and titus hollow lugians who come running when combat starts. The main path is seasoned with virindi. The chisel comes from Ecorto the Lost Director, near the mage shop in Zaikhal. -- Doc Feelgood 10/14/2001
The exit is tieable and summonable. -- Doc Feelgood 10/14/2001
LV 46 and i soloed the place easy and made 2.1mil in xp :) -- Cobain of FF 10/16/2001
Level cap is now removed. This is a 35+ dungeon. -- Doc Feelgood 7/8/2003

name: Agent of the Arcanum (Mayoi)
description: This is the guy that gives you the Writs for housing in Mayoi. -- Spearit of WE

name: BlueSpire
description:
Precise coords of BlueSpire. -- Oint
This is a town for lowest levels. Collector Merlonna Farel seeks Carenzi pouchling, Marsh Siraluun, Drudge Charms, and Mud Golem hearts. -- Doc Feelgood 11/24/2001

name: RedSpire
description:
Collector Ling Xiao seeks Carenzi Sentry, Tidal Siraluun, Drudge Charms, and Water Golem hearts Behdo Yi seeks Olthoi Harvester Pinchers. -- Doc Feelgood 11/24/2001
Behdo Yi also collects other pinchers as well. -- Doc Feelgood 12/11/2001

name: GreenSpire
description:
Precise coords of GreenSpire. -- Oint
Most of the town merchants live in a condoized version of the Tou Tou lighthouse. Collector Shalon ibn Mayar seeks Carenzi Burrower, Littoral Siraluun, Drudge Charms, Sand Golem hearts. Britana deals with Mattekar hides (Nov 01 patch) -- Doc Feelgood 11/24/2001

name: Timaru
description:
Most unique of all Marae Lassel towns. Coords given are the town center, however to get to the town, you must speak with a NPC half-way up the hill. Beware though, if you anger the Aun, you may loose access to Timaru..... -- Oint
Aun Mareura the Collector seeks Olthoi Claws, Rabid Carenzi pelts, Vapor Golem hearts, and Yellow Virindi Jewels. Aun Whethura the Crafter seeks Kithless Diraluun feathers. -- Doc Feelgood 12/1/2001

name: Rivermouth Villas
description: A group of five villas.

name: Agent of the Arcanum - Uziz
description: Real estate agent for Greater Uziz -- Immacolata

name: Plateau Hollow Settlement
description: 8 Houses near Plateau - Chrysophylax Dives - Leafcull -- Chrysophylax

name: South Hebian-To Estates
description: 5 villas scattered in the lush country near Hebian-to. -- Immacolata Purchase Item: Gold Phyntos Wasp Wing -- Zen Tek Ken 9/19/2003

name: Nanto to Bluespire Portal
description: Cannot be tied, recalled or summoned. -- Immacolata New exit coords: 39.5N, 75.3W (was 38.1N, 75.9W)-- Dutton 7/11/2004

name: Agent of the Arcanam - Eastham
description:
Rollup Rollup getcha used hovels here. Damp sir? Bless you -that baint damp that be a water feature. Onlieoneownerlowmilagelittleoldlady shacks fur th Gentry. Prices sir? Well they dont call me cuttingmyownthroatagentofthearcanaum fur nothin now do they sir?
Entered by Rodent al-Cruncher, Thistledown -- RAC (TD) 10/16/2001

name: Bestower's Guild
description: Lost? Aimless? Make an appointment with Elouard The Namer at the Aluvian Bestowers Guild and get new purpose in your life. Whats in a name? Find out here. -- RAC (TD)

name: Mask Maker - Eastham
description: Alexander the Deft and his apprentice lives on the first floor of Eastham Smithy. Turn your Virindi Mask or Inquisitor Mask into a Aluvian Kings Mask or Pwylls Crown. In the autumn he will also turn your various monster heads into masks of different kinds. Give him a tusker mask and get a backpack or a wand back. You can also get wands from skull mask, mosswart mask and banderling mask. The Apprentice can make flaming Jackolanterns from scarecrow heads as well as flaming skulls from skulls. -- Immacolata

name: Lugian Merchant - Yaraq
description: Drawohan the Lugian Gem seller has several very cheap gems of level III life protections. 270 pyreals a pop. He also sells Strong Benevolence which is used to craft the Spear of Purity. 2700 pyreals. -- Immacolata

name: Mask Maker - Al-Jalima
description:
Janda mask maker and apprentice. Give monster heads to Janda to gain masks. Give masks to gain wands. Give skulls or pumpkin heads to Apprentice for Flaming SKulls or Flaming Pumpkins. Give virindi masks for Gharundim racial mask (STaff mastery IV or V) -- Immacolata
As of 03/01/02, hes gone, and theres blood all over where he used to be. Eastham mask maker is still around, havent checkd Saweto -- Arkanes 3/2/2002
Mask Maker is still here, their just inside now. Gharu Mask = AL 190 B/A/A/A/A/A/A Staff IV Gharu Staff +180 Diff 0 -- Tsurani 3/7/2002

name: Lylethorpe to Bluesprire Portal
description: Cannot be summoned, linked to, nor recalled to. Requires Dark Majesty -- Ziegel

name: Movealong Mesa
description: Nothing to see here, folks. Move along... move along... -- Doc Feelgood

name: North Lytelthorpe Villa's
description: A small village of Villas North of Lytelthorpe. 6 villas of different styles. -- Dunc

name: Monument Sands Settlement
description: 7 Cottages and a few palm trees. -- Dark Man - Sol

name: Agent of the Arcanum / Furniture Maker - Hebian-to
description: Arcanum Agent is your local real estat broker. Give him the required monster trophies and receive a writ of refuge needed for acquiring housing. Jubei Minawoto can craft decorations and furniture for you from trophies and items, where as his lowly apprentice gets to sell basic furniture, chandeliers and paintings. -- Immacolata

name: Agent of the Arcanum - Ayan Baqur
description: Real estate broker for Greater Ayan Baqur. -- Immacolata

name: Northern Osteth
description: Housing Community between Banderling Castle and Celdesiths Cottage. -- Ispara

name: Abandoned Tumerok Site
description:
Did not go inside, but passed this portal while running to the new tummy town. -- Kalahan
Olthoi Harvesters and nothing but Olthoi Harvesters. Not very good XP, but decent loot. The dungeon itself is really cool looking, with all new textures and effects. The first levels are empyrean in structure, but at the bottom is a tunnel into a creepy Olthoi hive with unnerving environment sounds... and even further in is a weird swamp cavern with fumes belching up from the decomposing ground. If youre lucky enough to find a Pincer on one of the Harvesters, bring it to Redspire for some XP and health elixirs. -- Confucius of FF 10/27/2001
This is the dungeon for the Olthoi Title quest. I found a pincer after each spawn at the bottom of this dungeon. It would only allow me to pick 1 pincer up since they are on a quest timer. Return the pincer to Behdo Yii in Redspire to get 2500 XP, 5 treated heal kits and the title Bug Stomper. Overall, an easy quest if you have acid and pierce protection. Loot is level III and IV and in great abundance. Watch out, the Olthoi swarm when you hit one of them. Populated with level 15 Olthoi Harvesters. -- Spunkey Yank 11/1/2001
Entrance, exit and foyer are quiet. The dungeon is small and somewhat complex for its size
Spawn is fast. -- Doc Feelgood 11/6/2001
Oh.. and the corridors in this dungeon are twisty enough that you can do some wall working. -- Doc Feelgood 11/6/2001 Moved to 42.0N, 82.2W in the Pillars of Sand event (June 9, 2004). New exit coords same as new portal coords. -- Lila_MT 6/11/2004 Level restrictions were removed as well. -- Solan Thommad 6/13/2004

name: Mehnir Sho Tower
description: A Sho type tower sitting on top of a small mountain. Mehnir stones surround the tower in a circular formation. There also stones on the inside of the building. As of 10/26/01, no clue as to the place's importance. -- Kyriil - HG

name: Marescent Plateau Portal
description: Very cool looking head, near waterfall. You walk into its mouth. There is a Portal back down. called the Base of the Cliffs portal at 42.2n, 77.8w. This is also restricted to Lv 35 Characters -- Elvis :)

name: Aun Mariona - May be missing!
description: This is where you find Aun Mariona and deliver the Note from Hea Toneawa to Aun Mariona -- Skam Jim-OneShe is not here. Shes not in game, as far as I can see. The note from Hea Toneawa (as of Pillars Made of Sand) claims she is at 41.1N, 74.4W. She is not there, either. -- Solan Thommad 6/13/2004 Geomancer here: This could be some kind of mid-month thing that will become enabled due to a quest, so Im not going to delete this record. Instead I changed the name to include May be missing.. Ill post a note about it on the main page.

name: Menhir Ring 1
description:
First of 5 rings used for the QueenSlayer Quest and the AunHareltahs Weapons Quests. Aua Kahmaula, lvl 186 NPC, says, Greetings seeker. I am a spiritcaller of the Aua xuta. We are responsible for maintaining the stone rings of this island. Please disturb not my work, for all depends upon this rhythm.
If you hand him a pyreal bell he will break the ring. When all 5 drummers are gone, the Queen Quest is running. So go hunt olthoi and bag yerself some Brood Nobles. Sometimes the Brood Nobles can spawn for hours and hours because people abandoned the quest. -- Fewglee -- Immacolata -- Kai Lv-Smk -- Taygar

name: Ancient Empyrean Grotto
description:
Habitat for dozens of Olthoi Legionaries -- Fewglee
Pincers are dropped in the Red Haze Room -- a flood room near the bottom exit. -- Doc Feelgood 1/26/2003
Return the pincher to Behdon Yii in RedSpire for your reward.

name: An Olthoi Soldier Nest
description: Lots of soldiers, one near the bottom has a soldier pincer which you turn in to Behdo Yii at RedSpire.

name: Northern Ahurenga Plains Portal
description: Drops you at 52.1n, 86.2w. Not tieable summonable or linkable. Required DM. -- Dark Man - Sol

name: Lair of the Eviscerators
description:
Not linkable summonable or recallable. Requires DM. -- Dark Man - Sol
Storm X says, ok then... slash AND pierce silly me Storm X says, DUHHH what was I thinking :) Hahaha enough siad...:) -- Dark Man - Sol 10/26/2001
Entry is safe (unless someone dragged mobs in). This dungeon has a fair amount of Eviscerators on a medium spawn time (6-8 mins I think), each worth more than 10K xp each. Tons and tons of high-value loot drop to the floor uncollected (wands and armour above 10,000p are fairly routine) but not too much is keepable. At the bottom of the dungeon where the spawn is thickest is where the Eviscerator Pincer drops, which is worth 3,000,000 XP in Redspire... make sure you have 12 slots in your inventory free when you turn it in, cuz you get a whole lot of items. Also try to be in a fellowship with 4+ others when you all turn in your pincers, as the XP magnifies thru the fellowship. -- Confucius of FF 11/18/2001
has anyone figured out how to maximize the xp given from the pincers. More people in the fellowship = more xp? Or do you get more from having a certain number of fellows? -- Bandaid 12/31/2001
Entrance and exit are quiet. Foyer is quiet, and a good place for both buffing and getting into a fellowship for maximizing XP while working in the dungeon. Eviscerators attack only low with piercing and slashing -- no acid protection needed, and there are a fair number of bare-chested heros working the place. -- Doc Feelgood 1/8/2002
Fellowship XP is at its zenith with 8 people in the fellowship... no more, no less. Its not such a big deal while hunting, but its recommended when turning in the Pincers. With 8 people in a fellowship, you get both the 3 million XP from the pincer, AND another 5.3 million XP from your fellows. -- Confucius of FF 1/14/2002
WARNING... Buff Acid. As of the Jan 2002 patch Evis now spit acid. Personaly I think they hit harder also. So be warned bane all 3 or have ALOT of melee def or well die. -- Dark Man - Sol 1/22/2002

name: GreenSpire to RedSpire Portal
description: New exit coords: 40.6N, 83.0W (was 40.7N,82.5W) -- Dutton 7/11/2004

name: Nanto Portal
description:
Portal cannot be tied or summoned. -- Hexxor
Drops out at 53.5S, 82.1E -- Doc Feelgood 11/24/2001 New exit coords: 52.2S, 82.5E (was 53.5S, 82.1E) -- Dutton 7/11/2004

name: Base of the Timaru Plateau
description: Exit coords 43.9n, 77.7w. Can not be linked summoned or recalled. Requires DM. -- Dark Man - Sol

name: Base of the Cliffs
description: Exit Coords 42n, 77.8w. Can not be linked summoned or recalled. Requires DM. -- Dark Man - Sol

name: Small Hive
description: Random Spawn Dungeon on the Mare Lassel Plateau. Can not be summoned or recalled. Full of Olthoi Legionaries and Nobles. You know you are close to the bottom when you see a few Nymphs. There is a lone Olthoi Noble spawn in a small room at the bottom, which can randomly produce a Level 90 blue Olthoi Noble that drops the Rubble from the SW ring at 44.7N, 80.9W. Give this rubble to Aun Ngationa in Timaru for a Storm Totem. This can be used on the Palenqual weapon or turned into Aun Hareltah for 500k XP.-- Dark Man - Sol -- Atonea -- Doc Feelgood -- Taarna Blood SC

name: Palenqual's Caverns
description:
Palenquals Caverns. Entrance cannot be summoned nor linked to. Very cool entrance.. The Portal is inside of a huge carved head, with water flowing from its mouth... Theres a quest assoicated with this dungeon. When I tried to enter, You have not completed the quest required to use this portal. -- Dunc
Ok everyone this is how you get in just goto 46.7n 70.7w them bring him a totem talk to him first.you get a no drop weapon not that good but cool looking.you its a living weapon (5 types to pick from)alot of humans,birds,yes even drudges in there -- Rhuagh of ff 10/30/2001
No level restriction anymore and with the totems added this is where the famous critx3 weapons are found -- Bert Badas 12/30/2001

name: North Fork Dam Hive
description:
Can not be linked summoned or recalled. Requires DM. -- Dark Man - Sol
Entrance is hot with legionaries on the dam. Foyer is quiet. This is the home of both the third Rusty Chest for making Pyreal Bells, and the Olthoi Queens Quest Shower Room. There is a waterfall at the start -- turn left after jumping to get deeper into the dungeon. The Rusty Chest is easy to get to and in a quiet room. The Shower Room is a big acid-floored room deep in the dungeon -- it takes teams and lever pulling to get there. -- Doc Feelgood 1/26/2003

name: Aun Shimauri
description:
Tumerok NPC. Says, ""Wharu take the Hea. They have stolenour precious totems. If you come across any Hea, you may dispatch them with the Anu's blessings. And if you should find one of our totems, bring them to me and I shall confide some of our secrets to you."" He also sometimes plays his drums... pretty cool. -- Dunc
if you bring him a totems,you can get into the portal with the waterfall coming out of its mouth.thats the quest for a liven weapon. -- Rhuagh of frost 10/30/2001

name: Martinate Holding
description:
Found this dungeon running around Marae Lassel. Made it a good portion through, full of tuskers, Slaves, Guards, Silver and Armored. Also Virindi and the new Martinate Hollow Minions. We had to leave when we were swarmed by a dozen silver tuskers an Executor and about 6 Hollows. I would suspect this is Martins Lair or a base of his. Didnt make it to the end, yet. -- SlvrDrgn&Mthron
Be Carefull... Anti-Magic trap there. All my buffs gone so i had to recall. -- Elder Merlin 10/30/2001
Went back in with a bigger team, made it to the end. At the end you will find a virindi NPC there. If you give him a singularity weapon he will convert it so that you dont lose it when you die. -- Silver Dragon 1/9/2002

name: Aun Papileona's Shrine to Raeta
description:
After visiting Aun Papileona at 40.4N 78.2W he tells you, Greetings, traveler. I have a grave favor to ask you. In his jealousy, the anima Carenzi has infested the beautiful shrine I built for Raeta with his creatures. I tried to route them myself, but the horrid beasts nearly ripped me to pieces and ate the key to my chest. Until my shrine is cleansed of his defiling presence, Raeta will not return. Aun Papileona tells you, I locked my amulet inside my chest--if you bring it to me as proof that you have driven Carenzi away, I will reward you with the title of Carenzi Slayer. Follow Volkamas riverbanks to the north, and youll find my shrine. (I could not go in, My level was higher then 15) -- Zandor Hansson
The dungeon is Aun architecture -- very native. Entrance and exit can be hot with native fauna. Foyer is quiet. Dungeon is mostly Carenzi Pouchlings (smallest) with about five sentries (next smallest) in the final room -- one of these drops the key to the chest. The dungeon is medium-small with meandering loops of halls. Ramp to 2nd level is in the middle of the big room. Aun Papileona will give you a nice Reatas Amulet for returning his -- Regen 2, Rejuv 2, Healing Mastery 2. (Papileona, by the way, is really big on butterflies.) -- Doc Feelgood 1/8/2002 Full name: Aun Papileonas Shrine to Raeta. Moved to 38.9N, 76.3W from 41.7N, 78.3W. No level restrictions. -- Solan Thommad 6/13/2004

name: Northern Manumet Plains Portal
description:
can not be summoned or linked to, requires DM -- Ronin V
This portal drops off at 50.5N 68.2W -- Drakkn 11/2/2001

name: Redspire to Greenspire Portal
description: can not be summoned, linked to, or recalled to. New exit coords: 43.2N, 66.8W (was 42.9N, 68.1W) -- Dutton 7/11/2004

name: Mount Elyrii Hive
description:
-- Three [WE]
Level 70+ restricted. Deep within the Mt. Elyrii Hive is the Royal Hive, where the Olthoi Queen lives. To access the Royal Hive and defeat the queen, you must give 1 bell each to the five Aun Tumeroks at the five menhir rings spread out all over the plateau (remember, once you give a bell, you cant get back into Timaru for a month, unless you kill the Queen). You also have to be sprayed by an Eviscerator at the end of the north dam hive (which only lasts for 90 minutes). Once inside, proceed to the bottom and defeat the Queen. Check out Maggie the Jackcats site for more information on this part, as its very difficult and I dont feel like writing it all out here
) Just remember, once the Queens dead, loot her head ASAP or it will be lost and you wont be able to get the quest rewards. Another word of warning, you cannot log off in here or youll reappear at your lifestone when you log back in... this is to prevent camping though it also punishes people with a bad connection. Once you defeat the queen, return to Timaru and give the queens head to Aun Hareltah for 40 million XP, the title Queenslayer, and a stuffed Queen head you can hang on your wall. -- Confucius of FF 6/12/2002 Entrance / Exit is modestly hot with Marescent plateau fauna. Foyer is hot with Chaos Wisp. Upper level of the dungeon is accessable without being sprayed, and is inhabited with Chaos Wisps and Legionnaries
spawn rate is modest. Dungeon architecture is spacious with jumps and platforms. -- Doc Feelgood 11/6/2003

name: Empyrean Dam
description: Large dam, guarded by lots of Tumeroks, including a couple of Elder Shamans. -- Confucius of FF

name: Floodgates
description: Enormous floodgates, over which the main river of Marae Lassel spills. Unclimbable, and a bit quiet for such an enormous amount of rushing water. -- Confucius of FF

name: The Dark Lair
description:
Cannot be linked, summoned, etc. -- Dunc
Dungeon is two small levels containing lvl 15 Olthoi harvesters and lvl 25 Olthoi Gardeners. Very good loot considering the monster level...just dont sell it on Marae..heinous sell rates on the island. -- AllyMcAlchemist 10/29/2001
Entrance and exit are quiet. Foyer can be hot. The dungeon is small and the spawn fast. Stand a couple of rooms in from the entrance and most of the dungeons inhabitants can get to you. -- Doc Feelgood 11/6/2001
Home of the Gardener weeder tittle, gardener pincer is at the bottom of the dungeon wich is usually heavily camped, turn it in to Yii at redspire for 5 treated kits, a D note, a ring of acid protection and a gardener token hand the token back to get you tittle -- Dark Knight 11/11/2001
Smaller dungeon than the Tumerok Site, and the pincer gains you 25,000XP instead of 5,000. Its not much harder either. Like most Pincer dungeons, most of the camping is for the loot and finding 2 or 3 pincers just lying around is common. -- Confucius of FF 12/10/2001

name: Wasteland Hive
description:
Couldnt explore this place, but here it is. Possibly a random portal? -- Confucius of FF
If you dbl click the portal you walk in and wont fall in a pit. Lvl 70+ to enter. Once in there are 4 pits, N,S,E and W. N & S pits are exactly the same. E & W Pits are exactly the same. N & S contain locked olthoi doors in an acid pit but are dead ends as far as we can tell (2 mages trying to figure it out). E & W are very short with 2 leverd doors one E and 1 W. We cant figure out how to open these doors yet. Lots of olthoi Soldiers, Legionaries and 1 Eviserater in here on a VERY fast spawn timer. Thistledown lvl 78 OG Mage -- Eternal Light 10/15/2002

name: Tall Trees
description: Three trees, glowing with an emerald hue, form a triangle at this spot. Each tree, when IDd, comes up as an Unknown creature at level 979. A green environmental message flashes occasionally that says: The dead leaves of the trees above you rustle in the wind. A sibilant, chattering voice breathes, A sapling shall stand before the seeds of the warmer light. The sapling is bent to loathe its sap, the man of the south, and all seeds of the cleaner light. Weights of earth and anger shall be tied to it, and the sapling shall bend in pain and confusion. But there shall be none to comfort, for the planters are lost to feversleep. -- Confucius of FF

name: Aun Gehawa
description: A level 183 Aun Tumerok NPC is playing its drum here and says something about the Menhir rings on the island amplifying the power of their drums. This is the 2nd of 5 locations to hand in a Pyreal Bell for destroying the menhir rings to get at the Young Queen. -- Confucius of FF

name: Karab Delta Portal
description: Exits at 38.1N, 77.7W Portal was surrounded by Virindi Observers and Executors. -- Confucius of FF

name: Yaraq Portal
description: South of GreenSpire -- Khellian New exit coords: 21.8S, 1.8W (was 22.2S, 2.1W) -- Dutton 7/11/2004

name: Tumerok Cave
description:
Part 2 of Living Spear Quest iniated by Bachus Flufens. After returning spear to Bachus she sends you here to retrieve the living spear tip. Spear tip is in a locked vault. Vault key is found on a Hea Shaman. Add tip to haft to make the Living Spear. If you return the completed spear (Aun Tanuas War Taiaha) to Bachus she gives you 1500xp and 3 stam elixirs. Can opt to keep the spear..ok noob spear weapon 5-12 base +3/+3 w/ Spear Mastery III, SK II, Rejuvenation II. Diff: 40 (no other reqs). Did this quest solo w/ lvl 20 gimp mage..original sorcerer template...fairly quick respawn throughout both dungeons. -- AllyMcAlchemist
When I turned the Spear in, the reward was 10k XP, Peerless Kit and 2 Copper Peas. Maybe reward is based on level of character turning spear in (I was L16) or maybe they upgraded the it at the last patch. -- Vaseline of WE 12/22/2001 Moved to 41.7N, 82.5W in the Pillars of Sand event (June 9, 2004). Exits to 41.6N, 82.5W. -- Lila_MT 6/11/2004 In addition to being moved, the level restrictions were removed. -- Solan Thommad 6/13/2004

name: Ariake (Cottages)
description: -- Jaz

name: Glenden Hills East Settlement
description:
Cottages -- Jaz

Change the name to Glenden Hills East Settlement. Glenden Wood settlement. Item is a Littoral Siraluun Claw. -- Chupon 1/22/2005

name: Hea Raider's Cache
description:
A virindi Trove like chest surrounded by about 15 various Tumeroks. The Caches lock is 550 diff and is laced with chorozite so weaken lock cant cast on it. Keys available from one of the Hea NPCs that randomly spawn I hear. -- Quixis Blight
Just use Focus/Coord/Lockpick Mastery 7 and a peerless. Same Diff as the bandit shield chest IIRC which isnt hard to pick if you have the skill. -- War Mongress 1/11/2002

name: Greenspire Portal (Shoushi)
description: Cannot be summoned, tied or recalled. -- Adric the Red New exit coords: 43.2N, 66.8W (was 42.9N, 68.1W) -- Dutton 7/11/2004 Portal has moved to 33.6S, 72.4E from 36.9S, 75.7E-- Anonymous 12/9/2004

name: Aun Bernawa
description:
Aun Bernawa tells you, I am waiting here for Hea Toneawa. I dont suppose he gave anything to you for my sister, Mariona? -- Yeou Chu-Kheng
You give Aun Bernawa Note from Hea Toneawa to Aun Mariona.
Aun Bernawa tells you, Hm...let me see...that bakha Toneawa. If he dares to think that he can meet my little sister here in secret hes got another thing coming. She will never be corrupted by that melodramatic sissy. If I ever catch him lurking about in our arbor again, Ill cut off his OWN tail for him. Hell wish hed never left Timaru for Ahurenga. And if he thinks Ill let Mariona run away with him across the water...Why, why Ill...Here, take this to him. I must hurry back to Timaru to alert my family of this ridiculous affair.
Aun Bernawa gives you Note from Aun Bernawa to Hea Toneawa. -- Yeou Chu-Kheng 11/3/2001
The note Says:
Toneawa:
Pray do not contact my sister Mariona again. She will soon learn that this mesalliance of hers will not be tolerated. Go--leave our island. The Aun were well rid of you the day you betrayed our sacred mission.
Be happy that the trusted bearer of this missive is still alive to carry this back to you.
Bernawa -- Yeou Chu-Kheng 11/3/2001
You give Hea Toneawa Note from Aun Bernawa to Hea Toneawa.
Hea Toneawa tells you, Alas. That tyrant Bernawa. Not only did he murder my friend Hea Rifona, he is keeping me from my true love. Some day he will live to feel my fury. Oh Mariona, oh Woe. Take this small gift...I will not need them soon.
Hea Toneawa awards you 1000 experience.
Hea Toneawa gives you 3 Health Elixirs.
Hea Toneawa gives you Good Healing Kit.
Hea Toneawa tells you, And now friend, stay with me no longer, for I must be alone.
Hea Toneawa tells you, Many thanks, my friend, but I couldnt trouble you again with the affairs of my heart so soon. Perhaps tomorrow I will find the courage to contact my beloved again. -- Yeou Chu-Kheng 11/3/2001 Now found at 41.1N, 74.4W instead of 42.2N, 82.8W. He still does not show up on radar. -- Solan Thommad 6/13/2004

name: East Fork Dam Hive
description:
Buff mainly vs Bludgeon, Fire, Pierce and Slash. A Chaos wisp attacks upon first entry. Jump down the waterfall to face 3 Vapour Golems, whilst taking water damage. Up the ramp is a roomwith 2 diamonds guarding the lever. Leave a lever puller. Team fights down through Nobles and Legionaries to an acid-pit run. Run through pit following left wall and unpick the Olthoi door. FIght up to a closed (lever) door. Pull 1st lever to open this door and then wait for lever puller to run down and through to you, if they want a bell part. Continue up to reach original exit portal, or search after lever door for component of Queens quest bell. -- Nukem/Leafcull
Turn right after jumping into waterfall for the ramp out of that room -- dont fight under the waterfall unless you enjoy damage. Much of the dungeon is Olthoi, and the bell part is in a Rusty Chest guarded by a moderately spawning Chaos Wisp. -- Doc Feelgood 1/26/2003

name: Aun Papileona
description: Aun Papileona tells you, I locked my amulet inside my chest--if you bring it to me as proof that you have driven Carenzi away, I will reward you with the title of Carenzi Slayer. Follow Volkamas riverbanks to the north, and youll find my shrine. -- Zandor Hansson Moved to 39.8N, 76.4W from 40.4N, 78.2W. Now says: Aun Papileona tells you, Greetings, traveler. Raetas migrations are such a beautiful mystery of nature. But where she goes, I must follow. I have moved my shrine to again be near her presence. Aun Papileona tells you, It is unfortunate that my misfortune seems to have followed me in turn. I have a grave favor to ask you. In his jealousy, the anima Carenzi has infested the beautiful shrine I built for Raeta with his own creatures. I tried to route them myself, but the horrid beasts nearly ripped me to pieces and ate the key to my chest. Until my shrine is cleansed of his defiling presence, Raeta will not return. Aun Papileona tells you, I locked my amulet inside my chest--if you bring it to me as proof that you have driven Carenzi away, I will reward you with the title of Carenzi Slayer. Follow Volkamas riverbanks to the south, and youll find my shrine. Aun Papileona tells you, Incidentally, I would be careful going past my old grotto if I were you--a motley group of Hea have moved in and made the place their own. They had an interesting-looking chest with them...but I was in too much of a hurry to follow Raeta on her migration to inquire further. -- Solan Thommad 6/13/2004

name: Hollow Lair near Lytelthorpe
description:
The agent of the Arcaneums ENVOY is here, and a quest to get a writ, and lawn dwarf decorations and fountains to buy for houses -- Spearit of WE,
To access the uber furniture store: run past the envoy NPC towards the lifestone, take a left, run a short distance down a couple of flights, and youll find a room with a couple of Goldenback Tuskers, Drudge Lurkers, and 1 Leader Hollow Minion (level 55). First, kill the minion (you HAVE to take the kill), then pick up the Illegible Note on the floor, and take the note back to the Envoy. Give the note to the Envoy and youll get a Numudiras Token. You can either keep the token to give to an Agent of the Arcanum for 1 Writ, or give the token right back to the Envoy to access the furniture store portal in the same room. I recommend taking the furniture store option, as the quest is NOT repeatable and Writs can be gained in other ways. -- Confucius of FF 11/17/2001
Furnature store sells only 3 items at present: Plaques (100k), Fountains (200k), and Lawn Drudges (200k). These items are only worth 10k, 20k, and 20k respectively, so there go dreams of lawn drudges nerfing death items. :) -- Eshuun Dara 11/26/2001
if you take the first passage to the left and go almost all the way to the end you will find not only more of the usual goldenbacks and lurkers, a tusker slave can be found there. my patron didnt believe me when i told him so i led him to it. spawn was consistant both times i went in there. -- Han Shi 1/09/02 1/9/2002

Basically, the bug caused them to go to the top of the monster's hate list. Wi called it the Wi flag, and I got him to autograph my healer's heart in-game on Frostfell just before he quit the game. This was several years ago. Geomancer, 2-17-2005

The Clay Figurine looks like a cheap non magic necklace, so look carefully. In order to get the skill credit you must get the kill on Aun Ralirea and then bring the Clay Figurine to Hea Arantah as quickly as possible. If you were not the killer, try to turn in a second one, or are late bringing the Clay Figurine he will be a jerk about it. -- Ash al-Shmore -- Taarna Blood SC

name: Empyrean Ice Propylaeum
description:
Located near Essence of Enchantment -- Skam Jim-One
This dungeon is part of the Helm of the Elements quest. Top level has Olthoi Soldiers, second level a few Legionaries. The rest of the dungeon contains Glacial Golems and Cold Elementals. Two teams must push buttons and pull levers for each other to advance. The upper group receives a Frigid Bracelet, the botton group an ice prism to be turned in to an Agent of the Arcanum. -- Wylfghar 2/28/2002
Entrance and exit are quiet. The foyer is quiet only if you take no steps towards the door, otherwise a soldier will come out to greet you. Spawn rate in most of the dungeon is modest. The first part of the dungeon (Olthoi part) is small. There is an acid floor that must be jumped on, but it is easy to run off. Nearby is the chest with the tool. The second parts of the dungeon are the cold parts. These are larger, rambling and part of lever, lever land. -- Doc Feelgood 3/24/2002

Many of the levers are trapped, which means they are useless and should be avoided. Seems only the levers without traps opens door for the other team. Reward is Incalescent Bracelet and a Fire prism. -- Immacolata

name: Tamar Ibn Rashid
description: March 2002 patch - get your shadow armow dye, Blue Green and Red - 100,000py each dye pot. Dye pot covers 1 piece of armor. Tamar Ibn Rashid tells you, Welcome, welcome. Look at my pretty dyes. Choose one, for your very own. -- Skam Jim-One

name: Jo Ten-Ma
description:
March 2002 patch - get your shadow armow dye, Blue Green and Red - 100,000py each dye pot. Dye pot covers 1 piece of armor. No need to run all the way out to Kara - the dyepots can also be purchased at the other two vendors.
Jo Ten-Ma tells you, How did I get saddled with this job, anyway? When I signed on to become Kogas apprentice I thought I would actually be making armor, not peddling pots and paints.
Jo Ten-Ma tells you, Make up your mind, wont you?
Jo Ten-Ma tells you, Tell Thats all people want, just buy, buy, buy. No one ever asks me how IM feeling today.
-- Skam Jim-One

name: Venemous Nidus
description:
Entry is hot. Drudge Stlakers and Ravs. And Martinate Simulacrum(44th lvl). More later. -- Dark Man - Sol
Top lvl is the Simi guys and drudges 1-2 viri masters. Once you make the drop to the 2nd lvl be ready. Around the corner and down a ramp is the Altered and Augemneted Olthio. They hollow electric and acid. I took a 181 point blow on my gloves. NOT a place for a mage to hang out unless you like dieing ALOT. The key part is on the bugs corpses. BRING ALOT of freinds. There is a room with like 20 guys on a 3-5 min spawn. No camping/wiating in line here. Well maybe for player corpses...:) -- Dark Man - Sol 3/13/2002

name: Convergent Median
description:
More later. -- Dark Man - Sol
A buddy of mine and I made the run to this place from the S. Direlands portal drop. We made a long run (west mostly) around a mountain to get to this place. We couldnt find a way over the mountain until running to the end of it. There maybe a shorter way. Inside we found Martinate Magician Simulacrum (lvl 44 I think), Virindi Masters and observers. Also saw sirroccos in the bottom before recalling. -- -Loco Vato -Sol 5/13/2002

name: Fire Auroch Pasture
description:
A very large group of Fire Aurochs (10-12) were here when I ran by... seemed like too many to be coincidental. -- Confucius of FF
Absolutely. This is a fixed spawn of a few Fire Bulls, Cows, and a ton of Yearlings. Im guessing around 30 of the whole bunch. Bring your Bludgeoning Protection. This is a great spot to hunt the Fire Auroch Hide for the Buadren or the Fire Auroch Bull Horns for the Composite Bow Quests. Respawn is estimated at around 10 minutes. Surrounding area contains higher-end monsters like High Tumeroks, Banderling Enforcers, Dual Fragments, and Reedsharks. -- Nocturne, LC 7/9/2002

name: Simple Hive
description: Random Spawn Dungeon on the Mare Lassel Plateau. Can not be summoned or recalled. Foyer is quiet. Nobles and Evicerators. There is an Olthoi Noble spawn at the bottom, which can randomly produce a Level 90 blue Olthoi Noble that drops the Rubble from the SE ring at 46.5N, 75.9W. Give this rubble to Aun Ngationa in Timaru for a Siraluun Totem. This can be used on the Palenqual weapon or turned into Aun Hareltah for 500k XP.-- Kraji -- Melodoc -- Doc Feelgood -- Taarna Blood SC

name: Nuhmudira's Dungeon
description: Untiable, cannot be summoned. No level restriction. Inside, most of the dungeon is clean. In a room, one of the tomes is usable, so use it to open up a fireplace. Down that basement you'll run int Sclavi, but only up to Essa's at worst. You'll also find Nuhmudira's Journal somewhere in the basement. Nice textures. Nuhmudira had good taste. -- Garfield3d

name: Malignant Tabernacle
description: First part of the three dungeon Quiddity Ingot quest introduced in march 2002s Persuassion patch. Theme is to go down down down down untill bottom. If you run up, its the wrong way. Foes are siroccos, therals and tsurics, strange combo elementals of ice and fire, acid and lightning. They resist my 349 life magic almost all the time, and my 383 war pretty darn often. And I hit for 20-30 pts. Slashing seemed to work better. Baning all 4 elements seems to be a good idea. One of the therals at the bottom drops a Ring of a Singularity Key. Pick this up and get to next dungeon, Venomous Nidus, for 2nd part of the key. -- Immacolata

name: Gelidite Library
description:
Cannot be recalled, tied to, or summoned. NE of Stonehold. -- Ankhentomen MT
not to much 2 levels , 2 rooms that have a few fire monsters, contain 2 books new for april -- Stonehold Clan 4/10/2002
on the right tunnel there is a hidden wall in the center of the room, leads to another portol -- Stonehold Clan 4/10/2002
EAST of Stonehold. There is a secret Labyrinth portal to be found inside the Library (mentioned above). This quest allows you to cast your vote for the fate of Nuhmudira. Assemble book binding + 8 a hastily scrawled notes. Give this completed book, Nuhmudiras Charm - to the golem in the dungeon so you can help decide her fate. Choose wisely. As of this patch, much is still yet unknown about the consequences. -- Ankhentomen MT 4/10/2002
First level contains 2 similar rooms which each contain about 6 Flammas (Fire Elementals) and book new for April. In the centre of a wall with no doors on one of the Flamma rooms is a hidden passage that goes down to 2nd level. 2nd level contains Shivvers (Frost Elementals) and youll need to handle up to about 3 at a time. You then get to the Labyrinth and the rest is already described by various walkthroughs. 4/18/2002
First level contains 2 similar rooms which each contain about 6 Flammas (Fire Elementals) and book new for April. In the centre of a wall with no doors on one of the Flamma rooms is a hidden passage that goes down to 2nd level. 2nd level contains Shivvers (Frost Elementals) and youll need to handle up to about 3 at a time. You then get to the Labyrinth and the rest is already described by various walkthroughs. -- Jaz SC 4/18/2002

name: Shallow Hive
description: The portal spawns randomly in both time and space, though is often within 5 clicks of the above at least i have never found it further. -- Sho NilremCan not be summoned or recalled. The Shallow Hive has an exit portal near the entry. It has Olthoi Warriors near the top, and adds Olthoi Evicerators near the bottom. There is a single Olthoi Noble spawn at the bottom, which can randomly produce a Level 90 blue Olthoi Noble that drops the Rubble for the North East stone ring at 49.2N, 74.7W. Give this rubble to Aun Ngationa in Timaru for a Carenzi Totem. This can be used on the Palenqual weapon or turned into Aun Hareltah for 500k XP. -- Taarna Blood SC

name: Al-Arqas Journeyman Scriveners (Level III)
description: Journeyman scriveners sell Foci and Level III scrolls.

name: Sea Palace
description:
In the water, off the beach a ways. Some sort of palace with stone head megaliths making paths to it. No apparent enterance.
--Courtesy of Virindi Inquisitor and Blessed Red Flower. -- Garfield3d
The gray temple-like structure is four-sided and may be element related. The stone head nearest the temple is VERY close. If you can get on the head, perhaps you can get in. Regardless, I detected no objects or residents. -- Neko Neko 6/14/2002
This is actually Gaerlans Citadel... on the evening of July 11th 2002, this place erupted in a rainbow of elemental electricity shooting towards the sky as the water surrounding it bubbled with flame. These recent events come on the heels of the first sighting of Gaerlan who nearly killed Asheron at the Midsong Festival Stone, no doubt foreshadowing the upcoming battle between Asheron and Elysa against Gaerlan and Martine. Still no way up there, though, besides forming a PK ladder or jumping from the top of the nearest stone head with a 480+ jump skill... -- Confucius of FF 7/12/2002
The palace, now known as Gaerlans Citadel, is no longer in this location. Having taken flight and migrated SSW, it crash-landed in the mountains far northeast of Holtburg during the Verdict event of Sep 2002, where it now lies. Accessing the citadel is now part of the Gaerlan quest. -- Confucius of FF 2/16/2003

name: Grievver Caves
description:
Portal is tie able and recall able. Lots of Scrawed and Virulent. At the bottom is a dude called a Spinning Griever. Kill him and get silk. -- Dark Man - Sol
Do the place some justice. Its really quite beautiful and makes for a really neat experience... billowing webs and carrion everywhere. Come for the silk, stay for the ambience. The Spinner is past the first carrion chamber. Go down from there. -- Neko Neko 6/14/2002

name: Slithe Tradittor's Cabin
description:
Slithe Tradittor tells you, ""Traveler. I have a tale to tell and a task I would put upon you. Were you to take this task on yourself, you will bear witness to things I have seen and a wondrous device I glimpsed but could not fathom or grasp.""
Slithe Tradittor tells you, ""For you see, there is an artifact in a place unlike any that exists in Dereth.""
Slithe Tradittor tells you, ""I am an explorer for the Explorer Society. In a desert region, I came upon a suspended walkway hung out from the edge of a cliff. The other end of the walkway was attached not to solid ground but was lost in the spinning light of a portal. I held my breath and stepped upon the walkway, half expecting it to collapse and throw me to the ground so far below. Yet, the walkway held my weight. I crept forward and stepped through the portal. I arrived on another walkway, or perhaps the same one somehow extended through the portal. There was a platform at its far end, then another walkway... Well, it is something you must see for yourself. Suffice it to say that I journeyed through this structure, all the while being assailed by vile creatures. Near the top of this construction I spied an artifact- a tall pedestal it was, with arcane shapes gyrating in the air above it. I know not its function but it was clear to me that this artifact, this device, is of some import. There are many things it could be and none, I believe, of small consequence. Before I was able to reach it, a wretched monster sent me back to my Lifestone. Later, I attempted to return, yet the portal would not permit me to pass. I know not why.""
Slithe Tradittor tells you, ""I must study this device. I call it the ""Arcane Pedestal."" I even believe I have the means to create a version of it, but first I require an imprint of its morphology.""
Slithe Tradittor tells you, ""I shall give you a copy of my notes and an Imaging Crystal. The notes show you the way to that place. The Imaging Crystal can be imprinted with the composition and design of this device. Return to me with the imprint embedded within the Crystal and I will study it and determine how to create it.""
Slithe Tradittor tells you, ""The Arcane Pedestal. We shall have the Arcane Pedestal."" -- Astalon Decurth
This is the start point for the June 2002 ""Arcane Pedestal & Map of Dereth"" Quest. Speak to Slithe Traddior for an item, then travel to the Precarious Sojourn Portal. You *must* be higher than level 30 for the NPC to issue you a Crystal. -- Nocturne, LC -- Nocturne, LC 6/22/2002

name: Verdentine Magnan
description: This guy, dressed as the Isparian equivalent of Spider Man, is the guy you give your Silk (from the nearby dungeon) to. Hell give it back and tell you what to do with it. Even if you dont have the silk, come up here and check out his armor. -- Neko Neko

description: An Olthoi Gazebo located in the lake just behind the East fork Dam on Marae Lassel. There are fast spawning Olitho Legionary?s around base and on the dam. Perchers on the Gazebo can reach Olithoi on the dam with bows and crossbows. Great XP. -- Burch

name: Slithis Hill

description: A small pond at the extreme end of the Vesayen Isles chain, bubbling with green gas. A group of half a dozen Revenants and Dark Revenants kneel in silent meditation at its shores, almost as if it were a shrine for something. -- Confucius of FF

name: The Callous Heart
description: If you choose to pull the plain lever in the Gelidite Library quest choosing to damn Nuhmudira, you are flagged as Merciless and portalled back to Kai Mallan at the entrance. He gives you some poratl gems to Callous Heart dungeon (timer: 3 per weeks). There is 3 parts, Right Wing (15+), Left Wing (30+) and High Grounds (45+). Many Elementals and High level golems. In each parts u can find a life giver jewelry (from +15 to +30 hp). -- Call

name: Martine's Retreat
description:
Cool looking place. No monsters that I have found. Follow left wall to his study. On the right side is a tusker husk. On the left side is a letter. Striat ahead is a portal to his throne room. the best part is near the tusker husk on the wall. Go look its LOL funny. -- Dark Man - Sol
Owe and there is a bunch of shop keepers includeing an ARCH MAGE that sells plats for 44k etc just like the three racial ones. -- Dark Man - Sol 7/18/2002
WARNING... I think this is another vote setup. If you give him the letter first your voteing one way. If you give him the husk first your voteing the other way. -- Dark Man - Sol 7/18/2002
Now home to the Sunstone Gauntlet quest. Enter the Subterrainian Farms portal (20+). Have fun with the eye-candy, and the plentiful infesting monsters. (Olthoi Grubs, Servants, Gold and Jungle Wasps). Harker at the back is a heavily armored, fast regenning 95th level. You want his head to hand back in for the gauntlets. -- Doc Feelgood 8/6/2003

name: Hellfire Spawn
description:
These are the coords to where the hellfire that drops the Soll part spawns and sets off the relic bone spawn in the relic town , sometimes there are a few plasma and vapor golems on top of the spawn which you might have to clear but this is where they will eventually spawn around.
- Army Of Darkness {Frostfell} -- - SoD ClanNote that you must drop the Pyreal Forge Bellows and Sluice Gate Bar (Aerlinthe quest) before the Hellfire spawn here will generate a red SoLL infusion. And you may still have to kill the entire spawn up to several times afterwards before the boss Hellfire appears. (6/14/2004) -- Zarin of HG 6/16/2004

name: Small Temple
description:
same than the 2 others -- me
The temple at this area is in no way lame. Chomu and Dark Leechs in here..found many +8% mana c orbs in the chests that open with no keys necessary. The chest that a sik cant open tho, im curious, is this a questor chest? Also to clarify, this particular small temple is behind the ithaenc temple, same isle as sanctuary. Perhaps you dont care for this small temple but my bm/65 loves it. Its the toughest small temple I have found, and considering the exp and loot...Im very happy. Im considering getting a Lady Adjas key to try here considering that its not SIK openable...and on the isle. -- GRIMM 10/22/2002
Something else odd....I logged out..then back in here, and all the chests now cont be opened. This place is odd... However I did get large menos and alot of siks drop here as well. -- GRIMM 10/22/2002
Entrance is guarded with Chomu Sclavi, one of whom blocks the entrance. Chomu, Dark Magus and Dark Leeches inside. Dungeon is one room. Foyer is modestly hot. Entrance and exit are recallable, but not summonable. The small temples are the same layout inside, but different monster mixes. -- Doc Feelgood 12/16/2002
