name: New Hive
description: Entrance portal is a random spawn on the north end of the plateau. Foyer is quiet. Individual rooms are large and convoluted, but the overall dungeon layout is simple. There is a big jump to get to the bottom. Rubble drops from a Level 90 blue Olthoi Noble who will randomly spawn in place of the normal Noble at the bottom. -- Doc Feelgood 1/26/2003 Can not be summoned or recalled. Dungeon is full of Warriors at the top, with a few Mutilators and Swarm Evicerators towards the bottom. Exit portal at the very bottom after a large jump. Turn in at Timaru for the Timaru Totem of the Palenqual elder weapons quest. There is a single Olthoi Noble spawn in a side room at the bottom, which can randomly produce a Level 90 blue Olthoi Noble that drops the Rubble for the North Ring at 53.0N, 73.3W. Give this rubble to Aun Ngationa in Timaru for a Timaru Totem. This can be used on the Palenqual weapon or turned into Aun Hareltah for 500k XP. -- Taarna Blood SC

name: New Yanshi
description: It appears all wasnt lost. The residents of Yanshi have move up the road a bit and set up a tent community with what appears to be all of the original residents of Yanshi. With the Northern Yanshi Outpost Lifestone just up the road this place would be a great tie for selling for low levels -- Badamon, MT

name: Ziggurat Dungeons
description:
Lightning Ziggurat - Lvl 20-39
Acid Ziggurat - Lvl 40-59
Fire Ziggurat - Lvl 60-79
Frost Ziggurat - Lvl 80+
The Lightning Ziggurat (20-39) has Lightning Elementals (Sparks, Synnasts and Voltarcs), level 83 Stasis Wisps and Granite Golems.
The Acid Ziggurat (40-59) has Strife Wisps, Coral Golems, and Acid Elementals, including Mox and Buillics.
The Fire Ziggurat (60-79) is full of Fire Elementals -- Flares, Flammas, Infernos, Hellfires, Chaos Wisps and a few Diamond Golems. Go NW at the the first maze area, and west at the second.
The Frost Ziggurat (80+) has Frost Elementals, Tempest Wisps, Acidic Diamond Golems and Platinum Golems.
Each dungeon is similar in design, with a pre-maze area where youll be fighting most of the creatures, a maze area (head up), and the end portion with the Platinum Golem.
When you reach the end, hand the Imbued Pyreal Nugget to the Golem and it will open a portal to the Proving Grounds. -- Jaz of SC

name: Fathomless Chasm
description:
Entrance is quiet, Foyer is quiet, and it is a staging area for four separate dungeons that are level restricted: 20-29, 30-39, 40-49, 50-70, and 70+.
Entrance is tieable and summonable, but you must have visited the arcanium research facility south of Zaikhal and collected ten magic decanters before you can enter here. (Theres a 3-day timer between collecting decanters and completing quest. If youre not finished, you start over.)
There is no surface portal in staging area, and no monsters.
The inner dungeons start with a drop, and fighting elemental monsters -- different for each level range. There is a boss golem to kill at the bottom. The BDT here is to fill your decanters with pure mana, which is then used in making Isparian weapons.
-- Doc Feelgood
There are three drops. Each drop is heavily infested with elementals and golems. But, the spawn is slow -- if you clear a level, it will stay clear for many minutes. The level area after each drop is small but there are some pseudo respite areas were you can stand and control the rush at you.
You can fill decanters before the boss golem is dead -- click high on the waterfall, rather than low. -- Doc Feelgood 11/6/2002
Correction: you can enter without decanters, for, say, a corpse rescue. But without decanters, you have nothing to fill. -- Doc Feelgood 12/18/2002 Updated level restrictions/portal names/element:
20-39 - Fathomless Chasm Devex - Cold
40-49 - Fathomless Chasm Clough - Fire
50-59 - Fathomless Chasm Plummet - Acid
60-79 - Fathomless Chasm Descent - Lightning
80+ - Fathomless Chasm Abyss -- Neros 10/25/2003

name: Portal to Random locations
description: There is always a portal here, but it will point to different locations from time to time. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Temple of Forgetfulness
description:
Entrance and exit are hot with North Osteth fauna. The Guardian will ask you for an herb, using its spell-casting name. (talk about forgotten lore.) Herb required changes about every thirty seconds, so bring a selection.
Foyer is quiet. Run by or fight your way through copper, iron and obsidian golems to get to Inner Sactum portal. It may be a bug, but sometimes I got portaled to surface, rather than inner sactum.
Inner Sactum is quiet, just pick the proper gem and use it. Three week timer on these gems, and those of the Temple of Enlightenment. (same timer, use one or the other) -- Doc Feelgood
Herb does not change every 30 secs. it changes every time you click on the head.. so bring whatever you know the spell word for, and keep clicking till it asks for that. -- Eoin Cortorl 11/13/2002
Boquar- Mugwort, Cruath- Ginseng,Equin- Mandrake, Malar- Hyssop, Quavosh- dragonsblood, Roiga- Yarrow, Shurov- Comfrey, Tugak- Vervain, Volae- Eyebright, Yanoi- Bistort, Zojak- Hawthorn -- Eclipsa of FF 11/26/2002
Now also contains Attribute Gems: pick up a pair, one red, one green, combine and use. Two week timer on the pair. -- Doc Feelgood 1/28/2003

name: Temple of Enlightenment
description:
Entrance is at the cliff base, not on top, and the jump is difficult. Come by way of the beach. The Guardian will ask you for an herb, using it's spell-casting name. (talk about forgotten lore.) Herb required changes about every thirty seconds, so bring a selection. Foyer is quiet. Run by or fight your way through copper, iron and obsidian golems to get to Inner Sactum portal. It may be a bug, but sometimes I got portaled to surface, rather than Inner Sanctum. Inner Sanctum is quiet, just pick the proper gem and use it. Three week timer on these gems, and those of the Temple of Forgetfulness. (same timer, use one or the other) -- Doc Feelgood
Make sure you are carrying ONLY the book you were given when the statue portalled you into the temple. If you pick up another book or drop that book, you will be portalled back to the surface as Doc noted. -- Mage-One 11/15/2002
In the golem area, take either all lefts or all rights whenever the path forks. That's what the Guardian means when he tells you to follow the path ""with conviction."" -- Garfield3d 11/18/2002
Boquar- Mugwort, Cruath- Ginseng,Equin- Mandrake, Malar- Hyssop, Quavosh- dragonsblood, Roiga- Yarrow, Shurov- Comfrey, Tugak- Vervain, Volae- Eyebright, Yanoi- Bistort, Zojak- Hawthorn -- Eclipsa of FF 11/26/2002
Now contains Attribute Gems as well. Pick up a pair, red and green, combine and use. Two week timer on the pair. -- Doc Feelgood 1/28/2003

name: Tusker Emporium
description:
You will find the Tusker T-Shirt at the end of dungeon. Plus you will be able to buy a decoration plaque I survived the Tusker Emporium and tusker statues. -- Greeneye/ACMAPS
Entrance is at the bottom of the crater, there is a path down. Entrance, exit and foyer are quiet. Portals cannot be recalled, summoned or tied to. Dungeon is linear and long, long, long. Tuskers of 41st and 61st, and Tusker Minions of 32nd level crowd the halls. Spawn is medium. There are some trappy places. The eye candy respites between the long corridors are nice. The souvineer shop at the end is appropriately tacky, and quiet... a good wind down place. -- Doc Feelgood 11/14/2002
Until someone makes a map, if you make a right turn at every intersection, you will wind up at the Emporium at the bottom. 11/18/2002

name: Tusker Grotto
description:
Located on Aphus Lassel -- Greeneye/ACMAPS
Entrance/exit modestly hot with local fauna. Foyer is quiet.. barely. Dungeon is standard tusker architecture, but the flood rooms are more thickly packed than average -- stamina is an issue in this dungeon. Crimsonback (24), Goldenback (30), and Tusker Kin (12) are the inhabitants. A small dungeon, with medium spawn rate. The exit is at the bottom past a series of flood rooms that look like wide corridors. No BDT that I could find. -- Doc Feelgood 11/27/2002

name: Tusker Retreat
description:
Located on Aphus Lassel -- Greeneye/ACMAPS
Entrance/exit modestly hot, foyer quiet. Small dungeon, medium spawn rate. Exit is at bottom and relatively straight ahead. Architecture is standard tusker with corridors and flood rooms. Monsters are Male and Female Tuskers (16) and Tusker Kin (12). No BDT that I could find. -- Doc Feelgood 11/27/2002

name: Tusker Habitat
description:
Located on Aphus Lassel -- Greeneye/ACMAPS
Went here, and it's awesome. Liberators, and lots of them (7500 xp each). There are probably double or triple the number of tuskers here than in BSD, but they are spread out further. Would be great for fellowships.
Kermit the Quick ~ LC -- Kermit 11/18/2002
Entrance/exit is quite hot. Foyer is quiet. Monoculture dungeon, pure Liberator (61). Dungeon is medium small in size. The layout of the first part is symmetric and ""O"" shaped. The spawn rate is medium. Exit is at the far end of the O, take the ramp up. BDT is a Liberator Tusk on a tusker in the last flood room before the exit -- worth 75K and a recall gem. -- Doc Feelgood 11/27/2002

name: Tusker Honeycombs
description: You can find Assailers in here, and one of them at the very bottom drops an Assailer Tusk worth 8.33% xp for next lvl, and a token for Master of Slaughter title. -- Immacolata 7/21/2003

name: Tusker Temple
description:
Inside are a myriad of Tusker Slaves, Guards and Worshippers. There is also a Tusker Shrine deep inside. This portal is fully tieable, summonable and recallable. -- Jaz of SC
Worshippers are 72nd level and throw BV6's. Spawn is fast, and fighting is ""clumpy"". Layout is BSD-like -- there are flood rooms. Static Shrine portal takes you to Oolutanga's Refuge, the standard Isle entry spot. -- Doc Feelgood 11/14/2002

name: Tusker Temple
description:
-- Jaz of SC
Entrance is hot with local fauna. There is no exit. The entrance is recallable. Foyer is quiet, barely. This is the same layout as other Tusker Temple dungeons. The spawn is a thick mix of Male Tuskers, Female Tuskers and Tusker Kin. Expect to get jammed in a hallway if you try to just sprint through to the shrine at the back. -- Doc Feelgood 12/17/2002

name: Tusker Temple
description:
-- Jaz of SC
Entrance is hot. The Foyer is quiet, barely. There is no exit portal, but you can Recall to the entrance portal. The layout is the same as the other two Tusker Shrine dungeons. The spawn is a thick mix of Crimsonback, Goldenback and Minions, so expect to get jammed in a hallway if you try to just sprint through to the shrine at the back. -- Doc Feelgood 12/17/2002

name: Oolutanga's Refuge
description:
Welcome to Aphus Lassel. This is the town you appear in when you use a Tusker Gem or Shrine. -- The Spectre
The full service town at the entry point to the Tusker Isles. The shop keepers all talk Tusker, except for Brighteyes, the Tailor, who is leader of the human resistance. (not too surprisingly, since all the humans on the isles wear only towels, he has nothing to sell.) -- Doc Feelgood 11/15/2002

name: Tusker Lacuna
description:
Tusker Slaves through Devestators... A VERY nasty place, great for LARGE parties of 100+ folks. At the end are three tuskers, one of which drops a tusk that can be turned in for 5% of the xp required for your next level. -- The Spectre
XP for tusk is actually 12.5% -- dwJoker - LC 12/4/2002

name: Tusker Assault
description: Home to a large number of Plated and Rampager Tuskers, along with a mix of Tusker Loonies who cast Imperil VI on you... have fun. -- The Spectre

name: Rampage Bluff
description: More fun with Plated and Rampager Tuskers, along with thos ever fun Tusker Loonies who cast Imperil VII on you... -- The Spectre

name: Plated Rifts
description: Plated and Armored Tuskers, combined with Tusker Loonies and their wonderful Imperil spells... Watch out for the combination debuff/Bludgeon Vuln VII trap... -- The Spectre

name: Tusker Gauntlet
description: The name says it all... more super high level Tuskers than you can shake a stick at. Throw in the debuff traps, Bludgeon Vuln VII traps, and Imperil VIIs cast by mages and you have a party.. Is this the home of Bobo, King of the Tuskers...? -- The Spectre

name: Vengeance Caverns
description:
-- Jaz of SC
This is the heart of North Tusker Forest. Lvl 45+ Entrance is hot. Foyer is quiet. Mixed dungeon with Silver Tuskers and Temple Worshipers. -- Doc Feelgood 11/15/2002

name: Tusker Tunnels
description:
Actual Location of Tusker Tunnels. Plated Tuskers Give 60,000 Xp. Also Tusker tusk at bottom gives you 5% xp for next level, token, gem Title: Bloodletter -- Astalon Decurth
Inside the dungeon, the larger red glows on the ground denote where a dispell/vuln trap is. You can avoid all traps(except one near the end) by running beside the walls. Entrance doesn't have a spawn but sometimes Tuskers get drawn inside. Only exit is at the bottom. -- Garfield3d 1/20/2003

name: Tusker Burrow
description:
Entrance and exit are hot with local fauna
the foyer is quiet. Monoculture dungeon of Female Tuskers (16). Layout is a symetric fan-out of corridors headed down into flood rooms, which means the first fight at the top is a doozey. Dungoeon is medium small in size and spawn is medium. The exit is at the end of a big flood room on one of the center fingers. BDT is Female Tusker Tusk worth 15K XP and a Tusker Island Portal Gem when handed in to Brighteyes -- four drop off of Tuskers in the final flood room next to the exit. -- Doc Feelgood 11/30/2002

name: Tusker Lodge
description:
From the AC Vault. -- Solan Thommad
Entrance and Exit are hot with local fauna; the foyer is quiet. This is a monoculture of Male Tuskers (16). The layout is light and airy looking, and bilaterally symetric, and you go up and up, instead of down and down. The exit is at the top. The BDT is a Male Tusker Tusk worth 17.5K and a Tusker Island Portal Gem when handed in to Brighteyes. Four drop from Tuskers in the room which has the exit. Dungeon is medium in size, and the spawn is medium. -- Doc Feelgood 11/30/2002
Level cap removed. Now 5+. -- Doc Feelgood 12/20/2002

name: Tusker Cave
description:
From the AC Vault. -- Solan Thommad
Entrance is hot, exit is quiet... barely. Foyer is quiet. Dungeon is monoculture Crimsonback Tusker (24), symmetric, and the end room is found going up rather than down. Slightly more interesting graphic style than most nearby dungeons. Size is medium, and the spawn a bit faster than medium. The BDT is a Crimsonback Tusker Tusk, but they are found on Tuskers *near* the exit room, not in the exit room. Tusk is worth 20K XP and a gem when handed in to Brighteyes. -- Doc Feelgood 12/1/2002
Level cap removed. Now 12+. -- Doc Feelgood 12/20/2002

name: Tusker Cavern
description:
From the AC Vault. -- Solan Thommad
Entrance/exit are hot with Central Forest Fauna. Foyer is very hot, it is part of one of two huge flood rooms that make up the first part of the dungeon. (There is a respite corridor beyond the second flood room.) The dungeon is small, the spawn medium fast. Most of the dungeon is the first two flood rooms. Exit is at bottom. Spawn is pure Goldenback Tusker (30), and the BDT is a Goldenback Tusker Tusk found on tuskers near the exit. Tusk is worth 30K XP and a gem to Brighteyes. -- Doc Feelgood 12/1/2002
Level cap removed. Now 15+ -- Doc Feelgood 12/20/2002

name: Tusker Pits
description:
Silvers, Tusk worth 500K and Silver Serf title. From the AC Vault. Silver Serf?. As in Silver Surfer?. lol. -- Solan Thommad
Entrance and Exit are in a thick spawn of local fauna. Foyer is quiet. Layout is complex, but symmetric, with several jumps. Dungeon is medium size and spawn in medium rate. Exit is down and west off the main bottom room. Spawn is pure Silver Tusker. BDT is Silver Tusker Tusk, found on tuskers spawning in main bottom room. -- Doc Feelgood 12/10/2002

name: Path out
description: This is a way out of the Tusker Emporium crater. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Ayan Baqur To Fort Tethana Portal
description: Go in the Collosus Foundry portal, in the statue, and take the nearby portal out to Fort Teth. Exit at 1.7N, 71.2W. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Tusker Quarters
description:
Entrance and exit are hot with local fauna. No exit near entrance. Exit is at the bottom just off a big room. Foyer is quiet. Architecture is lots and lots of tunnels and rooms filled with pure Tusker Slaves. Monoculture dungeon, no BDT that I could find. -- Doc Feelgood
BDT is Tusker Slave tusk (100K) found on tuskers in flood room in front of exit. The layout is a fanout of flood rooms from the entrance. The exit, and tusks, are in the center of the fan out. -- Doc Feelgood 12/14/2002
The floorplan is the same as that of Tusker Abode. -- Doc Feelgood 2/20/2003

name: Tusker Encampment
description:
Located on the hilltop. Entrance is quiet... barely
exit is hot. Foyer is quiet. Liberators, Redeemers and minions throughout
Slaves on 2nd level
Guards on 3rd. No exit near entrance. Exit is found *up* using left hand rule from the entrance. No BDT that I could find. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Static Portal to Oolutanga's Refuge
description:
The shrine located at the back of Tusker Temple will take you to Oolutanga's Refuge. This is the same as the random spawn portals, but it is always here. -- Doc Feelgood
Exit at 2.3N, 95.5E -- Doc Feelgood 11/15/2002

name: N. Tusker Forest Ford
description:
A passage from the east island to the west island. Keep in mind that the west island fauna is considerably tougher than east island at this crossing point. -- Doc Feelgood
The best I can tell, this is the only crossover area. -- Doc Feelgood 11/28/2002

name: Chapel of Mowen
description:
-- Gripen
Entrance and exit are modestly hot
foyer is very hot: a narrow passage connecting directly to a flood room. Monsters are Tusker Worshippers (72), Sliver Tuskers (120) and Armored Tuskers (300). Layout is narrow corridors connecting flood rooms. Spawn is fast. -- Doc Feelgood 12/1/2002

name: Tusker Holding
description:
-- OmniTek
Entrance and Exit are hot with local fauna. Dungeon is pure Rampager, with Rampager Tusks dropping at the two exits. Layout is the same as Tusker Abode: a long, winding, statue-lined central hall with ""U"" shaped side corridors. Halfway through is a pit to jump in, with a bridge to land on. If you don't land on the bridge, you have to recall out, unless you can jump out. (A good jumper can do that.) After the pit, the dungeon ""twins"", and exits and tusks are available on either side. There are several debuff traps, in particular in ""debuff corridor"" about a quarter way through -- bring your creature-enhancing magic stuff. (Rampagers are hollow hitters, so protect magic isn't going to do a lot.) The Rampager Tusk is worth 6% of the XP for your current level. -- Doc Feelgood 1/3/2003
Inside the dungeon there are heads you can jump on to cast safely. The lava at the bottom of the pit is safe to swim in. Also, Rampagers aren't hollow hitting, so protections and impenetrability will help a lot. -- Garfield3d 1/20/2003

name: Riptide Channel
description: I made it across near this spot twice. It can be done. You just gotta keep turning 90 deg back and forth. However I also got stuck once and had to loggout and back on to get unstuck. I dont advise going this way. -- Dark Man - Sol 11/28/2002

name: South Tusker Forest
description: South Tusker Forest, the easiest part of Iron Coast, begins here. The easy part lies east of a line south from here through Tusker Lodge (.2N, 98.1E) and southwest to the beach at 3.1S, 95.9E. -- Doc Feelgood

name: South Tusker Forest east edge
description:
The edge between South and Central Tusker Forest on the west beach. Northwest is bigger monsters, Southeast is smaller monsters. -- Doc Feelgood
Correction: this is the west edge. -- Doc Feelgood 11/28/2002

name: Tusker Freehold
description: Entrance/exit is hot with local fauna. Foyer is quiet. Architecture is lots of flood rooms. The exit is at the bottom. Monsters are Liberators (61), Redeemers (41), and Minions (32). No BDT that I could find -- Doc Feelgood

name: Central Tusker Forest west edge
description: Location on the beach that divides Central Tusker forest from North Tusker forest. Tougher monsters are west of here, along a line from here northeast to Oolutangas Refuge. -- Doc Feelgood

name: North edge North Tusker Forest
description: Point on the beach that ends North Tusker Forest. South of here are tough monsters, on a line going from here back to Oolutangas Refuge. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Tusker Armory
description:
Entrance and exit are very hot with Silver Tuskers and equivalents. Foyer is quiet, but people will lead stuff back into it. No exit near entrance, exit is two levels down. Monoculture dungeon, pure Armored Tusker (Lv 300). Layout is flood rooms and short corridors. The corridors are narrow, many can be blocked by a single player. Looks like it will be a good leveling place. -- Doc Feelgood
Dungeon is medium size, and the BDT is an Armored Tusker Tusk, worth 300K. -- Doc Feelgood 1/3/2003

name: Mansion
description:
Mansion owned by a Monarch -- El Loco - FF
Please do not list specific owners of dwellings, as it is irrelevant to players on other servers. -- Tiltowait 12/3/2002
Fixed. -- Immacolata 5/15/2003

name: The Floating City
description: Yes this is a random dungeon, yes there are allready a billion and one entries for it, yes I am apolagising for entering another one, but I tried several times to add to the Floating City (Primary) thread and managed only to put in one line... so here is what I was trying to say, assuming this adds itself. There is far too much speculation and roumour on this thread, so, since I know virtually everything there is to know about the city, let me set a few things straight. Firstly, portals may now be tied and recalled to, they cant be summoned but if you see one on the landscape, tie to it, and camp it for any friends who may want to tie too (random portals only disapear when the landblock resets, so if your watching the portal it wont go anywhere). Secondly, there is no pattern to the portals apearing, they are RANDOM. Thirdly, multiple portals can spawn on the surface, the city is broken up into 8 different landblocks (7 called The Floating City, and one The Golem Sanctum), and I think all of them can be created as random landscape portals. I think the golem sanctum only spawns in the dires but I cant confirm that). Thus all these reports saying when you enter go this way are useless because it all depends on which part of the city you have entered. Now, when you enter the city, your first step is to do a /loc and work out which landblock your in, then before jumping off anything or going through any portals, check ACMaps.com which has maps of the city (done by yours truely). So far Ive only done 6, Im waiting on the random portals to take me back to the final two landblocks. That raises another point, many of the portals between the different parts of the city are random as well, which is why you should tie to the first one you found, as you may not be able to get back to explore more. Inside the city, all exit portals, and lots of the internal portals (all helpfully called just The Floating City) are random, but unlike random portals on the surface, they are allways in the same place, but every month (on patch day) they change their destination. On the maps I have made all portals are identified as either stable or random, stable portals all have a return portal next to them to facilitate two way travel. Lockpicking is not required, but does make a little more of the city accessible, it is I believe posible to get everywhere by random portals but random portals are of course random. The toughest door is resistance 322, and worth picking if you can because it leads on to a stable portal to another section. There are what apears to be two significant points of interest in the city, one is the golem sanctum, an absolute labyrinth of tightly twisting passages and more junctions than I can count, all filled with Iron golems, and at the end one obsidian with a dispell trap and a chest of crap loot. The other point of interest is something everyone should see at least once in their life, a floating advocate tower in the direlands (3.7S / 69.2W), about as high above the ground as the tou-tou lighthouse is tall, and with a bright pink energy fountain inside it. On top is a random portal to the direlands somewhere. At the begining of the Golem Sanctum is a stable portal back to the city, and a random direlands portal, I have seen these portals go to North Direlands Valley Junction, and my old favorite hunting ground North Direlands Land Bridge. During this months patch I also found a portal whos name and location I didnt write down, but the drop was so hot I died before I materialised. Shortly after that they did a server rollback and the portal changed again. Within the city you will find a number of Strained Books, which cannot be picked up but give you some interesting lore about the place, and some interesting insights into the Empyrians past. In all I would say this whole place is priety much a place only to come if you like exploring and lore, the monsters inside are for the most part, low level undead and a few banderlings, there are 2 virindi servants, and 2 revanants, and thats about it for the high level monsters. However, it does make a wonderful alternative to the Abandoned Mines as a subway, because while the portals change every month, there are a lot of exit portals and they drop you in often rare towns like Kara. A few non town portals spawn, but rarely, and all Ive noticed is Heartland which has to be one of the most common random portals (and the most boring). Anyways, Im begining to ramble on without really saying much, so I will just say that the floating city is a great place to visit, and a nice place to tie to and use as a subway (incidentally the exit portals can be tied to and summoned, so when you find a Kara portal, take a copy of it for your guild, its a nice quiet town that sells level 6 scrolls for those rich enough to afford them). Should anyone be interested in learning more, go take a look at ACMaps.coms maps and post a message on this thread, I look at it occasionally, alternatively if your on harvestgain, just tie to the city and use it to get arround, Im sure well bump into each other there (tho its never happened yet, portals in are VERY rare). I> -- Tyr on HG

name: Permanent Portal to Tusker Islands
description:
The Tusker Shrine that will portal you is located at the back of the dungeon. -- Doc Feelgood
Exit at 2.3n, 95.5e. -- Doc Feelgood 12/3/2002

name: Cottage
description: Stand alone cottage, there is another not too far away. No community name. -- Morssun

name: Mansion
description:
Scenic mansion atop hill overlooks the beach. -- Runeguard
Please do not use this database to plug monarchies on a single server or advertise websites. -- Tiltowait 12/12/2002
Shameless plug removed. -- Immacolata 6/12/2003

name: Static Portal to the Tusker Islands
description: Exit at 2.3N, 95.5E. The Shrine that will take you to the Tusker Islands is located at the back of the dungeon. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Static Portal to the Tusker Islands
description: Exit at 2.3N, 95.5E. The Tusker Shrine that will take you to Tusker Island is located at the back of the dungeon. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Direlands Desert Edge
description: Exit at 78.7S, 73.4W Part of the easy route from the Crystal Caves to the Hall of Lost Light. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Spirit Cell
description:
Part of the Gift Box Quest.. Need to be flagged to enter the portal by giving a Iolite Gem (Retrieved from a Student in one of the towns) to the NPC Outside (Astalon Decurth - Wintersebb) -- Astalon Decurth
Fast becoming obsolete since the Students in the city no longer hand out Iolite Gems to start this quest. -- Doc Feelgood 2/16/2003

name: Access to Crystal Mines
description:
Destination: Access to Crystal Mines (70.5N,8.1W) Part of the Gift Box Quest (Astalon Decurth - Wintersebb -- Astalon Decurth
Fast becoming obsolete since the Students in the city no longer hand out Iolite Gems to start this quest. -- Doc F

name: Holtburg Portal
description: Destination: Holtburg Portal (41.6n, 33.7e) Astalon Decurth - Wintersebb -- Astalon Decurth

name: Crystal Mine Low
description:
-- Astalon Decurth
Watch that first step. This is a medium-large, mazy place filled with golems. The top is sandstone, then copper, then granite. Keep heading down. When you run into a room thick with irons youre close to the BDT, which is in a chest. -- Doc Feelgood 12/23/2002

name: Crystal Mine New Isparinas
description: -- Astalon Decurth

name: Crystal Mine Mid
description:
-- Astalon Decurth
same layout as low. Contains Iron, Granite, Glacial and Obsidian golems. -- Doc Feelgood 12/23/2002

name: Crystal Mine Extreem
description: -- Astalon Decurth

name: Crystal Mine High
description:
-- Astalon Decurth
Contains Obsidian, Oak and Magma golems. -- Doc Feelgood 12/23/2002

name: Access to Crystal Mines
description:
Destination: Crystal Mines 70.5N, 8.1W -- Astalon Decurth
Fast becoming obsolete, and inaccessible, since the Students in the city no longer hand out Iolite Gems to start this quest. -- Doc Feelgood 2/16/2003

name: Blind Snowman
description: Give Lump of Coal (obtained from the Gift Quest)to Snowman to get a snowglobe -- Astalon Decurth Moved to 46.7N, 48.9E as of Jan 2005 patch -- Taarna Blood SC

name: Yanshi Namoon
description: A nicely equipped village. The merchants are a mage, healer, farmer and weaponsmith. Weaponsmith buys weapons and armor, but does not sell arrows This is an excellent base point for adventures into western Greenmire swamp. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Ulgrim the Unpleasant
description: Ulgrim is often in this location, but not always. He tends to travel around the world. Sometimes he is on Ulgrims Island, other times he is visiting the local bars in a distant city. Give him a mug of stout, or any alcohol, and he tell you stories about Dereth. Give him a glass of Sake and he will summon a portal to the Drunken Madmans Tower near Baishi. Ulgrims stories may sound crazy and exagerated, and they are, but they often have a grain of truth. -- Kevin Kaldor -- Doc Feelgood -- Taarna Blood SC

name: Aun Paritea
description:
Aun Paritea is the NPC you give the Iolite Gem to as part of the Gift Box quest introduced in the Dec 2002 Event Hall of the Tusker King -- Jaz of SC
Fast becoming obsolete since the Students in the city no longer hand out Iolite Gems to start this quest. -- Doc Feelgood 2/16/2003

name: Mansion
description: Mansion on a hill, by a lake, near Kara. Gorgeous view. -- Chin-Wa -- Doc Feelgood

name: East end of Zelta's Face
description: East end of the Zeltas Face cliff. -- Doc Feelgood

name: West end of Zelta's Face
description: The west end of Zeltas Face cliff -- Doc Feelgood

name: Zelta's Face
description: A high cliff along the south Farsi Island coast. This divides the beach from the interior. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Lady Maila Estates
description:
Gateway to Chorozite refiner in Beach Fort -- Doc Feelgood
Purchase item for these cottages is a Stran Siraluun Claw. -- Immacolata 6/12/2003

name: Precarious Sojourn Valley
description: Home of the fantastic floating circles and floating tower. Come here for the wallmap of Dereth, and to fill your Imaging Crystal. Normal way in is by using the Precarious Sojourn Portal, but, the valley can be run into from across Direlands wilderness, and if you have a ferocious jump, you may be able to hop onto one of the circles from a nearby cliff. Spawn at the top of the floating tower is very fast, and the undead loot is good. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Fermi's Face
description: A long unclimbable cliff separating beach from the inland areas. This cliff extends from 51S, 47W to 60S, 48W. Fermis Face is the eastern edge of Fermis Pockland. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Spine Ridge Fermi's Pockland
description: A north-south running ridge through the center of Fermis Pockland. The Pockland is a diamond-shaped area from: 50S, 45W on the north, between 55S, 43W and 55S, 50W on the east and west, and 60S, 48W on the south. There are numerous craters in this area ringed by mostly unclimbable cliff walls. The eastern edge is the Fermis Face cliff. -- Doc Feelgood

name: South end Fermi's Face
description: The south end of Fermis Face cliff. -- Doc Feelgood

name: North end Fermi's Face
description: The north end of Fermis Face cliff. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Inland Sea Vista
description: Northmost point of Fermis Pockland, and a pleasing view of the Inland Sea. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Fangtooth Vista
description: A great view of Pockland and the Black Hills. Overlooks Dungeon of Corpses. Get to it by jumping down from the nearby hillside. -- Doc Feelgood

name: South Direlands to Sho Roadside
description: Exits at 27.9S, 68.4E. -- Soo Yung -- Doc Feelgood

name: Wood Seller
description: Wood, treated wood, trees, wreaths -- Doc Feelgood

name: Holtberg to Nanto Portal
description: Exit at 51.0S, 81.7E. Take the portal inside the statue to Mannikin Foundry. Take the nearby exit portal to Nanto. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Zaikhal to Craigstone Portal
description:
Exit at 26.0N, 48.2E. Take the portal inside the statue to Effigy Foundry
take the nearby exit portal to Craigstone. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Mansion
description: A mansion, what to tell, incredible no one has posted this before. -- David Jensen

name: Island Villa
description: 1 Villa, Purchase item is a Ash Gromnie Tooth.

name: Bridge Span (Western Advocate Tower)
description: Western Advocate Tower of Bridge span -- Astalon Decurth

name: Bridge Span (Eastern Advocate Tower)
description: Eastern Advocate Tower of Bridge span -- Astalon Decurth

name: West Yanshi Namoon
description: 8 cottages with 8 more just to the west midway between Sawto and Yanshi on west side of road. Community portal located near Yanshi up by the tents at 10.2s 45.6e. Swamp Garden (22.6s 45.8e) dungeon ( where you turn in Little Green Seeds for plants) almost directly east of housing on east side of road -- Elad Treborsun

name: Large Castle
description: Nice Castle but its Empty -- Astalon Decurth

name: Floating Advocates Spire
description: Floating Advocates Spire -- Astalon Decurth

name: Floating Advocates Spire
description: Floating Advocates Spire -- Astalon Decurth

name: Floating Advocates Spire
description: Floating Advocates Spire -- Astalon Decurth

name: Floating Advocates Spire
description: Floating Advocates Spire -- Astalon Decurth

name: Floating Advocates Spire
description: Floating Advocates Spire -- Astalon Decurth

name: Floating Advocates Spire
description: Floating Advocates Spire -- Astalon Decurth

name: Fallen  Advocates Spire

name: Dark Tree Crystal Mine
description:
No Recall, Link or Summon. Part of the Jan03 Gift Box quest -- Hentaya (HG)
Well, okay, its not a Gift Box quest. Lets call it, Nuhmudiras Student Search II Quest. -- Hentaya (HG) 1/23/2003

name: Dark Tree Crystal Mine
description:
Cannot be Recalled, Linked, or Summoned. Restricted to characters of Level 40 or greater. For the new Gift Box Quest -- Astalon Decurth
Entrance and exit are hot with local fauna. Foyer is quiet. Dugeon is medium-size and mazy. Inhabitants are Granite, Iron and Obsidian Golems. BDT is in two chests on a non-descript corridor at the back. -- Doc Feelgood 3/27/2003

name: Caul Asylum
description: Singularity Recall Scroll dungeon. This portal cannot be recalled, linked or summoned. Dungeon is large, dendritic and filled with locked and levered doors. If youre after the scroll, bring a good lockpicker and a couple lockpicks, this person will be busy. Inhabitants are many kinds of 100-115 level monsters -- some mage nasty, some melee nasty. The quest takes a long time, bring buff capability. You can log out and log back in here. The eye candy is good, so dont rush your way through. The dungeon consists of several parts, and a map is a big help. You can also obtain one of 3 level 7 quest rings from the key guardians of each section. -- Astalon Decurth -- Doc Feelgood

name: Lartorous (Lugian NPC)
description:
Lugian NPC called Lartorous Part of the Student Quest -- Astalon Decurth
Lartorous is the entrance for the 2nd Student Quest dungeon -- talk to him and you are portaled in. Entrance and foyer are quiet. Hand in a Dark Tree crystal to the NPC inside, and you are admitted to the Warehouse dungeon. That dungeon is big and mazey -- when you see changes in decore and ramps down, you are going the right way. The BDT is on Excavation Obsidian Golems in the final room. This is a fast spawn room, and you must take a corridor on the far side to get to the 2nd floor, and the exit portal. The third dungeon is a surprise, and a real headache. Bring your polarizing sunglasses because it's a whiteout dungeon filled with Mist Golems. -- Doc Feelgood 3/27/2003
The third dungeon has two levels: top is Mist, bottom is Nebulous Golems; cold damage works well on both. Both levels are white and mazy. Head generally south to find the jump down, and the end of the dungeon. BDT is in Ancient Chests, near the exit. -- Doc Feelgood 3/28/2003 Adding quest URL -- Geomancer 1/15/2004

name: Bachus Flufens Cottage
description: Bachus Flufens Cottage -- Dunc -- Doc Feelgood No longer contains Bachus Fflufen. Now contains a runed chest and Hea Itealuan, Nualuan and Windreave. Also, completely surounded by Hea. -- Solan Thommad 6/13/2004

name: Chop Hill
description: A perfectly round steep-walled hill with a flat top. Looks like an engraving when viewed from one of the surrounding, slightly higher, hills. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Valley of Death Back Door
description: Discovered by Mehmet II, Tazzywon, and Confucius of Frostfell, this is a tiny crabbling pathway up the back mountains into the valley of death. Its hard to find but a good shortcut if youre coming from the north. Prepare to face level 900 tuskers on your descent inward. -- Confucius of FF

name: South entrance to Dire Dales
description: A portal drop out point and land entrance to the Dire Dales. Jan 03 patch has brought new uber monsters to the area north of this dropout. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Olthoi Hunter
description: The Olthoi Hunter is inside the barn in Newic. She accepts Olthoi items for reward. Note that with the Jan 2003 patch reward values have been increased. -- Jaz of SC

name: Mannikin Foundry Portal
description:
This portal takes to you the Mannikin Foundry dungeon. The surface portal from this dungeon exits in Nanto. Cannot be summoned, tied, or recalled. -- Firefinger
Exit at 51.0S, 81.7E. -- Doc Feelgood 8/6/2003

name: Tusker Barracks
description:
Located on Aphus Lassel -- Greeneye/ACMAPS
Entrance/Exit are hot. Layout is a matrix of small rooms and narrow, blockable, corridors. Spawn is pure Tusker Guard. The BDT is a Tusker guard tusk, found on Tuskers in the flood room in front of the exit hallway. Size is smallish and the spawn is medium rate. -- Doc Feelgood 12/14/2002
Re-entered into AC-Spedia database with correct co-ords. -- Jaz of SC

name: Lothar's Rock
description: Here lies the spirits and memories of a warrior and friend. -- Yew Wan Sum

name: Kleeoh
description: To begin the Bobo Quest Kleeoh Speaking with her flags you to enter the Behind the Waterfall portal at 8.7S, 85.7E (Levels 80+). -- Astalon DecurthWatching the local fauna celebrate your visit to Kleeoh is quite a site. -- Doc Feelgood 1/14/2004

name: Behind the Waterfall
description:
There will be four main dungeon sections: each in sequential order
Tusker Warriors Lair
Tuskers Food Storage
Legend of Tusker King
Throne of the Tusker King
Inside are Assailers, Devestators, Annihilators (a few), Reapers, Obsidian Chittiks and Tusker Sycophants, not to mention dispel traps and Tuskers Gift traps. Many different sections on the way down.
-- Astalon Decurth
This is the realm of the legendary Tusker King, Oolutanga (a.k.a. Bobo). He is located in the Throne of the Tusker King part (the 4th part). Talk to him to get portaled to the prep area for the final battle with Mowen Udaun, a huge level 900 tusker who flattens the unwary without a second thought. Buff in this little room, but dont go thru the next portal until youre ready as the drop is hot. Like Gaerlan, you dont need to kill him to get your reward (just register a hit on him) and once hes dead, take the portal that spawns and youll wind up back at Bobo. Hell give you a monkey paw with one wish (or if you got the kill on Mowen, it has 3 wishes) - take the paw to the treasure room portal and use it on the tusker statues inside. The Item Enchantment one the Recall Aphus Lassel spell directly into your spellbook, and the others give you XP towards an indicated skill. The Greed statues will fill your packs completely with I, X, or M notes. The person with the 3-wish tusker paw can use three statues. The funny thing about Oolutanga is that he appears as an object (white arrows around him when clicked and IDd), could this just be an elaborate ruse...? -- Confucius of FF 2/6/2003

name: An Archive
description:
An Archive Portal Quest Starts in Eastham when talking to Astara Duskshield Need key from Iron Golem Guardins outside at 62.9S, 36.4E Inside are Lichs, Warlocks of the Blood, champion of the blood, -- Astalon Decurth
Correction: Astara is found in Rithwic, not Eastham... -- Greeneye 2/22/2003

name: Tower Base Dungeon
description: Part of the Eastham boy quest. Iron, Granite, Glacial, Obsidian Golems, Portal inside to Upper Tower- Astalon Decurth - Wintersebb -- Astalon Decurth

name: Abandoned Armory Portal
description:
Home of the Aegis Shield.
Full of undead. No level restrictions, cannot tie/summon/recall to the portal.
Full of Revenants, Dark Revenants, Dark Maguses and Dark Leeches. -- Astalon Decurth

name: Mansion
description: Mansion -- CapFan

name: Three Cottages
description: Three Cottages in the mountains. Nice location. -- Misty Moonlight

name: Cape Nimbus Villa
description:
A lone villa rising stoic against the icy ocean of the north Osteth shores. -- Confucius of FF
Evangelines Villa -- Evangeline LC 3/27/2003

name: Mansion
description: Mansion -- dwJoker

name: Secluded Valley
description: A group of cottages that seems to have been over looked for some time. Mighty good bug hunting in the area. -- Dei Ray

name: Geyser
description: This is a steam spewing geyser in a pit, in the middle of nowhere. I came across it while looking for Black Claw Raiders. It is guarded by 2 blue phyntos wasps, in the middle of territory full of Diamond Golems and other nasties. -- Toss of FF

name: Majestic Saddle Cottages
description: Portal located in Hebian-to -- Oxbow

name: Marescent Gateway
description: Lifestone near Marescent Plateau portal -- Doc Feelgood

name: GW Art Colony
description: Home of Tiffany Comfore, Copper Vanup, and Wils Morren. Glendon Woods budding Art Colony. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Student
description: One of Nuhmudiras students. Starting point for the Dark Tree and Valara Crystal quests. -- Doc Feelgood

name: New Style Lifestone
description: New Style Lifestone -- Astalon Decurth

name: New Style Lifestone
description: New Style Lifestone -- Astalon Decurth

name: Mansion
description: Olthi North Mansion -- Astalon Decurth

name: Northern Shore Lifestone
description: On the beach, in the north, not too far from where Olthoi live. -- Garfield3d

name: Olthi North Lifestone
description: Olthi North Lifestone on Eastern Coast -- Astalon Decurth

name: New Style Lifestone
description: New Style Lifestone located SW of the Essence of Enchantment -- Astalon Decurth

name: New Style Lifestone
description: New Style Lifestone -- Astalon Decurth

name: West Entrance to Valley of Death
description:
North of OP. New monsters, densely populated. -- Astalon Decurth
This seems to be a main entrance to VoD. Hunting parties often form up here and occasionally the Tremendous Monongua is near by. Mahogony and Oak chests spawn in the area. Critters in the area to the North often measure their health in thousands of HPs. Resistances and regen rates are high. Suggest only the strongest of players or fellowships made up of level ~80+ characters venture into this area. -- Dei Ray -- Doc Feelgood

name: East end of Flower Area
description: This is the eastern end of the Giant Flower Area. -- Doc Feelgood

name: East Impassible Pass
description: East of here the central passes through the west landbridge area are climable and passable. Here, and west, they are not. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Jump through pass
description: Its a tight N-S pass, but you can jump through it, if you have a reasonable jump. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Direlands Northwest Shore Portal
description: Exit at 5.8N, 91.0W. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Four way valley
description: Entrances to Huey Crater (south) and Dewey Crater (north) interect with the E-W valley between them. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Entrance to Louey Crater
description: A big ramp leading into the crater. Scenic views inside all three of these craters. -- Doc Feelgood

name: South Direlands Landbridge Portal Dropout
description: A randomly spawning portal, but the dropout is close to the Abandonned Armory Dungeon. If you want to fight mobs of high level undead, you want a tie to this portal. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Tusker Abode
description:
Entrance/Exit are modestly hot. Foyer is hot with two tuskers who then call up a flood room of stuff. Monoculture dungeon, pure Redeemers (41st). Layout is a main hallway lined with statues and U shaped side corridors. Mid-way down the first level hallway is a lava pit. Lava is harmless, but you must jump on to the hard-to-see bridge in the center of that pit to continue, or jump out of the lava on to the bridge. -- Doc Feelgood
After the jump the dungeon splits into two symmetric sides. BDT is Redeemer Tusk worth 50K, found on tuskers near the exit portal at either end. -- Doc Feelgood 12/13/2002
Level cap removed. Now just 20+ -- Doc Feelgood 12/20/2002
-- Jaz of SC

name: Tumerok Fort
description: Location of 2nd Key in Overlords Sword quest -- Jaz of SC

name: Ulgrim's House
description: Ulgrims House and Phat Lewt and Casting Stein. -- Astalon Decurth

name: Mask Clan Training Camp
description:
Tumerok Mask Clan Training Camp, Assault Weapons Quest -- Astalon Decurth
Entrance and exit are hot
foyer is quiet. Come here for Tumerok Banner parts from the Mask Tribe. -- Doc Feelgood 4/25/2003
This is a head up dungeon. You are going the right way if you go through the room with a Lt. behind a grate. The Controllers, and the back of the dungeon, are after the high bridges. -- Doc Feelgood 4/29/2003

name: Falcon Clan Training Camp
description:
Entrance and Foyer are quiet. The dungeon is large and mazy, and filled with mid-level Tumeroks from Standard Bearers to Tumerok Commanders. Spawn ranges from medium to very fast.
You seek the three parts of a Tumerok Banner, which you will then assemble and hand in for an Assault Orb. (Apr 03 patch) -- Doc Feelgood
Left hand rule will get you deeper in the dungeon fairly efficiently. -- Doc Feelgood 4/26/2003

name: Shreth Training Camp
description:
Entrance, exit and foyer are quiet. Come here for tumerok banner parts from the Shreth tribe. -- Doc Feelgood
Exit from the first room complex is in the SE corner. Jump from the following bridge to shortcut to Commanders/Controllers. -- Doc Feelgood 4/26/2003

name: Reedshark Training Camp
description:
Entrance, exit and foyer are quiet. Come here for banner parts from the Reedshark Tumerok tribe. -- Doc Feelgood
Layout is sinuous corridors connecting big, fern-filled rooms -- not too hard to navigate with follow your nose navigation. Final room looks like the floor of a big modern office buidling. -- Doc Feelgood 4/29/2003

name: Gromnie Training Camp
description:
Entrance and Exit are covered by one distant local fauna spawn point, foyer is quiet. Come here for Tumerok Banner parts from the Gromnie tribe. -- Doc Feelgood
Dungeon is big and mazy, the layout is similar to Serpent Training camp. Tumerok Controllers (for Crests) are way, way in the back of the dungeon. The end is a big, leafy room, with an exit, and fast spawning controllers. Oddly, a large percentage of the tummies here drop insignia. -- Doc Feelgood 4/27/2003

name: Ulgrim's Island Portal
description: Exit at 94.8S, 9.7W. Bring the Drunken Mage a Wah Chons Winter Lager from Wah Chon, the Nanto Barkeep, and he will open this portal to Ulgrims Island. -- Doc Feelgood The exit coords were removed from this portal in order to prevent map programs from incorectly using it. -- Taarna Blood SC

name: Serpent Clan Training Ground
description: Entrance, exit and foyer are quiet. Come here to find Serpent Clan Tumerok banner parts. Layout is big and mazy, and there may be several different bottoms. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Mt. Ulgrim
description:
A hill that looks to have been a very small volcano at one time; surrounded by 30-foot tall flowers and a short run from Ulgrim's cottage. No monsters spawn on this island. -- Confucius of FF
This island now features a whole lot of ""small"" golems, ranging from level 95 Small Water Golems to level 135 Small Magma Golems. Cute and extremely slow, but powerful; bring friends. -- Confucius of FF 7/17/2003

name: Ulgrim's Basement
description:
This dungeon is found in the basement floor of Ulgrims Cottage on Ulgrims Island, which is accessible by either using Ulgrims Recall Spell or giving the Drunken Madman in the tower near Baishi a mug of Winter Lager bought from the barkeep in Nanto.
When approached, Ulgrim will ask you to fetch him a mug of his special Home Brew in his basement. Enter through the portal in his basement and marvel at the amazing array of decorations on the walls and floors, probably the most impressively decorated place in all of AC. Some of the items are recognizeable, some arent, some are unusual (like Ulgrims vast collection of monster heads), and some are just silly (like the Holy Handgrenade of Antioch, specially imbued with the Rabbit Slayer property). This dungeons worth seeing just for the decorations, if nothing else.
There are many items to get in this dungeon, the primary one being the Home Brew. Take the Home Brew to Ulgrim (dont drink it -- 14 day timer.) and hell give you the Casting Stein that has a mana C bonus of 7% and also casts Stam to Mana IV. While killing your way through the dozens of tiny white and brown mice (which respawn like crazy and have extremely high attack skill, even though they do little damage), youll randomly find a Golden Key, which unlocks all the locked chests and doors in the basement. All locked chests and doors are easily pickable, as well, so the key is not necessary for LP characters. They also sometimes drop a block of cheese, which is ironic as its 50 times the size of the mouse carrying it.
The Golden Key can be used on either of Ulgrims storage chests, in which one can find the Hangover Cure, an Ust, Stout, Winter Lager, and Peppermint sticks. Alternately it can be used to unlock the Treasure Room door which is hidden behind a wall of tapestries near the storage chests. Behind the Treasure Room Door is a room full of glittering piles of Treasure (worth 200k and hookable on floor hooks -- 28 day timer), a Golden Gromnie inscribed by Ulgrim (no timer, but unusable for purchasing mansions), and a Lock Box that contains a simple gold ring inscribed by Ulgrim with the message Lo Bnaseuim (28 day timer).
Upon returning to Ulgrim, you can give him almost any item found in his dungeon and hell say funny and witty things, most notably doing his Gollum impersonation when you give him the gold ring. Also, if you give him the Peppermint sticks, hell give you a Peppermint Pumpkin Pie that drains 20 points of stamina when eaten. -- Confucius of FF

name: Mansion
description: A mansion -- Horibu of DT

name: Slinky Slope
description: Take a running jump north here, and you can autojump six to fifteen times. Its a blast. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Qalaba'r Heights
description: A lone cottage with its own courtyard complete with fountain, standing guard at the east gateway to the Linvak Range. -- Confucius of FF

name: Mansion
description: North east of Lytelthorpe -- Immacolata

name: Stormtree Villas
description: 12 Villas in this tree infested area -- AR

name: Pine Deep Cottages
description: 8 Cottages surrounded by forest. -- AR

name: Thyrinn Cant Cottages
description: There is 14 Cottages in the area surrounded by forest. -- AR

name: Laiti's Villa
description: Laitis Villa overlooking a lake. Something strange about this place. -- ARJungle Phyntos Wasp Wing needed -- Xp of VT 6/10/2004

name: Villas on a slope
description: 3 villas, apparently unnamed settlement, on a scenic slope in northern Dereth. Darn fine place. Purchase item: White Jewel. -- Immacolata

name: Ulgrim's Island to Madman's Tower
description:
Tieable but not summonable, hand sake to Ulgrim and he will summon a portal to the top of the Madmans Tower, where you will fall toward the Madmans head =P
Discovered by:
David ibn Jensen -- David ibnJensen
Drops at:
53S, 61E -- David ibn Jense 5/18/2003

name: Scimitar Lake Cottages
description:
Qalabar Settlement

8 Cottages, Purchase Item: ???

name: Ebbing Tide Villas
description: There is 12 Villas located here -- AR

name: Ahurenga
description: Home to the Hea Tumerok tribe this small town is located at the western most side of Marae Lassel surrounded by swamp land. There a npc that goes by the name of Hea Arantah and he will reward you with the death of a Aun Hunter named Aun Ralirea. -- AR

name: Holtburg Tackle Master
description:
The Holtburg Tackle Master will make a fishing pole for you if you give him a Wood Golem heart or a golem jo. You will also need a C note to give to him to get a fiching license which is good for one day.
Caught mostly minnows and guppies
can be used as thrown weapons. Also got a piece of level II jewelry and a Ball of Gunk. -- Khaos

name: Holtburg Fishing Holes
description:
Multiple fishing holes where you can catch minnows and guppies all day. -- Khaos
They are also in Rithwic, Cragstone, Nanto, Yaraq and Shoushi. -- Immacolata 5/19/2003

name: Holtburg Lawn Chess
description: Come play chess. -- Immacolata

name: Rithwic Fishing Hole
description: Bring yer waders and yer lures. -- Immacolata

name: Rithwic Tackle Master
description: Bring him a wood golem jo or heart for a fishing pole. Day license for a tenner (C-note). Wild exaggarated fishermans tales for free. -- Immacolata

name: Shoushi Tackle Master
description: This tackle master have set up a real operation here at the banks of Prosper. There are benches and a grill so you can dine on your catchings of the nearby Fishing Hole. Bring him a wood golem jo or heart for a fishing pole. Day license for a tenner (C-note). -- Immacolata

name: Shoushi Fishing Hole
description: Ah the tranquility of fishing on the plank bridge at river Prosper. -- Immacolata

name: Yaraq Fishing Hole
description: Overlooking the beautiful inner sea, come standing on the pier and fish. -- Immacolata

name: Yaraq Tackle Master
description: Bring a wood golem heart or jo for a rod. A C-note for a day license. -- Immacolata

name: Mage Syltyn Rillon
description:
Start of Sword of Frozen Fury quest -- Jaz of SC
Talking to her opens the Virindi Complex portal for you, and giving her the Signet Ring from there allows you to take the sword from the Dias in the center of Glendon Wood. -- Doc Feelgood 5/23/2003

name: Sword of Frozen Fury
description: Sword of Frozen Fury Quest -- Jaz of SC

name: Cragstone Tackle Master
description: Right by the foot of the Cragstone waterfalls. -- Immacolata

name: Cragstone Fishing  Hole
description: Probably Dereths dampest fishing hole at the time being. Come fish by the sound of the roaring Prosper waterfall. -- Immacolata

name: Nanto Tackle Master
description: Up at the wonderful Nanto Falls. -- Immacolata

name: Nanto Fishing Hole
description: The only fishing pond of Dereth so far. And the smallest. Probably also Dereths highest elevated fishing hole. And Dereths southernmost Fishing hole. And .... Ok Ill stop here. -- Immacolata

name: Atrium Residential Halls
description: Apartment portals located inside are Winthur Gate, Vesper Gate, Valorya Gate, Hasina Gardens, Mellas Court, Larkspur Gardens, Ivory Gate, Heartland Yard, Gajin Dwellings, Alphus Court. Theres also portals leading to Qalabar, Baishi, and Glenden Woods. -- AR

name: Virindi Complex
description:
Part of the Sword of Frozen Fury quest -- Jaz of SC
Entrance and exit are quiet. Portals are not tieable/summonable, but have no level limit. First part is jumping down levels. Second part is a portal maze. (the ""path book"" story contains clues to the proper sequence.) Third part is mazey, left hand rule works well. Inhabitants are a wide mix, including: Augmented Drudge, Virindi Observers, Slave through Silver Tuskers, and Terebrous Hollow Minions. There are two Virinidi Executors, but they don't have to be fought -- just run by them. BDT is a Signet Ring dropped by any of several Virindi Inquisitors (90th) at the back. Good eye candy through out. -- Doc Feelgood 5/22/2003
You cannot enter this dungeon without speaking to Syltyn Rylyn in Glenden Wood first. -- Immacolata 5/25/2003
There's a timer on how often you can do it. Not even sure if it's repeatable. Mage Syltyn Rillon tells you, ""I hope you make good use of the sword you obtained so recently.""

name: Holtburg Swamp Chess
description: Conveniently placed chess board in a patch of swamp. Couldnt you have found a better spot, Turbine? -- Immacolata

name: Tou-Tou Scriveners (Level IV)
description: Level IV scrolls. -- ImmacolataThis dungeon has been moved to 41.8N, 32.1E as of the December 2004 patch from 27.5S, 96.1E.-- Armin 12/8/2004

name: Olcris Nuhmudria's Student
description:
The Lugian you talk to to start the Knorr quest -- Jaz of SC
Bring an M-note, or two, for your conversation. He will exchange the M-note for a Knorr Portal gem. He will exchange two, then there is a three day timer for more. -- Doc Feelgood

name: North Shore Dires Lifestone
description: New style lifestone, never seen it before. Animated with two brackets rotating around a round stone. -- Garrl

name: Mansion
description: This Mansion belongs to the Odins Fury Monarchy -- Dark Bolt -- Doc Feelgood

name: Bretsleff Cottages
description: 8 cottages in a circle. -- Immacolata

name: Advocate Plaza Complex
description: Home of the Advocate Dungeon in Beta Days -- Doc Feelgood

name: Dutton's VoD trail
description: A small valley that can be used as a north entrance into the VoD.  Just SE of Acid propy.

name: Feruza ibn Salaq
description:
NPC for refining Chorizite -- Jaz of SC

You give Feruza ibn Salaq Pyreal Bar.



Feruza ibn Salaq tells you, "Ooh, I always forget how heavy an entire bar is. Thank you. With all of my spell research done, I've taken to writing down the formulas on scrolls. Here, take this scroll, I hope you can learn from it."



Feruza ibn Salaq gives you Scroll of Spike Strafe.



You can give him Pyreal Bars (8 motes) and he will give you a random ring spell or wall spell. It can be easier to get them this way, than it is searching for and camping SIK chests. -- Taarna Blood SC 6/13/2005

name: Nalib Cavana Settlement
description: 8 cottages, purchase item is Sclavus Tongue. -- Immacolata

name: Ahurenga Portal
description: Exit: 46.1n, 89.8w. Ahurenga is the aun tumerok village on the swampy western coast of Marae Lassel. -- Immacolata

name: Seat of Knorr
description:
Only accessible by portal gems from Olcris in Stonehold
This dungeon is not reachable by normal means but for sake of recording tips and descriptions Ive added this entry. -- Immacolata

name: Zaikhal Mansion
description: Wonderful Mansion with paved courtyard with fountains and a nice view over the Zaikhal mountain ranges. A short jog north of town. -- Immacolata

name: Firesong Cottages
description: 8 cottages. -- Immacolata

name: Dame Tolani Villas
description: 12 villas. Purchase item is a Large Armoredillo Hide. -- Immacolata

name: Majestic Saddle Cottages
description: 6 cottages scattered about on a west facing hillside. -- Immacolata

name: Fallen Shadow Spire
description: The charred, arrow poked remains of one of the shadow spires that menaced Derethian cities (and citizens) years ago. It lies in a huge crater, much like the one in Arwic where another Shadow Spire destroyed the old city. This is a spot where you must take your vassals on Sight Seeing. Afterwards you can head up to the watefalls for some fishing. -- Immacolata

name: Soltan Villas
description: Villa settlement. -- Immacolata

name: Agent of the Arcanum - Stonehold
description: Takes Pyreal ingots, diamond powder for writs. -- Immacolata

name: Large school of Niffis
description: Permanent spawn of Opor, Sephal, Listris, Parfal and Glisnal Niffis at the Ithaenc Cathedral. Just jump down one waterfall. I found 3 pearls and 2 large shells in 30 minutes of hunting. -- Immacolata

name: Asandra Cottages
description: Cottages. -- Immacolata

name: Lightbringer Dale Cottages
description: Eight cottages in a wooden dale - very nice spot. Mattekar Hide Sleeves to buy. -- Immacolata

name: Respite Ridge
description: A respite point near VOD west entrance. The ridge is spawn-free, and the top has a nice view, too. A good place to form up VOD expeditions, or run to if things go awry. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Magus Gondibyr Langarl
description:
Cragstone Mage
-- Semet, FF

name: Black Hill Collector
description: On the tower of the Small Black Hill just east of Wai Jhou. Black Hill Collector tells you, Im interested in monster trophies from common rats, red phyntos wasps, armoredillos, drudges, mosswarts and banderlings. If you give me such an item, I will reward you with money or an item. With regret, I dont deal in hides. -- Immacolata

name: Jojii Shrine (Wai Jhou)
description:
Inside a Sho style lighthouse built in the swampy waters of the obsidian rim. Has a Jojii Shrine inside it. You can donate one pyreal to the shrine for a blessing.
You give Jojii Shrine Pyreal.
Run with dragons while your young.
-- Immacolata

name: Wai Jhou New Alliance Tent
description:
A tonk, an isparian and a lugian have pitched tent in Wai Jhou swamp (now didnt they teach them ANYTHING about picking camping sites back at the Academy?). They ask for donations to construct a new fort in South Direlands.
Give Caelis Renning the human salvaged metal and wood. Give Aun Teverea the tonk cloth and hide. Give Kraveon the Lugian gems and stone. -- Immacolata
As from july 03 the tent is ready to burst with crates and bags of salvage donated by isparians. If you meet the quota of each collector, they will tell you and reward you with a silly hat. You might want to be careful here, visitors has a bat habit of not wiping their feet... ie. they drag along a train of the nearby natives -- Immacolata 7/20/2003

description:
One of the 3 special vendors at the top of the tree in Candeth Keep. These vendors buy for 100% and can only be reached by completing the Salvage Quest at the Tent near Wei Jhou.





Provisioner type shop, buys Gems and Jewelry. Sells Lockpicks, UST, Carving Tool, Healing Kits, Potions, large variety of food, cooking supplies and cooking tools. Sells supplies at 140%

name: Mansion
description: A mansion snuggling in the forests and hills of Northern Dereth. Quite comfortably within the reach of.... well.... The Sticks. You could take a run up to the beach fort for some chorizite refining, thats about as good as it gets. Good Big Game hunting though. -- Immacolata

name: Osteth's Loneliest Cottage
description: One little cottage all by itself in the meadows of southern Osteth. Very alone, far from anything. -- Immacolata

name: Asheron's Sanctum
description:
Could only glimpse this portal high up on the steep mountain. There is no apparent way up there, my money is on a quest :)
-- Immacolata
Aha. There is a way up. You must complete some quest in order to gain access to this dungeon. Inside lives Asheron. Speak to him and receiv a book about the olthoi menace. The book is hookable.
To get in you must do the Knorr Academy quest first, I think. Everyone I spoke to in the dungeon had completed the Knorr Quest. Those who didnt could not get in. When you speak to Asheron he mentions that he is aware that you have been through his other estate (Knorr). You cannot get out though. Must recall it looks like. -- Immacolata 7/23/2003

name: Spiralling path to Asheron's Castle
description: This is where you get onto the long, spiralling path leading up to ole unc Ashie. Run counter-clockwise. -- Immacolata

name: Aaminah
description: This worried lady will start you on a quest. Some clues are upstairs. -- Doc Feelgood

name: MOG's View
description: This ridgeline offers spectacluar views of both the Black Hills to the south and Valley of Death to the north. Path up is on the west side. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Craigstone Portal
description: Exit at 26N, 48.2E Portal is inside the castle. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Hebian-to Portal
description: Exit at 38.6S, 82.1E Portal is inside the castle. -- Doc Feelgood

description:
Landing is hot with Swarm Guardians (115), Warriors (125) and Mutilators (135). The spawn is just as thick as lower level hives, but a bit faster. Layout is the same as the other hives
Ths portal is tieable, recallable and summonable. -- Doc Feelgood 8/4/2003

name: Precarious Sojourn Portal
description: Exit at 38S, 59.5W. This is the portal that takes you to the city of floating circles to get the Arcane Pedestal and Map of Dereth. You MUST visit Slithe Tradittor near Lytelthorpe before using the portal. -- Jaz of SC  Inside are ""Champions, Warriors, and

name: Wood Chip
description: Part of Oswalds Dirk quest. Talk to Aaminah in Ayan Baqur to start this quest. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Fir Tree
description:
This tree can be clicked on. If youve done most of the Lost Husband quest that starts in Ayan Baqur with the NPC named Aaminah, it will portal you into a dungeon with 4 trials. The first is a Lockpick trial which requires you to have LP and have it buffed pretty high (300+) or else it will drain away your health. The 2nd is a room full of rolling balls of death with wood platforms hovering above... you must jump from one to the other without falling or youll die and your corpse will be 100% unrecoverable. The 3rd is a room with a target on one end, you on the other, and a lava pit between. Use a bow, xbow, or wand to strike the target with a critical hit. The last room is a rather difficult logic puzzle, which might possibly be bugged (4 of us did it and our answer we all arrived at separately was wrong). Look it up online and avoid a lot of frustration :) Solving this takes you to a room with the new Oswalds Dirk, possibly in a pickable chest... I didnt make it this far because of the bugged puzzle, so I might be wrong on where it is. No word on where the lost husband really is, though, or why Ulgrims acting so guilty. -- Confucius of FF -- Doc Feelgood
Entrance is mildly hot. Dungeon itself has nothing to fight -- its a jump-and-puzzle dungeon. If you fail the first room puzzle and survive, heal up and try again, theres no timer on trying the puzzle. There are several chests in the final Dirk Room, some are pickable. Just entering this dungeon flags you as ready for the follow-on quest, Heart of Innocence, and there you learn the lost husbands fate. -- Doc Feelgood 8/9/2003

Double Razorback Ridge is side-by-side ridges
the north ridge marks the south edge of VOD. Take this path up, and run north as an alternate route to VOD. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Oltho Brood Hive
description:
Got new kinsd of Adolescent olthoi. -- Immacolata
Ok, the first parts of the nest has Soldiers and Guards (new variety I havent seen before, level 79). Further down you will meet swarm olthoi but no harder than eviscerators. There are some Adolescent Brood Matrons who drop tibia, feet and tails. They spawn every 5 minutes and the bits are on a 24 day timer. Even further down is a Queen that I didnt get to meet. The bits that are dropped can be given to the olthoi hunter in Arwic for fine armor pieces. -- Immacolata 8/22/2003
Entrance and exit are hot with local fauna. There is an exit near the entrance. Foyer is hot with Guards. Layout is large and rambling. The spawn is fast, and in some areas dense, expect jams. -- Doc Feelgood 8/26/2003

name: Carved Cave Portal
description:
Inside cave guarded by Wild Monouga -- Zen Tek Ken
This appears to be a duplicate of the Carved Cave west of Stonehold. Entrance is hot with a slow spawn of Wild Monoguas, foyer is quiet, exit takes you back out near entrance. (so this is not an alternate entrance to the Stonehold CC). Two keys are needed to get through the locked doors that are between entrance and bottom where the portals to Dires (near Candeth Keep, +21st level), HOLL dungeon (no level restriction) and Q-bar are located. Both keys are in unlocked chests that are in the dungeon. -- Doc Feelgood 8/23/2003
The Carved Cave dungeon portal west of Stonehold doesnt exist anymore so ignore the top part that relates to it. 8/24/2003 Please check out some information about... -- 2/11/2005

name: Olthoi Brood Hive
description: Non-random -- GM Entrance is not summonable or recallable. Haliana settlement out of Craigstone is a good choice for a nearby portal dropout. Entrance is hot with local fauna. Foyer is quiet. This place is large and rambling with jumps as well as ramps. Spawn is thick and fast in places, and getting jammed is likely in those places. Top is Soldiers and Nobles, deeper in Evis and Swarm Drones are added to the mix. The Matrons and Queens at the bottom are bigger, tougher, and regen very quickly -- very difficult to solo. There are two each. This is the low level version of the Olthoi Armor quest. -- Doc Feelgood

name: Giant Snowman
description: Not exactly sure when he was put back in but I noticed him a few months ago :) He spawns with two snowmen buddies. The giant snowman is an NPC so long as you do not aggrivate him. He will sell you the intructions on how to make a snowman as well as Iceballs for 100p and Enchanted Iceballs for 200p. If you choose to kill them, the snowmen drop 12 regular iceballs and 1 magic iceball while the giant snowman drops 24 Enchanted Iceballs. If you choose to kill him, the respawn timer is a half hour. -- Chupon 10/29/2003

description: Falatacot Matriarch (lvl 135), Falatacot Patrician (lvl 125) and Falatacot Consort (lvl 120). -- Jaz of SC 10/30/2003

name: Olthoi Brood Hive (20+)
description:
Entrance, Exit and Foyer are quiet. Cant be summoned recalled or linked. A big, rambling place filled with Nymphs, Drones and Servants. Spawn is thick -- expect jams -- but spawn rate is moderate. Found one Matron near the bottom (Lvl 70, fast regen)
there are likely more. She dropped a part for Olthoi armor. -- Doc Feelgood 10/31/2003

name: Renegade Garrison
description: Entrance is lodged in the base of El Badasso Rift -- approach from the south (subway) or northwest, or have a really hefty jump. You must be flagged by picking through the backpack at Lugian Encampment before you can enter. (17.1 N (near Zaikhal) 4.8 W). Bring an M-note for bribing foyer guard. Entrance/Exit is hot with Lugian guards (50-70), Foyer is quiet. Top part of dungeon is medium in size with straightforward layout -- door to Olthoi section is to the right on the first fork. Lugians and Tumeroks (50-80) guard first section, density and spawn rate is modest. Door to Olthoi section can be attacked to open it. Olthoi spawn behind the door is THICK. A good way to fight it is to beat the door down, then run back down the corridor to the first bend. Olthoi will follow, but reluctant to fight that far from their spawn area. -- Doc Feelgood 10/31/2003

name: Lugian Encampment
description: Starting point for Renegade Garrison dungeon / Renegade Mace Quest. Open the backpack on the ground to get flagged to enter the Renegade Garrison dungeon. (killing the party gathered around the pack is optional.) Renegade Garrison is at 44.3N, 51.9E -- a modest run NNW of Subway. -- Doc Feelgood 10/31/2003

name: South Shore Heights
description: Restricted to 12+ Portals you out to 86.2, 39.6E which is west of Kara. -- Halaliel aka Unicron of Solclaim 11/4/2003your exit coords lack a N-S designation... they arent showing up correctly. -- Doc Feelgood 11/6/2003

name: Crystal Mine
description:
This portan cannot be recalled, linked, or summoned. You also must be flagged to enter.


Part of the Ancient Olthoi Queen quest. -- Ian Stone 11/6/2003

name: Gerent's Compound
description: Part of Ancient Olthoi Queen event. Not recallable, linkable or summonable. -- Ian Stone 11/6/2003This is the location of the purple Energy Crystal orb (the Blue one is no longer available). At one time this dungeon was part of a Live event that was part of the Ancient Olthoi Queen story arc. It is now a quest dungeon containing Tusker Guards, various Virindi, Drudge Ravners, some higher level shadows and a few Tenebrous Hollow Minions.-- Taarna Blood SC

name: Ancient Temple
description: A fairly straightforward, if not excessively long and boring dungeon, this place gets you the Living Tome, a cool floor-hookable furniture item. Inside are all Falatacot Consorts, Patricians, and Matriarchs, more and more the further you go in. Near the bottom, you know youre going the right way if you go down some spiral staircases. At the end is the Falatacot Abbess, whos level 161 and has 4000 HP. She doesnt drop anything of note, but beyond her is the Living Tome, which you just use to get your own. No camping needed. Respawn is quick, though, and theres a LOT of them, so I recommend bringing a group of at least 4-5 uber players, if not a small army. Their swords and spells do a lot of damage, so bane for all physicals and buff your acid or bludgeon weapons. When this quest first debuted, you could give the living tome to Nuhmudira for a global and a book of lore, but then she leaves. -- Confucius of FF 11/7/2003

name: Elemental Caverns
description: This is the dungeon for the elemental weeping weapon quest... -- Spoiled (Darktide) 11/29/2003The drop is not safe, but there is a handy pillar to perch on right inside that is safe for buffing. Youll see four tunnels downward, each glowing the color of the elemental pool youll find. This place is filled with level 100 tiny gromnies that do elemental damage. They hurt, even through banes. Theyll attack as soon as you are inside. I was able to run through the dungeon and convert four weapons to each element. I didnt bother killing the gromnies, I just healed a lot. The exit portal takes you to the other side of the hill, as if you had passed through. Each tunnel has an exit portal at the bottom. -- Geomancer 12/16/2003

name: Xavier Royal Guard
description: Found next to the Olthoi Chasm dungeon. If you find any information inside he will reward you. -- Zen Tek Ken 12/18/2003Xaiver accepts ""missives"" (notes) found inside Olthoi Chasm. The untranslated notes are no-drop/no-give, but if you have them translated by the translator in Zaikhal, they can be given, and they are a nice way to get XP to mules. -- Doc Feelgood 1/14/2004

name: Olthoi Chasm
description:
This dungeon has several levels to it, each with a different level restriction to it. I believe there may be a note to pickup at every portal entrance. The first one had one so far. It goes all way up to lvl 100+ area that at end has a undead npc. -- Zen Tek Ken 12/18/2003Entrance is quiet
foyer is quiet. Spawn is a mix of Undead and Olthoi. Dungeon is large and meandering, and divided into sections by portals. The portals are at the back of each section, and in front of each portal is a note that can be turned in to Xavier for XP. Sections are level restricted 20+, 40+... up to 100+. The portal for each section is tieable and summonable, *but there is no going back portal* so you cant get back into a lower level section. Spawn rate and monster level increase as you go from section to section. Its a nice place for leveling and looting if youre tired of pure Olthoi and pure Tusker dungeons. (Note: the note you pick up is no-drop/no-give... until you have it translated by the Zaikhal translator.) -- Doc Feelgood 1/14/2004

name: Mount Ingot
description: Limestone Golems, Granite Golems, Iron Golems, and Scold a lvl 85 Magma Golem. Kill Scold and get his heart to turn in at snowman village for a ice box. -- Zen Tek Ken 12/18/2003

name: Frost Haven
description:
Snowman Village, get the Ice Box quest here. -- Zen Tek Ken 12/18/2003
Added quest URL - Geomancer

name: Carved Caves
description:
This dungeon seems to have gotten lost from the database when it was moved near Zaikhal. The portal cannot be summoned, and has no level restriction anymore.
The following is copy and pasted from the old entry for Carved Caves. If this is already here, forgive me, it didnt come up with a Search.
Near Stonehold. Last key in quest for the SoLL is found in chest at the bottom. MANY monsters.
Now lvl 17+
has lots of monugas, a few skels and some shadows at the bottom -- Ki Dung Sa Bong 10/18/99
Near the end where you find a key .. green portal to Direlands .. -- Frescobaldi 12/20/99
Main chamber with the SoLL key is guarded by 3 Shadow children up front and 3 Shadows near the chest containing the key. Portals to Qalabar and Midland Direlands in the same chamber. Portal to Direlands sends you to a lifestone near the middle of the southern coast. Portal to Hebian-to is nearby. -- Farouk 1/26/00
Addition: Level 15 for Westward Portal to Carved Caves, Level 17 to get into Carved Caves, Level 21 to take portal at bottom to mid-Direlands. Portal restricting at its finest. -- Doc Feelgood 2/6/00
Does anyone know how to get there? -- Lost & Confused 3/12/2000
You need to get carved keys to get down to the Soll key - once youve found the 2nd surface portal, your virtually on top of the shadows. Theres also a chest, that req a sturdy iron key with the Skeletons in the Monouga Gallery - 30/6/00 -- Typhoid V 6/30/2000
The chest with Sturdy Iron Key spawns level V scrolls. Useless since SplitPea. -- Nekorkhan (MT) 7/9/2000
Note that the portal cannot be tied to nor summoned. Tie to the Murk Warrens, about 8 clicks away, instead. You can reach the surface portal of that dungeon (just take a right) without fighting. At the Carved Caves, be ready for the Shadows in the end. Be careful, or they may draw you into the Qalabar portal. You will definitely want to take the Direlands portal from this dungeon to reach the Halls of Lost Light. -- Wylfghar 12/28/2001 -- Solan Thommad 1/17/2004
