Spawn is mid-level skeletons, spawn rate is modest. Layout is dendridic with many dead ends. Right hand rule will take you to the end. BDT is Stone of the Firebird in a room with a lava floor (but not burning lava.) -- Doc Feelgood 2/3/2004

name: Aerbax's Holding
description: Added during the October 2003 ""Reign of Terror"" Patch. Originally restricted to levels 60-90, the upper level restriction was removed with the November 2003 Patch. Dungeon contains Virindi Executors & Profatrix, a variety of Shadows, and some Tuskers. Inside is a altar that gives out the ""Bracelet of Dark Essence"". A quest item that is actually useful. The spells include MAJOR Stamina Gain, MAJOR Health Gain, and Willpower VI. Respawn here is fast but not insane. Should be able to reach altar easily in one buff cycle (much less if you know your way around). This Dungeon is one part of the three-part ""Preparation for the Ritus"" Quest. -- Ally McAlchemist 11/20/2003

name: Temple of Ixir Zi (Blackmire 1)
description:
Use the Odd Looking Vine at bottom the temple to teleport you into the dungeon. -- ZTK 3/10/2004
This is the first in a series of Fellowship quests. The level breaks are 40-69, 70-99, and 100+ Puzzles and trials lead to the High Matriarch Ixir Zi. One of your felowship members must be the Victim who uses the 4 Eyes to bring the Matriarch out. The Eyes massively debuff the Victim and continually drain them. I believe the draining only starts when they have 0 stamina. I strongly suggest that the victim logs out for the duration of the battle. They have 15 minutes to rejoin and will be much safer. Make sure to have a couple people wait in the Boss room to refellow and Heal the victim. Send the rest of the people into the reward room to battle the few Burun present. Afterward your Victim may enter, but make sure that they wait out the debuffs before getting their reward. The Sarcophagus casts a drain spell as it gives you the Ancient Armored Vestment. You then have a choice of an Axe, Sword, Mage Staff, Thrown Weapon Brace, Crown, and a Mansion Portal to Kivik Lirs Temple. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/14/2004

name: Fadsahil al-Tashbi the Master Archmage
description:
Desert master mage. Moved to this new location with the April 2004 patch. -- Geomancer 4/16/2004
Fadsahil al-Tashbi the Master Archmage used to live in an ancient temple nearby. That is, until he learned that the temple was full of undead cultists and burun. He has since moved to this small tent to the Northeast of his old home.
Fadsahil buys mage items at 80% and sells mage and alchemy supplies at 110%. He has the ultimate selection of mage and alchemist items
all spell components and scarabs, all Peas, Splitting Tool, Concentrated Aqua Incanta, Neutral Balms, Eye Dropper, Alembic, and Mortar and Pestle. He also sells Portal gems to all of the starter towns and a portal gem back to his old shop. At 20k value, Fadsahils Portal Gems make great lightweight death items and are an affordable time saver for travel. Another must have death item, Dho Master Robes, are also sold here.-- Taarna Blood SC 10/14/2004

name: Renegade Fortress
description:
-- Syl 5/12/2004Location 28.5S, 65.5W This is the location of the spy Toberik that Krank in Linvak Tukal sends you to find. There is a door at the front of the fort that can be attacked. It is best to do it from a distance since the lugians dump hot oil on anyone near the walls. Once the door is broken down, rush inside and jump into the center pit area with the buildings. Toward the back there is a head with a portal inside. Toberik is in the basement area of the building to the left of the portal. A room with boxes has a hole in the ceiling and he is hiding up there. Take his note back to Krank in Linvak Tukal to be flagged for the Noble Weapons quest.

The note is aparently givable. I dont know if this is intended or not. -- Taarna Blood SC 9/26/2004

10M xp pincer spawns on the mutilators in the red room -- Seeker 6/9/2004restricted to level 80+ -- Seeker 6/11/2004 Current coords are correct. Quest url added, map url corrected. -- Lila_MT 7/2/2004 If you see this with coords of 0,0 in Oracle of Dereth it means that somehow youve got it in your locations.loc twice. Open locations.loc in notepad, find Mutilator Tunnels and look for the entry with the 0s for coords. Remove that entry.



Changed the name of this dungeon in an attempt to get rid of the Oracle of Dereth bug Don't bother marking this entry suspect, it's meant to be named like it is.

name: Olthoi Warrior Nest
description: 3M XP Warrior Pincer, Sublime Ring of Piercing Protection -- Seeker 6/9/2004 -- Lila_MT 7/2/2004Corrected the map url I posted a moment ago. -- Lila_MT 7/2/2004

name: Crumbling Empyrean Mansion
description: Worker Pincer, good for 50K XP -- 6/9/2004

name: Desert Oasis
description: Out near Fadsahil al-Tashbi, the desert master mage, Burun nearby, laggy, nice eye candy -- Seeker 6/9/2004

name: Tumerok Cavern
description: Tumeroks. About Level 26. And Silt Lurkers. Didnt get very far down. -- SolanThommad Part 1 of Living Spear Quest initiated by Bachus Flufens. The spear is in a locked vault. Key to vault is found on the Hea Warrior. Vault graphic is new and pretty cool. Return spear to Bachus for additional quest info. -- Dunc -- AllyMcAlchemist -- Solan Thommad

name: Candeth Keep Lifestone
description: Lifestone within the walls of Candeth Keep. -- Lila_MT 6/11/2004

name: Burun Cavern
description: Massive amounts of Burun Ruuk Seers and Burun Ruuk Louts. Added in Pillars Made of Sand. -- Neros 6/12/2004Carved Gemstone Lockpick, Renegade Lugian Ring and some lore texts are here also. The Ring is nothing special, but the Gemstone Lockpicks are high powered lockpicks with 100 uses. They are on a 7 day timer. -- Taarna Blood SC 9/25/2004

name: Drunken Madman
description: Drunken Madman is located outside of Baishi, If you give him different selections of drinks he will summon various portals Including, Walled portals (PK) and Ulgrims island -- Druxus (MT FF) 6/13/2004

name: Bachus Flufens
description:
Bachus Flufens tells you, Woe is me. The Hea must have overheard that I have been sending travelers to investigate their caverns, for they invaded my house, burned down my apple trees, and ate my bunny rabbits. I barely escaped here to safety of Redspire in one piece. Fortunately my dear friend Micon has agreed to give me shelter until I am back upon my feet.

Bachus Flufens tells you, They must hold that relic in high esteem indeed. A most fanciful folk, I must say. I heard that it is a legendary spear that they dismantled and enshrined in two separate caverns on the island. It once belonged to a warrior from an opposite faction, I believe. He tried to persuade them back to traditional ways, but they would have none of it. Somehow they dispatched him but retained his spear...which is supposed to have some sort of magical, living properties to it. Im not quite sure what to believe.

Bachus Flufens tells you, Perhaps the answer could be found in the caverns to the northwest along the shore. Try the area around 40.2N 84.7W --at least thats where I saw the Tumeroks heading last. Beware, friend--its quite likely to be well guarded. Id go myself, but I must catch up on my journal today. If you would like to read it, here are a few pages that I wrote the other day. -- Solan Thommad 6/13/2004

name: Hea Toneawa
description:
Hea Toneawa tells you, Greetings. Could you do me a favor, please? I planned to meet my beloved, Aun Mariona, but I am afraid that my Hea brethren have learned of our romance and are watching over me. Could you take her this note? I dare not go meet her myself, lest they slay us together. You will find her in the redwood groves almost directly north from the city your kind calls Bluespire. I have written the directions to our meeting place on the note.



His note claims Aun Mariona is at 41.1N, 74.4W. She is, of course, not there but her brother Aun Bernawa is. -- Solan Thommad 6/13/2004

name: East Arwic Lifestone
description: This was mistakenly marked as a suspect location, when lifestones were moved closer to towns, but this one is still here up the hill NE of Arwic -- Kitte 6/20/2004

name: Gaerlan Portals
description: Ziggurat, library portals, etc. moved from Eastham to bunkers here for Pillars Made of Sand event -- Seeker 6/21/2004

name: Renegade Stronghold
description:
From Pillars Made of Sand patch. Ascendant and Tumerok Champions, Gotrok Tiatus and Fortress Guards. Use the key on the chest at 34.8S 12.1E for a Renegade Bone Charm, Lore and 100 Tumerok Salted Meats.



To find the key go right at the entrance and keeping bearing right until the end. The key spawns on the table. -- Seeker 7/3/2004

name: Renegade Chest
description: Use the key from Renegade Stronghold on the chest for a Renegade Bone Charm, Lore and 100 Tumerok Salted Meats. From Pillars Made of Sand patch -- Seeker 7/3/2004

name: Renegade Stronghold

name: Hidden Entrance
description:
The enterance is a big rock called Hidden Entrance. Grab all the different books lying about and return to Yanshi and talk to Ydnew. Multiple dungeons below. -- Seeker 8/11/2004The various dungeons are for different level ranges. Underway - Level 40+
Tunnels - Level 60+
Halls - Levels 80+. More from Maggies once she makes a separate quest page for it. -- Geomancer 8/14/2004

name: Umbral Hall
description:
Another subway. Tieable, Summonable. Lots of portals, Hot Landing Zone.
NORTH: Al-Arqas, Tou-Tou, Uziz, Stonehold, Kyrst
SOUTH: Sawato, GW, Arwic, Freehold, Khayyaban
EAST: Al-Jalmia, Rith, Lyth, Lin, Kara
WEST: Xarabydun, Nanto, Eastham, Samsur, Plateau
Monsters: Shadow Lieutenants, Idols, Dread Idols, Mosswart Fanatics -- Seeker 8/11/2004 Lila_MT 8/29/2004

name: CapFan's Hideaway -or- Dires Hub
description:
A Dungeon using new technology for the enterance, similar to Xarabydun. There are two buildings at this location. One of the structures has only one door, but inside there are two. The inside of the structure is larger than the outside. The second door leads to a dungeon.





The dungeon is filled with various high level undead and golems. Near the bottom, guarded by a litch Opressor and a host of undead is an SSK chest and a Runed chest (300 LP).





A short drop from here takes you to a room with 14 portals. A new Hub/Sub. The portals:





Stonehold Valley Portal


Direlands North Landbridge Portal


Direlands South Landbridge Portal


Vesayen Isles Portal


South Shore Heights


Obsidian Span Portal


Obsidian Plains


Direlands Southeast Shore


Darktide Festival Stone Portal


Slaughterhouse


Isle of Tears Portal


Black Hill


Walled Portals


Obsidian Rim Portal





-Cap





-- CapFan 8/11/2004

name: King Toad idol
description:
You must be flagged to enter by giving a note from a Burun Ruuk Seer to Aun Laokhe in Arwic tower. Take the hookable portal from blackmire 1.


Lots of level 100+ Burun and Guruk inside. There are 12 unreadable scrolls and one statue inside, for level 4, 5, 6, and 7 of fellowship spells for Magic Defense, Melee Defense, and Missile Defense. To get usable scrolls, hand them to the Aun Translator in Arwic. -- Seeker 8/15/2004

name: Aun Tahuirea (Crystal Golem Hunter)
description:
Your fellowship is now locked. You may not recruit new members. If you leave the fellowship, you have 15 minutes to be recruited back into the fellowship.

C Lord is now a closed fellowship.



Upon killing a Crystal Lord in a fellowship, you get this message. Go to 24.0N, 72.0W and talk to this guy. Teth BSD is kinda close. Tumerok post at 12.2N 68.2W is a closer but less common tie.



Anyway, he will give you each a key to his chest. Loot can be good sometimes, I have witnessed one decent major come out of it. I have heard rumors of an XP reward, but my group killed 2 Crystal Lords and did not receive it. -- Taarna Blood SC 8/15/2004

The key that opens the chest drops on a nearby Drudge Prowler and inside is Kreergs Spear. Return it to Bleeargh, Mosswart Swamp Lord near Yanshi -- Seeker 8/21/2004

name: Coral Tunnels (East)
description:
The new dungeon in the new tower on Aerlinthe. -- Tolliver 8/26/2004

This is the Eastern entrance to the Coral Tunnels. This system of tunnels goes under the Aerlinthe Harbor and exits on the Western side just below the Coral Golem spawn there. This is a quick way across the harbor for someone who knows the route. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/12/2004

description: The second level 80+ dungeon for the Olthoi Armor quest. Layout is identical to the other. -- Taygar 9/10/2004 OK, there are two level 80+ Olthoi brood hives. One at 57.4N, 67.4E, one at 64.5N, 56.2E -- Seeker 9/16/2004 So, this location is actually correct. Thanks Seeker. -- Geomancer 9/16/2004

name: Kivik Lir's Temple (Blackmire 4)
description: Another fellowship quest dungeon. Crowds of large unhappy Burun all around it. A ramp on the east side provides access. Inside of the building is a pit with an Odd Looking Vine at the bottom. Use the vine to enter. The rewards for this quest include Ancient Armored Leggings, and choice of jewlery or fellowship magic skill buffs. There are several various level ranges with 100+ being the highest. -- Taarna Blood SC 9/22/2004

name: Izji Qo's Temple portal exit point
description: This is the exit point of the Mansion portal from the Blackmire 3 quest (Temple of Hizk Ri). There is little in the area currently, yet there is much speculation about a future Blackmire quest nearby. -- Taarna Blood SC 9/25/2004

name: Shendolain Vestibule
description: The new Shendolain Vestibule is located here. The old one is still in the OP, but this one is in a more sensible location for its level requirements now. This was the location of the 5th soul crystal prison that held BaelZharon. The reward for this quest can be crafted into a bow, sheild or orb. See the great writeup on the Maggie the Jackcats site for more info. -- Taarna Blood SC 9/25/2004

name: Sir Tenshin
description: Part of the Level 20+ Elysas Favor quest. Sir Tenshin directs you to investigate a farm at 37.4S, 75.5E. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/12/2004

description: Part of the level 20+ Elysas Favor quest. He directs you to visit a reformed bandit at 42.8N, 29.5E. Inside are Hollow Minions with a Note. Return it to Sir Rylanan to advance. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/12/2004

name: Coral Tunnels (West)
description: This is the Western entrance to the Coral Tunnels. This system of tunnels goes under the Aerlinthe Harbor and exits on the Eastern side just below the Coral Golem spawn and Recall platform. This is a quick way across the harbor for someone who knows the route. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/13/2004

name: East Aerlinthe Lighthouse
description: Ancient Empyrean Lighthouse similar to the one in Tou Tou. You can climb to the top. There is an identical Lighthouse on the other side of the Aerlinthe Harbor. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/13/2004

name: Smith Ejan
description: Named Undead near a temple. Tortured spirit that brodcasts annoying area messages. He can be killed and looted for The Charred Book, which can be translated at Cragstone Library for the Aerlinthe Record. This is an interesting piece of lore, but has no practical value. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/13/2004

These totems come form the Rubble in the various Olthoi Hives, 5 in all to choose from. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/30/2004

These totems come form the Rubble in the various Olthoi Hives, 5 in all to choose from. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/30/2004

name: Tiny Hive
description: Random Spawn Dungeon on the Mare Lassel Plateau. Can not be summoned or recalled. Soldiers and Legionaries. There is a double Olthoi Noble spawn at the bottom, which can randomly produce a Level 90 blue Olthoi Noble that drops the Rubble from the NW ring at 50.1N, 80.4W. Give this rubble to Aun Ngationa in Timaru for a Tonk Totem. This can be used on the Palenqual weapon or turned into Aun Hareltah for 500k XP. -- Taarna Blood SC

name: Fortress Barrier
description: Attackable barrier that protects the inside of the Burun Fortress. It can be debuffed and generally requires several people to kill. Resistant to war magic. Part of the slay Morgluuk / Noble Weapons quest. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/30/2004

name: Vile-Smelling Refuse (Southeast)
description:
These Dungeons dont show up as portals or items, but any 3rd party detectors will call them Vile-Smelling Refuse. You must be flagged to enter by giving Captain Krank in Linvak Tukal Toberiks Report. This report comes from the Renegade Fortress at 28.5S,65.5W.

Beware of the fume damage floors here. They can do 40ish dmg per second. Ramps are always safe. Fairly straight forward, just go down. This dungeon contains a Ruuk Shaman Watcher at the bottom. Upon its death you will get a green message, and the Ruuk Shamans with Morgluuk are reduced in number and spawn.-- Taarna Blood SC 10/30/2004

name: Vile-Smelling Refuse (Northwest)
description:
These Dungeons dont show up as portals or items, but any 3rd party detectors will call them Vile-Smelling Refuse. You must be flagged to enter by giving Captain Krank in Linvak Tukal Toberiks Report. This report comes from the Renegade Fortress at 28.5S,65.5W.

Beware of the fume damage floors here. They can do 40ish dmg per second. Ramps are always safe. There are some twisting corridors full of damage fumes. Some dead ends and loops also. This dungeon contains a Titan Watcher at the bottom near an exit portal. Upon its death you will get a green message, and the Titans with Morgluuk are reduced in number and spawn.-- Taarna Blood SC 10/30/2004

name: Vile-Smelling Refuse
description: These Dungeons dont show up as portals or items, but any 3rd party detectors will call them Vile-Smelling Refuse. You must be flagged to enter by giving Captain Krank in Linvak Tukal Toberiks Report. This report comes from the Renegade Fortress at 28.5S,65.5W. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/30/2004

name: Vile-Smelling Refuse (Morgluuk)
description:
These Dungeons dont show up as portals or items, but any 3rd party detectors will call them Vile-Smelling Refuse. You must be flagged to enter by giving Captain Krank in Linvak Tukal Toberiks Report. This report comes from the Renegade Fortress at 28.5S,65.5W.


This is Morgluuks main dungeon. Beware of the fume damage floors here. They can do 40ish dmg per second. Ramps are always safe. Go here after you have sufficently weakened his forces by completing some of the other dungeons. The Egg slaying dungeon weakens him, and the other 3 subtract from his forces. I recommend that you at least slay his Egg.


Once inside this dungeon, head West and then take the SW fork. Go down until you reach a corridor with passages to the sides and 2 large burun at the very end. Dont go down the corridor, go right at the bottom of that ramp and find another ramp going down. Morgluuk is down the next slanting tunnel you come to. If you did not get rid of some of his guards, they are on a very short spawn. There is a damage fume floor at the base of Morgluuks ramp. It is best to have one person try to lure him onto the ramp for the battle. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/30/2004

name: Vile-Smelling Refuse (Southwest)
description:
These Dungeons dont show up as portals or items, but any 3rd party detectors will call them Vile-Smelling Refuse. You must be flagged to enter by giving Captain Krank in Linvak Tukal Toberiks Report. This report comes from the Renegade Fortress at 28.5S,65.5W.

Beware of the fume damage floors here. They can do 40ish dmg per second. Ramps are always safe. This dungeon is short but brutal. Lots of Fume damage floors here. Many Burun eggs are scattered about, but the one you want is way at the bottom in a large room. It is always in the same spot, among a group of 4. Most eggs are easy to kill, but this is a true tough egg. After you kill it a green message appears saying you weakened Morgluuk. This halves his HP and reduces his skills, stats and regen. If you do no other dungeons to weaken him, do this one for sure.-- Taarna Blood SC 10/30/2004

description:
Bhab, Arcanum Tinkerer tells you, Remember, if you find anything that looks even slightly mechanical down in those Foundries, bring it to me and Ill see if I can make it into a little statue for you. Bhab, Arcanum Tinkerer will make decorative green Oxidized Statues from statue parts found in the Foundry dungeons in towns.


-- Taarna Blood SC 11/8/2004

name: Aino Lunnan-Shin (Xarabydun)
description: Give her the Cystal Nodule from bottom of the Lightless Tunnels in Xarabydun. She will give you a Gem of Impulse that when used gives you +100 mana for 3 hours. There is a one week timer on handing in Crystal Nodules and the Gem of Impulse is no drop. -- Taarna Blood SC 11/8/2004

name: Uninhabited Area Portal (Xarabydun)
description: Dungeon at the bottom of Xarabydun city sewers. Entry to the sewers and portal is blocked by a locked door with 82 diff. Portal restricted to levels 1-25, but can be Tied and Summoned. At the bottom of Uninhabited Area Portal is a portal to the Lightless Tunnels, also 1-25. In order to get to the Lightless Tunnels portal, you must find a key on a Mite among a room full of mites. This key unlocks one of 2 doors into a room with a locked door alcove. In this alcove is a chest, with a lore text, and a lever. The lever is placed so that you can use it through the door without opening. This lever opens the door in the room with the mites which leads to the Lightless Tunnels. -- Taarna Blood SC 11/8/2004

name: Lightless Tunnels to VOD
description: Only accessable to characters 1-25. Reached by going through Uninhabited Area Portal and then into Lightless Tunnels. There is a Mid Direlands Portal at the bottom of a 40 damage pit here(with Bludge pro 7 and 110 jump) It is Tieable and Summonable, restricted to 18+. This exits at 37.1S, 65.9W and is actually the Valley of Death hot drop, which is very hazardous for any lowbie that goes in. This is a good place for your new portal mules to get a VOD portal while they pick Crystal Nodules. -- Taarna Blood SC 11/8/2004

It's tough to get to and placed in a tower with margul, but it doesn't require a key(7 day timer - no gem required). -- Screamin Squall 03/19/2005 Can also be reached by using Shadow Cursed Totem. This portal gem item may be found in Black Marrow Reliquaries.-- Taarna Blood SC

name: Shoushi to Yaraq
description: New portal to the town of Yaraq. -- CapFan 12/9/2004

name: Shoushi to Tou-Tou
description: New portal to the town of Tou Tou. -- CapFan 12/9/2004This portal originates from Shoushi, not Yaraq. -- DSanai 12/10/2004 Updated to say Shoushi instead of Yaraq. Re-suspect this if thats not the thing to do.

name: Shoushi to Kara
description: New portal to the town of Kara. -- CapFan 12/9/2004

name: Shoushi to Hebian-To
description: New portal to the Capital town of Hebian-To -- CapFan 12/9/2004

name: Briad Mansion Ruin
description: New low level quest outside of Shoushi. Talk to Lou Ka in the bar in Shoushi. -- CapFan 12/9/2004

name: Shoushi Cooking Forge
description:
Casts: Master Chefs Boon - Increases the targets Cooking skill by 45 points.



-- CapFan 12/10/2004

name: Shoushi Fletching Forge
description:
Casts: Fletching Masters Boon - Increases the targets Fletching skill by 45 points.



-- CapFan 12/10/2004

name: Shoushi Salvaging Forge
description:
Casts: Master Salvagers Boon - Increases the casters Salvaging skill by 45 points.



-- CapFan 12/10/2004

name: Shoushi Alchemy Forge
description:
Casts: Master Alchemists Boon - Increases the casters Alchemy skill by 45 points.



-- CapFan 12/10/2004

name: Shoushi Lockpick Forge
description:
Casts: Master Lockpickers Boon - Increases the targets Lockpick skill by 45 points.



-- CapFan 12/10/2004

name: Zairente Ra-Yao
description:
There is a lonely peddler, Zairente Ra-Yao, way out in the mountains here. He buys and sells weapons and armor and has high-value trade notes. Among the more interesting items he sells is a peculiar old dagger - unenchantable, 0.5 - 1 bludgeoning(.) damage.

-- Gronk 12/11/2004Zairente Ra-Yao is a random spawn, hes not at these coords anymore.
peculiar old dagger is part of the mage armor quest. -- Seeker 12/12/2004

name: Suzuhara Baijin
description: Suzuharas Care Package quest (Stonehold) -- Seeker 12/12/2004

name: Aun Ilmenaura
description:
Aun Artisan in Feather and Claw, gives skill XP in item Tinkering: Carving Knife + Claw = Hairbrush

-- Seeker 12/19/2004

name: Aun Pitmaura
description: Bluespire crafter gives xp in Weapon Tinkering: Whittling Knife + Siraluun Claw = Scissors -- Seeker 12/19/2004

name: Aun Kahuiura
description: Crafter in Bluespire gives xp in Magic Item Tinkering: Mortar&Pestle + Claw = Hairgel -- Seeker 12/19/2004

name: Aun Nireura
description: Crafter in Bluespire gives xp in Armor Tinkering: Lockpick (Intricate Carving Tool?) + Siraluun Claw = Hairpin -- Seeker 12/19/2004

name: Sign
description:
You think, A sign. Theyre everywhere nowadays...from the smile on the grocers face, to the voices that carry on the wind. Id seen a fair share of signs in my day, but this was a day like no other and this was a sign that I couldnt pass by.



using this sign in Zaikhal fills your mind with thoughts, starts you gesturing and entices you to start a quest.... -- Seeker 1/3/2005

name: Holtburg Fletching Forge
description: Adds +5 stackable to your skill for 3 minutes -- Taarna Blood SC 1/16/2005

name: Holtburg Alchemy Forge
description: Adds +5 stackable to your skill for 3 minutes -- Taarna Blood SC 1/16/2005

name: Holtburg Cooking Forge
description: Adds +5 stackable to your skill for 3 minutes -- Taarna Blood SC 1/16/2005

name: Holtburg Salvaging Forge
description:
Adds +5 stackable to your skill for 3 minutes -- Taarna Blood SC


1/16/2005

name: Holtburg Lockpick Forge
description: Adds +5 stackable to your skill for 3 minutes -- Taarna Blood SC 1/16/2005

name: War Room
description: Must talk to Aludi al-Jaladh in Ayan before you can enter. This quest is for the Aviator Cap. If you do not have lockpick, you must kill the drudges outside the fort, or in the dungeon for keys to unlock the doors. Inside are Drudge Ballast, Toilers and Laborers. At the end is the Drudge Aviator. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

name: Drudge Flying Machine
description: Related to the Drudge Aviator quest. After killing the Drudge Aviator, hand the flying machine the Flying Machine Instructions to be instantly portalled to Ayan. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

name: Vile Sanctuary
description: Contains Withered Lugians guarding the Anemic Atlatl. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

name: Banished Assembly
description: Full of Withered Drudge Seraphs and Seraph Mystics guarding the Sterile Sword. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

name: Ravaged Cathedral
description: Contains Withered Banderlings and Tumeroks guarding the Insensate Axe. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

name: 3 Empyrean Heads
description: 3 Empyrean heads in a row facing NW. They mark the boundary of the Withered Area to the SW. This marker marks the location of the center Head. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

name: 3 Empyrean Heads
description: 3 Empyrean heads in a row facing NW. They mark the boundary of the Withered Area to the SW. This marker marks the location of the center Head. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

name: Withered Banderling Island
description: This marks the location of an island in the Withered Area full of Withered Banderlings guarding the book The Withering. In addition, one of the Hierophants near the center drops the Barren Bow. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

name: Static Banderling Spawn
description: Static spawn of many banderlings. 6 each of Scalpers, Predators and Savages. Strewn around are bones, corpses, blood and carcases, but nothing else of importance. Would be a good place to camp looking for a Niffis Fight portal gem. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

name: Defiled Temple Middle Wing
description: Start of the Defiled Temple quest for levels 60-79. End Reward is the Tursh Totem and the Royal Dye. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

name: Defiled Temple Lower Wing
description: Start of the Defiled Temple quest for level 40-59. End reward is the Tursh Totem and the Royal Paint. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

name: Defiled Temple Upper Wing
description: Start of the Defiled Temple quest for levels 80-99. End reward is the Tursh Totem and a similar reward to the other dungeons. As I write this I dont know the exact name however. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

name: Defiled Temple Asylum
description: Start of the Defiled Temple quest for levels 100+. End reward is the Tursh Totem and the Royal Oil. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

name: Tower
description: Tower at the center of the 4 Defiled Temple portals. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

name: Banderling Village
description: Start of the Banderling Shrine quest. End reward is Cyphus Suldows Half Moon Spear. In the village are Amethyst Gromnies, Banderling Chanters and a Banderling Spirit Dancer. Kill the Spririt Dancer for a Crude Carving. Give the carving to the statue and a portal to the dungeon will summon. The Dungeon is restricted to levels 60 or higher. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

name: Qalaba'r Oasis
description: Group of Cottages outside Qalabar. Item is a Swamp Stone. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

name: Ice's Edge Cottages
description: Group of cottages near Stonehold. Item is a Sclavus Tongue. -- Chupon 1/17/2005

name: Asbel Domain
description: Lytlethorpe housing group. Items are Mattekar Hide Sleeves or Timber Siraluun Claw -- Chupon 1/22/2005

name: Bright Blade Cottages
description: Zaikhal settlement. Item is sclavus tongue. -- Chupon 1/22/2005

name: Bucolic Villas
description: Al-Jalima settlement. Item is Carenzi Stalker Pelt. -- Chupon 1/22/2005

name: Celcynd Cottages
description: Crater settlement. Item is shore dillo spine. -- Chupon 1/22/2005

name: Desert Boundary Cottages
description: Eastham settlement. Item is shore dillo spine. -- Chupon 1/22/2005

name: Glenden Hills North Settlement
description: Glenden Wood settlement. Item is Littoral Siraluun Claw. -- Chupon 1/22/2005

name: Helms Villas
description: Zaikhal settlement. Item is a Crude Lockpick -- Chupon 1/22/2005

name: Ianna
description: Crater settlement. Item is a shore dillo spine. -- Chupon 1/22/2005

name: Lake Nemuel Settlement
description: Stonehold settlement. Item is a Littoral Siraluun claw. -- Chupon 1/22/2005

name: Linvak Tukal Foothills Settlement
description: Qalabar settlement. Item is a Shore Dillo Spine. -- Chupon 1/22/2005

name: Loredane Villas
description: Zaikhal settlement. Item is a Jungle Phyntos Wasp Wing. -- Chupon 1/22/2005

name: Midsong Cottages
description: Al-Jalima settlement. Item is a Dillo Hide Coat. -- Chupon 1/22/2005

name: Mimiana Villas
description: Al-Jalima settlement. Item is a White Jewel. -- Chupon 1/22/2005

name: Aurten Rhell
description:
NPC in Bluespire starts you out on Refulgent Bracelet quest
-- Seeker 5/27/2005

name: Gromnietross Aerie Spawn
description: A spawn containing a single Adolescent Ash Gromnie. It also contains one Sapphire Gromnie, Amethyst Gromnie, Emerald Gromnie, and Ruby Gromnie. These are level 100 and have no noticable special loot. -- Taarna Blood SC 6/7/2005

name: Caulcano Black Marrow Reliquary
description: Static spawn, no key required, 7 day Timer. Can be reached by using Burning Veil. This portal gem item may be found in Black Marrow Reliquaries. -- Taarna Blood SC 6/8/2005

name: Oasis Black Marrow Reliquary
description: Static spawn within a floating tower, no key required, 7 day Timer. As far as I know, this place can only be reached by using the Antiquated Compass. This portal gem item may be found in Black Marrow Reliquaries. -- Taarna Blood SC 6/8/2005

name: Floating Bridge Black Marrow Reliquary
description: Static spawn, no key required, 7 day Timer As far as I know, this place can only be reached by using Seething Skull. This portal gem item may be found in Black Marrow Reliquaries. -- Taarna Blood SC 6/8/2005

name: Entry to Inner Stronghold
description:
There is no portal. This is a Xarabydun type landscape dungeon. It is a tunnel leading down, which contains various Shadows, Lugians, and Lugian type shadows. At the bottom is an 80+ portal to Inner Stronghold.

-- Taarna Blood SC 6/8/2005

name: Trophy Collector - Lin
description: Both trophy and wing collectors live here, just up the hill from the jeweler. -- Serafin 6/24/2005

name: Lifestone (Shoushi)
description: This is the Shoushi Home Town Lifestone -- White Heart 7/5/2005

name: Portal to Sanamar
description: As seen on the Destiny TOD preview server -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Sanamar
description: Viamontian Starter Town. Location taken at the statue of King Varicci di Corcosi II, as seen from the TOD preview world Destiny. -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Statue of King Varicci di Corcosi II
description: The statue of King Varicci di Corcosi II, as seen from the TOD preview world Destiny. -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Lifestone - Sanamar
description: Sanamar Lifestone as seen on Destiny TOD Preview server -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: The Red Bull of Sanamar
description: First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Anton Sillezi - Sanamar
description: First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server. Gives you items for some kind of "Trade Route" quest, presumably starter level. -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Barkeep Jean Vaden - Sanamar
description: First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server. Barkeep sells rumors, food, some cooking items and Trade notes -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Rand (Brewmaster) - Sanamar
description:
First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server. Viamontian Brewmaster who gives you a quest to find his brewmaster book.



Rand tells you, "A band of Drudges stole my brewing bible. I need some hardy soul to find it for me. Last I saw them, the dirty thieves were headed in the direction of the Waterfall Cave at 84.0N 75.4W."

Rand tells you, "Return that brewing bible to me, and I'll fill your head with the arcane secrets of the brewing world." -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Elena Du Furza - Sanamar
description:
First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server. Lady who gives you a quest to replace a gem in the a tower nearby.



Elena Du Furza tells you, "The Beacon at the top of the Beacon Tower requires regular maintenance. I have been unable to reach this beacon due to Wasps and other creatures taking up residence on the tower platforms. Place this gem within the beacon and you shall have the satisfaction of knowing that you have done your King a great service." -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Beacon Tower - Sanamar
description:
First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server.


Elena Du Furza tells you, "The Beacon at the top of the Beacon Tower requires regular maintenance. I have been unable to reach this beacon due to Wasps and other creatures taking up residence on the tower platforms. Place this gem within the beacon and you shall have the satisfaction of knowing that you have done your King a great service." -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Lorca Sammel - Sanamar
description:
First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server.

Lorca Sammel tells you, "If you would, please explore the lair near 71.7N 60.4W. If you find my necklace, please return it to me. I will reward you as handsomely as I am able." -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Portal Guardian - Sanamar
description:
First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server.



Portal Guardian gives some kind of low level starter quest. -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Grocer Jaffres Dini - Sanamar
description: First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server. -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Shopkeeper Tod Burgni - Sanamar
description: First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server. -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Tailor Monique du Bressa - Sanamar
description: First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server. -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Jewler Susana Arlean - Sanamar
description: First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server. -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Fabian Strinjelli - Sanamar
description:
First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server.

Fabian Strinjelli tells you, "You Bloodless swear loyalty to that fool Asheron. But where was he when the Olthoi laid siege to our city? He helped us not, just as he has abandoned you now." -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Fletcher Mikael di Suinn - Sanamar
description:
First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server.


Sells various archer/xbow/TW supplies. -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Collector - Sanamar
description:
First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server.

Collector tells you, "I'm interested in monster trophies from common rats, red phyntos wasps, armoredillos, Drudges, Mosswarts, Banderlings, penguins, and Ruschk. If you give me such an item, I will reward you with money or an item. With regret, I don't deal in hides." -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Town Crier - Sanamar
description:
First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server.

-- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Paissen du Kim - Sanamar
description:
First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server.

-- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Blacksmith Karlus Loc - Sanamar
description:
First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server.


-- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Healer Deme du Laur - Sanamar
description:
First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server.


-- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Luressi di Maki - Sanamar
description:
First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server.

Will give you a portal gem to Silyun for ANY trade note, even a 100p one. Faster than running.

Luressi di Maki tells you, "If you would like, I could sell you a portal gem to Silyun. One I note is all I ask. As a gesture of goodwill." -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Scribe Benno di Hergeaux - Sanamar
description:
First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server.


-- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Archmage Luchessa du Lamiere - Sanamar
description:
First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server.


Second floor, basic starter town mage. Scarabs 1-4 , but no Portal Gems.


-- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Stuven di Bonachien - Sanamar
description:
First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server.

Stuven di Bonachien tells you, "The Duke's rebellion died a long time ago, which we are all grateful for, of course. But to think of how the King ended it..."

Stuven di Bonachien tells you, "I know that Eleonora du Bellenesse slew Prince Renlen, and for that she deserved her execution. But the manner in which it was done... It's enough to make you weep."

-- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Sanamar Scriveners (Level I - III)
description:
First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server.

Scriveners sell Foci and Level 1-3 scrolls. Some are even Sclavus. -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Lifestone - Silyun
description:
First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server.

-- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Statue of Eleonora du Bellenesse - Silyun
description:
First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server.


Although there is no ID information, I have to assume that this is Eleonora du Bellenesse. She was the Viamontian warrior woman who was captured in the TOD Trailer. Also daughter of the Duke.


-- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Silyun
description:
First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server.

This is apparently the remainder of the Duke's rebel forces. You can easily attain a portal gem to this place by talking to Luressi di Maki in Sanamar. -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Grand Mother - Silyun
description:
First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server.

This is the "Mother of Silyun". She gives you a quest to recover the Heart of Eleonora du Bellenesse. This is apparently one of the quests that allow you to chose sides. If you help the Duke, the King will be against you. Im not yet sure what that means.

Grand Mother tells you, "But I warn you - if you do this, you will fall out of favor with the Grand Knight of Sanamar. He may well treat you with the same enmity with which he and his King have long treated us." -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Archmage Pazzescorios di Frodenci - Silyun
description:
First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server.

Basic Mage. Scarabs 1-4 -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Scorus - Silyun
description:
First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server.


Fuin Mage, gives the Healing Machine quest. I believe that you get a Knath Lair Mansion Portal as a quest reward.


Scorus tells you, "But there may be a cure. The mages who graced this land prior crafted marvelous artifacts - items of great power. Find these items. Create the machine. Perhaps we may cure our maddened kin." -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Lifestone - Fiun Outpost
description: -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Portal to Silyun
description: -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Fiun Outpost
description: First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server. -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Egg Orchard
description: Tieable and Summonable. Dungeon in the middle of the new high level madhouse valley. The run to this place can be rather ugly. The dungeon contains new high level "Withered" Olthoi. They are immune to all magic except projectile magic. There are little larve, nymphs, and evicerators body types. Most are in the 4000hp range and very evil. The small ones are especially nasty in numbers greater than 2-3. -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Thrungus Hole
description: Dungeon in the middle of the new high level madhouse valley. The run to this place can be rather ugly. This dungeon apparently involves the quest to save the nearby Hermit from melting. -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Hermit
description: Quest NPC in the middle of the new high level madhouse valley. She is inside a cave that is relatively safe. She gives you a bag of special stones, and asks you to help her break a curse. Apparently this is associated with the Thrungus Hole dungeon, but I did not go inside or finish the quest. -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Abayar's Laboratory
description:
First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server.

Dungeon at the base of a large and complex tower, much like the one in Greenspire. I went just inside and saw some shadows, but did not go very far inside. Portal is tieable and summonable. -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Path of the Blind
description:
First seen on Destiny TOD Preview server.

Dungeon within a small fort area. Portal is Tieable and Summonable. Inside are Hollow Lugians called Tukora Sentinels. They are level 135 and have nearly 5000hp. They seem to give good XP. I dont know the intended purpose of this dungeon, but I think it will become a very popular XP hunting ground. -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Augmentation Realm Upper Level
description:
This dungeon IS Tieable and Summonable on the Destiny preview server. This is a wonderful thing, as getting here truly sucks. This is the dungeon where you eventually find the blank Augmentaion Gems. You MUST have given the Insatiable Eater's Jaw to Fiun Rehlyun, otherwise you cannot enter the portal or summoned gateway. The timer on the Jaw is 21 days. The timer on the gem blanks is 30 days. This means that you must get a new jaw each time you go for a new gem.

There are several areas of the dungeon, and each has its own theme and type of creature. You will find a portal soon after you meet the Small Magma Golems. This is to the Lower Augmentation Gem Level, and it also seems to be tieable/summonable.

After this, you will find several portals that seem to possibly go to the same place or mirrors of the same place. I will report more as I explore more.

At the end of this area, there is a named Viamontian knight, Sir Belas I think. He is rather nasty, but when he dies he leaves a few more than 10 blank gems. -- Taarna Blood SC 7/7/2005

name: Entry to Shattered Out-Lands
description: This is the valley that most easily allows you to enter the new High Level playground. I personally think there are about twice as many creatures as needed. The creatures are bad enough, but the lag can be awful. As things stand now, dying in here would almost certainly mean a lost body. Tread carefully. -- Taarna Blood 7/7/2005

name: Insatiable Vault
description: This is the location of the Insatiable Eater's Jaw, which is needed for the Augmentation Gem quest. Entry is safe. Jump directly into the pit and proceed down until you find a large room with a dark floor and a pit. There are several down ramps that lead in circles or to dead ends, but when you find the pit you can jump down. There are 3 jumps down in total if I recall correctly. After the last pit, you will find an area with a Surface portal at the bottom of a ramp. Before going down the ramp, go to the left or the right and into a dead end wing. There is an unmarked Insatiable Eater there. It has the Jaw and you even get a helpful message when you kill it. The timer is 21 days. -- Taarna Blood 7/7/2005The jaw can also be turned in for 40 million xp, 2 MMD notes, and a title token for the title Insatiable Slayer. -- Chupon 7/22/2005

name: Heart of Madness
description: -- Hexxor of Thisledown 7/19/2005You must complete a quest to enter. -- Hexxor 7/19/2005Added map and quest urls. -- Lila_MT 7/20/2005

name: Huntsman of Silyun
description: You are new to Silyun, are you? If you are a skilled hunter, you may be of some use for me, in helping me track the most dangerous quarry of all: the assassin, Oswald. Of course, first you must prove your skill. Bring me the jaw of an Abhorrent, Ravenous, or Insatiable Eater, and we will talk of how you may help me. -- Hexxor 7/19/2005

name: Lila Fiori
description: The Grand Mother will be so disappointed. She really likes Snow Lilies and I am all out. -- Hexxor 7/19/2005

name: Mendica Scarsolo
description: I got these clothes from Agonno the tailor. He said some Bloodless had brought them in and he couldn't sell it. -- Hexxor 7/19/2005

name: Raimonestes Risolu
description: Rain or shine I stand watch over this statue. -- Hexxor 7/19/2005

name: Rickard Dumalia
description: Rickard Dumalia tells you, "Bring me a blank augmentation gem and I will teach you to learn more from the challenges that you face. Visit Fiun Rehlyun if you don't already have a blank gem." -- Hexxor 7/19/2005

name: Fratellodunon Ribellarista
description:
Fratellodunon Ribellarista tells you, "You are not from around here."

Fratellodunon Ribellarista tells you, "It might be best if you leave before you become entangled in the politics of this area."

Fratellodunon Ribellarista tells you, "..."

Fratellodunon Ribellarista tells you, "If you insist on staying I suggest that you talk to the Grand Knight in Sanamar."

Fratellodunon Ribellarista tells you, "He can better explain problems that plague this area."

-- Hexxor 7/19/2005

name: Fratellone Ribellarista
description:
Fratellone Ribellarista tells you, "Where do your loyalties lie? Is it with the Bull or Stag?"

Fratellone Ribellarista tells you, "Perhaps you are undecided. Talk to the Grand Mother, perhaps she can open your eyes to our cause."

Fratellone Ribellarista tells you, "I look forward to seeing you on the side of the righteous." -- Hexxor 7/19/2005

name: Marlan Nessunello
description: Marlan Nessunello tells you, "Silyun is the last refuge for the people of the Duchy of Bellenesse. Long ago we rebelled against King Varricci. Unfortunately our rebellion was short lived and we were forced to flee. This town is all that is left of the survivors." -- Hexxor 7/19/2005

name: Waterfall Cave
description: Drudge Lurkers, Stalkers and Raveners at the top, Banderling Strikers and Rogues a little further down. Did not go to bottom. -- Lila_MT 7/20/2005

name: Portal to Eastwatch
description: Destination: 90.3N, 43.3W. Cannot be recalled, linked to nor summoned. Must have Throne of Destiny Expansion Pack to use. -- Capt Justice TD 7/21/2005

name: Ruined Empyrean Vault
description: -- Chupon 7/22/2005Item obtained is the Voracious Eater Jaw. Title received is Voracious Flayer. Reward is 5 million xp and an M Note -- Chupon 7/22/2005Map and quest links. -- Lila_MT 7/23/2005

name: Abhorrent Vault
description: -- Chupon 7/22/2005Item obtained is an Abhorrent Eater Jaw. Title received is Abhorrent Slayer. Reward is 15 million xp and an MMD Note. -- Chupon 7/22/2005

name: Ravenous Vault
description: -- Chupon 7/22/2005Item obtained is a Ravenous Eater Jaw. Title received is Ravenous Slayer. Reward is 35 million xp and an MMD note and a D note. -- Chupon 7/22/2005

name: Portal to Sanamar
description: Portal to Sanamar just outside of Shoushi. -- Lila_MT 7/22/2005

name: Portal to Silyun
description: Portal to Silyun just outside Qalaba'r -- Lila_MT 7/23/2005

name: Plains of Ruin
description:
Destination: Plains of Ruin (90.7N, 51.2W)



You must purchase the Throne of Destiny expansion to use this item. -- Shauna Eyebright 7/24/2005Drop is hot with a mix of level 150+ critters. -- Shauna Eyebright 7/24/2005

name: Portal to Silyun
description:
Destination: Silyun (87.3N, 70.8W)



You must have purchased the Throne of Destiny expansion in order to use this item. -- Shauna Eyebright 7/24/2005

name: Cataracts of Sabella
description: Must have Throne of Destiny -- Moonstone - DT 7/25/2005

name: Frozen Library
description: Location of the Ruschk Iceberg Key; full of eaters and fiun -- Glycerine 8/7/2005

name: Frozen Library
description: Location of the Ruschk Iceberg Key; full of eaters and fiun -- Glycerine 8/7/2005

name: Old Lascare
description:
The retired military leader views his domain from outside his door.



"Old Lascare tells you, "What are you bothering me for? Go away."



A journal lies inside his cottage . . . perhaps it will say more about his story.



Part of the Red Bull of Sanamar Quest.



0x3AED000B [29.886929 58.317570 88.005005] 0.450921 0.000000 0.000000 -0.892564 -- Davidge 8/23/2005

name: Icy Hideout
description: This portal has been sealed by someone to prevent entrance. You may want to speak with Mancanza, in Silyun, about gaining access to this portal. -- Davidge 8/23/2005

name: Ruschk Camp
description: Kill the Ruschk Camp Leader for his Blacksmithing Chest Key. -- Davidge 8/23/2005

name: Ruschk Camp
description: Kill the Ruschk Camp Leader for his Leatherworking Chest Key -- Davidge 8/23/2005

name: Camp Blacksmith
description:
Start of the Squalid Shield quest. Level 95 Ruschks and a few undead in all three of the camps. Talk to the NPC here, then visit the two other camps and get the keys he requests.



2.5M XP for completion.

-- Davidge 8/23/2005

name: Cordelia
description: Bridge between the 2 islands. A shorter way to get to the Ruined Empyrean Vault via the Plains of Ruin than via the Fiun Outpost -- Cordelia 9/1/2005

name: Watcher ofthe Deep
description:
000,000 xp.





A Lifestone and portal to the Vissidal Isles are located nearby. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/16/2005

name: Shuthoth
description: Lugian servant of Nuhmudria that allows you to start the Gateway to the Deep quest which gives you access to Vissidal Island. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/16/2005

name: Devastated Watcher
description:
One of 2 Statue Heads on Aerlinthe Island. Receives the Watery Token which transports you to the 1st of 4 dungeons. You can re-enter by using the statue head like an item.

Part of the Gateway to the Deep quest which gives you access to Vissidal Island. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/16/2005

name: Destroyed Watcher
description:
One of 2 Statue Heads on Aerlinthe Island. Receives the Watery Token which transports you to the 1st of 4 dungeons. You can re-enter by using the statue head like an item.

Part of the Gateway to the Deep quest which gives you access to Vissidal Island. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/16/2005

name: Portal to Gatekeepers
description:
This portal is near Ayan and takes you to the mountaintop with the Crystal NPCs. You must be flagged by finishing the 1st dungeon of this quest on Aerlinthe Island.


Part of the Gateway to the Deep quest which gives you access to Vissidal Island. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/16/2005 -- 10/16/2005

name: The Flame Guardian
description:
Destroy 5 Water Spirits (lvl 155 Golems) and talk to the NPC to be portaled to a Subway lookalike dungeon. A boss type undead,Bur Lizk, is at the bottom. Its death will summon a gateway to the next area.


Part of the Gateway to the Deep quest which gives you access to Vissidal Island. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/16/2005

name: Gatekeepers of the Deep
description:
There are 4 Crystal Gatekeepers on top of a spire near the OP. They can only be reached by portals. Once you have reached this place, you need 4 items to continue: Yellow Virindi Gem, Sezzherei's Lair Gem, Pyreal Bar, and a Swamp Stone. Give these to the Gatekeeper crystals when they request them and they will send you to the next dungeon. The dungeon can be re-entered by returning here and using the same crystal Gatekeeper again.



Part of the Gateway to the Deep quest which gives you access to Vissidal Island. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/16/2005

name: Flame Guardian Lifestone
description:
Reached from the Crystal Gatekeeper Rhujun.





Part of the Gateway to the Deep quest which gives you access to Vissidal Island. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/16/2005

name: Water Guardian Lifestone
description:
Reached from Bur Lizk's Fake Subway.



Part of the Gateway to the Deep quest which gives you access to Vissidal Island. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/16/2005

name: Water Guardian
description:
Reached from Bur Lizk's Fake Subway. Kill 5 Fire Golems (lvl 155) and speak to the Water Guardian to advance.



Part of the Gateway to the Deep quest which gives you access to Vissidal Island. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/16/2005

name: Vissidal Island Portal
description: Part of the Gateway to the Deep quest which gives you access to Vissidal Island. Must be flagged by giving the Watery Token to the Watcher of the Deep. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/16/2005

name: Merwart Pelagurg
description:
Merwart Pelagurg tells you, "Ah, it is you, who showed me kindness before. I thank you, human. If you get another Bloodmouth Maw, I can make you another Remoran Fist weapon... And if you don't like your Remoran Fist, you can give it to me and I will share knowledge with you."



Go to around 77.9N,64.2E and kill Bloodmouth Remorans until one drops a jaw. Drop rate is comparable to gromnie teeth. Hand it in for 2.5 million XP and a UA weapon. You can hand the Ua Weapon back for 13 million XP. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/16/2005

name: Merwart Village
description: A nice little village with various shops and services. Looks like these little folks live in giant Niffis shells. They reference Angry Grandfather teaching them. Could this be Ulgrim? Possibly a Viamont Noble? -- Taarna Blood SC 10/16/2005

name: Merwart Urglurg - Merwart Village
description:
Merwart Urglurg tells you, "I welcome you, human. You may be surprised to find a Merwart with my vocabulary and elocution. We here on Vissidal Island were raised out of our primitive squalor by Angry Grandfather, a human shaman."


Merwart Urglurg tells you, "He gave us names and speech and taught some of my cousins how to cater to the needs of the human adventurers who would surely come here in search of excitement." -- Taarna Blood SC 10/16/2005

name: Merwart Gurglurg - Merwort Village
description: Merwart Gurglurg tells you, "Welcome to Vissidal Island, human. We were told to expect your coming. Vissidal is the name of this land, or so Angry Grandfather told us. It once belonged to people called... Fa-la-ta-cot. Yes, that's the word." -- Taarna Blood SC 10/16/2005

name: Shopkeeper Hulmur - Merwort Village
description: General Shoopkeep. Sells for 190% Buys for 70% -- Taarna Blood SC 10/16/2005

name: Blacksmith Bulidurg - Merwort Village
description: General Armorer. Sells for 190% Buys for 70% -- Taarna Blood SC 10/16/2005

name: Archmage Moldurg - Merwort Village
description: General Archmage. Sells for 190% Buys for 70% Also has Vissidal Portal Gems -- Taarna Blood SC 10/16/2005

name: Healer Hargurg - Merwort Village
description: General Healer. Sells for 190% Buys for 70% -- Taarna Blood SC 10/16/2005

name: Lifestone - Merwort Village
description: Lifestone on Vissidal Island near Merwart Village. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/16/2005

name: Sanamar Portal - Redspire
description: Appeared with the Invasion of Redspire -- Taarna Blood SC 10/16/2005

name: Temple of Xik Minru
description:
This is the dungeon that contains Xik Minru. You will need to give a piece of AMBER to the golem NPC to get past the entry hall. This is the place where Geowulf the Stonehearted got lost and killed. Branwyn, his greiving wife, is found near Arwic. Take the wedding ring you find inside back to Branwyn for a great ring with Major Healing and Major Flame Ward on it. It also has a run and regen spell. Give this ring to Harlune the Misanthrope in Mite Maze and he will upgrade it. You will also find 3 pieces of Geowulf's Journal on the ground. These are worth 8-16 million XP each if given to Branwyn.



At the end you will find Xik Minru. She has 50k HP and is rather nasty. You have to turn in an artifact to get her to spawn. Various types are found on the undead around the temple. Upon killing her you will get a key and a book. The book is worth XP and the key opens a chest for dye that will allow you to dye your Blackmire quest armor. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/19/2005

name: The Deep
description: This creepy NPC will reward you for various Gold body parts taken from the random special Gold monsters on Vissidal Isle. Xp varies from 6.5 million to 11.4 million depending on type. It will also give you a token that allows you to take the title Servant of the Deep. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/19/2005

name: Algar Oreksun - Kill Quest
description: This human NPC is gives out a kill quest. Kill 50 Mucky Moarsmen to get 40 million XP and a title token. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/19/2005

name: Colista Fluress - Kill Quest
description: This human NPC is gives out a kill quest. Kill 50 Benek Niffis to get 40 million XP and a title token. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/19/2005

name: Dayla Bint Kazm  - Kill Quest
description: This human NPC is gives out a kill quest. Kill 50 Shallows Gorgers to get 35 million XP and a title token. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/19/2005

name: Peng-Ya  - Kill Quest
description: This human NPC is gives out a kill quest. Kill 50 Remoran Sea Raptors to get 45 million XP and a title token. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/19/2005

name: Fiun Gaya
description: Gives 800,000 points of experiance for Snow Lilies. -- Ginger S'nap 10/20/2005 Starting point for the Lunnum's Pyre robe quest. The robe can buff up to 600 AL and has nice Moderate mage spells, but requires 295 buffed self to use. -- Taarna Blood SC

name: Dangerous Portal Device Drop
description: One of 3 random drops for the Dangerous Portal Device found in the Burun King quest series. -- Taarna Blood SC 10/24/2005

name: Shanrek the Forger
description: NPC for the Counterfeit Writ quest. Give him a C note to start the quest. -- Taarna Blood SC 11/6/2005

name: Blue Coral Reef
description: The reef Shanrek the Forger points you to. If you have given him a C note, you can use the reef and spawn 4 level 155 Blue Coral Golems. They can be a bit tricky for anyone under 80. When they are dead, loot the piece of coral and take it back to Shanrek -- Taarna Blood SC 11/6/2005

name: Bandit Mansion
description: This is the location of Gronk the Hammer, who has the crate of fake Niffis pearls. It is much like a normal mansion, except it is located on a mountain near the Obsidian Plains. It can be access thru the KEEP OUT portal near Bandit Castle. -- Taarna Blood SC 11/6/2005

name: Bandit Castle Portal
description: On a cliff, cannot be reached from the ground -- Taarna Blood SC 11/6/2005

name: KEEP OUT!
description: Portal to the Bandit Mansion. Must be flagged by Shanrek the Forger to enter. -- Taarna Blood SC 11/6/2005

name: Xsao Lann
description: Darling's owner. She is looking for information on her lost ursin. -- Taarna Blood SC 11/6/2005

name: Creepy Canyons
description: This is where you dungeon where you find the ursuin Darling and her collar. Also a lot of L235 Tusker Stompers. -- Cordelia 9/1/2005Contains Darling the ursin at the bottom. It can hit rather hard, so be careful. Take the collar back to Xsao Lann at 1.5N, 71.6W -- Taarna Blood SC 11/6/2005

name: Ruschk Fire
description: This is the place where you take the Purified Ice Log. This is part of the Lunnum's Pyre quest. -- Taarna Blood SC 11/6/2005

name: Great Frost Tree
description: This is the place where you get the Ice Log. This is part of the Lunnum's Pyre quest. Spawn contains one Shadow Nightmare, 3 Copper Gromnies and 4 Brass Gromnies. -- Taarna Blood SC 11/6/2005
